The house is pretty creaky, and there was a fair amount of noise from the street, so if you're a light sleeper it may not be for you.  We didn't find it a problem, and would definitely stay there again.

Jen's Artisanal B&B is an artsy, shabby-chic multi-dwelling home right on Rue St. Denis in Montreal. As such, it is perfectly situated between the English-speaking/hipster side of town and then French-speaking side of town. Moreover, the inn is an easy walk to Mont Royal park, old town, and to most of the major attractions in the city center. For any further out destinations, you will find yourself a mere block away from the Laurier Metro Station. All amenities were provided by Jen, including bagel breakfasts, internet access, bedding, towels and basic toiletries. Accommodations were perfect.

We arrived at this two-story residence easily from the Amtrak station. Jen was home when we arrived to let us in. She showed us around briefly and then let us be on our own. Despite sharing the building with other guests, our room was very private. We were very comfortable and the location in the city is very close to restaurants, cafes, and Metro stations and bus lines. We had a great stay! Recommended for couples or families with children.

Jen runs a very pleasant bed and breakfast in a wonderful and convenient neighborhood of Montreal. She was very reliable both in her communication before our arrival and in setting us up for a lovely stay. We would love to stay again!

I am so happy to have chosen this place. I'm a DJ who drove from Vermont to Montreal for a gig that ended at 2am. Jen met me at the B&B at 2am, with keys in hand and a pleasant smile. My room was clean and I fell in love with the Frida Kahlo-inspired bathroom. It was super clean and warm during those wintry nights. Great deal.

Jen's B&B was the perfect place for our first Montreal (and Airbnb) experience. From the start Jen was quick to respond and helpful with information. She is a great host and seems to run the B&B professionally. We had to postpone our plans due to a snowstorm but Jen could accommodate us a day late with no problem, which was much appreciated. The Mile End area was a great location to get a well-rounded idea of the city; we were really happy to have ended up there instead of some other locations we were considering. The house is old but it has tons of charm. We were lucky to have the whole space to ourselves the first night after a full day of walking around, we made dinner in the kitchen and spent the evening playing with instruments in the living room. The next night there was a full house which got a little noisy due to echoing voices and creaky floors, but really not a problem. This may be petty to mention but I would recommend bringing your own pillow if you prefer sleeping a little elevated. Overall it was a pleasant, fun, and hassle-free visit to Montreal; we would definitely stay here again!

Good location in the vibrant Plateau neighborhood and a vintage spot. Metro station nearby. Jen is not living in the apartment, so if you need advice for your stay, prepare questions when you meet her on the first day. Breakfast was very basic. Generally, we promote it for young travelers.

Jen's place was great! The location especially. Everything was right around the corner, just brilliant. 

The room was comfortable and Jen left bagels and cream cheese out each morning for breakfast, YUM!!

I would thoroughly recommend it.

Excellent location just a short distance from the metro and within walking distance of many places on Rue St Denis and Mont Royal.

Breakfast provided was greatly appreciated, and Jen responded quickly to all our requests. 

This was our first experience with an Airbnb flat, and Jen has set a very high standard for any future hosts we use. Thanks, Jen
I felt very comfortable in this beautiful space! The location was convenient in the Plateau.

Jen was very helpful, especially in figuring out Montreal parking regulations, and the accommodation was in a nice historic building and great location.  As mentioned by others, the short helpful guide that was left in the room was also nice to have.

Jen is a fantastic host! The B&B was really nice and conveniently located near everything: the metro, Bixi bikes, shops, Mile End, Little Italy, and Outremont... It was very cool to stay in this authentic place during my week-long conference in Montreal.

Thank you, Jen, for your opinion about us.

Regarding the trousers, is it possible to get them next Saturday around 1 or 2 pm?

I'm having problems with my phone's web connection. We are currently in Quebec City.  Could our guess, Anick Gosselin, please call you tonight?

Thank you very much,
Bernard
I stayed for 3 nights at Jen's place. I felt at home right away and experienced Jen as a flexible and friendly host. So yes, I definitely recommend staying at the B&B!

Jen's place was great! Very well located in the Plateau and close to a metro station for further city exploration. Jen welcomed us, took the time to show us around the house and answered all our questions. She also showed us travel books on Montreal and the surrounding area for guests. We also appreciated that she gave us directions for free parking near the house. That was super helpful! 

On the downside of things, a little general cleaning of the place would be useful to make the overall experience excellent.

We really enjoyed our stay at Jen's. The flat has character and feels like home, decorated with good taste. The place is ideally located and very close to nice bars and restaurants. We appreciated the morning bagels very much! It was a very good experience and Jen was perfect with communication! We would love to go back!
It was a very charming place in a large part of the city. There was nothing negative to say about it.

Jen was an excellent host. She was super nice, helpful, and gave us a lot of information about Montreal. The place is in a fantastic location, close to everything. Wifi was great. I recommend this place if you're on a budget but want easy access to all that Montreal has to offer!
Excellent location! Lots of great restaurants and shops nearby. Just a short walk to the Metro. Jen was very helpful with navigating the city and public transportation. Overall, great! Thanks again!

Quirky place in the absolute perfect location. Tons of boutiques along the same street, and walking distance to most places worth seeing. Jen was a genuinely kind host and willing to offer advice on the area. Plus, I met two really awesome travelers at the B&B... seems to be a place that attracts interesting people!

We had a great experience at Jen's B&B! Went up to Montreal for the jazz festival, and Jen's place was a great deal. Not expensive, perfectly clean, and above all well-situated in the city (one block from the subway and located in the Plateau area with lots to do/eat nearby). The only drawback was that the B&B wasn't air-conditioned (same goes for many buildings in Montreal), but it worked fine for us because we got the one room with the AC unit.
Great! Awesome!! Fantastic!!! Very nice and colorful house in a great place.

Jen was an excellent host! She was very flexible about our late arrival and gave us some great information about the neighborhood and tips for getting around Montreal. We didn't see her for the rest of the weekend, but she was available via email or phone in case we needed anything. The room and house were beautiful and we especially enjoyed the delicious Montreal bagels for breakfast. Thanks Jen!

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Plateau Montreal B&B. This is a lovely old apartment – large, bright, full of Quebecois character, and very well located just a short walk from the Laurier Metro. The shared bathroom and common areas worked well for me as I enjoyed socializing with the other travelers and felt very safe and comfortable. Our host Jen was welcoming and made sure I had everything I needed. This was my first Airbnb experience, and one I would gladly recommend to others.

Apartment very well located in a very pleasant neighborhood
Comfort quite modest, well suited for young people
Good value for money
Pleasant contact with J'en

The room is ideally located, close to the metro station, in a dynamic and very lively neighborhood at night. The house has charm and is clean. We had a little impression of being in a hostel, several rooms are rented with different neighbors every day. Jen is very friendly but doesn't live on-site, so you need to call her and make an appointment upon arrival.

Charming and quaint location. The owners do not live on-site but were there to welcome us.  

Well-situated, the only downside is that our room looked out onto Rue Saint Denis which was quite noisy at night.
This was our first Airbnb and Jen was really friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay in Montreal and felt the location was perfect as a base for exploring the city.

Jen's room worked out fine for me. The location was perfect, an easy short walk to the Laurier Metro stop and Bixi bikes, on St Denis, close to Mont Royal and St Laurent. Breakfast was strictly do-it-yourself: bagels, cream cheese, and orange juice provided. There was a bathtub which was important to me and which I enjoyed. An air conditioner and fan kept the room cool.

Jen and her husband have a charming, colorful house that they leave with the other guests. Our room was facing the street but not noisy at night. 

A good address well located to visit Montreal!

Well-located apartment with the metro at the foot of the building, or you can reach the city center on foot in 25 minutes.

Beautiful colorful and clean apartment.
I felt well attended to, the only downside was the front room near St Denis that was so noisy until at least midnight.

We had to wait 15 minutes to meet Jen for check-in. However, she was supremely flexible in the first place, allowing me to set the check-in time and only a day before arrival. The floors squeak quite a lot as do the doors, at least to our room "The Plateau." It's all pretty great after that though.  The room had a working fan AND an air-condition window unit. The windows are huge and easy to open, good drapes to boot, they were easy to snap open and close. Easy access to a vegan and raw food restaurant, 15 min walk. Fully stocked kitchen with tea, fruit, bagels; great bathrooms.  I would definitely stay here again. Thank you for the effort Jen!

I enjoyed my stay at Jen's place. Her place is clean and conveniently located near a metro station. Jen was also very helpful and accommodating - prior to me arriving, she helped to provide very clear instructions on getting to her place from the airport. And on the day I left, since I had a late flight, she allowed me to store my bags in a spare room so that I could still explore around during the day, which I very much appreciated!
Nice place, great location!

Excellent location for this two-story house, original decoration with a bohemian touch. Welcome by Jesse, Jen's companion. Friendly and cool. I only stayed one night. Jesse kindly offered to stay until 2 pm the next day exceptionaly, as I had spent the night being sick. Attention that I really appreciated.

Jen's place was perfectly located. Clean, bright and comfortable, I highly recommend this location for anyone traveling through Montreal. Jen was also very accommodating with late arrivals and late check-out times, which my travel plans included. Two thumbs up!

Jen saved my life and my kid's! We made a last-minute decision to go to Montreal for an event. While there, I sent various inquiries and while most people responded that they needed more advance notice, Jen responded that her place was ready and available! (There are various rooms rented.) And the location in the Plateau area is fabulous! If you're not looking for the Hilton, then this place is quite comfortable and convenient. And to top it off, Jen provides the materials to make your own tea, coffee, and bagels for breakfast. That was just an added bonus. We will definitely return on future trips!
Comfortable and quiet, we did not meet Jen but her husband Jesse was very welcoming. Lovely place for a night and very central.
Jen was a friendly and helpful host, our accommodation was unique and in a great location. We had a wonderful family day weekend in Montreal.

Jen was great at accommodating my partner and me at the last minute, which was a relief! The place was very colorful and had fun items, like guitars and a ukulele. It was nice having a kitchen where we could cook. The place is in a great location in Montreal - close to Mount Royal and directly on a busy street with tons of nice places to eat and yoga studios, etc. The bus station is a one-minute walk, too! Our only complaint was that the place did not appear to be cleaned very well - if you like things to be really clean, you probably wouldn't want to stay here. The place was well loved, but not in a cleaning sort of way.
Great price for a bed in a great location. The Plateau neighborhood is awesome.  If I'm being picky, the pillows are flat. The bagels were great, and the apartment had a lot of character.
Thank you Jen! This was the perfect accommodation for my night in Montreal

We had a really nice stay at Jen's place.

This colorful house is comfortable and perfectly located!

Jen is sympathetic and really accommodating.

We clearly recommend it!
Jen's house is colorful and well-situated to visit Montreal; I would highly recommend it!

We spent four days here and everything was great. It's a beautiful old apartment with several bedrooms and a spacious common area downstairs, with a kitchen and living room. Right on St-Denis, it's quick to get on the metro and you're in a great neighborhood for walking around. Jen is a great host, friendly, and leaves you to your own devices.

The room was clean and tidy. Jen made accommodations without hesitation (thanks for the towels!). Even with a second guest down the hall, the place was quiet and allowed for a lot of privacy. 

Bagels and coffee in the morning were a nice touch. Will stay there again!

This was a clean, lovely room in a great Airbnb. Really close to the metro and the best neighborhoods. Met a few fun people who were also staying there. 

Disappointed that I didn't make time to get a massage from Jen, the host.

We really enjoyed our stay at Jen's bnb! The apartment is in a great location, a block from the train station and right near many restaurants and shops. The apartment is very nice and clean, Jen is really helpful and friendly with any questions you might have. We would definitely recommend staying here, it was perfect for our stay in Montreal.

I loved Jen's flat! Very cute and charming. Everywhere you turn there is artwork and adorable knickknacks throughout. The location is great, it's very close to the metro and a plethora of restaurants. Jen is a great host, I would absolutely stay there again!

I really enjoyed staying at Jen's. The place is very well situated, close to the metro, and there are many nice shops nearby, as well as some great bars and restaurants.  I didn't have much time to see Jen but she was available if I needed her! I would certainly recommend this address.
Great place. Very convenient and wonderful overall. Would definitely stay again.
Nice place to stay and close to everything you need in Montreal. I would come back!
Everything was great at Jen's. Jen had some good tips for us about Montreal and was very friendly.

Great host and apartment in a superb location! Jen was very friendly, the apartment was clean and the fruit and bagels for breakfast were a nice extra touch!

Thank you so much, I will be back on my next trip!

My friend and I loved staying here. The location is amazing and the vibe is like a cool, eclectic hostel that allows the privacy of your own room. I loved the lending library (with Montreal tour books!) and Jen was nice enough to leave out tea, Fairmount bagels, and fruit for guests. The only downside for me is that I found the mattress uncomfortable. That being said, I am really picky about sleeping surfaces and generally don't sleep well on any kind of futon mattress. My friend slept just fine and had no complaints.

Jen was an excellent and helpful host! She was very friendly at check-in and offered excellent suggestions for places to eat and things to do around the neighborhood.

The location of the Airbnb couldn't have been more perfect, extremely walkable to many restaurants and shops! First time in Montreal, and feel very lucky that friends who had stayed at this location recommended this Airbnb to me. The BIXI bike share system has many docking stations near the Airbnb location, and the Laurier Metro station is just a couple blocks away. The maps and guidebooks in the apartment were great to have as references!

I would describe this property more as a "hostel with delicious bagels" than a "B&B," but that's perfectly okay. What it does well, it does really well! We had the room pictured in the Airbnb profile and it was nice—a good size, and clean. The rest of the building is older, a bit shabby, but definitely clean and more than adequate. There is one bathroom and several other bedrooms that are rented out. Getting bathroom time and hot water were never a problem, even though others were staying. The kitchen and other common areas, including the back garden balcony, are nice too.

This Airbnb stay was a little different in that we didn't interact with the hosts much. We actually never met Jen. Instead, her husband Jesse met us and let us into our room. He was welcoming and showed us around. There was also a handy welcome sheet in the room with wifi info, restaurant suggestions, etc. (The pizza place across the street is great!)

The neighborhood is fantastic, and definitely what makes this place such a great deal. It's very close to the metro, restaurants, and a little grocery store. If you like walking vacations, you can definitely walk downtown or to the old city from the location. 

It was a good place to stay, and I would recommend it to others.

Our stay at Jen's was fantastic! The B&B was beautiful and very cool, there was awesome art everywhere in the house! Jen was very accommodating and nice! She also gave us great advice on where to check out some cool bars and an awesome vegan restaurant! We were also close to everything:D Thank you Jen for such a great trip... and the bagels!

The house is located on Rue St. Denis, a busy street with many shops and restaurants. It is also quite close to Laurier metro station.

The house itself looked more like a hostel than a house; it was shabby, needed repairs, and a good cleaning.

Easy email contact to Jen and nice welcoming by Jesse. I liked my room for the 2 nights. With my earplugs I could sleep quite well despite the traffic noise. Self-service breakfast is ok for me. Other people may need a hint at the Airbnb description. All the best, Heribert (Germany)

We had a lovely trip to Montreal while staying with Jen. The B&B is in a wonderful location - close enough to walk downtown, and surrounded by many, many delicious restaurants and bars. We used bixi to get around and there were several stops nearby. The room was a nice size and the bathroom and kitchen were kept clean during our entire stay.

Jen was very nice! The location is fantastic and everything is true to the description. I stayed for about a week and it was great to have an apartment-like feeling rather than a hotel, you can really make yourself at home. The living area is really nice with a sunroom and living room, great for reading or making coffee and doing some work in the morning. 

Cleanliness-wise, it could be a little better - it wasn't horrible but the room could have used a dusting, and the closet had a slightly musty smell.

All in all, I would recommend it for the location and the bed and breakfast setup - needless to say, I ate a lot of bagels!
Nice place, clean and quiet

My partner and I enjoyed staying at Jen's place. She was a good host, she was there to greet us warmly when we arrived, giving us plenty of tips on parking, eating out, or visiting places. 

The location itself is great, in the middle of the Plateau with many small cafes, bakeries, and nice restaurants around. It's also within walking distance of Mont Royal.

The place has a lot of character and despite the room colors didn't look as vibrant as I was expecting from the pictures, it still looks funky and has a nice vibe. 

My only issue was the street noise plus some noises on the first night, as someone was going in and out from the room next door and the door was banging. However, I slept perfectly after wearing some earplugs, plus I know I'm quite sensitive to noises.

Jen was fantastic; she was incredibly accommodating with any changes I made. The location is in the heart of the city and right next to all the bars, restaurants, and nightlife activities. It's extremely accessible via train for quick and easy travel throughout the city.

The strength of this apartment lies undoubtedly in its location. It is two steps from the Laurier metro station.  It is a 5-minute walk from the St-Denis/Mt-Royal intersection. There is no better place to stroll on the Plateau!

Jen was very welcoming and helpful. We spent a good time there. The apartment was shared with other travelers. We felt like we were in a youth hostel. The apartment was well-equipped and we had everything we needed. Breakfast was included, which is a nice perk.

Thanks!
A nice stay. The location is simple, clean, and central.
Jen is a very good host, taking her time to show you around the place and answer all your questions. The room is spacious and well located at Rue Saint-Denis. Definitely recommend it!

Very warm welcome, Jen makes you feel right at ease immediately. The apartment is located on the Plateau, close to transportation and various places to go out. I only stayed for a weekend, but it was a very good experience that I would like to repeat.

Jen was an excellent host! She was accommodating of my late arrival time and helped me navigate the streets of Montreal to find parking, which isn't easy. When I first arrived, she gave me a tour of the lodging, which matched what was described on the listing page, and even had a laminated quick-tips sheet with house rules and some helpful tips for getting around the city. I would be happy to stay here again.

Jen was an excellent host and flexible with our delayed arrival time. Although we didn't meet her, she was quick to answer the phone when we had questions. The apartment was comfortable and welcoming. Breakfast was a really nice touch. I will definitely stay here again and recommend it to others who want to be in a great location and a funky clean apartment.
It was a pleasure staying at Jen's place. She was very helpful and the room was lovely. The house's location was also excellent; 100% recommended.

Fantastic position, close to the station and all amenities. Although the house was lovely, it needed a clean, nothing major just a bit dusty and the bins weren't emptied during our stay. Check-in was easy, and Jen was very flexible with our late and changing check-in time.
Jen's place was funky, clean and well located. A great spot to stay in Montreal!

Excellent place to stay in Montreal. It is very convenient and close to the metro station and bus station. And also, it is a safe place to stay even though you come back at midnight from the metro. The host is very nice and considerate. I will choose this place when I visit Montreal again.
Jen's B&B was a lovely place to stay! It's in a great location, easy to walk through the Plateau and Mile-End neighborhoods, and was clean and comfortable.

Dave and I both loved staying at Jen's bed and breakfast. It was exactly what we were looking for. It was so charming and colorful. It was nice having access to the bagels and tea. Jen and her husband were very helpful with finding parking when we arrived so that we could avoid getting parking tickets.

The bed and breakfast was located in a great area - it's an easy walk to plenty of great restaurants and Mont Royal. We walked almost everywhere, but there was a metro stop very close. We would definitely stay here again!

Jen's place is in a great location, very close to public transport, great restaurants and shopping. The house has a lot of character and charm, I recommend sitting on the back balcony with a cup of tea in the afternoon! Our room was a little dusty, but apart from that the place was generally pretty clean and as described in the listing.

Excellent location, great price! Classic old-style Montreal apartment with creaking hinges and all. Very laid back, only one other couple staying that weekend. Had the kitchen and back balcony to ourselves when we were there. Food, Bixi bike rentals, bistros, and depanneurs... all within a block or two. Great if you're just looking for a taste of city living.

Jen's place was easy to get to from the Metro, and she was there to greet us when we arrived. She was very friendly and gave us several recommendations for restaurants/pubs in the area. The place itself was funky and quaint. It's definitely an older apartment, but for the price and the location, it's worth it. As a bonus, Jen kept local bagels stocked in the kitchen for breakfast!

She was going out of town the day we arrived, but she was still able to show us around the apartment. The description of the place is accurate, no frills. The neighborhood is THE BEST part about this place.

The only thing that caught us by surprise is that the toilet and the rest of the bathroom are in two different rooms. So at one point I wasn't able to use the bathroom to wash my hands after using the toilet because someone was in there...but that only happened once.

And one thing that was slightly irksome for me personally was one of the pillows that had little support, but I'm also used to thick, fluffy pillows, sometimes stacking one top of the other; so take this part of the review in with a grain of salt.

We were really looking to just crash for the night and take in Montreal as much as we can, so we weren't in the house very much. It was very low-key and enjoyable.

After traveling the world and staying in hostels, the warm, thoughtful reception at Jens place was a breath of fresh air. So obvious that she's an experienced host who is used to dealing with travelers and their needs.  Caring, thoughtful host with a well-kept room in a fun, funky neighborhood with rock bottom prices... what more could I ask for?

10/10 would recommend!

Great place, plenty of character and artsy feel as well as space (rare to find in the plateau), the pictures didn't do the room justice as it was bigger than expected. The location is just amazing being so close to the metro, as well as the plateau being such a desirable place to live. Also, the A/C was a godsend on the couple days where it got really hot!

There was an issue with the tub at one point but it was fixed very quickly.

There were a couple other girls renting separate rooms and we all got along and I even ended up making close friends with one!

Jen was just great, she made sure we were comfortable, let us know all the spots nearby, came by to clean and was quick to respond, super accommodating.
Had a wonderful stay! A great, safe place for a single traveler like myself. The location was perfect and the price was very affordable. I highly recommend it for budget-conscious solo travelers!
It was nice to stay here for the week, close to the subway and restaurants! The host was very nice and my roommate for the week was also nice.

The studio is nice and comfortable, located just next to Rue Saint Denis. Maria was very helpful and responsive. She prepared everything perfectly! We had no problems finding the place and getting around.

As for location, you can't get any better! It's in the heart of Montreal. A short walk from le Vieux Port/Old Montreal (1.5km with a slight hill). Be forewarned that since it's in the middle of downtown, it's not going to be quiet. This is no fault to the hostess, just that this city rarely sleeps - which, depending on who you are, is a blessing or annoyance. Laundry is 10 blocks away since the hostess isn't in town, the sheets may not be clean so you'll have to do them yourself. Maria is always available via text so very helpful. If you drive, underground parking is a block away. Rental bikes are also close by. I would definitely stay there again for a quick weekend visit to Montreal.
The host left a pleasant note with some directions about the wifi and wished us a great trip. The description matched the room perfectly. The neighborhood was lively and exciting!
Good home base!
Ultra-quick confirmation, fast communication and an apartment that perfectly matches the description. Excellent host.

Pros: Great location. Great host. Cozy studio. Comfortable bed. Clean. Perfect for spending a night or two. 

Cons: Not suitable for light sleepers (noisy refrigerator, noisy entrance door that residents tend to slam).
Very convenient and flexible. Thank you, Maria

We had a great overnight stay here. The location is perfect and Maria left us with everything we would need for a comfortable stay. She was very quick to respond when we had a question about parking. We would love to stay at Maria's again next time we're in Montreal :)
Host able to have key ready early thanks

The studio was cute, clean, and comfortable. The keys were exactly where Maria said they would be. The neighborhood, as promised, was within easy walking distance of many bars, restaurants, and other attractions.
Great place. Accessible host. Convenient location. And overall amazing time.
Great host would stay again
Location is unbeatable! Great value in a vibrant and fun neighborhood!
Maria's place was great! It's a great location with lots of bars and restaurants within a 2-minute walk. If you're arriving by bus, this spot is only a 3-minute walk from the station.
Great location, perfect for a solo traveler or a couple!
Central location, suitable for a short stay.
Great little space at a super affordable price! We absolutely loved our stay here
Apartment located 10 minutes walk from the bus station, very convenient for people who want to make a stop before traveling.

My husband and I stayed at Celine's studio on Rue Dolbeau for a few days at the beginning of August. It was a perfect setup! The studio was comfortable, immaculate, and close to public transportation, taxis, and places to grab a bite to eat. This was our first time using Airbnb so we were a little nervous, but Celine was an ideal host! She was easy to communicate with, kind and welcoming.  She even left us some coffee to brew in the mornings. Celine is wonderful and so is her place!
The reservation was cancelled 7 days before arrival. This is an automated message.

Nice large studio in a quiet area. Very close to a bus stop which can take you towards the eastern part of the city, fairly close (~15 minutes walk) to a few subway stations. Fairly cheap for that time of year, considering what you get.

The host was very nice and responsive. Our flight was delayed by 2 hours so we got there at midnight and our check-in was still very smooth.

Celine was an excellent host. She accommodated a last-minute reservation and an early morning check-in and went out of her way to solve minor house issues. The place was clean and well-supplied with utensils, coffee/tea, and all the things needed to make it easy to live away from home for a few days. The location is close to public transit and a nice 24-hour farmers market. The bed is a futon - so not perfect for everyone. Overall, good experience.

Tyler was a great host and responded very quickly. The apartment was very clean and located in an amazing neighborhood close to many shops, restaurants, and subway stations. I would definitely recommend this apartment to anyone!

Tyler was amazing, friendly and very accommodating! The apartment was clean and in an excellent location, walking distance to restaurants and all areas of the city. We really felt at home and we would definitely love to stay here again on our next trip to Montreal! Tyler ensured that we were happy during our stay and we would definitely recommend him to anyone!

Good location and great apartment; just as described. Didn't meet Tyler but information was clear and check-in went smoothly. Small issue with the parking spot but in the end we managed to leave the car there during our stay. Think we managed to pick out the coldest day of the week so after exploring the city we enjoyed a cozy night in, watching Netflix :) Would definitely stay here again if we return to Montreal.

Tyler's apartment is located in downtown Montreal at a very convenient location. There are numerous bars and restaurants in the area, and the metro is only a few blocks away. This made getting around really easy.

The apartment itself is lovely. Spacious, well-lit, and clean. It even has Netflix for the time you spend indoors. All this helped to make our visit pleasurable. 

While Tyler was not around, he provided all the details required for us to access the apartment via text. This went off without a hitch. 

Oh yes, there is a dedicated parking space too. Which is always a bonus when you have a car in the city.

Overall, I would definitely choose to stay here again when I visit Montreal. Thanks Tyler!

Tyler was very friendly and welcoming. He's prompt in his replies and provides excellent dining and drink suggestions. 

His apartment was great, too. Clean and tidy. The location is perfect, with many eateries and bars nearby. Parking was also conveniently located near the apartment. 

Thanks for having us!

We had an amazing stay at Tyler's place, the location is perfect and everything is easily accessible on foot or by public transport... The apartment seems to have been recently renovated and has a modern and stylish decor.

Our stay at Tyler's place was great. He made sure that his friend met us upon our arrival, showed us the parking and the apartment, even though we arrived quite late. 
The apartment itself is very nice, with lots of character and effort put into its renovation and decoration. It is located on a quiet street, but just steps from Rue St Catherine where all the shops and restaurants are. Having an assigned parking spot was amazing.
Overall, we would definitely stay at Tyler's place again if we need a place in Downtown Montreal in the future.

This was our first time in Montréal and the apartment location, space, and value could not have been more perfect. The space itself is cozy, clean, minimal but with character, with a parking space nearby and a little back porch. It's in the middle of the action, near restaurants and centrally located to all the things we wanted to do in Montréal. The kitchen was well appointed. Tyler was very helpful and responsive. We will be back for sure!

Spent a lovely few days in Montreal at Tyler's studio. The apartment was exactly as described. Clean and beautifully set up. The neighborhood was perfect for what we were looking for. Located minutes from all the shops and awesome restaurants. And quite close to all the sights; Port and Plateau were a short Uber ride away. All in all, the perfect weekend at a lovely studio. Thanks so much, Tyler!

Tyler did a wonderful job of accommodating our late arrival time. He got us our keys quickly, and the apartment was in wonderful condition! It looked exactly like the photos. The building was in a very trendy area within walking distance of shops, bars, restaurants, and metro stations.

We had a great stay at Tyler's apartment. The apartment is in great condition, exactly like the photos and a nice location! Supermarkets, restaurants, and the subway are nearby, and there is also private parking. Tyler was a great host. We would definitely recommend this apartment!

The neighborhood was very close to everything. A wide variety of restaurants and shops were available. The metro was also a few blocks away. It was a nice central location for your stay in Montreal. Don't be fooled by the exterior of the building, as it is very nice and cozy inside. There is a lot of natural light due to the large windows.

The apartment was wonderful and just as Tyler described; clean, spacious and only minutes from major metro lines. The neighborhood has many restaurants and is close to must-see sites including the Museum of Fine Arts. Tyler himself was communicative and helpful throughout the entire process. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone staying in Montreal.
The host answered all of our questions without any problems. The apartment is easy to access, unfortunately for the cleanliness as the clean apartment could have been very good!

Tyler was very helpful coordinating our arrival with a friend who met us to give us the key and show us to the parking lot. The parking lot is a little misrepresented in the current listing, as it is several blocks away and for 90% of our stay, it was occupied by an unauthorized vehicle. We asked Tyler about this, and he said he couldn't do anything to make them move. There was also an air mattress available, but no pump or linens to go with it so we couldn't use it. Overall, we enjoyed staying in this area (lots of great shops and restaurants, close to the Centre Bell if you're attending an event) and the apartment is beautiful, but we had constant headaches arising from the parking situation. I would have given a higher rating had the listing been more specific in this regard or had the situation been resolved more to our satisfaction.

The apartment was as described, clean and perfectly located. Close to the subway and bus stops, plus rental bicycles are just outside the door. Walking distance to Crescent Street for lots of restaurants and the Fine Arts Museum. 

We stayed a week, and our small dog too. The studio is large, with nice light. Important to us, the bed is comfortable. Also, we appreciated the convenience of a washer and dryer. First floor is handy, just a half flight from the street. 

We hope to come back again.

Listing was just as described. Parking spot was just around the corner. Location is excellent - easy walk to both the Green and Orange metro lines. 

Loved our stay at Tyler's place!
This is my worst Airbnb experience ever!

Tyler's place is perfectly located for a visit to Montreal. Just off Rue St. Catherine and other major arteries of the city. Parking just around the corner was a short jaunt, nothing to complain about. 

Communication with the host and his associate Faizan was easy, swift, and helpful. 

Overall, a steal of a deal, good people, great location, nice place... I think it's a pretty solid choice. 

The bed was very comfortable, the bedding was also clean and comfy, linens were clean and plentiful. The AC worked great but we barely used it. 

A supermarket is around the corner.

Tyler's downtown studio is a great getaway spot for the perfect weekend in Montreal. The studio was very clean and perfect upon check-in. It's located in a great location surrounded by shopping and food. The parking spot is a block away and it's a private spot, so there's no worry about finding street parking. Tyler was easy to communicate with and I would recommend staying here if you are planning a trip to Montreal.
Typical apartment in the heart of the commercial street, ideal for discovering the city, doing some shopping or going to a restaurant. Free parking space is a big plus. Tyler was very available.

The location of the apartment was great, as it was close to almost everything. 

I never met the host, but he arranged for his friend to be there to meet us. 

The place itself wasn't bad aside from some minor things like: the entrance of the building looked like it was under renovation but it wasn't.
The place wasn't ready to receive new guests; the towels were put in the dryer minutes before our arrivals. 

For the price, I expected the place to be better in comfort and readiness.

Tyler is discreet. I haven't met him. I couldn't reach him by phone when I needed, but he promptly answered all my Airbnb messages. That worked for me and generally his messages are friendly. The apartment is really nice and comfortable. The kitchen table and seat are beautiful. It could be a little bit cleaner (some kitchen utensils needed washing) and more organized (the sink cabinet and closet were messy) but no big deal. The apartment is on the first floor of an old house and it seems to be under some renovation in the basement. So the entrance is all dusty and it may cause a not very good first impression. I hope they'll improve that soon, but overall it's a great place. Super close to metro stations, restaurants, and attractions. There's a nice backyard and a small porch, however, it's not clean and the stairs are broken. If Tyler gives some love to it, I believe it will be even nicer during summer (I was there in the beginning of fall). I would come back.

Great location, everything is easily accessible. 
The interaction with the host was smooth.

Perfect location and nicely equipped - ideal base for exploring the city. Extremely comfy bed!

The basement of the building is under renovation, so it is a little messy when you enter the building but obviously not the guys' fault. The bathroom is a little dated but again perfectly functional.

There are a couple of minor issues with heating and TV reception, both of which I suspect are due to the renovation work on the building. I am sure these will be resolved quickly and won't cause any future guests any problems at all - and I would certainly recommend this place to other travellers!

It looks modern and it could be a terrific apartment. Unfortunately, it needs a lot of renovation, finishing touches, and cleanliness. Communication is slow and last-minute. 

You can't reach the porch or backyard. The full house is in renovation, apart from the apartment. Parking is in a tiny alley and not visible. It would be better to park your car in the paid parking lot across the street.

The apartment and surroundings could be nice for young people who want to party and crash, but anyone else should be able to find better places and neighborhoods. We saw a lot of fancy places and the public transportation system is excellent.
Very Friendly
Very nice apartment as described in the listing. Also very well located, just two steps from a metro station and two steps from Rue Ste Catherine and Eaton Centre. Highly recommend!

As for the location: 

- It matched the pictures exactly. It was nicely decorated and some books about Montreal were available.
- There were serious heating problems.
- The oven and TV were not working.

As for the neighborhood:

- It was central and located near shops, restaurants, bars, etc.
- It was quiet at night.

As for the host: 

We had a really disappointing experience. We told him in advance that our cell phones were not working in North America and had thus few ways to get in touch with him. 
We had arranged a time of arrival. We called him from a public phone to inform him that we would be a little late due to a problem with our car. He did not answer the call and did not react to the voicemail we left. When we arrived at the apartment, he was not there. He had left a lockbox but we didn't know the combination (he sent it to us by mail the morning of our arrival, knowing since weeks that we didn't have access to internet). We had to call him two more times in the next hour (it was raining outside) until he finally picked up (without apologizing) and told us the combination.
Later (we were staying for 5 days), we let him know that the oven and TV were not working, asking for more information, and he NEVER replied. We were thus unable to cook anything or watch TV at the apartment.

For all these reasons I wouldn't recommend this place.

The apartment matched the description perfectly; it was incredibly spacious and had excellent amenities. The quality of the facilities was high, and the bed was very comfortable! However, the apartment was extremely cold, and the two heaters provided were insufficient for the size of the space. It was also quite difficult to get in touch with Tyler, which was not a positive experience.

For the price, this apartment was great. For the traveler who values central location, decorative details, a host who is never actually around (we never met) but always a friendly text away, free parking and a comfy bed, Tyler's flat is well worth the money.

That being said, the apartment is so affordable for a reason- there were some corners cut. No central heating (had to use space heaters, which wasn't bad with the mild weather, but I can't imagine it being enough in the dead of a Montréal winter), no working oven or stovetop (one of the main reasons I airbnb instead of hotel) and a foyer and totally inaccessible backyard that are completely trashed and under construction. When I arrived, the building owner came by to do some work inside the apartment while I was unpacking and settling in. While he was only there for a few minutes, as a woman traveling alone it was a little awkward and unnerving.

None of these were dealbreakers for me- the apartment was cool, comfy and clean, and Tyler was attentive. I guess it depends on what you value.

To start out with the positives, Tyler's place was exactly as it appears in the photos. The place is very nice. There is also a TV on a wall mount so you could watch TV from the bed. Erol is very kind and was very helpful with our problems. The location was also very good. It was nice to know we had a secure parking spot.

Unfortunately, we ran into a few difficulties while staying here. First, the parking spot was relocated to a parking lot about 5 minutes away, which isn't too bad, but it drizzled one night and we didn't have umbrellas. Second, the place was slightly chilly. It is heated by two heaters that you plug in. We left the heater on while we were away and when we returned it was a good temperature. This may be due to the renovations going on in the rest of the house. Third, we ran into some power issues where the outlets on one side of the house went out, as well as the wifi. We called Erol and he had the issue fixed by the time we returned. Again, may be due to the state of the building itself. Lastly, although the apartment was clean for the most part, the couch had a bit of cat/animal hair, which got into our clothes. 

Overall, our stay was not bad. Erol/Tyler are slow with responding to messages sometimes, but they were quick to respond when we called. Thanks for the stay!

The location was good. Close to shopping, restaurants, and bars. It was also great having parking available, especially in the city.

Upon entering the apartment, there was a horrendous smell of wet dog which was apparently from the guests before us. Tyler's friend who dropped off the key was very friendly and accommodating to our delayed arrival and also brought us air fresheners to help mask the incredibly unpleasant lingering dog smell and was available for any questions or needs, which was nice. 

The unit overall is great for visitors wanting something basic in a buzzing location. There is no heating in the unit so we had to rely on the small portable heater, so just keep this in mind during cold winter times. The TV remote batteries didn't work and the lock on the front door was touchy. In terms of accuracy of photos, the unit had charm with the open brick walls but the decor had a rather interesting collaboration of rather dated pieces of furniture and modern additions as well.
Perfect size and perfect location for a quick getaway in the city! Walking distance to Bell Centre and not far from Old Montreal. We wish we could have stayed longer and would highly recommend it.

Overall experience was great! The space was clean, and exactly as advertised. The host greeted us upon arrival and was incredibly hospitable. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants to stay in the city and not pay a fortune for a hotel.

The place is well decorated and clean. Loved the exposed brick and the hard-loft feel. The smart TV was very convenient and I generally enjoyed my stay here. My one complaint is that there is no central heating, and the room can be cold especially in the dead of winter. Tyler was very responsive throughout and I have no complaints on that front. I would think this place is much more suitable in warmer weather.

Nice apartment and very well located! 
The host is nice and there is free parking included.

The listing makes the apartment look great, but it doesn't reflect reality. The place is fairly clean but has some rough edges. It's heated by space heaters and the finishes are pretty non-existent. However, the location is excellent for exploring the city. It's a decent home base, but not ideal for a couple's getaway.
Second time we're giving up and it's a RAS. This housing is very well located
Great place in the heart of downtown.
The place was beautiful. It looked exactly as it did in the photos. My only complaint was that the heating wasn't very good, but they left plenty of extra blankets for me to use.

It's a really nice place. He was very welcome to us. 
Nice kitchen, bed :) but the house was a little bit cold and there wasn't enough bathroom tissue.
Very good apartment, well located, it has a very good value for money ratio. Tyler, our host, was responsive and available to address any issues that arose during the stay.
Well-located apartment, highly recommended!

Not like the pictures at all. The pictures do a nice job showing the decent parts of the apartment, but they leave out the crumbling entryway, broken closet doors, and refrigerator full of wilting lettuce. I was a little frustrated when we first arrived and then walked outside to find a man peeing on the stairs leading up to the door (at 3:30 in the afternoon). Would not recommend; you can stay in a hotel room for $30 more a night.
We didn't get to see Tyler, but everything worked out fine. Great location, clean and calm. Nice apartment, very stylish.
If you like cozy apartments within walking distance of most things, then this is the place for you!
Responsive and understanding host who quickly resolved the issues. Overall, it was a good stay

We arrived in Montreal by car during the snowstorm. No one was there to greet us and directions were not very clear for finding parking, which was impossible due to the blizzard (a free spot, but not plowed). 

The apartment is very nice and well-located, with a metro station nearby and shops nearby. However, we had the bad surprise of finding the teapot with an used tea bag inside.

Absolutely loved Tyler's place! His apartment is surrounded by great places to eat, easy access to shops and public transport. The place is super comfortable and homey! We had a slight problem getting into the parking space but Tyler responded to our questions really fast and it was sorted out immediately! We'd definitely stay again in the future.

Tyler's place was great. It was clean and in a good location. Tyler was easy to get in contact with for any questions we had. The parking spot was a big plus and is very close to the apartment. I would definitely recommend this place to others!
It's such a nice place, but I got a cold because the air conditioner wasn't working at night.

Tyler's place was a great little loft perfect for a couple. Conveniently located right on St Catherine, it has lots of stores and restaurants nearby. Parking is a bit inconvenient due to it being a bit of a walk and also in a confusing location. Other than that, it was clean and a great stay!

Tyler was an awesome host. He was very accommodating and went out of his way to ensure we were happy and satisfied with our stay; he was always available to answer any questions or address any concerns we had. We would definitely recommend staying here!
Tyler's response is super fast and efficient... Good communication and easy access to locations... Very well located if you have business in the city center...

This apartment is beautiful and located right in the heart of shops, restaurants, and public transportation. Even though it was in the middle of the city, we were able to find parking directly in front most times we needed to park. The apartment is beautiful, stylishly decorated, clean, and very comfortable. We really enjoyed our stay!

Tyler was an excellent host! Due to unforeseen circumstances, we were informed shortly before check-in that the original listed apartment was temporarily uninhabitable. Tyler worked hard to find us comparable accommodations at one of his other properties. Although we weren't able to stay in the original apartment, Tyler ensured this did not affect our time in Montreal and we ended up really enjoying our stay.

Despite Tyler's friend overstaying his welcome at this apartment, Tyler quickly got us a taxi to another apartment closer to the Place des Arts and cosier, so we had a perfect stay. He was really helpful and we settled in comfortably. The first place did look a bit like a building site as other reviews had said but that doesn't take away from it, it's a really cool and large space, would be a great place to stay - in a cool area with lots going on. Recommended: Upstairs Jazz bar close by. Thanks Tyler + Erol, have a great summer, we love Montreal!
The host cancelled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated message.

Staying at Tyler's place was awesome! Both Tyler and Errol were very communicative and helpful. The flat is located right around some awesome bars, restaurants, and coffee shops and we felt we were in the center of Montreal. Highly recommended!

My boyfriend and I had a great time at Tyler's. It was a great, modern apartment right in downtown Montreal with lots to do nearby. Tyler provided detailed instructions for our stay, and was extremely responsive and always available via text throughout our stay.

Tyler's downtown apartment is perfect if you're in town for an event in the downtown area. There are many restaurants nearby and you're close to the parking spot provided. Clean, cute, and comfortable space. Would stay again.
This place is great. The location is great. The entrance seems odd at first, but once you get to the top of the stairs, the place is beautiful. We enjoyed our stay and communication was easy.
Tyler is a very helpful host. The place is near the subway and there is a variety of restaurants in the neighborhood. It was a nice stay

Spacious and well-decorated house, close to the commercial area. The entrance to the building and some appliances were older, and the garden area was still being cleared. Tyler was always available and was quite friendly. We recommend it!
The host cancelled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated message.
The host cancelled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated message.
Beautiful apartment in a quiet neighborhood but close to everything. City center accessible on foot. Excellent metro proximity!
The place is closed to restaurants and also nightlife. I had a good
Booked this for my two daughters who were attending a concert, they loved it, it was close to everything and clean and cozy...
Amazing location! Amazing host! Amazing apartment! Very central location with many things to do nearby, the metro was very close, making getting around the city seamless.

The apartment is clean and located in a good spot close to the metro, shops, and restaurants. Instructions upon arrival were clear. The parking spot was easy to find and nearby despite being on a different street than the apartment. The entrance of the apartment has a higher step to be mindful of in order to not trip. Tyler was a good communicator keeping us updated regarding the city's plan to cut the water briefly on one of the days. Overall pleasant experience staying at Tyler's.

Tyler and Errol responded efficiently and quickly to any of my questions. 
The studio was really nice and clean. Netflix was a bonus and the moveable TV ... cool!

However, I had a little difficulty with the doorknob of the apartment (round key) ... Also the door makes a creaking noise. And the bathroom door could not be closed properly.

Aside from those, my stay was great and I will come back if there is another opportunity!
Tyler was very quick with his responses and very precise with check-in. He had no problems whatsoever, and I recommend this cute place to everyone.

Tyler is an excellent host who responds quickly to messages and ensures the comfort of guests. The apartment is really well-located in downtown, at the foot of Mount Royal.  Convenience store, SAQ and grocery store are less than 3 minutes walk away. Having included parking is a big plus and it's located very close to the apartment and secure. The street is quiet (I slept very well!) but close to action if you want to go out for dinner or bars. Very comfortable bed and modern bathroom. The loft-style urban setting puts you in the mood. Private patio, well appreciated for apero. Functional kitchen, though the fridge is relatively noisy. Excellent wifi. Overall, an excellent stay with Tyler! I highly recommend it!: )
Nice, clean place. Walkable, everything is nearby. Easy to reach by car. Parking was a big bonus.
Great hosts who are friendly and easy to deal with, perfect location and a really nice apartment, would definitely stay here again.
We had a great stay! The place was close to everything we wanted to see. Tyler responded quickly and we didn't feel like there was anything lacking in the place. Thanks, Tyler and Errol :)

Conveniently located in the heart of Montreal. Studio apartment as pictured, with some nice aesthetic touches, a large shower, and a comfy bed. Surrounding the apartment, the building itself and the patio are under construction, but otherwise the apartment was as described and it was easy to get anywhere from this location by walking or via metro. Great place to stay!

Absolutely loved this space! It's much more spacious than the photos show. The space is very stylish and comfortable, with great amenities. The location is also very great, being close to many good restaurants. Would definitely stay here again!

Tyler's place was great. The central location makes getting around easy, and the bed is comfortable. Check-in was easy, and Tyler was quick to respond to any questions we had. 

The Wi-Fi was fast. The parking spot is about 300m from the front door and is a little tight, but we weren't planning on using the car while in the city, so it wasn't an issue.

Tyler provided clear instructions for check-in and parking. We loved the location of this studio apartment. Just off of Ste. Catherine's and a 20-minute walk to the Bell Centre. The apartment was very clean. My only complaint is that the back door should have blinds for extra privacy.

This was the best experience I've ever had with an Airbnb. Tyler's place was beautiful, spacious, and in a great location. Close to everything but still really quiet. His apartment was also impeccably clean. Not a speck of dirt or dust to be seen! Tyler was also really easy to communicate with. I can't stress how much I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a home-away-from-home in Montreal!

Great stay at Tyler's studio last weekend! The location is incredible—groceries, coffee, convenience stores, and the subway are all within 5 to 10 minutes of the apartment. The studio itself was a great home base for a weekend in Montreal, perfect for a couple. The row house itself, while being steps from bustling St. Catherine Street, was quiet and private, and had everything we needed. It's in an old stone house from the late 1800s—I admire the work being put into this unique space! Thank you so much!

Tyler's place is wonderful! He was incredibly accommodating and fast responding. He's a heck of a host! Aside from Tyler himself, the place was beautiful and in a wonderful location so that you can get everywhere you want quickly. I'll definitely be back!

Had to cancel my stay last minute due to a series of events, but Taylor was super nice about it and understanding. Communication was excellent and everything seemed like it would have been a great stay. Recommend to anyone

Tyler was very communicative and helpful before and during our stay. The house was easy to find, very cozy, and so comfortable for us to stay in! I would definitely stay there again the next time I visit Montreal.

I believe there are some improvements to communication that could be made. The place is very nice. It would be important to clarify that parking, which is easily accessible, is paid. Free parking is too complicated. The purpose of this comment is to make suggestions for improvement. Thank you, Jason, for taking over the heating. This point also needs improvement. We need to clearly inform people how to turn on the heating. I almost asked for a free night's stay because I was freezing cold.

Great spot just a little ways down Ste. Catherine's. Very, very clean. The bed was super comfortable, pretty much had everything we would've needed. The location was good for shopping and if you're going to the Bell Centre, but sometimes we found ourselves driving to get to the really good restaurants. 

Only thing that might have marginally improved our stay was a new shower head – it was like a jet and you couldn't really move it so that it wasn't spraying you in the face. Not so great for a girl who doesn't get her hair wet every day! And maybe a set of wine glasses would be appreciated. 

Overall, highly recommend staying at Tyler's apartment. Thanks again!

The flat itself is a nice space and is as pictured—spacious, nice design, spotlessly clean. Convenient location, very close to the Metro and downtown shopping, or if you are going to a hockey game or have meetings at Concordia or McGill. The free parking spot is a couple of blocks away, but is a great bonus. One caveat about the location: this end of downtown is still a little on the seedy side at night. Not unsafe, but not the most picturesque neighborhood: panhandlers, guys sleeping in doorways, etc. If you're used to this kind of thing and know what to expect, it's fine. 
However, the space is in an old house that doesn't look like it's been renovated elsewhere. The biggest issue, especially for a Canadian winter, is there doesn't seem to be any central heating. Steam radiators were not working. The only heat source in the apartment was from a wall-mounted fan/heat/ac unit that was too small for the square footage and did not heat the space adequately. Since there was no heat coming from the rest of the house (the stairway and vestibule are old and unheated), it was extremely cold. The bathroom was freezing. My husband likes a cooler room for sleeping but he said it was way too cold even for him. We checked out the second day and moved to a hotel. I have to say that Tyler was extremely apologetic, gave us no issues and refunded the second night immediately. Very courteously handled. He also said he would address the issue for the future—if you are planning on staying here during the colder months, I would check to see if the heat problem has been fixed.

First time using Airbnb, and it was a great experience. 
Tyler was very helpful and clear with communication, there were no surprises, which is the last thing you want when traveling.
The place was clean, great location right downtown, easy to get to shops, food and transit. 
We only stayed a couple of nights, but he seemed to have all the amenities for a long stay as well. 
Would definitely go back! 
Thank you Tyler!

Tyler has a very nice place in a great location. We were happy with the check-in process, the cleanliness, and with the general communication. However, the heater was not working in the apartment and this issue was never resolved by the hosts, so the apartment was freezing all weekend. The only consolation was that the bed was very warm.

We stayed 2 nights and 3 days during late November.

Tyler & Erol were such great hosts! They are really open with communication. Checking in several times before check-in and even after. They give instructions to the T, and that is extremely helpful for someone visiting someplace new. They are extremely flexible and accommodating. Their place is super convenient to downtown area. For our stay we left our car parked and walked everywhere. There's wifi, and Netflix available in the apartment. The heat in the apartment doesn't really ventilate through the entire place, so it was definitely cold and I would suggest bringing extra hoodies and sweats for sleeping in during the colder months. They were nice enough to provide a portable space heater in the bathroom and we ended up moving it between the bathroom (showering & getting ready) and sleeping area (the rest of the day) a lot. This really helps warm up the sleeping area and made it more comfortable.

We had some issues with parking upon arrival (the building next door was doing construction and all the scaffolding was in the parking spot. They were super proactive and immediately took care of this issue that same day, renting us another spot at the same parking area. Thanks for that guys!

The block where the entrance of the building is, construction is going on and it blocks the entrance of the door. It's a little confusing, but everything is golden once you get into the apartment! I'll definitely come back if I'm in the area & will def recommend their place to everyone. For location, parking, and everything else, it's a great value!

This place is nice and clean but guests should be prepared to walk into a building that is undergoing extensive renovations. The main floor is totally gutted, which was a bit creepy to walk into alone and at night. The flat itself is a great place to stay and hang out; there are some issues that need to be tended to like the shower head is broken and kinda useless and the back window has no curtain. Once these are dealt with, I would recommend this place; the location is great, only 25 minutes walking from the train station and super close to many great restaurants and shops. It's also quiet at night which was great.

Right behind Rue St. Catherine (lots of restaurant and bar options) and a 5-minute walk to the metro station (Guy-Concordia), it is in a great section of downtown Montreal. We drove into the city, but we didn't need our car once we were situated. Beautiful renovated apartment and very clean! Highly recommend.
Tyler's place was very clean and accurate to the listing. I would definitely stay at his apartment again.
Great space! Tyler was really easy to communicate with and extremely helpful and accommodating. The apartment is a stones throw from amazing restaurants. Will definitely be back!

We had an amazing stay at Tyler's place. The interiors look great. The way the space is widely used and decorated is amazing! Great value for the money. The parking spot is quite close and at no extra cost.

The fire alarm located right above the kitchen is quite annoying as it beeps every time we cook. I would not bother to cook with so many options for food nearby. Tyler's house was centrally located to all attractions. He was very quick with his response and a great host!

Great studio! Very well located at the corner of Main Ste Catherine Street (full of shops and restaurants). 5 minutes from the subway station.

Regarding the studio, I really appreciated the self-check in and out. The studio is well equipped.

Finally, Tyler was very nice and responsive; I highly recommend his place.

Though I didn't meet Tyler personally, he was very responsive and a pleasure to communicate with!  Stayed for 2 nights, check-in was a breeze and the apartment was very cozy. It looked exactly like the photos and is in a great and lively location!

Tyler's flat is located in a prime location! So many bars and the supermarket are literally 3 minutes away on foot! The home was super warm considering the temperatures dropped below -40 at night! He even had an extra plug-in heater just in case we got chilly. The home was very clean and easy to find! Thanks Tyler!

The apartment looks exactly as it does online. Easy to find, easy to get in. Professionally cleaned between guests. Very responsive hosts through the app, though we never saw them in person. We were there during a record-breaking cold snap and the place was cozy and warm the whole time. Overall, we had the best time and would definitely stay there again. 

The only criticism is that the parking space shown in the picture is really two spaces. Make sure you park as close to the wall as possible so you don't steal the spot from your lovely neighbor. Secondly, I wish there had been a shovel and some salt in the apartment. It snowed an abnormal amount while we were there, so maybe not a regular issue, but we needed to dig out the parking spot a bit to get in, and the stairs leading into the building needed some love.

We could not stay at this Airbnb. The building itself was under construction, with the entrance (not pictured) smelling of mold and dust, and construction materials lying around. The apartment smelled strongly of cleaning product upon our arrival. The street was also undergoing fairly intense repairs, which I expect would cause noise during the daytime.

Tyler's flat is conveniently located downtown. Close to many restaurants and it's great that it comes with private parking, not on the street. It looks very modern inside and was nice and quiet.

I will definitely recommend this flat to others and will be coming back if I am ever in town. 

Thanks again.
Good location for a quick trip to Montreal. Will need to come back when the sun is warm and shining. Nice and inviting studio with good space to work and a kitchen to help make you feel at home.

The apartment was exactly as listed, if not better than expected! It was in a great area with easy access to the metro and plenty of places to eat within a few blocks. Tyler was a great, communicative host and we'd love to stay again if we ever return to Montreal. It felt like home for a few nights. We had an amazing time!

Tyler's place was everything it was advertised as! It was very comfy and had a great location, and Tyler was super responsive and accommodating to our needs. Our only complaint was construction going on right outside the apartment which was unexpected but they didn't make any noise on the weekend.

A beautiful loft located super close to everything. We were very happy to have a parking spot too! Tyler is the best, he responds quickly and gave us crystal clear instructions upon check-in. Looks even better than the pictures!

I had a great stay at Tyler's studio. It was clean, spacious and modern. It was also in the heart of the city so everything was just a short walk away. Tyler was also very helpful and quick to respond to messages. Overall, a fantastic experience!

Tyler was a very nice host, he made all instructions clear and was just an email away if we needed anything. The place looked like the pictures on the inside and there were no unpleasant surprises. For our purposes, there was nothing lacking, although there might not be enough cooking utensils to make much more than pasta.

The parking space is about a block and a half away and a bit tough to get into. We never needed my car once though because the subway station was just as close and brought us anywhere we wanted to go.

Tyler was an amazing host, responding quickly to any questions while also checking in to make sure we had everything we needed for a pleasant stay. The apartment was exactly as described, very spacious and super clean. We couldn't have been happier with our stay.

Had an amazing stay at Tyler's place. It's a few minutes walk from downtown and plenty of restaurants to eat nearby. There was an issue with the WiFi (that was out of Tyler's control) but he handled the situation professionally and was clear in his communications. We definitely felt welcome and would highly recommend his apartment for your stay.

I had a great stay at Tyler's place. It was extremely clean inside, had a fully stocked kitchen, a great bathroom, and it was in a part of town that had a metro a short walk away with plenty of cheap places (and expensive places too) to eat around it. While I was staying, construction was being done on the building, so there was some loud building noises going on under me during the day, but nothing to keep me up at night and most of the time I was walking around the city so it ended up not being a problem. Tyler's place itself is beautiful on the inside. The pictures are exactly what it looked like, and they gave us fresh towels and left shampoo/conditioner. The only issue I had was with the parking spot, it was incredibly close to a building and I had a hard time getting into it, as it was icy and another car had parked close. It took me and my bf around 20 mins to get into and out of the spot. We were able to work it out though, and it was nice to have parking in Montreal considering it is a packed city. Overall a great and very fun stay.
Great space and back deck! This place has everything you need for a night or extended vacation. Check-in is super easy, just follow the directions Tyler provides :)
Great location!

Tyler's place was exactly as anticipated! It was very clean, had everything we needed, and in such a great location from which to explore Montreal. The temperature was chilly while we were there and the place was plenty warm the whole time! Tyler was super receptive to our needs and was a quick message away if we needed anything. We came in a car, so having access to a parking spot was great. The parking spot was a block or two away from the flat, but it was super easy to find and convenient to use. We had no complaints, only high praise for our experience staying at Tyler's place!

Our stay couldn't have been more perfect! We were close to many of the places we wanted to visit in Montreal and steps away from a Metro that could take us all over the city. 

Tyler was one of the best communicators we've ever had on Airbnb and was beyond accommodating for us. The space was clean, convenient, and quiet. It really made planning our entire trip such a breeze. We were able to relax and watch Netflix late in the evening and in the morning we were able to cook with a fully equipped kitchen.

I highly recommend this place to anyone interested in visiting Montreal.
Super nice apartment with a great location! I felt at home. Easy check-in/check-out and fast communication with Tyler. Perfect!

A spacious flat with character! Had just what I needed for a weekend away with my partner. Loved the brick wall, and close to downtown - we walked all weekend! Enjoyed lazy mornings making French-pressed coffee to drink in bed while watching Netflix. Tyler was incredibly accommodating, easy going, and hospitable! We will be back!
The apartment was well-located and Tyler provided many helpful tips for us. It was clean and comfortable.

I highly recommend staying at Tyler's place. The location is excellent, located on a quiet street just off the main thoroughfare of restaurants and bars and within walking distance from the city center. The studio itself is very cool with an amazing interior, very clean and quite big! Tyler was an amazing host - great communication and provided us with some great tips for places to go and see. Also having use of Netflix was great! We would definitely come back!
Check-in and check-out were easy and straightforward with detailed instructions. Tyler responded quickly to questions. The place was neat and clean.

We loved Tyler's place! Situated perfectly in Montreal, we were able to explore everything by walking or public transportation. The apt was super cool and very clean, on top of it. Tyler checked in regularly to make sure everything was to our liking! Would absolutely stay here again.

I stayed at Tyler's place!
Seems clean and very well located.
Tyler was very helpful and sent detailed instructions about check-in. The place was very clean and perfect for a weekend stay!

With Tyler’s description, check-in was super simple and parking was easy to find. The apartment was clean and looked just like the pictures. We had a great and comfortable stay there. Tyler gave us some good recommendations for the city and was always very helpful. Furthermore, the location of the apartment is great, as it is situated in the middle between Old Montreal and Mount Royal, which you should visit both!

Tyler's house is very close to downtown and easy to locate. The house itself is very stylish and cozy. Tyler had left us detailed instructions on getting in and finding our parking spot. He was also very responsive, and even offered us a chance to continue parking for the rest of the day we checked out, as we planned to still hang around town. I would definitely recommend this house for anyone wanting to explore Montreal.

The apartment is satisfactory. 
The instructions for entry are correct.
The building and the street were under construction.
Tyler was attentive even though we haven't met him. He was responsive to a small problem encountered and facilitated the guarding of our luggage.
Well-located for access to interesting places and public transportation.
I recommend it.
Great little place near downtown. Easy access to all the good things Montreal offers, whether by bike or on foot.

The best thing about Tyler's apartment is its location! It's right in the heart of the city and within walking distance of almost anything you'd want to see or visit, including close proximity to a metro station. Tyler was very communicative and warm in welcoming us to Montreal. The apartment itself is kind of a gem - the street had construction going on and when we walked up to the front of the building and even into the building's foyer we weren't sure what we had gotten into, but then we opened the apartment door and everything looked as shown in the photos. We recommend it for future travelers.

If you're looking for a clean, affordable place to stay, Tyler's place is a very good option. The location is fantastic and close to great restaurants and the Metro station, and the TV had Netflix. The entrance was under construction and a few details were missing (like loose door trim and sticky doors) but overall a solid stay in Montreal!

This is such a cute flat! Lots of room for 2 people. Very conveniently located in downtown Montreal. Close to a metro stop and lots of restaurants and shops. The place is very clean. Tyler is a great host and goes above and beyond to make sure your stay is comfortable. If you’re looking for a spot, definitely recommend staying here.

This place is ideally located within walking distance of many bars, restaurants, and shops in downtown Montreal. Tyler is a very responsive host who is ready to answer any questions you may have. We had such a great time. Highly recommend!
This was our second time staying at Tyler's Airbnb, and we would not stay anywhere else in Montreal. Super clean, great location, and Tyler is really responsive.

Tyler was an excellent host, he was super responsive to our messages. The apartment outside is undergoing some renovations but since we stayed during a holiday weekend there were no works so it was nice and quiet. Inside the apartment is really stylish with a lovely modern living room and bathroom. We found the apartment to be really comfortable and in a great location.
