Honestly, this is one of the best Airbnb experiences I've had so far! Sofia's place is really close to public transit, and she lives in a nice quiet neighborhood. Although I didn't get to meet her, she made sure everything was ready and easy for us. Check-in was a breeze. I'd definitely try to stay here again whenever I plan another trip to Montreal!
Three beautiful stays

Clean place, good owner. :) 
Spacious apartment.

Sofia has a cozy apartment in a quiet place in Montreal. It's perfect for relaxing, and it's very easy to get downtown or other places from there. The kitchen is complete, the washing and drying machines are very modern and efficient. We had a wonderful time in Montreal, and hope to go back soon!

My mom and I loved staying at Sofia's place during our trip to Montreal. Her place was clean, quiet, and well-equipped for a very comfortable stay. Parking behind the building was so convenient. My mom had to work from home for a couple of days, and the living room made a great home office as well. Definitely recommend for a peaceful retreat in Montreal that's still reasonably close to downtown.

The accommodation on the top floor we liked very much. It was equipped with all amenities, including a variety of foodstuffs. Parking is available behind the house. The apartment is accessible via an staircase. For first and last access, the outdoor staircase must be used. The nearest metro station is 7-8 minutes away (round trip fare $6 per person).

I had an amazing experience, Sofia's directions were very clear and precise. 

Thank you

We had a great stay at Sofia's place! Photos are accurate. One private parking spot behind the apartment was very convenient. It's on the third floor with no elevator, which was not a problem for us. 

There is no air conditioning, but in the middle of June with the window cracked open and the fan on, it wasn't a real issue.

It's about a 10-minute walk to the subway, depending how fast you walk. We took the subway every day and got very used to the walk. There aren't many things to do in the area, but with the subway so close, it didn't really matter to us.

At first glance, the neighborhood appeared a little sketchy and run-down, but we never had an issue. It's a very quiet neighborhood with quiet residents who seem to keep to themselves. And the interior of the apartment is very welcoming and well furnished.

All in all, we had a great time and would stay again! Montreal is a beautiful, relaxed city and I recommend it!

Sofia's place is worth every penny for its value. Although it's not located in the best neighborhood, this is the place that is close to downtown and offers easy access to anywhere. Sofia is a good host who prepares her place like a home for family travelers and provides very clear instructions and everything is accurate.

Apartment very well located, close to a metro and quiet neighborhood. Sofia was easily reachable in case of problems. The condo was immaculate, very beautiful living space, I highly recommend it without hesitation!
Great location, close to downtown and the metro. Nice quiet neighborhood and the unit is as described. Great value when visiting Montreal.
Great two-bedroom place close to the metro with off-street parking. Easy check-in/check-out.
The host cancelled this reservation 4 days before arrival. This is an automated message.
100% Recommended

The apartment is really lovely. There is enough space for 3 to 4 people and it offers everything you need. The parking lot behind the building is an advantage. With Uber, it took 10 minutes to get downtown. We would stay there again.
Very clean and cute place! Comfortable and felt like home! I would recommend!
Sofia's place was clean, tidy, and looked exactly as it did in the photos! She made check-in and check-out easy, and parking onsite was convenient. The location was also great!
Excellent house. Great house. Very organized host communication. Would definitely come back!

This apartment is way more lovely & cozy than what you see in pictures. Sofia is such an amazing host, she made our stay a homecoming experience. It is close to all public services yet very tranquil at all times. THE best stay we have ever had :)

Sofia's place was great, exactly as described, nice and clean and Sofia was so quick to answer and helpful with any questions, would recommend to anyone and definitely stay at her place again! Million thanks!
Great apartment. Host very quick to answer any questions. Very clean apartment.
I had a great stay at Sofia's. Didn't run into any issues.

It was my first time coming to Montreal and Sofia was a great host. She was very responsive and helpful. Her condo is really clean and there are plenty of street parking spots. She also has a parking spot in the back but I did not use it because it is easier to park in the street. One minor complaint that I had is that you can smell cigarette in the bathroom. It is probably from the neighbors smoking. I did let her know and hopefully this issue can be addressed in the future. We just left the bathroom vent on and it seemed to help. The location is decent and about 10-15 minutes from Downtown. Overall I had a great stay and would recommend it.
Sofia's place was great! Easy to get to with easy access to downtown Montreal. All parts of our stay were convenient and easy. The ad is accurate and Sofia is a great host!
Excellent reception in a quiet and friendly little neighborhood. Thank you, Sofia!

Sofia's place is very nice, it is a lovely home and had everything we needed for our stay, everything looked like the pictures and everything listed was there. The location is not bad and only 20 minutes away from downtown Montreal without traffic, I didn’t find any restaurants within walking distance but there are many close by in a car. There are two cornerstones conveniently on each block near her place, which was nice. We just had to be careful because there are a lot of personal belongings belonging to the host in the home so we tried to be as respectful of her things. A lot of people touched the home. 

If you can't take the stairs, that would be the only issue other than that everything was great. I would recommend this for people needing a quiet place to stay not too far from everything.

Sofia is a wonderful host who has put the time into ensuring visitors have clear instructions on how to get to her location, as well as clear check-in and check-out procedures. The home itself was very tidy and spacious, with a gorgeous kitchen and balcony. For those traveling with a vehicle, it is a great location -- within a quick drive to downtown, and she had a parking spot available. I would highly recommend this space for folks with access to a car or are comfortable using public transit to get around. Thanks, Sofia!
Great, clean place. Close to downtown. Exactly as described. Great communication with Sofia. Thank you!
Good all-around place to stay in Montreal.
Clean, quiet, comfortable and near the metro. It was just right for 3 of us, and Sofia was easy to reach.

Great space, everything you need in a roomy, well-located apartment.  For older people, be aware there is no elevator so it can be a little tricky getting to the top floor. 

Would definitely rent again, Sofia was very helpful and her place is so well equipped.
Great place and location.

The best in MONTREAL!! Sofia’s home will give you everything you need! This was my first Airbnb booking and I am so impressed. 

Sofia is really a professional and AMAZING host!

Thanks Sofia :)

Sofia's apartment was perfect for our family trip to Montreal. The apartment is extremely clean, spacious and within walking distance of the Metro. Sofia was a great host and very responsive. The apartment is a great home base for a trip to beautiful Montreal.
Very well located near the city center but with the pleasure of a residential neighborhood.
Excellent hosts and exceptional accommodations available year-round except during the summer months.

A very bright and conveniently located apartment near the Green Line metro station. The parking is a real plus, and there's also street parking available. Comfortable with all the necessary amenities and a supermarket within walking distance. A good address. 

Sofia was very helpful.
Sofia's place is very nice, close to downtown and we could reach her easily when we needed help. We liked the style of the living room and kitchen, very cute. We will be staying here again :)
Wonderful stay at Casa Sofia! Definitely will be back!

Bright and spacious apartment in a quiet neighborhood. It is close to a supermarket, a metro station, and easily accessible to the city center. 

Sofia is a very attentive host who answers all your questions promptly.

Sofia's place was exactly as pictured, it was clean and tidy! Sofia would answer her phone as soon as we called. Everything was clearly explained with instructions. A great place, definitely recommend!
Great value for a very nice condo. The parking spot was a definite plus!
Everything was super!

Sofia's place is very clean and suitable for our family of four. Two bedrooms are cozy and comfortable. She is very responsive, although we did not get the chance to meet her. I recommend it to anyone planning to explore Montreal!
Lovely apartment and a lovely stay. Sofia is a great host. Would come back again in the future.
Great place to stay, lots of mirrors which is always nice. Short/cheap cab rides to the port or downtown for $11-16. I would stay with Sofia again!

Sophia's apartment was amazing, beautiful and spacious. Clean and very comfortable beds. Sophia made sure we got in safely by texting me and made sure we had everything and that she could be contacted if we needed anything. The building was quiet and the location was perfect for where we were touring around the city. The pictures show exactly what it looks like and it's affordable. Thanks Sophia, we would stay here again.
Sofia's place is modern, comfortable, and in a great location. You can't beat it, especially for the price.

Well located in a quiet neighborhood. Walking distance to Atwater Market (20 minutes) and to Chez Nick in Westmount (20 minutes from the market). Quick response from Sofia made our stay even better. Try "Entre Ciel et Terre" (8 minute walk) for a quaint dinner...food is excellent! Highly recommend Sofia's place.
We had a very nice stay! Sofia was responsive to all messages and everything went smoothly with no issues whatsoever. Very close to downtown as well. Highly recommend!
Nice place!
Very warm welcome, cozy decor and good descriptions of the surroundings. I recommend it.

Wonderful apartment. Super close to the metro. Only thing I would mention is to be aware that the apartment is up three flights of stairs, which could potentially cause issues, especially with luggage. Otherwise, we had a lovely stay and would definitely come back in a heartbeat.

Excellent place in Montreal! Our lockbox was frozen shut at check-in, but Sofia answered and helped us out right away so we could get in! The space is very stylish, clean and comfortable. Definitely recommend her place :)

Pleasant stay at Sophia's place. Practical for parking and accessing the metro (7 minutes walk). Clean and well-equipped apartment. 
The bedding was comfortable.
I recommend this address.
Sofia's place is a great choice. Comfortable bed, stylish apartment, good location! Sofia is quick to respond to all questions and was very helpful with check-in and local recommendations.

Sophia is a SUPER HOST definition. She has great communication skills. Her home is stylish and sparkling clean with plenty of amenities. The location is amazing, especially if you have a car (parking available on-site); you can drive anywhere in greater Montreal in less than 20 minutes, although the abundant construction in the city may delay you a few minutes. Special thanks for the late check out. Cheers :-)

Please note: You need to climb two stories (there is no elevator), so it's not ideal for the elderly or those with physical disabilities. 

We will definitely try and book her place again when we are back in town!
Great location, close proximity to the city. Parking is provided, close to the metro. Fast WiFi, quick responses. Highly recommended!
The host cancelled this reservation 171 days before arrival. This is an automated message.

Overall, a good experience. This unit is in a fantastic location and the perfect home base for us and our friends during our stay. We were a bit surprised by the level of noise coming from the street outside (the windows are not very soundproof).

This place was an amazing find! We were in awe from the moment we walked into the apartment! Location was fantastic, all the amenities and the service we received from flatbook throughout our stay was top notch! 

We were aware that there was no AC but when we arrived we were so happy to see a small unit set up for us! It was a pleasant surprise and they had many fans for us to use as well. 

All the guests had a wonderful experience, 5 stars!!
Great place, best value for your money anywhere in this neighborhood.
The place was beautiful and clean
Looks nice on the surface but the street is too busy with minimal amenities and comfort.

Spacious apartment beautifully decorated located in a cosmopolitan and lively neighborhood with nearby bars and restaurants.

Noteworthy: There is a lot of activity on the street late evenings on Friday and Saturday nights.

The condo was beautiful and very comfortable. The location was perfect, within walking distance of small restaurants, shops, and bars. Overall, the stay was great and I had a wonderful time in Montreal.
Very nice stay!
Great place. Super spacious and well-equipped. Located in a great neighborhood.

We had a great stay at the Sonder flat. It was perfectly located for us in the center of nightlife, great food, and bars. As a large group of 6, the flat was a nice size and we slept very well at night. The only drawbacks for us were the lack of kitchen staples (most rental homes include ample sugar, salt, olive oil bottles, etc) and some issues with electricity (the only way to turn on bedroom lights was via turning on the living room light as well and there were lacking usable sockets in the bedrooms). Otherwise, we had a great time and would definitely return with larger groups again.
Awesome area to go out with lots of cool small restaurants

Great location, coffee across the street and pretty much anything else you need was within walking distance. Furniture and floors were cheap, some parts of the floor were broken. The apartment overall was quite sterile and dark. Not super cozy but served its purpose as a place to sleep and shower.

An amazing place to stay in Montreal! It was a clean, stylish apartment that offered some great amenities. However, the best part of the whole apartment is its location. We were close to so many great restaurants and activities. This apartment is an easy recommendation.
Amazing location, and great value for a spot in Montreal

The apartment is big, well located near good restaurants in Le Plateau. Some parts of the floor were broken and the kitchen and bathroom floors were sticking. We asked for an extra cleaning and the concierge answered our message within a few minutes, but unfortunately, even with an extra cleaning the floor was still sticking. The best part of the apartment is its location.
AMAZING LOCATION. Clean and stylish space. Super fun - best Airbnb I've ever stayed at.

Great location, comfortable amenities, but what you don't see (or hear) in the ad are: music from the downstairs retail store, noise from the upstairs renters, one bedroom with no windows, outlets, or ventilation, a TV with no cable or antenna access, and street noise. It's a great rental if you plan to be out and about in Montreal.

This is a great place to rent, right in the heart of the nightlife. My friends and I really enjoyed the location and the space was beautiful. It looks even bigger in person than the photos! Thank you for the stay! I would definitely stay here again
The host cancelled this reservation 6 days before arrival. This is an automated message.

Farid was very helpful with getting around Montreal. His location is perfect for all the sights and attractions, I had an amazing time for my first visit to Montreal! I would definitely stay at his apartment again!

The apartment is perfectly located for exploring Montreal, close to a metro stop and within walking distance of shops, restaurants, etc. The WiFi is fast and reliable, and Netflix is also excellent. However, it was quite dirty and somewhat rundown.

Great location right off St. Laurent. Lots of great restaurants nearby. Very cool loft apartment with lots of space. The second bedroom is a futon, could have used an extra blanket or sheet for it. 

The apartment was nice and clean. Ben was great and met us to show us around when we arrived, and to help park.
Ben welcomed us on site and explained the amenities of the condo very well. Location in the heart of Montreal. Close to St-Laurent Blvd. Great!
I will save my comments for later.

Great modern apartment with a super cool shower. Location is right off Saint Laurent, super close to a Saq, Cafe Campus, Schwartz Deli. Convenient to everywhere, just a couple of blocks from the Sherbrooke Metro, great place.

The hosts are very warm and communicative. The location is really great, very close to downtown, McGill, Old Port, and other POIs. The apartment was nice and modern with good amenities. The only problem is that the second bed is on a loft on top of the other bed, which means there is no privacy at all. It has a very short ceiling so it's only good for sleeping. And, the AC and ceiling fans do not reach the loft, so it was always hot.
Large space, clean and tidy. Comfortable large sofa, supermarket and bars nearby.

Ben was a wonderful and accommodating host. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the loft. Everything was perfect for our two-night stay in Montreal. La Plateau is a vibrant and fun neighborhood and I can't imagine staying anywhere else in the city. The apartment is so comfortable and relaxing. I especially loved the oversized bathtub and waterfall shower. 

Ben was very easy to communicate with and was kind enough to check in with us during our stay to make sure we had everything we needed. He was able to provide great restaurant recommendations and beyond. Thank you, Ben! :)

If you are looking for a fun and comfortable place to stay in Montreal, look no further. It exceeded all of our expectations.
Ben was very welcoming in his well-located condo. We walked everywhere, and the photos matched the description perfectly, and the bonus was the amazing rooftop terrace!

Our stay in Montreal was nothing short of ideal. The space is exactly as advertised, if not better. The open layout was perfect for hosting three friends and me. We made great use of each and every amenity, including the rooftop patio, which provides a great view of the surrounding neighborhoods and skyline. The condo is located in the heart of the action and finding something to do was never an issue. What impressed us more than the condo itself was Ben's willingness to make our stay as memorable as possible. Ben ensured that we knew of all the best places to eat and which events to attend for the true Montreal experience.

What you see is what you get! The place looked exactly as it did in the pics. Very clean, modern, fully stocked with everything you need and more right down to board games, books and movies. Ben was very accommodating and even offered to pick us up from the airport but we were driving. He had the place ready on time and took us on a walk through to make sure we were good instead of just handing us the keys and splitting. This was my first Airbnb experience and after this one I will be using Airbnb again for sure.

Thanks Ben and Airbnb!!

Bens place was very spacious and modern, with all the amenities we could want. Both Ben and his wife were super lovely and accommodated us with an early check-in at the last minute and had great communication. Ben and his wife even greeted us with fresh bagels and schmear from the famous Fairmont bagel shop and croissants. Their communication was great, and the place was a great deal for the area. It is super close to a lot of bars, restaurants, and shops and walkable to the metro which was about 10 minutes away and close to many buses. Even though it was a hip and somewhat loud area on the weekend, being off one of the side streets was very nice and quiet for a good night's rest. One thing to note is that you will need to use the set of keys to lock the door so going in and out requires the keys. It took some coordination but in the end it worked out. His entertainment setup is also amazing for when you want to curl up and watch one of their diverse library of DVDs with surround sound. All in all, I would stay again and Ben was a good host for our first time in Montreal.

Ben was incredibly helpful throughout our entire stay. We met to pick up the keys, and then he was available via text for the duration of our visit. We were also very grateful for his assistance after we left, when we realized that we had accidentally left some luggage outside on the sidewalk. He did everything he possibly could to help us retrieve it.  We truly appreciate him going the extra mile.

Ben's place was awesome! We loved the space and it had everything we needed. The only issue we had was our car was too big for the underground parking garage, as the roof was super low, so we had to find street parking.

Everything was great! The apartment was beautiful and within walking distance of most places we visited during our stay. 

Ben was very friendly and helpful with anything we needed during our stay!

Thank you again, Ben!

Great condo in a fantastic location, close to plenty of shops and restaurants. Walking distance to downtown. The pictures are very accurate so we knew what to expect on arrival. We were able to park the car on the street, although an underground garage was available if needed. Ben was a very helpful and friendly guy. We had a good stay at Ben's place and were very comfortable there.
Ben is very kind and welcoming, the condo is magnificent, and very well-located!
An excellent host, Ben went out of his way to make visiting Montreal such a great experience!
Very beautiful condo and very well located. Ben is very welcoming and sociable.
The place was great, as was the host! I would recommend staying here.
I loved staying there. Very welcoming.
Angel is a very nice and accommodating host! The apartment is pleasant to live in and clean. Close to the metro and city center. We had a wonderful stay!
Angel is warm and welcoming and has a beautiful apartment. I would recommend his place to anyone visiting downtown Montreal!

Chris is a nice person who makes you feel welcome in his place. He has good communication and is there to help if you need it. I didn't have any problems. Clean place, close to the metro station and other bars.
People were very nice. The noise level at night is high due to its proximity to a karaoke bar, but overall it was a great experience for the price.
Excellent location, clean, quiet, and meets basic needs for a place to lay your head.

I had a great time at Chris' place! He doesn't live there himself, but welcomed me and made sure everything was alright. He is the nicest, gave me tips for the city and prepared a little care package for me. The apartment is okay, a student flat in a great neighborhood, very close to downtown Montreal. I would definitely come back!

The place was really easy to find from the highway and super close to the metro station. The apartment is big and spacious, clean - very minimalist. The hosts were very nice and easy to get in touch with.
Great experience, treated us well
Perfect location had a little hiccup with finding which apartment was mine wasn't listed in guest details, other than that I enjoyed my stay super clean and neat... I want a condo now haha

The location of the elbow is very convenient for those seeking "hub of attraction"
The condo is as perfect as shown in the pictures and even better.
Flatbook made the stay very pleasant due to their 24/7 prompt responses and assistance.
Highly recommended.
Our stay was great. Access codes were emailed to us before arrival, the location was very convenient and the apartment was clean and well-furnished. We wish every Airbnb was this easy.

We loved staying at this condo! The condo was clean, spacious and in a great location. The host responded to our questions within minutes and provided us with everything we asked for. We definitely want to stay at this condo again the next time we are in Montreal.
The accommodation perfectly matches the description. It is very well located and very well served. Communication with the owner was very easy. I highly recommend this apartment to discover Montreal.
Everything was as we expected

Close to downtown Montreal. Had a wonderful stay at this location! Brand new condo, extremely clean! We had a great time at this Airbnb! 
We will definitely stay here again next time we're in town.
Super easy check-in/check-out process. Great spot and location, very clean, with everything necessary for a good stay.

The Sondra group responded promptly and thoroughly to all of my questions. The apartment had all the amenities you could want, great Wi-Fi, and excellent suggestions for things to do and see in Montreal.

The location was perfect as it was within walking distance of Old Montreal, downtown, and Rue St Dennis. 

They even left a nice gift for my birthday in the apartment upon my arrival! I highly recommend them for your stay in Montreal!

Mike White
We received a lot of information before our stay and everything was well planned out. The location was excellent, and the space was exactly what we were looking for. Great!
Great location and nice unit.

Lovely condo that looks true to the photos and is in excellent condition. The kitchen was well-appointed with the basic things we needed. Beds are a bit noisy and bedding is nice to look at but cheap quality so not very comfortable. Note that it is a great, central location though it's on a somewhat seedier block of Ste. Catherine so you will see homeless people hanging around the church across the street from the condo often. We didn't have any issues though. Also, the smoke detector was off the wall and not working when we arrived, but I received a prompt reply via email from Sonder with an offer to fix it ASAP. Overall, a good place to stay in downtown Montreal.
The Hyatt Hotel is located approximately 1.5 blocks away from the bustling area with a nearby convenience store. The facilities are clean and they fulfill all your requests, including towels.

We enjoyed our stay in Sonder's place. Check-in was easy and the apartment is really well located to get around the city. You can walk both to the Plateau area and Old Town. 

The apartment also had everything we needed for our stay, and we were able to eat some evenings at home when we didn't have the energy to go out. One of the beds squeaked quite a bit, so if you are a light sleeper it could be a bit hard. I would recommend staying at the apartment.

Incredibly inflexible and unhelpful. Had to cancel a trip due to illness. Very much understand no refund being made available as it was a last minute change. That being said, I did not expect to be charged cleaning fees for an unused apartment that had been cleaned prior to our arrival. 

AVOID

Great location close to everything! Just a few short blocks from the Just For Laughs festival and Place des Arts. Walking distance to the entertainment area of Rue Saint-Denis, Old Montreal, and numerous other attractions.

The condo was new, very bright, very clean and modern in a secure building. Easy access instructions. Easy and great communication with the folks at Sonder. 

Hope to stay here again someday.

Horrible time the whole family had to shower at the YMCA
Spent more time on the phone being passed around from representative to representative and lowball offers of compensation
Disgusted

This apartment is really well located! Super easy check-in and check-out. The apartment is so nicely decorated, super well-furnished, and extremely clean. I wish there was a little more light in the rooms.

Our host made arrangements easy and convenient. The neighborhood was wonderful, easily accessible to bars, restaurants, and subways, yet quiet and charming. We really enjoyed sitting outside in the shared space with a beer or tea.

Pamela's place was just what we wanted. Quiet neighborhood, GREAT location in Mile End. Quaint backyard, comfortable bed and clean bathroom. Our host was communicative and left the key in an easy-to-find spot for us. There is some non-resident parking right in front of the house - perfect! There is also a lovely little football field behind the back yard where there is always someone (kids/adults alike) playing a game. Plenty of coffee shops, restaurants, bars and locally owned boutiques within walking distance. Perfect!

Centrally located apartment in a really nice, lively area of Montreal. Very welcoming host. Isabelle was SO thoughtful. She offered a disposable kitty litter and catnip for my cat, who quite enjoyed the stay too!

The room (and apartment) was SUPER clean and came with everything from a bathrobe to shampoos and soaps to even - and this one impressed me a lot - a PRAYER MAT. For people who need one to pray! I had NEVER seen anywhere think of providing so simple and obvious an amenity before, not even expensive hotels. It shows a level of empathy that she continued to demonstrate during the whole 10 days I stayed with her.

She's a good conversationalist and also very capable of resolving conflict calmly, which is good since there are bound to be toes stepped on when two strangers decide to live together for several days.

All in all, despite some minor awkwardness, I'd say that I had a nice stay and would recommend Isabelle's company and hospitality to anyone wanting to find low-price high-class accommodations in Montreal for a brief time.

The host: Isabelle is a fantastic host. She is direct, easygoing, and fun with a great sense of humor (to the extent that she understands and appreciates mine. lol). It was easy to communicate with her, and we had some interesting exchanges. A brilliant conversationalist who has an interesting opinion on the surrounding world.

The place: The room has all the basic amenities you could dream of with a great balcony to enjoy if the host agreed to share it with you. Although small, this is a known fact, it's perfect for the solo traveler. 

The neighborhood: I've lived in Montreal for quite a while now and am still puzzled by Mile End. I call it "the little Paris" because of the amount of French people living there, but not only. The place is charming, and the small cafes and pizzerias definitely give you a taste of Europe.

Isabelle welcomed me, and I felt like she had been my good friend for a long time by the time I left! Isabelle went out of her way to find a parking spot, made sure my stay was lovely and comfortable. She is a fabulous chef, and a wonderful company.  I truly enjoyed my stay.

Bad weather forced me to advance my arrival and Isabelle was available to receive me a little earlier than planned. A neighbor was making noise and she went to ask him to lower the volume. In short, she managed to make my stay comfortable and I thank her for it.
Great place, great hostess, great value.

The host made us feel very welcome, we were six of us. Everything was clean and spacious and the neighborhood was right in downtown with all the amenities and restaurants. Although it rained, we still had a good time.

The apartment was lovely and in a fantastic location in Montreal. 

Just as described. 

Kenny was welcoming and helpful. He made our stay very pleasant and accommodated our arrival and departure times.

We had the most wonderful experience at Kenny's spot! It's in an awesome location, central in the Plateau, and a quick 10-15 minute drive or cab into downtown.

It is cute, clean, and he leaves you towels and other nice additions that really make you feel comfortable! 

The property is set up through an entry code so no key exchange makes everything so seamless and efficient.

We will definitely come back to stay here again!

Although we didn't meet our host in person, he communicated with us via text and promptly replied to any of our exchanges. We arrived in the evening and the lights and air conditioning were on for our comfort. Fresh flowers were on the table and the apartment was clean and stocked with all necessary supplies. The apartment was spacious enough for our family of six. Great location, close to shops, clubs, and restaurants. We would definitely come again.

The apartment is very well located, on the Mount Royal plateau, close to restaurants and shops.

Kenny was very attentive and did everything he could to make our stay pleasant.

The apartment is just like in the photos, with 3 beautiful bedrooms and a terrace.

We highly recommend it.

Very nice place with three proper bedrooms and a sofa, kitchen and living room. There were four of us and we were perfectly comfortable. In a great central location, easy walk or short drive from many Montreal destinations. Kenny was very accessible. Thank you!
It's my first time using Airbnb, overall it's a nice house!

Kenny's Airbnb was very spacious and unique. Everything was clean and the location (Plateau) was really good. Close to many bars and restaurants without the noise and crowds of the downtown core of Montreal (which can be reached by foot in 20-30 minutes or easily via subway).

Check-in/check-out was convenient using a key code. The apartment had a dishwasher, AC unit, washer, and dryer. There's also a TV box with Netflix, a nice added touch.

Free parking provided at the back of the house was very helpful. Finding parking in Montreal can be a huge headache.

I would definitely stay here again!

Cute place that sleeps 3 singles comfortably (though we were only two). Loved the quirky decor. There was coffee, sugar cubes, and a French press which was nice. No hairdryer though, so ladies - bring your own. :)

Very well organized
However, it is a bit noisy
Very large space. The photos did not capture its full extent. It has everything you need. Excellent location. Parking space is a little awkward.

Our experience with Kenny was wonderful. Kenny was very quick to respond and helped us find an extra parking space for our U-Haul trailer which we had with us as we were moving our son into his apartment for the school year.  

The location is perfect, the apartment is large and I especially enjoyed sipping my coffee on the back balcony! Also, the free parking was fantastic for a small/regular sized vehicle. Parking may be too tight for a large SUV. The keyless entry was convenient, and the AC was welcome as it happened to be a hot and muggy couple of days.  Finally, we asked what we should do upon leaving and Kenny quickly wrote back "don't do a thing" and "good luck" to our son. It was a nice, personal touch.

It was great staying at the heart of Rue St Denis, just 2 blocks from the Metro. Having a parking space is an added bonus. Air conditioning was great. Kenny was so thoughtful; she left bottles of water for us, which was a nice treat during the hot streak. The terrace was a nice treat. This place is awesome for a family.

This property has a great location and unlike most in the area, it offers a private (albeit small) parking spot in the rear alley. 

It features two terraces, one overlooking busy St Denis, the other overlooking the backyard. 

The parking spot is a bit difficult to get in and out of. My full-size car fit, but I needed my travel partner to guide me when leaving the spot. 

Coffee and bottled water were readily available and a nice touch. 

The Metro station is very close by. 

I think it would be tight fitting six people comfortably. One bed is quite small; five would be more accurate. 

The free WiFi was fast and reliable. 

The host was very responsive with emails, arranging how to access the apartment.

Great place to stay! Very clean and conveniently located near all the bars and restaurants and a metro station. It was very quiet, so you don't hear anything from the outside. I would definitely stay again and recommend it to future Montreal travelers!

We had a great experience for our first time at an Airbnb. We really enjoyed our stay, and the location was wonderful. The rooms were clean, and the place had a cozy feel to it. We would definitely repeat.
Terrific place in Montreal. Great location. Clean and comfortable.

Kenny's apartment is a great place to stay in Montreal. Like others have said, it's located in the heart of a great neighborhood, Plateau Mont Royal, and right around the corner from a metro station. There are multiple great bars and restaurants (including a bistro called Cafe Cherrier and the famous L'Express) within just a few minutes' walk.

We were a group of four and the apartment fit us very comfortably. The rooms are spaced pretty far apart for privacy, which was an added bonus. The bathroom is large and the water pressure in the shower was excellent (it's a pet peeve of mine when pressure is low!).

Kenny was extremely responsive—he answered a bunch of my emails before the trip and a couple I had while we were staying at the apartment, most of them nearly immediately. 

I would definitely stay here again!
Great
Kenny's Place was very clean, as we expected and she even allowed us to return the next day when we forgot our trays. We would definitely stay here again.

The apartment was adequately sized. The location was excellent, a three-minute walk to the metro station and a bus stop right outside the front door. The street scene was quiet as was the apartment itself.

The place is located in a great neighborhood, right on the Plateau and not far from the trendy Mile End neighborhood. There are many nearby places to eat or go out. The apartment itself is very nice, comfortable, and quite spacious.
Kenny is an excellent host with great communication and accommodation. The apartment is located in a trendy neighborhood and is very comfortable for 6-8 people.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay! Mona Lisa Apartment was just like the pictures and very charming! The Da Vinci theme was not lost on us... I loved the "last supper" on exposed brick.  Rooms were clean, bright and as pictured. Our host communicated beautifully and we were happy to find our accommodation in a new city with surprisingly little stress!
Private parking, laundry, two lovely decks, near bistros, across street from lovely cafe with the best croissants and coffee, metro very close, 1.9 mile easy walk to Old Montreal, park nearby, ... We loved it! We will be back.

The entry/exit organization is very well done. We were not very present in the accommodation (kitchen not used), due to our discovery of Montreal!  
The accommodation is well described in the listing. Construction all along. Well located to discover Montreal... a friendly café located right across the street. 
A slight drawback on the bathroom cleaning, particularly the bathtub... but it can be fixed. 
Good value for money. No visual contact with Kenny, communication by email... Access code for the accommodation. Thank you for allowing us to leave our luggage after 12 pm since we had an evening flight.
The living space is cozy with ample room for 5-6 people, a great location in a charming neighborhood, parking spaces and a small balcony.

We had a lovely time here. The apartment was huge, super spacious with two balconies and everything we needed for a home base in Montreal. Kenny was super fast on our inquiries, and parking/checking in were a breeze. The location is great, with lots of awesome restaurants around, and the park not too far away. We highly recommend it. Thank you Kenny for the great stay!

The Mona Lisa is a fabulous place to stay in Montreal. It's location is smack in the middle of a vibrant neighborhood with lots of shops and restaurants. It's a quick walk to wherever you want to go and the metro. Inside there is lots of space to stretch out. We were three people and never felt crowded. The bathroom is nice and the shower had plenty of hot water. Overall, a good choice for a weekend in the city.

We had a great weekend at Mona Lisa! It was the perfect location for exploring the neighborhood and the entire city. It was convenient for transportation and even had a parking spot. I would definitely recommend staying there.

With a very late arrival, Kenny was very understanding and so we were able to enter the accommodation without any difficulty. The apartment is in accordance with the photos, spacious and very well equipped. Close to the metro, and very well located, it's ideal for people wanting to visit the city. Thank you very much Kenny, we really enjoyed our stay in Montreal.

The apartment was great! We loved the location and Kenny answered all my questions very quickly. The space was clean and lots of space for us. It was great having the items needed to make coffee and a quick breakfast before heading out for the day. I would highly recommend this listing.
Kenny's place is amazing :) It is right next to plenty of great food, bars, and shopping. It's very cozy and easy to access with parking in the back and the metro down the street. Thank you Kenny!

Basic apartment on the second floor of an old, Second Empire residential building. Front and rear porches. Three nice bedrooms plus a sleep-able sofa and a spare queen mattress. 

This place can easily accommodate eight with good privacy.

Shops all around for basics and beer plus some lovely cheese shops and bakeries.

Great location.

Two parking spaces in the back.
Liked everything about the place. It was very warm and very close to amazing places.
Nice flat ideally located in the heart of "Le Plateau," a 2-minute walk from Mont Royal Street and the tube station. Convenient for parking a car. Kenny was very nice and helpful!

The place was great to stay at! Kenny is very accommodating and the space was great. The beds were very comfortable and clean. The neighborhood was cute and there was a lot to see on foot, we didn't even need to use our car.

Kenny's place was perfectly situated, just a 3-minute walk from the metro and right across the road from a cute coffee shop (with lots more great restaurants, bars, and shops within walking distance). Kenny was very quick to respond to questions and provided info clearly. We liked that the apartment had Netflix already set up, and the kitchen was well-stocked with utensils if you want to save some money and cook for yourself. Bring your own food staples though, (salt, sugar, butter, etc) as there was no food in the apartment. Parking spot was easy to find, and we enjoyed the general feel of the place (brick walls, a good amount of light, big stack of clean towels). Our only real complaints were first, that the apartment is listed as 1.5 bathrooms, but there was only 1. As there were 4 of us, this wouldn't have been a deal breaker but we would have liked to know what to expect ahead of time. And second, the bed in the back bedroom was not very comfortable (the front bedroom was fine, and no one slept in the middle bedroom so I can't speak for its comfort level). All in all, I would recommend Kenny's apartment; I do wish we'd come during the spring or summer months to enjoy the two private balconies and backyard!
The geographical location is ideal. The beds are very comfortable.

Fantastic location with lots of nice restaurants and shops, all within walking distance.  Warm and cozy feeling, and a family of six comfortably fit, I would definitely stay there again. 
- Tammy
good

The apartment is very well-located but of low quality, with average equipment. There are no amenities for short stays (e.g., salt, oil, basic foodstuffs...). 

It does not justify the advertised price.
Very well located apartment. Nice 3 bedrooms and large living space. Check-in and check-out are very easy! This is my second time at Kenny's place and it's great!
Wonderful place! Big, clean and comfortable. The location is next to lots of restaurants and bars. I will definitely come back.

Magnificent apartment ideally located with a parking space. 
It would need a little maintenance to make it perfect and for the dishwasher to work...

Montreal Mona Lisa was everything that was promised: well located, clean, comfortable, and with parking at the back. Check-in was super easy and Kenny was an attentive host, getting back to us quickly with any questions we had. We'd be happy to stay there again.
Clean, nice and cozy in a great location!

We were three colleagues and the apartment was perfectly suited for that. Three individual bedrooms with a shared bathroom. The location on Saint Denis Street is excellently situated, close to shops and restaurants and the Laurier and Mont-Royal metro stations.

Attention if you are coming from France, there are no adapter plugs, so you will need to bring your own but there are stores like La Source on Mont-Royal street and likely many others. 

For cooking, there is a small amount of dishes but for us who only used them very simply it was enough.
The bedrooms are spacious with good bedding. We don't physically meet Kenny but she is very responsive and answers all our questions during the stay. A little problem with the entrance door and her father is there in 5 minutes. He is very nice and accommodating.

In short, a very good stay with a good value for money.

The apartment is very good! I was there with my family (4 people in total) and we had a very good time. Close to cafes and restaurants, Mount Royal Park and Little Italy, the flat is also close to public transport and underground stations. Communication with Kenny was precise and super easy.  I would like to repeat the experience in Montreal and I suggest this flat to everyone!

Kenny was a great host. The apartment was very clean, as expected. We had an issue with parking where a guest staying in the other unit occupied two parking spots, which forced our car to get very close to the neighbor's spot. I sent an email to Kenny and she contacted the other guest and resolved the parking situation very quickly.
The host cancelled this reservation 116 days before arrival. This is an automated message.

Kenny's place was such a great decision! It's right in the heart of Montreal. The rooms were kept clean and tidy, and the apartment as a whole was so quaint! It was perfect for 6 people. The parking space was helpful for anyone driving up, no need to find street parking. Kenny was very quick to respond to any questions I had! Definitely would recommend.

Great location, with a parking spot right smack in the middle of all the action. Many good choices for food, coffee, cocktails, and enjoyment within a 5-minute walk. The check-in process was super easy and Kenny was very quick to get back to me about any questions.
Convenient location and ample space, everything worked out well.

There are a number of good things about this apartment: it's in a great location, it has three bedrooms with good-sized beds, the use of a private parking space is very helpful, and the wifi and hot water worked fine.

However, I expected something more upscale given the cost. We had water dripping inside the window when it rained at night, entry systems that stopped working (and some confusion over who to contact about that), light switches in odd places, one loud air conditioning unit for the whole apartment - a number of glitches. 

The apartment definitely worked for us during our four-night stay. But there were a number of issues along the way.

This was a great option for a decently sized group of people looking to explore Montreal on a budget; there's plenty of good enough bedding (it seems like there's at least one extra spare air mattress and couch space, if your party is more than 6 people). The location is stellar (walkable to many areas of interest, with good restaurants), and the check-in process is hassle free.
Overall, Kenny's is a great place. The only suggestion I have would be for the tub, as it could use a slight improvement.

A lovely place in a great location. I especially appreciated the small balconies in front and back, where we enjoyed our morning coffee and our evening glasses of wine. Only issue was with the sheer curtains. You had better be prepared to get up when the sun does!
Average stay. Nothing outstanding.

Great location and nice light inside the house thanks to two skylights. It's fairly quiet inside though the front bedroom gets some traffic noise from the street -- but nothing that would interfere with sleep as long as you're used to living in a city. 

One thing to note is that the apartment is on the third floor and the rear staircase is somewhat precarious. You might want to get a street parking spot in front of the house first to unlock the door and unload large items, then move the car to the dedicated parking spot in the back. Otherwise it takes a minute or two to walk around the block from the back to the front or vice-versa.

A minor annoyance is that all the drains have fine mesh filters on them that get stuck very quickly. We ended up having to clean out the bathroom filter pretty much every night.

Contrary to the description, the apartment does have a hair dryer, but did not have shampoo when we visited. There's a drugstore across from the metro station if you need to pick anything up.
Nice apartment in a fantastic location. Plenty to see and do nearby, and a great space for groups to stay. We'd definitely stay here again.
The place is adequate. Very well located. Very comfortable, it's a 3-bedroom apartment! Full kitchen. Kenny was very kind. I recommend this place.
Awesome place, parking spot in the back and close to downtown.
Great location, great apartment with lots of room, Kenny was very helpful. Would definitely book again.

The space was awesome for our needs - really spacious with three bedrooms and an additional mattress. Very close to Mont Royal metro station. Exceptionally fast response to all communication - and very clear instructions. Only complaint is the air conditioning unit is just not sufficient for the space on a super hot day. First night was exceptionally uncomfortable - slowly got better as the nights after were much cooler. Really enjoyed everything else though and would recommend.

Very well situated near the Mont Royal tube station, with lots of restaurants and nice shops around. The street-facing room gets very noisy because of traffic, but the other two are nice and quiet. The flat is well equipped and friendly. Kenny responded promptly and well to all our requests. I'd go there again.
Well-placed and perfect for a family with three children.
Location, location, location!  Walking distance to bars, cafes, and restaurants. We wish there was a coffee machine, but it's never been an issue with a great cafe just across the street!

We had a very nice stay at Kenny's apartment. He was very responsive via email and was able to accommodate a slightly earlier check-in for one of our guests. The apartment was in a nice location and well suited for a group of 3. We would return to Kenny's apartment.
The host cancelled this reservation 45 days before arrival. This is an automated message.

The accommodation is very well-located with 3 nice bedrooms. Contrary to what is written in the description, there is no TV. You need to call to get the wifi code.

The accommodation deserves to be maintained by the host, particularly for the cleaning area...attention there's nothing to cook, no pots, no bowls, not even a cutting board.

I have no doubt this was once a beauty (whenever the pictures were taken). However, the host admitted that the space had been rented to a long-term tenant and the evidence was everywhere...from cigarette butts left both inside and outside as well as drug paraphernalia left behind. The floor obviously hadn't been mopped in quite some time and it smelled of smoke. There was no TV (although it was listed on the listing) and the smoke detector was not working and was not addressed when pointed out. Old linens were left behind but removed when requested due to smell. As well, the dishwasher was plugged into an extension cord, which was plugged into the wall and would trip the breaker when turned on at the same time as the AC. On a positive note, the location is great, the AC worked, and the beds were comfortable.

The Mona Lisa apartment is located in a wonderful neighborhood with parks and the beautiful Mount Royal on one side, and the vibrant Mile End district on the other. It's close to the subway and therefore a good choice for every explorer. The interior of the home is pretty as well, although it would benefit from some renovations in certain areas. The host is incredibly responsive and helpful, so that was never much of an issue. Overall, I recommend it for families.

Well-located, clean and well-maintained housing. 

Includes air conditioning and Wi-Fi. 

Bathroom a bit dated.
The person who intervenes for the owner enters the apartment without warning.
Excellent location, spacious and bright! No fixed parking space.

Great location on a busy street, but noise is not an issue. There are many bars and restaurants within walking distance. Close to the subway.  Slightly dated decor, but it's clean and functional with good value for the city.
Good value for the price. The space was comfortable, the location was fantastic, and communication with the host was very easy.

Montreal Monalisa is located in an ideal location. Very close to the metro and restaurants. The outdoor terrace near the kitchen is a lovely place to have breakfast. We found the unit clean. 

Some observations. We saw 2 smoke alarms in the hanging basket. Not quite sure why they were there, but any future guest should ask about this. There was no toaster. Not quite sure if this was an oversight or are there electrical issues. They did have a portable air conditioner which provided enough cooling for the main area, but the bedrooms were warm. One of the fans did not work and another did not function as well as it should. There was not a third one.  An unusually warm time in Montreal, there needs to be better air flow in the bedrooms, which means three well functioning fans. Light switches were hard to find and some of the lights did not work. 

The main complaint is that they listed as an amenity, a parking space. This is not true. Fortunately, the manager was there when we arrived and very graciously got in my car and helped us find a public parking space that was good until we left. Public parking is very difficult in this neighborhood, so be aware that this could be a problem.
The apartment is well-located, just next to a metro station. However, if you are counting on parking, be aware that it is an error and parking your car is very complicated in Montreal.

Great location for those who love the neighborhood like us...

Beautiful house view from the street. 
Nice brick walls on the interior side...
For the rest, quite average. It would deserve to be "repainted" and a good sweep.
Spacious apartment, very well located (with a free parking space). Some outdated equipment (or that doesn't work). Please note, it is not suitable for an infant (steep and unsafe staircase).
We had a very good time in Montreal. Kenny gave us some good addresses. A slightly worn-out but very pleasant accommodation and a brand new kitchen battery.

Very nice apartment, very well located. We lived there with four people, our stay was very pleasant! I recommend it! 

The apartment is very warm and very well equipped

Apartment well-located with 3 bedrooms, therefore practical for groups or large families. The best thing is having two small balconies to enjoy the Montreal sunshine.

The downside is the bathroom, we had big problems with the bathtub and it's quite tricky considering there were 5 of us using it. 

Overall, we enjoyed our stay here!

No dedicated parking space (which is why I gave a 3-star rating). This was a big issue for us since we had a rental. Parking in Montreal is difficult and confusing for visitors. If you can't read French, it's almost impossible.

The apartment is in an amazing location (two metro stops very close) and is big for the area! (Deserves 5 stars). Three nice-sized bedrooms with loads of hanging closet space/storage space. Two small balconies, one facing the road and one facing the alley. Both are relaxing to sit on. The kitchen had all the amenities we needed. Nice size bathroom! The water pressure in the shower is very low. As a woman with medium length hair, I had to spend much more time than usual washing out my shampoo/conditioner. 

My main concern is the lack of communication from the host. If you call him, he answers, but if you email him through Airbnb (which he prefers), he either doesn't answer or answers late. With our parking issue when we arrived this was a big deal for us. Just call him for any issues you might have.
Great location
Great place. Lots of space. Beautiful outdoor space.
Ideally located apartment on the plateau. Very spacious and very bright, with a nice little balcony at the back. Fully equipped with all necessary amenities. Thank you again!
Spacious, bright apartment ideally located on the plateau. Host very responsive via messaging. Thank you!
super cozy and nice place
Great place to stay with all the amenities you need. Electronic lock for easy check-in. Located right next to many great bars, shops, and restaurants.
Great location and very easy check-in. Parking availability was also very convenient. Perfect for a traveling group of friends.
Kenny's place was neat and tidy. It was located in a prime spot in the city, with many nearby attractions within walking distance.
Spot was good, however parking was an issue
The accommodation was pleasant, spacious and with a very nice decor situated near the Mount Royal plateau. We had a very enjoyable stay

Overall, the stay was good. Generally as expected and in a good location. However, some things could be improved. 

We ran out of toilet paper and the host told us where the new rolls were, but there was only one extra and we had already found and used it. So the last day of our stay was without any. 

I was also thrown off by a racist remark made by the host when we arrived, which came of an unnecessarily prolonged banter when we just wanted to unpack and rest. Probably would not stay here again for this reason alone.
Good apartment but had some trouble checking in!
Well-located apartment
Super well-located beautiful apartment
Okay, nice place to live, very good location, only downside is there's no parking at the residence
Thank you very much, Kenny! We absolutely loved the apartment. The beds are very comfortable, the kitchen is well-equipped, and the bathroom already had everything we needed.

We did not meet Rebekah, it was an acquaintance who gave us and took back the keys. We were a family of 4 (a baby and a 4-year-old child).

We liked: the proximity of shops (supermarket, pharmacy, fruit shop, the warm Rose Café), the bus at the foot of the building, the size of the apartment comfortable for 4,
We less liked: the apartment not very clean (cigarette smell, ashtray not emptied, a match in the bedroom - for a non-smoking apartment!! - the parquet that darkened our daughter's knees at four years old, the fridge not stocked, dust under the cushions of the sofas ... and so on), the lack of equipment (broom, vacuum cleaner, dishes to prepare food), the washing machine defective (it broke down after 2 uses, we had to go to the laundromat), the broken lights in both bedrooms (which we repaired), the TV which is actually a screen for watching DVDs, the bedding for the third person in the small closed room is actually a non-convertible sofa of one meter long (our four-year-old son could not sleep on it ...). Rebekah therefore made us use an inflatable mattress.

It's a cheaper apartment, certainly, but not consistent with the description. Good for a couple who likes to eat outdoors.

Fannie's apartment is a typical apartment in the Villeray neighborhood with lots of charm. Clean, perfect for a couple! The neighborhood is very nice with plenty of restaurants and shops nearby the apartment. The Jarry metro station is 2 minutes away on foot and allows easy access to downtown Montreal. I highly recommend it without hesitation! We loved this neighborhood so much that we want to move there ;)

My accommodation was very warm and pleasant overall. I really enjoyed the neighborhood for its proximity to many places that are dear to me: park, Talon market, Villeray... The metro is very convenient, a 2-minute walk away, in just a few minutes you can find yourself right in the heart of Montreal.

The accommodation itself was enjoyable, but quite dim. The room was super, and the bedding gave us some great nights' sleep. 

Cleaning could be more thorough, as the place didn't breathe very well when we arrived.  Also, there was a minor issue with the neighbors; we had a concert every evening which can be annoying when you come home after a full day in the constant noise of the city. 

Thank you Fannie for being so pleasant and accommodating. Thank you to her for being present when we needed it.

I had an amazing time staying in this apartment. It's a great place with a large group of people and everyone is very friendly and makes you feel comfortable. In just a few days, they took me to explore Montreal, helped me with my administrative tasks, and explained the differences between Canada and my home country. We even had some big communal meals... 
I particularly recommend this stay for active people who want to make new friends. There's always someone at the apartment, it's lively, and for those who appreciate that, it can be amazing. 
It's not far from the bus/metro. I was able to get to downtown Montreal multiple times without any problems in a short amount of time. 
The apartment is bigger than the photos show. 
My room was spacious and comfortable. No issues with cleanliness. 
Despite the short duration of my stay, I know I'll keep in touch with my hosts and continue visiting regularly. 

TL;DR: Bigger than the pictures show, nothing negative to say, very lively and a huge plus for the conviviality and charm of the shared living spaces.
I stayed here for 3.5 months and had an amazing experience! It had everything I needed and was very comfortable. Fantastic location!

Very well located, bus 165 at the door of the building, 5 minutes walk from the Guy Concordia metro station (green line), clean and organized apartment, small kitchen but equipped. Good heating and fast internet. A small defect is that there is no TV. Samuel responds to emails very quickly and can assist with what is necessary! I recommend it.

I lived in a downtown apartment for over a month and it was nice. The apartment is really big and gets a lot of sun. The best part is that it's away from the street so there's no dust or traffic noise. Things that bothered me were the smoke smell, and noisy neighbors at times.

Very good apartment! Studio very well located, close to the metro and Sant Catherine Avenue! Samuel always answered my messages and always helped me quickly! I recommend this apartment because it's very close to everything and very well-equipped
Friendly host. Good location, but could use some cleaning.
Accommodation in the city center. Fully equipped and spacious. Samuel responds very quickly, the stay was really appreciated! Thank you
Great responsiveness and perfect for a long stay!
This place is in a fantastic location, very close to the main downtown offices, about a 1km walk to Bell Centre, etc.
Very well-located housing.

This was a great place to stay with even better people to deal with! We unfortunately didn't get a chance to meet the owners, but they answered within reasonable time and were very kind. Very cute place, close to the subway, churches, restaurants, and more. My boyfriend and I had a lovely weekend and are very grateful we found lovely people to lend us their home. We would recommend them to anyone! Thanks again and all the best!
We had an excellent stay here.

Our trip to St. Henri was wonderful. The apartment was a great space for two and Ode was an excellent host. This was our first time using Airbnb and we can't wait to plan our next trip! Thanks again, Ode!!
Ode's apartment is very nice, pleasant and functional. There are quite a few restaurants nearby and parking space for the car. An excellent stay!

Jonathan and Catherine's place was really comfortable, clean and nice. Catherine was attentive, she made us feel at home and she even recommended us some places to visit. 

We loved the private rooftop, you can read a book, drink a beer or enjoy the view.

Catherine made us feel right at home! She responded very quickly to messages and was very helpful with tips about things to do in Montreal. The place is lovely, and the rooftop terrace is a great addition! The flat is in a very lively and vibrant neighborhood. Overall, a great stay!

Super stay. Catherine (Jonathan's roommate) is very nice, cheerful and attentive. It was a real pleasure to be on vacation with them. The accommodation is clean, comfortable and well-equipped (good internet connection; washing machine & dryer; office for working...). The room is quite spacious. The value for money is very good in my opinion. I was able to enjoy the roof terrace before it got too cold. The apartment is well located, there are parks and shops nearby, other shops are not far either, I often walked there (Mont Royal which I like is a 30-minute walk away). There are good restaurants and very good cafes within a 5-minute walk. The metro is about 10-15 minutes away. There's also a bike station and a good grocery store a few minutes away.

The neighborhood is nice, the street is quiet. For those who want to do some shopping or window shopping, they will probably have to take the metro to go a little further. But easily accessible with the metro. 

Very good first Airbnb experience.
Friendly and easy-going hosts. The arrival and departure were adapted to our own schedule, perfect. Great room, nice location, friendly hosts, nothing's missing

This was a great place to stay for my trip in Montreal. You have great coffee two blocks from the apartment called Etincele. Really friendly place and great coffee and homemade Madeleine. If you want to buy some cheap fruits and vegetables; go to the shop at the corner of Papineau and Beaubien. You also have a great shop at Beaubien and La Roche on the way to the metro. 
You will be able to enjoy the rooftop for sunbathing or an apero at sunset.
Very kind host, the place is super quiet, I really liked it
Charming apartment and very warm host

Upon my arrival, Catherine, Jonathan's roommate, was working and left me instructions to quickly access the room. The apartment is warm and the terrace on the roof is simply amazing. There were small bottles of soap and shampoo on the towels left at my disposal. This was very much appreciated. Catherine is very welcoming and easy to reach. If you are looking for a cute and quiet corner of Montreal, Little Patrie is perfect for you. The only thing I would improve is the dust on the floor in the bedroom and kitchen. Overall, the general experience is positive.

Well, this was the first time I used Airbnb and going to someone's house! I can say it was totally amazing living at Jonathan's place! He treated me like we were friends before! The house is clean and well located too! I would say it was a brilliant experience and we are even friends now!
This really nice Airbnb is close to a Bixi station and the metro. I enjoyed my stay, Jonathan is a very nice person to live with. I'd definitely stay here again.
A highly recommended super host and very pleasant apartment.
Great place, very nice rooftop terrace, Jonathan is very friendly and hospitable! :) Thank you!
Well-located apartment, Jonathan was very kind and made you feel at ease upon your arrival.

Clean, spacious, welcoming and warm space. Jonathan was a great host, offering help with navigating the city, points of interest as well as honest conversation. I cook, so it was wonderful to have everything I needed. All in all zero complaints. I hope to be welcomed here again next time!

Jonathan is a very good host. The room is beautiful and the rooftop terrace is an added bonus. The apartment is very clean and located in a beautiful neighborhood of Montreal. There are nice restaurants and bars nearby. I would stay there again.

Excellent location, close to the city center. 

A simple but very warm accommodation for a few nights. 

The terrace is very pleasant to end the day.
I went on vacation and enjoyed a lot my experience in Montreal and at Jonathan's.

Excellent stay at Jonathan's place. The apartment was exactly as I expected, quiet and very clean.

Even though I didn't meet Jonathan who was on vacation, he went out of his way to make my arrival easy. Thank you again!

Jonathan was very kind, considerate, and helpful. He's very easy to talk to and was available by phone if you needed anything, whether it was information about the apartment or what to do/where to go in the area. The place itself is clean and cozy. It's in a calm, quiet neighborhood, but easy to walk or take public transportation anywhere else you need to go. The rooftop patio is amazing! I would definitely stay here again :)
I would totally recommend Jonathan's place, it's clean and spacious. Jonathan was really helpful, and the rooftop just adds a special touch to the apartment.

Excellent stay. The apartment is very clean, the kitchen is very well equipped, beautiful room and the cherry on top: the rooftop. 
Jonathan is very kind and helpful.
The host cancelled this reservation 16 days before arrival. This is an automated message.

This was a great experience! I decided to move here from another place in the Montreal area that was a disaster. Samuel and his roommates were very accommodating and the place is great. The room has lots of light and is a very good size. Neighborhood is fantastic, seems more French than English. GREAT park right down the street.
Just great

Samuel was truly a wonderful host. He was welcoming and helpful. He gave suggestions on where to go and showed us how to get there. He also kept himself available to contact if we needed help just in case. His place was homey and comfortable, in a very picturesque neighborhood. Thank you Sam, for such a pleasant stay!

The room is simple, spacious, and clean. It's located in a great neighborhood with easy parking. I never actually met Samuel but we kept in touch by phone. He and his roommates were very polite and helpful. This was a great deal for me that worked out exactly as I hoped it would.

Beatrice's place was great. Couldn't complain about anything at all. The location was great, the place was spacious, the bed was comfortable, and the kitchen had everything you need to cook and serve a full meal (I didn't get a chance to use it). 

At first I was skeptical about the place because it had no reviews and the main contact number on Airbnb is not a local one. But there was really no reason to be as Beatrice provides you with a direct contact number to her mother, who handed me the keys. 

They were both very accommodating with check-in times. Marie is very sweet; she told me what was around the area and ways to get around. She made sure I had everything I needed before she left. 

I would definitely stay again; it would be my first choice if available on my next trip back to Montreal.
Great location just off St. Laurent Blvd, yet the apartment is quiet and very comfortable. The back patio is a great place to sit back and relax. We'll be back as soon as possible.
A nice place in a nice neighborhood, with nice cafes and bars nearby and close to the metro. I would definitely come back anytime.

I loved Beatrice's spot! Location was amazing, the apartment was clean, comfortable, and spacious. The kitchen was well equipped (however I didn't get a chance to use it). The backyard was beautiful and Beatrice was communicative and accommodating. I would definitely stay here again!

Thank you Beatrice, the stay in Montreal was really nice. The apartment had everything inside. I will surely join you again. 

Your recommendations were great and you were very helpful!
The apartment was fantastic. We loved staying there. There are many shops, bars, and cafes nearby. We felt very comfortable. Cheers, Marcus, Katja, and Ben
Beatrice's apartment was a wonderful place for our first Airbnb experience
My boyfriend and I had a great time at this place. The house is stylish and clean, and our host ensured we were comfortable at all times!
Quick, efficient, hesitant to book!
Pleasant and comfortable, Jason was helpful in providing all the help we needed in a timely manner.
Excellent
Jason's place was perfect, spacious, updated and clean! Would gladly stay there again if my travels brought me back to Montreal!
The host cancelled this reservation 3 days before arrival. This is an automated message.
Highly recommend this place, super luxurious feel with an excellent host! Would definitely do it again!
The apartment is well-located, it is clean and very functional, we sleep soundly on our two ears!
Everything is just great! Perfect condo!

Super value for quality!
The place is impeccably clean.
Very quiet location, just a 5-minute walk from the metro!
I highly recommend this apartment!

The location of the apartment is very convenient, as there is a metro station very close by. The apartment itself is generally comfortable, with the kitchen and bathroom being particularly nice! Jason answers your questions promptly, and we had a wonderful time in Montreal!

Great place! Loads of space! Free parking! Decent price!

It was a short walk to the metro, making getting to Mont Royal and the old town easy. Comfortable place to stay.

Only suggestion would be to get groceries before you arrive as there isn't a supermarket nearby.

Jason was incredibly nice from the start! He always answered all of my phone calls whenever I had doubts about the housing. He was able to help me out and even give me nice suggestions for places to go in Montreal.

Jason's place was great. The space is very large and the bathroom and kitchen were fabulous and well equipped. Very modern and recently updated. Ample storage space for your belongings and the area was away from traffic. Jason provided check-in details in a timely manner. Would stay again.
Fantastic place, very comfortable. Very true to the pictures. Typical neighborhood, beautiful, about a 15-minute drive from downtown and closer to other neighborhoods like Little Italy and Mile End.
Thanks Jason.
Comfy beds, great showers and plenty of room and closet space. Would definitely recommend this place. Neighborhood is quiet.

Jason is an amazing host. He's supportive and communicates clearly. The place is conveniently located near public transportation and well-equipped! It's much better than it looks in the pictures!

We truly appreciate his generosity!
Great place, would stay again
Spacious apartment, beautifully decorated, beautiful bathroom with two sinks and fantastic shower, great kitchen. Residential neighborhood, a few minutes walk to the metro.
Nice place! Everything is clean! Near subway and other bus stops! The grocery store is nearby! The department offers many helpful services.
Spacious residence, located far from public transportation (buses, metro...)
I will come again next time

The place is very nice, clean, stylish, and spacious. We loved the shower because it was very cool and relaxing. We liked everything, including the amenities like the washer and dryer. The location is about a 7-minute walk from the metro.
Well-equipped apartment. Comfortable bedding, etc. Quiet and peaceful neighborhood: No issues
Great place!!

Very beautiful apartment, quiet, fully equipped, 800m from the metro, amenities nearby, responsive landlord, good bedding, washing and drying machines are a bonus for those arriving by plane. Excellent value for money. We will be back
Apartment well-located but noisy.

Well-located housing, close to the metro station, easy street parking, spacious enough for 4 people. The air conditioning allowed us to have good nights during this week of heatwave. Points to improve: provide more cutlery (insufficient for 4 people) and add some decor on certain empty walls.

We thank Jason for granting us a late departure so we could watch the France World Cup quarter-final match.

The reason I booked Jason's place is because I attended a conference at the Palais de Congres de Montreal. For the price, I would say that I made a good choice! My friend and I drove to Montreal and we didn't arrive until around 2 am. Jason gave very detailed instructions for self check-in which made it really convenient as I wouldn't want to bother him at that time. After we had arrived in  Montreal, we commuted throughout our stay. It is a 7-min walk to the metro and I would say that the neighborhood is pretty quiet and safe (there were times when we went home around 1 am). Jason told me that we could park our car in the backyard which was a bit difficult to find since Jason did not respond when I asked him about it (not a big deal though because my friend and I figured it out eventually). The condo is just as how it looks like in pictures, and I especially loved the kitchen and the bathroom. There were essentials he left for us like soap, shampoo, towels etc. During our stay, we lost Wi-Fi for about a day and Jason fixed it as soon as he could. Overall, our stay was nice. I would book his place again. Thanks Jason!

My cousin and I stayed in Montreal for 5 days. The apartment location offered us everything we needed for those few days: easy access to buses and the metro, and a convenience store.  The accommodations were lovely; they offered a fully stocked kitchen that we decided to cook after a trip to the Jean-Talon Market. On evenings we enjoyed relaxing and cooling down in the really good AC. Wifi worked perfectly as (Website hidden by Airbnb) spottiness. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a neighborhood experience, that’s very economical and still connects you to the city in less than 25 minutes.

Great place to stay if you're visiting Montreal. The metro is an 8-minute walk away and easily accessible. The apartment is very clean and has a fully equipped kitchen, perfect for cooking. Highly recommended!
The apartment is equipped with everything you need for living in it. It takes 10 minutes to the metro station called Sauvé, so it takes about 10-15 minutes to reach the city center.
Beautiful, pleasant and clean accommodation in a quiet neighborhood. Lack of utensils and cutlery in the kitchen. 10 minutes walk from the metro station. The owner is responsive to my emails.

Our stay with Jason was very pleasant, the apartment is spacious and quite comfortable, the bathroom is new and clean. The apartment is a 8-minute walk from the Sauvé metro station on the orange line, so convenient for reaching the city center. The entrance is autonomous and therefore allows flexibility for arrival time. Communication with Jason went well too.
