Catherine was both very pleasant and there for any questions or help we needed, I stayed at Catherine's apartment with my 10-year-old son and a friend over the Canadian F1 championship weekend. We found the area to be great for both of us and my son; we had great restaurants nearby and parks to walk/play in. Parking was plentiful, and if you were unlucky not to get a space directly outside the apartments, you could find one close by. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. Only one thing could make it more comfortable, and that would be AC. They may have been this, but I was unable to locate the controls, but this should not stop you from booking a very nice, beautiful apartment with a very good host.
Very beautiful apartment in a quiet and well-located location
Nice flat in a vibrant neighborhood

Catherine's place was perfect for my stay in Montreal. The space was clean, comfortable, and conveniently located in the lovely community of Verdun (~20 minutes to downtown Montreal). Communication was efficient and timely, and pretty sparse since everything was easy to locate in the studio. I look forward to staying there again next time I am in town!

Having never been to Verdun before, we were unsure of what to expect. We ended up loving the apartment and area and didn't even make it into the city or Old Montreal. There is lots to do and explore on foot and by bike (using the Bixi bike rentals located around the city). We loved a local restaurant just around the corner called Piquillo Bistro. The food is delicious and the owners are extremely friendly. The apartment was the perfect place to finish a long day. The bed is very comfortable and communication with Catherine was very quick. Would definitely come back!
Great location and space!
Well-located apartment in a quiet neighborhood. Faithful to the description and very well equipped. Thank you Catherine for her availability.

Great spacious loft. Check-in was straightforward, and Catherine communicated in both French and English. It's so close to public transportation and restaurants, and you can be downtown Montreal in 5-15 minutes.

The apartment was very clean and pleasant, well-equipped, not far from the city center, and we enjoyed it! Our limited communication with Catherine was pleasant and efficient. We will definitely stay again.
This place was very clean, cozy, and the perfect place for a couple to stay!
The host cancelled this reservation 20 days before arrival. This is an automated message.

Great apartment in a great location! Steps from a trendy street with all the shops you could need, tons of cafes and restaurants. Two blocks from a great walking/running/biking path along the St. Lawrence River! Three blocks from two metro stations that connect you to the downtown core in minutes. The area is very safe. As a single female, I lived here for just under a month and never felt anxious walking at night. The apartment is beautiful, with lots of modern touches and basic kitchen facilities. Would highly recommend booking this loft - and would book again myself!
The host cancelled this reservation 97 days before arrival. This is an automated message.

Horrible horrible experience!! This apt. totally ruined our vacation in Montreal. We had just come from another Airbnb in Quebec City that was just amazing and above expectations and landed in a dirty, small and noisy Airbnb with a host that had no sense of hospitality at all! The floor was sticky, the dishes were still in the dishwasher, the bed was not made and only had 2 pillow covers out of the 4 and they smelled like a sweaty man, there were only 3 small towels that were stained and did not smell fresh and were also located in the kitchen? There was a Nutella pot outside full of cigarettes. You could hear every step and laugh from the neighbors upstairs. Even though this was not unavoidable for the host she should still warn the guests about it. The 2 bar chairs in the pictures were not even there and there were many light bulbs that did not work. So what you saw in the pictures was different in person. There was no closet available to the guest so we had to keep everything in our suitcases which made the apt. even smaller. There was no toaster, water cooker nor a coffee machine. Just essential things!! So we had to literally go out for a cup of coffee. The trash can didn’t even have a bag in it. It was literally walk in clean and tidy up the apt. (That’s not even yours to begin with) before we could actually get some sleep. We left after 3 days instead of staying our full 6 days and only because there were no other Airbnbs available in such a short notice and we had our 3-year-old daughter with us. Otherwise, we would not have minded sleeping in the car, at least the car was clean! We were only refunded €61 out of the €452 even though we only stayed half of the time! It honestly felt like a rip off and scam. When we contacted to host about our complaints and that we were leaving earlier she said she was sorry and that she would contact the cleaning company to see where it went wrong and get back at us with a solution. We never heard from her again!.

Upon arriving at this home, all of the garbage was full, and the bedsheets hadn't been washed. Fortunately, this was the only downside to our experience. We contacted the host and received a prompt response. Under the circumstances, the host was extremely apologetic and dealt with the situation well. It seemed to have been a miscommunication with the designated cleaners. 

Despite this, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The pictures are identical to what the place looks like in person. There are several places to eat and shop within walking distance. This place also has a spacious balcony which is especially nice considering the location of the home. Parking is available, however there is one particular day of every week where parking is prohibited from 9:00-11:00 AM. We ended up getting a $62.00 ticket because we were unaware. As long as you pay attention to the signs you will be fine. Overall, we would certainly recommend staying here, and we plan to book this home again in the future.

Catherine's Airbnb is the best one I've had the pleasure of staying at! It's neat, clean, totally equipped - better than expected - and located just 5 minutes walking from stores, the metro station, coffee shops, and restaurants. You get to be in one of the loveliest neighborhoods in the city and still only a 10-minute ride by metro or car to reach downtown and the main attractions. Oh, and it's near the St. Lawrence River! Book it and don't hesitate, Catherine is helpful, courteous, and professional.
Very nice experience. Apartment perfectly located, exactly what we wanted.

A big thank you, please remember this address. Special attention to Alice, her responsiveness and kindness.

Hannah & Patrick
Great location, spacious apartment with a great outdoor deck. Very quiet neighborhood and street parking was easy to find and close by as long as you followed the signs.
Amazing, a must-stay if you're coming to Montreal.
Perfect place. Great WiFi, excellent facilities. Would definitely stay again

I stayed at Ben's place for about 5 days and really enjoyed it. The place was great and exactly as described, but what really stands out is the host. He made the stay a smooth experience with any questions sorted right away. He went far and beyond to accommodate any request with great attention to detail. There was an instance where his integrity would come under a test, and let me tell you, the guy is trustworthy. I would definitely stay again and recommend him to anyone!
A small studio to see the installations and location. Good value for money.
Had a great stay at Ben's apartment. Very central, and looked exactly like the pictures! Would stay again!
The apartment's location is near Concordia and the Guy Station, which is perfect. Ben is a nice guy; we had a few hours of delay, and he has been kind to us. The room is very clean.

We haven't met Ben in person but he was attentive and present through messages to ensure a smooth arrival at his apartment.  The one-bedroom apartment corresponds well with the photos, it is on the 3rd floor of a large 23-story building, with a pool/sauna and gym on the top floor (to which we have access freely and which are fantastic!). The building is well located, at the foot of Mount Royal and a few meters from the Guy Concordia metro station and Sainte Catherine street. It was a very good experience that we would gladly repeat! Thank you Ben!
Clean and well-located apartment!
Great apartment, excellent location
Translation: very good
Satisfied!!
Ben's place was awesome, his instructions for check-in/parking were super clear and easy. The location was perfect for exploring downtown, would definitely stay at Ben's spot again!
Perfect cozy bachelor pad in a central location. Free parking was a nice perk because Montreal has a lot of parking meters.
Good value for money, beautiful amenities and a good location in Montreal.

The place was perfect for our needs and the parking off the street was big, arriving as we did just before a big snowstorm. The location was great for nightlife downtown and only a block from the subway. We took our time choosing the place and were glad we did. Also, Ben was quick to respond and checked in to make sure everything was going well.

Not my first time in this building; great location. Apartment was spotless. Easy check-in. Terrific parking option. Nice little touches like a can of ground coffee next to the coffee maker - not as common as you'd think. Will stay here again.
Bens' place has a brilliant location with convenient parking right next to it! He is very good at communication and was willing to help with anything! Thanks again. Perfect, host for me!!
Five Stars
Very nice place. Wifi worked well and super close to the metro. Loved my stay.

Ben's place is convenient for shopping and walking on the West side of Ste Catherine in downtown Montreal. The apartment is clean and parking is easy to access. There are many restaurants nearby, so once you park, it's easy to explore Montreal on foot or by metro. I think the space is better suited for 2 people than for 4 (open concept), but it would be doable if you were 4 friends on a budget.
Awesome value!
Ben was an excellent host. He was easy to communicate with. His place was nice and located in a great spot. It was within walking distance to many places. Parking was very convenient.

This apartment was perfect for what we were looking for. Not only was it clean, it was well-stocked, and in a great location. The parking spot was an added bonus for us because we drove to Montreal. Ben was a fantastic host who was easy to get in touch with before, during, and after our stay. St. Catherine was a 2-minute walk away and had tons of restaurants and great bars to offer. I would highly recommend this location to anyone looking for a decent place to stay right in the heart of the city.
Cute little apartment, close to all the essentials... great place to stay!
Ben has a great place - parking and public transit were easy!

Nice, private studio apartment, conveniently located within walking distance to the subway. We never actually interacted with Ben, but were able to message him while there and received a quick response. Thank you for letting us stay at your place!

Very cute and clean apartment right in the heart of the city. Easy access to the metro was incredibly convenient, and there were lots of shops and good places to eat nearby. Parking was also very convenient. The bed was super comfy too! Ben was a great host and helped out if we had any questions. Would highly recommend!

Ben's place is perfect for couples looking for a cozy spot to stay in downtown Montreal. It's clean, quiet, and looks exactly like it does in the pictures. It comes with many amenities, and the Wi-Fi works very well. Ben's place came stocked with soap, shampoo, toilet paper, towels, a hairdryer, and even an ironing machine. The free parking is extremely convenient for guests driving to Montreal; however, I do caution those with taller vehicles (like lifted trucks) since the ceiling of the garage leading to the outdoor lot didn't seem that spacious in height. We were able to park and leave our car in the same spot for the entire duration of our trip while relying on the metro station that is one block away to get around the city. Ben's place is also conveniently located two blocks away from Sainte Catherine Street which has a great variety of shops and restaurants all within walking distance. Ben was very polite and quick to respond to any questions we had. His check-in/check-out instructions were very clear and easy to follow. I would absolutely recommend booking with Ben. Thank you again for the wonderful stay!

Great value and great location. Close to Guy-Concordia metro station, convenience stores, SAQ, tons of restaurants, etc. Quiet at night but some traffic noise during the afternoon. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a comfortable stay for nearly half the price of an average hotel room. Great communication from the host as well!

Ben was really nice and accommodating. Communication was superb. The location was also central and close to a lot of restaurants and essential places. Free parking was also very helpful since street parking is quite expensive and limited. The building is quite old and the other tenants on the floor did not maintain their units so the smell of smoking is very evident. The unit itself is pretty clean so that was good. Overall, good experience. Affordable price with decent stay/unit.

Ben's place is nicely located in Montreal in a trendy part of town. Ben's communication throughout was excellent. There are many restaurants and bars within walking distance of his place. The apartment itself is in a quiet building and has all the necessities for a comfortable stay. The place was clean and easy to find. The biggest advantage is that you get secure parking included with your stay, so if you are driving into town definitely great. Thanks for a wonderful stay!
Ben was very clear and concise with his instructions. Check-in/check-out went smoothly. Great neighborhood, close to all amenities, good food spots, the metro, and bars.

Great place to stay while visiting downtown Montreal.

Ben is a great host, he makes it easy to settle in and answers right away to any questions.

The place had everything you could need for a short stay and was very clean.

I would stay there again anytime.
Met all of our expectations, loved our stay!
Very nice apartment in a good location!

Ben's place is right downtown, a block away from the subway station, which is a great location (free parking was also great). Throughout, Ben was very responsive to our questions, and the process was easy and simple; he is very easy to work with, and definitely recommend his place for anyone looking to visit Montreal.
Ben is a very accommodating host. He responds quickly to messages and makes sure everything is in place for a successful stay! Parking is a bonus! Thank you!

Good location, approximately a 5-minute walk from the metro station. The apartment looked like the photos and was spacious. The only downside was that it smelled strongly of cigarettes from the neighbors. Neighbors were noisy until late at night – sometimes as early as 3 am.

Ben's apartment was exactly as pictured and described, really clean and the location was perfect! Communication with Ben was super easy, and he was really understanding of our unexpected very late arrival into Montreal. Highly recommend!!

Communication with Ben was fast, clear, and we had no problems with check-in or finding our way around. He wrote out instructions that we could refer back to, which answered all of our questions and made us feel comfortable. The space is exactly as it appears in the pictures, and there were no surprises - just good ones like the mini coffee maker. 

The location was perfect, and parking was easy. We had a great weekend! Thank you.

Wonderful, clean apartment in a great location. It's within walking distance of pretty much anything you could want. The neighborhood is nice and trendy. Free parking and Netflix are a nice touch. I really enjoyed my stay. Ben responds very quickly to messages and is super helpful!

The location was great. The room was cozy and clean. This wasn't my first Airbnb experience and it was excellent. The metro down the street is very helpful! There are also a ton of restaurants a few blocks up on Crescent and Bishop Street. Very easy to get around and find your way to any spot in Montreal, including the botanical garden/biodome, Old Port, and other spots downtown. Overall great experience!
Ben's place was in a great location!
Great place to stay. Close to Saint Catherine Street.

Communication with Ben was helpful and thorough; he responded almost instantly to any questions. The apartment was clean and cute and centrally located. Parking was very convenient, too. We loved our stay!

Ben was an excellent host. We had a small issue at check-in but Ben quickly fixed it. The apartment is awesome, it's clean, well furnished, located 5 minutes walk from the subway station, grocery stores, cafes and bars. 

I would recommend this place.
Great location in the city, quiet street but just one block from nightlife and fantastic restaurants.  A spacious and clean apartment with a nice view of Montreal streets! I will definitely be back.
The apartment was very nice and well-furnished. Communication was excellent.
Clean apartment in a convenient location. The bed was comfortable and there was complimentary coffee, which was greatly appreciated.

The location of the apartment was good because it was near a metro station and had a convenience store and many dining places nearby. Ben gave very detailed instructions so we were able to check in smoothly. He was also quick to respond to our queries

Nice, clean place facing a busy street. Convenient parking. Very close to the metro station if you don't want to drive. 

Very nice communication with the host - very helpful and responsive.
The place was accurately depicted in the photos. I'm glad I booked this location.

Ben's apartment is very simple and nice. Although we never met in person, check-in and check-out was easy and communication was strong. The apartment was clean, easy to find, and the bed was very comfortable! I would definitely recommend this place. Thanks!
A wonderful little quiet apartment with a good soaking tub and a comfy bed. Oh yes, and I really appreciated having the Netflix and TED Talks channels!

Ben was fantastic! The apartment was clean and matched the listing description perfectly. After a minor communication hiccup, we felt right at home in the space as if it were our friend's house. He was incredibly responsive and very helpful with travel ideas for my friend and I!

Great accommodation with ample space for a studio flat.  Loved the living room area, which was an extremely comfortable place to relax at night. The AC, though noisy, was great when it worked, although it did cut out all the electricity once, but Ben was on hand immediately to help fix the problem. 

Brilliant location; lovely neighborhood, convenience store in the building, within walking distance of the metro and plenty of restaurants nearby.

Free secure parking on site was a bonus, especially as we relied on public transport after parking up, which was easy to navigate.

A couple of additional touches would make it perfect: a full-length mirror in the room, some lighter bed sheets, and shelves/drawers for unpacking clothes. That being said, it was suitable for our needs.

Ben's place is great for those visiting Montreal: walking distance to Bell Center, shopping area, restaurants, and Mount Royal. A bit on the downside was the noise coming from outside during the night, but that's because it's a central apartment and big cities are noisy. Communication went smoothly, we are happy with our choice. Thanks, Ben.
Very clean and it matched the advertisement perfectly, I had an excellent experience and would definitely stay again in a heartbeat!
This place was nice and clean, close to a lot of restaurants and shops. I would stay again.
This is a terrific location and the apartment has everything you could need! Ben is very helpful and easy to communicate with. Overall, it was a great experience.
The studio is really well-designed so that it feels very comfortable and spacious, and the location was perfect. We loved our stay!
Excellent location, communication, and cleanliness. It was a perfect trip thanks to Ben who ensured it! Thank you!
Great location. Ben was very quick to respond back!
Ben was a great host. He was very responsive and responsible. His place was very clean and located in a very central spot.

The experience matched the listing perfectly. It's a clean little apartment in a lively neighborhood. We brought a tandem bike with us, and it was stressful because it was too large to fit in the elevator. We couldn't find a bike rack and ended up locking it to the fence behind our parked car. Fortunately, it wasn't stolen from the secure lot, but we were worried about it. Tandem bikes are extra big and heavy. Perhaps a standard bike would have fit in the elevator just fine. The apartment has a balcony, and we could have stored the bike there.

Loved staying at Ben's apartment. He was always very quick to respond and we really appreciated his attentiveness. On top of that, his home was quaint and cozy and in a very convenient location! We walked to many different areas from the apartment. Bus stops are nearby as well. It was extremely convenient and comfortable. Ben was extremely helpful in recommending places to visit and even accommodated us arriving a bit earlier so we didn't have to carry our heavy luggage around. Loved visiting Canada and loved being able to stay in this cute apartment. I'd definitely recommend it.
Great visit.

Ben was an excellent host, always available to answer any questions I had and was very accommodating during my stay.  I was traveling from outside the US and felt very comfortable in the apartment. The location is in a great part of town, very walkable to many stores and restaurants. I would definitely recommend this apartment.
Ben's apartment was perfect for a weekend in Montreal. Great location, very clean apartment, and very easy check-in process

My sister and I stayed at Bens place for one night. He communicated quickly when needed, but we gave him 3 stars because the apartment was not very clean. The neighborhood that the apartment was in made us a bit uneasy at times. The overall price was a bit much for the space, but the pool and rooftop terrace were enjoyable.
Great location and very easy communication. We loved our stay here.
We are really thankful to Ben. We arrived home after midnight due to our flight, and he made no problem of it and even comforted us.
Well-located apartment and easy to access :-)

Bad experience

Noisy neighborhood, busy construction site, smell of weed everywhere in the building. ... 
Old apartment
Not clean at all
Bad furniture
Unsure if linens or towels were clean or if any cleaning was done before our entrance
Kitchen missing many tools
And overpriced for what it is
Instructions were good and adequate, and downtown is easily reachable
Great location and it matches the description. Ben is excellent at responding quickly to any questions you may have.

The place was okay, certainly not great. It would have been nice to have more than an old dish towel in the bathroom to dry our hands, let alone a couple of actual bath towels. The building itself was the real problem; dingy and run down would be the most charitable way to describe it. Falling down construction foam wrap in the elevator, plastic sheeting covering the carpet in the hallway. Not a good look. 

But for us, the real clinker was when we got there, plastered all over the doors and walls were signs saying the water was going to be turned off from 9:00 AM-5:00 PM. Totally unacceptable. The signs were posted the day before, and our host should have known and informed us of this. His response was "It's not my fault!!" And yes, that is his actual quote; not something I ever wanted to hear from my kids, and definitely not a response I want from a host.  I called Airbnb, cancelled our next day, and thankfully, was able to get a full refund. 

If you're looking for a budget place to stay, this might be okay as long as there are no other problems with the building. Otherwise, if you are looking for somewhere nice, in my opinion, keep looking.
The accommodation is very central, which is really good. The building itself is a bit unusual but the room is okay.

Ben's apartment was perfect. I arrived after midnight. Check-in was flawless. The apartment was clean. The air conditioning was already running. The area is near Concordia College. Lots of younger people. However, it was very quiet during my stay. A close walk to Starbucks and the location of my deposition near the hospital. Uber drivers were waiting for me if needed. Good deal.

We loved staying here. This apartment is a basic studio apartment so if you're looking for a luxury stay this is not your place...but for us it was perfect. We just needed a place to crash in Montreal which was one of our stops on a very long road trip we were on. Having off-street parking was a huge plus - we parked our car and didn't have to think about it or look at it for the duration of our stay. This apartment is in a fantastic location and we were able to walk or take the city bike system to every single place we wanted to go - museums, Old Montreal, shopping, and restaurants.

Great location and private parking are major pluses for anyone driving. The pillows were very thin, so be sure to bring your own. The rooftop and pool were nice. There was a lot of construction going on throughout the building, but I didn't notice it when inside my room.
Thank you for the stay, Ben. The apartment was great.
Great location! Walking distance to everything downtown. Ben was very friendly and helpful, highly recommended.
Good spot! Great location, responsive host. Exactly as advertised

Great location, easy check-in and it was wonderful to have free parking. 
The apartment was okay, it could use a woman's touch.
It is difficult to walk beside the bed without banging your shins but the bed was surprisingly comfortable. Could use some extra pillows though.
Nice apartment, as described in the profile. Everything you need is there. Central location. Easy communication with Ben. Good value for money and ideal for a short stay in Montreal.
Great place in a great location. Nice stylish studio apartment in the downtown area... would definitely stay again! Ben was quick to respond to messages and really helpful.
Great location, awesome private parking (as long as you don't have a truck or SUV that is too tall to fit), clean, and great communication from Ben! We would love to visit again!

This is a great apartment located just outside of the central shopping district. It's conveniently located to a Metro station to take you wherever you need to go. The instructions to access the apartment are clear, and parking is provided. The only two complaints are that the pillows were pretty much non-existent, and there isn't a remote for the TV, which was only a problem because it was on when we got there, but there are buttons on the side to turn it off and adjust the volume. I would definitely stay again.
I highly recommend it! Incredible quality-price ratio.
Nice and easy place to stay. Nothing fancy but great communication with the host and everything was clean and convenient.

Ben's apartment was clean (even though some utensils were not from previous renters, I guess). 
Communication with Ben was on point before and during my stay. 
There were lots of noise coming from outside and inside the building (but then again it's Montreal!).
The free parking is really great and easy to find.
This is a wonderful value for being three blocks from Downtown and it was what I was looking for.
I would recommend this apartment!
Great value, excellent location! Amazing experience!
The studio was very clean and comfortable.
Very good!
This apartment was in the perfect location - a short walk to restaurants, shops, and the metro! The place was spotless and had great amenities. I would definitely recommend staying here!
Nice place, good description, well situated in downtown. Ben was a good host, quick to answer any questions. Parking was ideal, if you have a standard car.

The host is very instructional and detailed, which is a good thing because you don't need to be left wondering. Clear instructions are provided and the host is responsive. The place was as expected, nothing less. Overall, it was a good experience; I would recommend this place.
This place is in the perfect location in so many ways. Great bed, nice couch, next to everything! Could easily fit 4 adults. Would stay here again.

My girlfriend and I stayed here for 3 days from December 29th to January 2nd. This place is amazing; it's very close to most of Montreal's attractions. For the price, this is a great deal. The subway stop is about a 5-7 minute walk. Everything is within a 5-mile radius. For those planning to visit Montreal during New Year's, EVERYTHING IS CLOSED ON JANUARY 1ST.

The only problem we ran into was that it got a little cold at night, but nothing too unbearable. The entrance to the parking lot is a bit low; my compact SUV antenna kept hitting the top of it. I can't imagine a big truck or SUV fitting through it. Overall, it was great and I would definitely stay here again.
Excellent host, very clean, everything was perfect, good communication and very well located, I highly recommend it, thank you so much for your hospitality!
Great location! Short distance to downtown. Really enjoyed our stay at this location, it was a great spot for our trip!
Beautiful and clean. Would stay again

Ben's place is in a fantastic location. It's close to everything and has great amenities and is very secure. I had a wonderful stay and was very comfortable throughout my entire visit. Netflix was available on the TV, and he even had menus for some of the area's restaurants to help make dinner easier. Ben is quick to respond to questions and requests, and if I ever need an apartment in Montreal again, his listings will be the first place I check. Thanks for reading, and have a great time in Montreal.
Nice place and nice host.
Nice place, but it wasn't clear it was a studio until we arrived. Good location. Decent size for a studio, though. Overall, enjoyed my stay!

Ben's place was easy to find, and the free parking is great! The place is clean and located in an accessible area with many restaurants, bars, and museums. He communicated quickly and gave detailed directions on how to check in, and there is a sauna, right enough said. Safe and clean place. Very happy with my stay, will stay here again next time I'm in Montreal.

My stay at Ben's apartment was great! It is very well located, near many stores, shopping malls, and supermarkets. The metro station Guy and many bus stations are also close by. Ben always answered me quickly, which I really appreciate. He was also very supportive during my arrival and departure. I definitely recommend his apartment!
Exactly what the listing states and true to the photos. Ben's place was exactly what we needed for our weekend getaway. Ben was very responsive and made check-in a breeze.
A nice place to stay in the heart of downtown Montreal

Ben's apartment was spectacularly clean and organized, as well as perfectly located near downtown. He provided clear and detailed instructions about everything he might need. He was friendly and suggested great local attractions! We had a fantastic trip!
Super Stay in Montreal! A very well-located apartment to walk around the whole city, Ben is a very responsive and available host for any help needed. Thanks again, Ben :)
Ben answered all of our questions quickly before we arrived. The check-in process was easy. We found that we could walk to many places from the apartment, and we were so close to the metro as well.

Ben's place is in a really central location - within walking distance to many restaurants and shops, as well as the metro stop. Even though it's in such a central location, we weren't bothered by any noise. The place has everything you need (kitchen utensils etc.) However, the building is very old and you smell smoke, marijuana, etc. in the hallways. The apartment itself could also have been a little cleaner. The parking spot was good for us, but I can definitely see people with larger cars having trouble even accessing the parking area. We paid roughly 30 €/night for our stay. So overall we were happy with what we got for the price we paid.
Location was spot on. Walked to everything. Perfect size and parking was super handy. Highly recommend!

For those arriving from outside, especially by car and wanting to stay in the city center with included parking that is very easy to access, it's really a great place. It's safe. Everything is nearby, it's truly a practical location. Definitely worth returning to.

This was my first experience renting with Airbnb and Ben was great at replying to my questions. The place was as expected and was perfect for what we needed. Right around the corner from many restaurants and shops and within a 45 minute walk of most of the main tourist destinations. Thanks Ben!
Well-located. Swimming pool and sauna accessible. Accommodation rather quiet. Difficult to find parking inside.

The place is as described. The parking is the selling point of this Airbnb. If you are traveling alone with a car, you may have to double park for a few minutes while you run up and grab the garage keys and return to your car. Unfortunately, the hallway leading up to the apartment reeked of cigarette smoke 24/7. I understand this is out of the control of the Airbnb host, but if you're sensitive to this smell or have bad asthma, this may be an issue for you. The apt itself kept most of the fumes out. The location was perfect and was walking distance to many great restaurants.

Well-located apartment. Close to the metro and Sainte Catherine Street. Ideal for visiting the city. The only complaint I can make concerns the cleaning, as well as the bad odors coming from the hallway.
Clean apartment in a great location. Ben was easy to communicate with, and check-in/check-out were extremely easy.

Located very well in the middle of Montreal, it's easy to get to all tourist attractions from there. The only big issue was with the parking garage. We couldn't enter it with our car as it was too large. The maximum car height can only be around 1.78m. We had to park a few blocks away and pay extra for it, which wasn't nice because we chose this apartment in the first place because it included parking.

Ben is quick to respond and his place is close to the metro. It's also clean! Don't be discouraged if you smell any smoke, it's just from the other units. Just open the window and the scent quickly disappears. I have bad allergies and was concerned about this at first, but it wasn't in any of the linens or couch.
Ben's place was exactly what we were looking for. Good area, metro close by, lots of places to eat and drink all within walking distance. Would recommend to anyone!
This apartment is in a fantastic location, providing everything you need to visit Montreal. Ben was responsive and the apartment was great. The on-site parking was very convenient too.

Very well-located accommodation, close to the metro and several restaurants. Comfortable temperature, comfortable bed. Excellent communication with Ben A. Free parking on site an advantage in this area. Strange odor in the hallway during our stay, but okay in the apartment.
The best place! So close to everything, right in downtown, highly recommended! You will love it, we did too!

The apartment is basic but clean. Ben was very responsive to all questions. Check-in was easy and the instructions were clear. The parking spot was a huge plus as it can be costly to park if you have to drive everywhere. The apartment is in a great and safe location near the metro, restaurants, and shopping. We walked everywhere. If I'm being picky, investing in little touches would be nice such as better quality towels and higher quality pillows. But as I said, the accommodations were basic - not luxurious. Overall, it was a good and very functional starting point to explore and experience Montreal.
Thank you for being such a great host! We really enjoyed staying there, and we really loved Montreal! What a great location it was!

This place was just fantastic !!! Ben was an amazing host and did an amazing job communicating. Ben made check-in really easy and did a fantastic job in making sure the place was clean, as well as making sure his guests were comfortable and all the essentials were met. The place was in an amazing location and was extremely close to metro stations. So it wasn’t hard at all to venture out into the city and find your way back. Overall, this place was great and I highly recommend it to any couple who is looking for a nice getaway to Montreal. Ben was an amazing host and you can’t ask for anything better.
Ben was an excellent host, particularly in his communication with us. The location of his place is perfect and very convenient for getting around the city! Thank you, Ben!

Ben's studio apartment was located in a great location. We were there during the extreme heat and the air conditioner worked perfectly at keeping the space cold. Parking was super easy as the space was a secured outside lot where you could choose your parking spot. 

This is an apartment building. The common areas (hallways, elevators, lobby) are not clean.  The shared laundry rooms, however, are super clean. 

Ben responded quickly to any inquiries we had.
The location is great, and the owner was very nice!
The apartment was nicely appointed and clean, and the location was amazing. The pool was under maintenance, but Ben reimbursed us when I mentioned it to him.

Well located near the metro. Has a basic kitchen. Free parking for a standard car (really big, won't fit). Has a gym, pool and sauna, although the pool was closed for repairs during our stay. Only issue we had was there is a lot of noise coming from the street due to one of the windows being jammed open to fit the air con machine. The next night we could drown out some of that by blasting the air con machine on full, but still not the quietest sleep. Overall it was a good stay.

We really enjoyed our stay at Ben's little apartment. It was perfect for my wife and me. The air conditioning was a lifesaver during the Montreal summer heat. The apartment is in a great location, making it easy to explore downtown Montreal on foot or by taking the metro. I also used the gym, which was a nice touch. There were a couple of spots where the cleaning was overlooked in the kitchen, but it was no big deal for us. Ben is super quick to respond to messages and check-in was easy. 

We would gladly stay here again.

My husband and I stayed in Ben's apartment downtown Montreal for 3 nights and we were happy with the location and the free parking. Ben was very responsive and provided clear, detailed instructions for check-in/check-out, parking, and building amenities. The apartment is close to shops, restaurants, and public transportation. It's also within walking distance of the biggest park in Montreal (Mont-Royal), which was a bonus. The neighborhood seemed safe; however, it gets very noisy on weekends!  It seems like many college students live in this area, which is fine, but they can be extremely noisy in the building, hallways, and on the street until late at night. The walls and windows in the building didn't seem to be very insulated, so there was also a great deal of very loud street noise (cars, motorcycles, trucks, people shouting, etc.).

The apartment itself is no-frills, but it suited our purposes for a few days. Since we stayed in the summer, we especially appreciated the air conditioning. The bathroom needs some TLC, but was functional. I believe the bed was listed as a queen-size, but I think it's one of the Ikea brand full/queen beds, and it definitely didn't seem as large as our queen-sized bed at home. The kitchen was well-stocked with dishes, glasses, etc., and has a full-size refrigerator. Like other reviewers mentioned, we experienced the smell of smoke in the hallway outside the apartment, but had no problem inside the flat itself. The elevators worked well and were big enough for my husband's mountain bike. Overall, the free parking and the location of this apartment outweighed the noise and the lack of fancy amenities. I would recommend Ben's apartment.
Easy check-in, parking and amenities are big pluses for the price
Ideal location for visiting Montreal, close to all amenities, clean and conforming to the host's description. I recommend it!

Ben's place is in a perfect location to enjoy the city of Montreal. It was great that it had parking and we fully enjoyed our stay. It's a great Airbnb if you plan on being out during the day and using the Airbnb as just a place to sleep. The only negative was that he had a slow response time to my messages, but once he answered everything went great.
Very well located, good collective amenities, a pity about the pool under renovation and an effort on cleanliness is to be considered, so it would be perfect, but we had a nice and pleasant stay
Amazing communication and prompt response times. The location was perfect. Communication is very important to me, and Ben was extremely helpful in answering my questions.
Great location, that's it

This place was great for its price and location. It was nothing special, just a clean place to sleep while enjoying Montreal. Unfortunately, my truck was unable to fit in the parking, so I had to pay for parking.
Very well located
Ben's place was ideal for our short stay in Montreal. It was well-located for downtown and Mont Royal Park. The nice apartment had everything we needed, and Ben was responsive to any questions.

We had a very good stay at Ben A's apartment.
The apartment is well-located and very clean, we didn't miss anything. It has a very convenient parking space. The building in which the apartment is located offers a free large pool, sauna, squash court, and gym. 
Ben A is very responsive, his explanations for our arrival at the apartment were clear and precise. 
We recommend Ben A's apartment without any hesitation for a stay in Montreal.

My parents are seniors and I booked Ben's place for their short stay in Montreal. This review is on their behalf.

They loved Ben's place and found it to be convenient, clean and perfect location. They found Ben to be polite, very accommodating and quick to respond to any questions or requests they had. Thank you Ben for being such a great host!
Ben's place was very clean and quiet. He was very accommodating and communicative, and I would definitely stay there again.

The location of this Airbnb is great, however, it fell short in many aspects. The suite was not clean. The bathroom was the worst. The sink did not drain well and had a terrible smell, the bath mat had hair and nail clippings in it. The shower curtain was brown at the bottom from not being cleaned. The plug to the tub was completely brown and disgusting. Bathing was out of the question. There were two very small toilet papers left that made us have to go purchase more along with soap. The baseboards throughout the suite were thick with dust. The kitchen had a dirty stove and fridge. The kitchen is not equipped with the essentials if someone wanted to cook. No cookie sheets for example, hardly any utensils. The couch was not comfortable and it had crumbs on it when we arrived. It is listed that there are candles but they were completely burnt out and the lighter did not work. We purchased our own because the suite bathroom sink had that bad smell. I will say Ben was good with communication and clear with details about how to get into the suite. I think this suite has great potential if it was cleaned. I didn't expect amazing for the price, but I did expect it to be clean.

If you want to see Montreal, this is the apartment for you! Nicely appointed with everything you need to make your stay perfect. Easy walking to downtown, or a few minutes to the Guy-Concordia metro station if you prefer. An abundance of places to eat within 5 minutes. Grocery stores, parking... If you like to cook, walk 20 mins to the Atwater Market for gourmet food; detour on the way to see the pretty rue Coursol houses. If your shopping is heavy, come back by metro from Lionel-Groulx station.
Ben responded quickly to my messages and provided clear and easy check-in instructions. The location was excellent, within walking distance of restaurants and the metro. Highly recommended!
There is something better
Central and convenient parking.
Great value for money in a central location.

Ben's place was great! The apartment was just enough space for what we needed for the long weekend. The only thing that was an adjustment for us not being city people was the noise at night while sleeping, but that comes with staying in any city. Having the convenience store right across the street was a huge plus, along with the free parking. For the money that we paid for 3 nights and free parking to not have to worry about driving was definitely worth it. The location was (Website hidden by Airbnb) was very easy to walk to everything including Crescent Street (5 mins away) where there were many bars and restaurants to pick from. Can't forget about the Netflix being a huge plus too! I would definitely recommend. Thank you Ben!

Amazing location and a great apartment for rent! The building and the room are kept clean, and having a parking space was great too. I would recommend this apartment for anyone looking to stay in Montreal's downtown area.
The space met our needs perfectly. It was very clean and conveniently located within the city. We loved having off-street parking available! We would definitely use the space again.

The place was fine, check-in was easy, but it was freezing cold. The heater wasn't working and it wouldn't warm up at all. We were visiting from the states and we didn't have data so internet was important for us—the internet kept going in and out, so we couldn't get a steady connection to research.
The apartment was well-located, but it was not clean. We had to cancel our reservation.
Close to everything. Excellent value for the price. Quiet and safe location with parking
Good location. Okay value.
Really nice place! I will definitely come back next year!

Ben's condo is perfectly situated in the heart of downtown Montreal. The space is just as seen in the pictures; however, the shower is very small and the bathroom fan does not work. Also, there is a funky smell in the hallway but other than that, it was a beautiful stay. It was very clean and spacious enough for my partner and me. We also had access to the condo's pool, gym, and squash court which was awesome! Free parking was also a bonus! We would definitely stay here again. :)
It's a great location, Ben was a very good host. He responded to messages very quickly. The value was also great.
fabulous experience

There were stains on every piece of fabric, the sheets were dirty, there were only two towels provided and they were old and ratty. The building needed a lot of maintenance. The walls were so thin you could hear the phone vibrating next door. There was also a little yappy dog next door that barked almost constantly. The hallway smelled strongly of smoke along with other odors. The drinking glasses were broken. The furniture was rather cheap and extremely basic. The balcony had trash and cigarette buds strewn on it. There was mildew in the shower. This was not worth $75 a night plus the steep cleaning fee. I’ve never left a bad review before but this place was so disappointing! The free parking, easy check-in, and close proximity to the metro and Tim Hortons were nice.

Overall, we enjoyed our stay at Ben's place. The location was great and it was one of the more budget-friendly options. The reviews were so good that I think our expectations were a little too high. In retrospect, we should have known there would be some compromises. The building is not very nice once you get past the lobby. The elevators and hallways often smelled of cigarettes and generally didn't seem very clean. The apartment itself was dark and had a slightly musty smell. It was clean except for some crumbs on the floor and couch, and the bedding which didn't look like it had been washed. We asked for it to be replaced, though, and Ben took care of it quickly while we were out for dinner. Ultimately, the apartment didn't get in the way of enjoying the city, and we had a little extra money left over to spend elsewhere.
Great space for me and my significant other. Perfect location, and parking was secure and convenient.

Ben was an excellent host and very helpful. My biggest issue with the place was the extremely loud noise level with incredibly thin walls. Neighbors were screaming, and dogs were barking until early in the morning. Otherwise, it was clean and easy, and Ben was great.

This studio is in a fantastic location! It's perfect for a couple visiting who doesn't plan on spending all their time inside the studio, but needs a cozy space to check back in, take breaks throughout the day, and relax at the end of the day. Ben provided very clear and detailed instructions! I had a wonderful time.

Well, here is a thing, I've given one star to this entire place and to cleanliness due to issues with bedroom sheets. They do not change them. And the whole bed and sheets had odors of sweat, some body smell, and on top of those "reach" smells, the cover of some deodorant or perfume - it might be used instead of washing the sheets or it might be just additional floral from the previous dozens of clients. 

So why one point? Because this is apparently a "tradition" at this place not to change sheets and not to listen to customers - the same issue was already addressed in the comments, and here we are at the same point with nothing done.
Finding it as a real disrespectful attitude towards the customers, especially when the same issue was already addressed by other people, but the owner still kept the same "tradition" of not changing the sheets. 
And in addition, the same place charged me $49 CAD for cleaning fees when the cost of the place per night was $31 CAD. So it is 61.25% of the whole price for cleaning. I think they could take $3 for the sheet's washing from those $49 CAD, but they didn't...
--
*Additional thing to keep in mind, that the apartment is in the center of Montreal and the windows are not really built with good sound isolation, so you might hear all the sounds of the street even during the night. 

Hope the review will change the attitude of the owner towards his customers.

Ben's flat was quiet and secure, with the Metro nearby. Restaurants and bars were one block walk away. Parking on site was available for cars only, with a maximum height of 70". 

We had a great stay and would recommend the unit for 2 or 3 people.
Very well located but very noisy.
Nothing to say! Clean, accessible and simply went away.

Second time I've visited this location, but didn't get the same apartment. The place is quite standard but nice, convenient and close to busy Ste Catherine Street. Communication with Ben was easy, wifi bandwidth was weak but otherwise okay. 

I would come back.

Everything went smoothly from check-in to parking to finding the location. The location was right in the heart of downtown Montreal and everything was within walking distance. The Airbnb had a pool, rooftop terrace, Netflix, and parking. Definitely would stay here again!

Great location, it's nice to have parking included and be able to park the car in a safe place, especially during winter to avoid getting towed. 

The apartment is functional; we didn't check out or use any of the extra amenities, so I can't say much about that. 

However, the apartment was perfect for a nice getaway weekend in Montreal. 
I enjoyed the jazz club around the corner and everything was clean and there. 

Thank you

Nice and spacious apartment - a bit far from the metro, but the Bixi station was very close and a grocery store was within walking distance (5 minutes).

However, upon considering your stay here, please be aware that they are very serious about their cleaning - you should thoroughly clean (vacuum, mop, bathroom) before returning the keys to the apartment. I did not and he requested $50 after my departure (even though I didn't agree to this fee when booking).

Apart from that, it is located near many cute restaurants and shops.

Superb apartment well maintained in a great neighborhood in Montreal. Close to shops in the Plateau and public transportation.

Philippe and Sandra are very pleasant and helpful hosts. I highly recommend it and would rent it again.

Three friends and I stayed at Philippe and Sandra's lovely apartment for the weekend. We arrived later than expected, but Sandra was very flexible and kind about this. The apartment itself was well equipped except for some small things, which were easily amendable as there is a grocery store just a few blocks away. The hosts were personable and sweet, and left many helpful books and maps to ease our exploration of Montreal. As far as location, we were able to walk all over the Plateau neighborhood easily, full of great restaurants and shops. There was easy access to the subway from the apartment to get to old town, downtown, etc. in just a matter of minutes, though walking was our preferred mode of transportation! Truly a great experience and good value, we would recommend Philippe and Sandra's place to any friend.
Apartment that perfectly matches the listing, even better than what is described, with very welcoming, friendly and helpful owners. Thank you!

The apartment is very well located for sightseeing, close to public transportation and shops, in a beautiful quiet location. It is perfectly maintained. We were lucky enough to meet our very friendly hosts Phillippe and Sandra who welcomed us superbly. Thank you for this pleasant stay! We will definitely come back for sure :-) I highly recommend this apartment.

This was the first time I used Airbnb. Philippe and Sandra's apartment was very large and amazing. There was lots of natural light in the suite. I loved staying there and the area is full of great coffee shops and restaurants. I will stay at this suite again. Thank you, Philippe and Sandra.

Philippe and Sandra are very nice and helpful. They even offered me a bottle of water when I arrived although the grocery store is a couple of blocks away. 

The place is as clean as it can be, it has a lot of space and is in one of my favorite areas of Montreal. Neighbors are quiet, and there's all the furniture you need. I recommend it to anyone staying in Montreal.

Philippe and Sandra proved to be courteous and available hosts. The 2-bedroom apartment was clean and equipped with all the necessary appliances for cooking the groceries purchased on the beautiful Laurier Street nearby. The neighborhood is quite pleasant, and all the pleasure of vacation is accessible by foot or public transportation. What a nice stay!
A wonderful stay in this Montreal apartment, a warm welcome and very kind hosts. The apartment is ideally located in a quiet neighborhood near public transportation (Laurier metro).

Our stay at Philippe's was wonderful. The apartment was spacious, very clean and fully equipped with everything we needed. The location was perfect - very close to the metro and close to great restaurants and shops in Plateau.

Thanks Philippe!

Had a great stay. The place is simple and quiet, but close to the metro, an easy walk to shops and restaurants and the fun mile end area. Best way to get around is on Bixi's though! The apartment was very clean and had almost everything we would have needed. I arrived very late at night and alone, but was made to feel very safe and comfortable by the hosts. They were adamant that if I needed anything, they were there to help. I would definitely stay again.

Thank you to Sandra and Philippe for this ideal accommodation for our stay in Montreal. We were very well received and discovered a lovely, comfortable apartment located in a very accessible neighborhood by metro and bus. We highly recommend this accommodation and thank our hosts again.

We had a wonderful time staying at Philippe and Sandra's. The apartment is simple but has everything you need. It was very clean with a lot of natural light in a perfect location near every major street in the plateau, near restaurants and cafes. It's walking distance from the subway and there's a bus stop right outside. Philippe and Sandra were very quick to respond to any of our needs. They gave us useful tips about interesting places worth visiting and how to get there. I highly recommend this apartment.

This place was awesome! Very close to public transportation and the neighborhood was great. Filled with eateries and markets. This place made our trip even better. The only thing we had an issue with in the house was where the toilet was placed. Other than that, Philippe was a great host and I would stay here again!
The flat was great (clean and well-furnished) and the hosts were really welcoming. We had a really great time!
A clean, functional apartment with all the necessary amenities. Philippe was very helpful and provided clear instructions. Great location in the Plateau neighborhood.

We loved staying at Philippe's in Montreal. I felt safe in the neighborhood which was important as I was traveling with my three kids (ages 15-19). The neighborhood is quiet and accommodates all the needs and wants of visitors (grocery, chocolates, wine, fresh baked products, etc), all within walking distance. Thank you for making my second trip to Montreal as lovely as the first.
Very warm welcome from Philippe and Sandra. The apartment is comfortable. It is located in a very nice neighborhood, with a park nearby: the ideal accommodation for a family with children!

Great location, close to subways, bus stops, great restaurants and cafes. Street parking was available without any hassle. Philippe gave us some great advice on routes to take for our return journey.

The apartment was also exactly what we had wanted. It was clean and well-equipped. 

We'll definitely consider this place again.

The apartment was brilliant! new, clean, comfy and with all the details to make you feel at home. The neighborhood is perfect for dinner and during the day - don't miss the bakery just around the corner! Phillip came to say hi when he returned from his weekend and he was really friendly and helpful. Thanks for everything, we loved our time there!
The reservation was cancelled 17 days before arrival. This is an automated message.

Philippe lives in the same building and is therefore always available to say hello and offer any advice you may need. The flat is lovely and well-equipped with everything you need for a fantastic stay in Montreal.

Super experience in Philippe and Sandra's apartment. 
Before arriving, they were available and easily contactable by email for any information or assistance.
We were four people in this accommodation, there was space for everyone, the apartment is therefore spacious, clean and warm. 
Philippe explained everything to us upon our arrival (apartment functionality, public transport, shops) and a information booklet is available at the living room.
The apartment is within a 10-15 minute walk of Laurier metro station which allows you to reach downtown. Shops and restaurants are nearby.
I highly recommend this accommodation.
I was very happy with my stay in this apartment. The neighborhood is very pleasant and Philippe and Sandra are really nice and available.

We really enjoyed our stay at Philippe's apartment. He warmly welcomed us and gave us all the necessary tips concerning Montreal and the apartment. Very clean and central. I would highly recommend it. On our next trip to Montreal, we will definitely stay with Philippe again. 

Laura & Friends

Philippe was very accommodating and very friendly.
The accommodation was exactly as he had described and even better. Everything was ready for our arrival, and the two beds were made. 
The apartment was well-located, and a 20m walk from the first bus that could take us to the metro.

The apartment was clean and all the comforts were there.

This was my first Airbnb experience and it was very positive. 
I would highly recommend Philippe's place and would stay there again if I needed a place in Montreal.
A perfectly clean and pleasant accommodation suitable for 4 people. A warm welcome with several maps of Quebec and its region. Thank you very much

Philippe was very welcoming and always responsive via Airbnb, though due to our personal scheduling we did not meet. The apartment was well furnished and had everything we needed during our stay. The location is great. Finding street parking was no trouble. A wonderful, nicely cultured neighborhood with many great shops, cafes, and restaurants close by, as well as a 10-15 minute walk to the metro.

The apartment was very clean and Philippe was pleasant to work with.

However, I should mention that the entire apartment smells strongly of cigarette smoke and we were not given any notice of this (it even permeated the bedding and remained on our clothes for days after leaving). We were informed upon our arrival that this was from recent guests. I certainly understand that this was beyond Philippe's control, but we would have definitely appreciated a heads up beforehand as this would have affected our decision to stay at the apartment. In all other respects, we had a great stay.

The neighborhood is pretty cute nestled in the Plateau, so close to many nearby places. The apartment is up a steep spiral staircase, so be careful going up in winter time. We had everything we needed and Philippe included a folder with a lot of information to help you get around. 

Although the bathroom is a little small, it was clean. Towels were included and we had no problems staying there. 

Thanks Philippe for everything!

We thank Sandra and Philippe for their hospitality and kindness. The accommodation, comfortable, matched the description perfectly and was well-situated; close to transport and shops.

We recommend this rental in which we would gladly return for a future stay.

Without any unpleasant surprises, the accommodation met our expectations.
Pleasant neighborhood, close to the metro and shops.
Philippe and his wife were proactive and efficient.
Highly recommended address without a doubt.

Philippe's place is so beautiful! My parents and I stayed for 3 nights and everything was super smooth. The location is great, right in the Plateau area and close to transit and very popular streets. Philippe is super friendly and ready to help or give advice. The apartment is warm, cozy, with two nice bedrooms, a great kitchen and living area. Very pleased with this experience!

This place matched the description perfectly - fantastic value for a two-bedroom apartment. I was in town visiting friends and it was perfect for my needs. The neighborhood is lovely - very close to places I wanted to go in the Plateau/Mile End, etc. Philippe was very friendly to communicate with and responsive to any questions we had. He also provided great directions and the coffee maker was a nice touch. Overall, just what I was looking for.

We enjoyed staying in Philippes house, it was the perfect starting point to explore Montreal for the first time: The bus stops right in front of the door, you walk 10 minutes to the metro, and the little shops and cafés on Av. Laurier are only a few steps away. We had a friendly and helpful host, and the apartment was perfect for our little family (2 adults, 1 child). Everything was clean and well prepared for our stay.

The house was great and within walking distance of everything, including the 2 train that takes you to downtown. The apartment comfortably fits 4 people and comes with cooking equipment if you need it, which I thought was really good. Phillippe and his wife were very good hosts and greeted us on our first day. For my next stay in Montreal, I will definitely be staying here again. A supermarket is right around the corner as well as a liquor store.

Thank you very much to Philippe and Sandra for their hospitality.

The apartment was impeccable, bright. 

The neighborhood was quiet within two steps of a lively street (cafe, supermarket,...). 

10-15 minutes walk from the metro.

A great place to spend a wonderful stay in Montreal. 

Highly recommended.

Hervé and Marie-Pierre

The accommodation is in accordance with the description. We stayed in the apartment for 3 people without any problems. The apartment was quite pleasant and its location, close to many shops and Laurier station, was quite practical (the station is a 10-minute walk or less than 5 minutes by bus, with the bus stopping right outside the apartment). Note: the apartment has access via a steep staircase (characteristic). 

Thank you Philippe and Sandra for their warm welcome.
Very nice apartment and very well located! Well equipped and comfortable. Good value for money! Very good welcome! Friendly and smiling owners! We had a very pleasant stay...

Thank you for this very successful stay.

We appreciated your hospitality and your accommodation is totally adapted for a stay in Montreal in a quiet neighborhood close to the city center. 

Thank you again.
Very friendly host and very pleasant house. Address to recommend for visiting Montreal
The place was great. Very clean, and exactly as described. Located in a residential neighborhood, very quiet and not far (bus ride or 30-ish minute walk) from bars and restaurants. Recommended!
We had a great stay at this nice apartment in Montreal. It's in a quiet, pretty neighborhood, about 15 minutes walk from the subway. Philippe was very welcoming and recommended it!

We arrived late on a Friday night and communicated previously with Philippe through text messaging. He was there to greet us when we arrived and showed us around the apartment. He informed us of all the local shops for any basic necessities and groceries that we might need. The apartment was simple and everything we needed - a comfortable bed, a good shower, space to relax after walking around all day. There is also a kitchen for those who want to cook. We would happily stay here again.
The apartment was very nice and it matched the pictures shown, the hosts are nice :)
Philippe's apartment is very spacious and comfortable. The location is great and very close to downtown. It met all of our expectations and I would recommend the place to anyone.

Personalized welcome from Philippe pleasantly surprised me. Everything was efficiently arranged for my arrival. Philippe wasn't present at my arrival, but the apartment was accessible via his clear instructions. The visit early the next morning to check in and offer breakfast was the cherry on top! This proves he cares about his clients' well-being. Everything is thought out in advance to ensure your comfort, down to the smallest details. This allows you to be independent right away, even if it's your first visit to Montreal! And I will definitely go back.

My daughter and I loved Philippe's apartment in Montreal. The neighborhood was quiet, conveniently located near a strip of restaurants, a grocery store, and a drugstore. It was nice having a bus stop right at the bottom of the stairs. It was super clean and everything we needed was in the apartment. We'd gladly stay with them again.

Spacious apartment as described, except for the bathroom which is not very large but that's enough. Everything you need is in the kitchen. Shops are 5 minutes away on foot. Very well located Bus at the doorstep of the apartment or metro 15 minutes away on foot. Philippe was absent upon our arrival but had everything organized. He came to see us when he returned. Very nice. We enjoyed a pleasant stay there.

Super apartment for visiting Montreal! 
Philippe and Sandra very warmly welcomed us and were very available during our stay.
The apartment is located in a quiet and typical neighborhood of Montreal, just two steps from all amenities.
We had an excellent stay there. 
In short, we recommend this address!

We really enjoyed our stay in Montreal and loved this apartment. It was in a great location close to public transportation, grocery stores, restaurants, etc. Philippe was very helpful and provided tons of information to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. We would definitely recommend this place!

Spacious and well-equipped apartment for four people, perfectly clean and offering a pleasant ambiance (park Laurier with its calm or lively atmosphere, pool, general ambiance...).  The location is ideal for buses, the metro, Bixi bikes, as well as various shops (within 5 minutes).

We thank Sandra for her hospitality and explanations. Our hosts were very accommodating. For our first family visit to Montreal, we had a wonderful stay. Highly recommended.

We are delighted with our stay at Philippe and Sandra's place. Practical, well-located, well-equipped, the apartment was perfect.  Philippe and Sandra's hospitality was warm and we greatly appreciated our exchanges with them. A tiny downside on the parking in the street which seemed complicated... but it seems to be the case in many streets in Montreal. Thank you again for their great availability.

My friend and I had just a great experience at Philippe's. The place is cozy and located in a nice neighborhood.  Perhaps my only concern was the lack of air conditioning, which would be nice to have during the summer.
My stay was excellent. The unit was as shown on AirB&B. Philippe was very responsive and the unit was well located. Great stay!!! I would stay there again.

We had a great stay at Philippe and Sandra's! The apartment was exactly as described and was ready and waiting for us to drop our bags and settle in when we arrived. The neighborhood is Montreal at its finest - brick buildings, small shops and cafés, green boulevards and parks, and very walkable. Philippe and Sandra answered all our inquiries promptly and were lovely hosts. We look forward to a chance to stay here again in the future!

One thing to note: due to some construction at the Laurier metro station entrance on Laurier Ave., the walk was a couple minutes longer to reach the other Laurier station entrance at Saint-Joseph Blvd. Nothing too much for avid pedestrians like us, but it might be for others. 

We also definitely recommend getting ice cream at Bo Bec on Laurier Ave! It's about a 5 minute walk from the apartment.

An ideal apartment located in a quiet and friendly neighborhood!

We met Sandra who was incredibly kind, approachable, and gave us good advice.

We recommend this accommodation.

This being our first Airbnb experience, my wife and I were very pleased with this clean, comfortable apartment. The hosts were helpful, and while we never met them in person, everything was well prepared for our arrival and they were very easy to keep in touch with before and during the stay. All amenities were as promised, the bed and bath were clean and comfortable, and there was just enough room for us to feel like we could spread out a bit while spending indoor downtime during our vacation. The neighborhood is pleasant, though prospective guests should know that it is located rather on the far northwest end of the Mont Royal Plateau area (about a mile north of Boulevard St. Laurent). But there are attractions nearer by as well, so all in all an excellent stay. Strongly recommended.

Philippe and Sandra welcomed us with great enthusiasm, thank you to them for their hospitality. A nice apartment very well located in a lively neighborhood but remaining calm. 

Everything was perfect!!

Philippe was present to welcome us even early in the morning. He showed himself very available for any help or advice. We already knew the neighborhood so we didn't have any particular requests but if the situation required it, we could easily reach him, especially since he lives on the ground floor. 

The apartment is functional, clean and comfortable.

Although we didn't interact much with our host, we met him briefly during our stay and he was very welcoming and friendly. The listing was exactly as described. It was a gorgeous little apartment with everything you'd need for a short stay - extra blankets, iron, cutlery, etc. The neighborhood was also wonderful. I loved Montreal and I loved the apartment we had the wonderful opportunity to stay in. Thank you Phillipe!
Philippe's apartment was very clean and comfortable. We had everything we needed for our stay. He was very hospitable. I would definitely stay here again!
Such a cozy and beautiful home. Every time I come to Montreal now, I plan on staying there!

Very warm welcome from Philippe and Sandra, who are exemplary hosts, always available if needed.

The apartment is exactly as pictured, very well-arranged, everything is spotless. It is conveniently located, a 10/15 minute walk from the Laurier metro station and at the bottom of the street you'll find plenty of shops, perfect for grocery shopping and restaurants.

We stayed there for two months with a friend and we truly felt like home!

Highly recommended, don't hesitate! :D

Cécilia and Marie
Translation: Very good stay at Philippe's place, the apartment is clean and quiet, very well located.

My brother and I enjoyed our stay at Philippe and Sandra's place. Although I did not meet Philippe (but I did speak with him over the phone; he is a very nice guy), I did meet Sandra who was very lovely. She gave my brother and me a tour of the place and also made sure that where we were parked for our stay would be a good place to park to avoid parking tickets. Within the house, they provided a nice little manual that they drew up. It had a nice map with nearby restaurants, grocery stores, and public transportation, as well as instructions on how to use the TV and a listing of some of the more commonly used channels so you didn't have to go searching for them, along with information for connecting to the Wi-Fi. There were some basic cooking supplies (pots, cutlery, etc.) which was nice because it meant that we didn't have to eat out every night. The area was very nice and just a few minutes walk away from a very nice park, bike rental station, and swimming pool, and about a 10-15 minute walk to the Metro. From their place to Rue Sherbrooke and St. Laurent (where they had many festivities for the Grand Prix Weekend) cost my brother and me about $11 for the taxi ride. All in all, the place is nice though it is a bit small, especially the bathroom. However, the two bedrooms that were there were a good size and didn't feel cramped at all. As mentioned before, our stay there was enjoyable. I would stay there again.

Unfortunately, we didn't meet Philippe, but everything was ready for our arrival despite our 3-hour delay at customs (waiting time). The apartment corresponds well to the photos. It is located approximately 14 minutes from the Laurier metro station and there is everything you need nearby.
Our arrival was not unexpected, apart from the pleasant atmosphere of the neighborhood and its central street nearby.

Philippe's place is a great home base while in Montreal. It's located in a lovely residential neighborhood. The place was nice, clean and had everything we needed. It's small but enough space for 2-3 people. We had no problems on arrival, just a bit of confusion on the checkout time but it ended up working out. Definitely important to know that the way in is up a VERY steep staircase! I would recommend staying here :)
Everything was cool, especially because there was a small problem that Philippe quickly fixed. Montreal was a great surprise, now I know where I might run if Trump gets elected ;-)

It was very easy to communicate via email. We never saw our host, however, it was easy to get in and use the apartment. There was a manual on the table describing, however, the first page is only in French. The place is clean and has all the minimum amenities. The bathroom and shower are very small, but the size of the kitchen and the apartment and the bedrooms are good.

We were informed about the neighborhood and its amenities, such as a pool, car rental, and public transportation. The neighborhood is very friendly, with a park nearby, (website hidden by Airbnb) family-friendly.

We never met Philippe during our stay but he was very kind, he also provided us with a booster seat and a crib for the little girl and was very flexible with arrival and departure times. The whole apartment is very clean and, even though it looks bigger than it actually is from the photos, it remains very charming, well-kept and welcoming. The Wi-Fi works well and the location is convenient: a 10-minute walk from the metro and in a nice residential neighborhood.

We had a pleasant stay at the apartment. The location is very nice, the apartment simple but convenient. 
Communication was good with Philippe.

This was our first Airbnb stay and it was fabulous! The apartment was exactly as described in the listing and very clean. For us, the location was perfect—near our friends and around the corner from a beautiful park, restaurants, and cafes.
For the second time, everything went very well.

This place matched the images, simple and cute with the essentials. The neighborhood was on the rise with many cool restaurants. Nice atmosphere, felt very safe. Would recommend for those seeking something a bit cooler and relaxed.

My friend and I had a great overall experience staying at Philippe's Airbnb. Philippe's wife initially greeted us with her huge smile and warm personality. The place itself was super clean and perfect for 2-3 people. Amenities wise, the place isn't as stocked as others I've been to, but that's probably because I've been spoiled at others so make sure you bring shampoo, soap, extra coffee and tea. Philippe is very quick at responding whenever you message him; he also lives downstairs so if you need anything just ring. For those driving there, street parking is available but it can be a bit confusing, make sure you read the signs like normal and you'll be fine. What else? That's about it! Cool, chill spot, neat shops around, perfect base camp.
All as described. Friendly and helpful host.
Very clean, quiet corner, informative instruction booklet (rest, pharmacy, metro etc).

We had a lovely stay at the cozy apartment and were really thankful for the recommendation and help from Philippe and his wife. The apartment is located on the first floor, reachable by a typical Montreal staircase. We stayed with 2 people in the apartment which was perfect. The place was clean and well-equipped. Everything you need was provided and looked like in the pictures. The bathroom was small but didn't bother us.
