Spent two days there and had a great time. We didn't spend much time in the apartment, but it's cozy and the rooftop terrace offers great views. There's a park, as well as plenty of places to eat nearby too. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay.
We enjoyed our stay here. The space was very clean and had a feeling of home.

Melanie's place is a hidden gem! It has an amazing location close to everything, and the place itself is absolutely gorgeous. Melanie was extremely accommodating for us since we were driving in from the US and she provided all the needed amenities. Don't hesitate, stay here!

Melanie's place was great. Check-in was easy. It was in a great location and parking was super easy. Melanie gave us great recommendations for places to eat and it was easy to fill out the weekend with activities around Montreal. I would highly recommend this place if you are looking for a GREAT value for a GREAT price! This place was great for two friends but I would also recommend it for two couples. Highly recommend!

Great place to stay. 
Thanks Melanie!
Beautiful place to stay!
Super accommodation, very well-located, warm and clean. Friendly welcome and quick responses to any questions. The terrace in the summer must be beautiful!!!
Great place, clean and close to downtown Montreal!
"Beautiful and really well located! It's a bit noisy because the room is on a busy street, but there's another room. Everything you need is nearby!"
We really enjoyed our stay at Melanie's place. It was tidy and in a good location! Melanie was very responsive and made a great host!
It's a great place to stay overnight, with a good location too.
Excellent!
Truly satisfied!
Very well located.
Awesome neighborhood. Coffee shops and stores right outside the door. SUPER clean. Overall very happy with our stay.
Great location with easy access to downtown Montreal via the metro. Good views from the rooftop patio!

Melanie's place was great. The rooftop deck was amazing and I wish we could have stayed longer! Street parking was annoying, but I suppose that's par for the course. Would definitely stay at Melanie's place again--it was clean with comfortable beds, close to everything and did I mention the rooftop deck?!

My friend drove up from Ontario and I flew in from BC for an epic best friends reunion. Melanie's place was great for our needs. It had everything we needed and a fantastic location. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it!
Easy check-in and check-out, cute and clean, no-frills spot in Montreal. Thanks for a nice stay!
Cozy apartment, a short walk to downtown Montreal but that was expected! Nice stay

Melanie's place has a great location and offers good value. We were a bit worried about parking, but it was easy.  Dog-friendly is a big plus. It's not a luxury apartment - the bathroom is quite small, some windows don't have screens, and there's no lock box - but you aren't paying for luxury either.
Nice and convenient place to stay in a perfect neighborhood!
A terrific place with lots of amenities within walking distance, and close to all the best the city has to offer, including Mile End, the mountain, and Old Montreal. Would gladly stay here again.

The place was clean and stylish (I love loft style places) and all amenities mentioned were available. The location is great with lots of places to eat, a 10-minute drive to Mount Royal. Melanie accommodated for a bit of late check out and was available for any questions.
Translation: Awesome!
Great space in a great location. Would recommend to anyone staying and looking for a hip spot close to bars and a good selection of restaurants!
Spacious and perfect accommodation for a small group of travelers. The terrace on the roof is very nice with a beautiful view.
Lovely neighborhood and very nice accommodations!

Well-located apartment with terrace and view of Montreal. 
Second time we've stayed in this apartment that we appreciate

Melanie was available by phone and message when we needed it.
Excellent location, comfortable beds, and on-street parking was never an issue.

Melanie's place was very homey and comfortable. We loved the big TV, board games, and lots of tea and coffee. It's a little hard to find the first time, but once you know where it is it's very accessible. We loved our stay!

Annie's communication prior to our stay was thorough and thoughtful. We had cell phone numbers and names of two contacts who could welcome us on our day of arrival. This was very helpful since the time needed to pass through the border between the USA and Canada can be unpredictable. Our welcome contact showed us around the apartment, introduced us to Momo, and was very friendly. She even walked us to the nearby street where we would find restaurant choices because eating was our priority at that moment!

Freshly ground coffee, a French Press, and many bright and beautiful colors both inside and out from painted walls, kitchenware, and blooming flowers welcomed us in the morning. The deck felt soft underfoot, and the privacy of the backyard extended the kitchen in an organic way. The pool was refreshing and soothing to view. The entire space was aesthetically pleasing.

At night we slept well. All was quiet. The shower worked well. The coming and going was easy and gentle.

We had a pleasant stay at Annie's place. The accommodation was very well-arranged and very close to the metro, which is really appreciated, especially since we were traveling with three children. The courtyard was nice, and we enjoyed it as well as the barbecue! We didn't miss anything!

We enjoyed our stay at Annie's condo very much. It is centrally located, has a lovely garden and pool, and all the amenities we needed from towels to pots and pans. The neighborhood is peaceful and quiet, close to the Jean Talon Market and a little park for our son to play in. 
Annie was helpful in answering any questions we had; we are sorry we never got to meet her. 
Momo is a friendly cat who always let us know if he needed to get in or out.

We enjoyed our stay with the little one. The park rental was super which allowed us to decrease the number of items to bring. The location, terrace, and the general accommodation met our expectations. Thank you for your hospitality! Guillaume, Annie, and Maëly.

Four of us stayed at Annie's place over a long weekend, and it was the perfect spot to start and end our days in Montreal. The pool and backyard were charming, and the neighborhood itself had everything we needed. I've stayed in downtown Montreal in the past, but prefer this neighborhood. The flat was spacious - the four of us never felt like we were on top of each other. Annie was helpful and responsive even though she was on vacation herself. Great stay!
Lovely apartment located in a very trendy neighborhood. Great restaurants and shops.

We have stayed at a few places on AirBnB and Annie's was great. Eclectic with a touch of old world feel, you will love the flow into the back yard, the proximity to the Metro and Little Italy. 

Everything you need is so close. The neighborhood is very interesting and represents a part of Montreal that should be embraced.

Annie was a great host - she took the time to make sure we felt at home!

We enjoyed the place; it was cozy and comfortable. We appreciated the proximity to shops, restaurants, and the metro. 

My sisters loved the pool! 

I enjoyed the company of Momo the cat!

Perfect stay, paradise to resume the previous comments! We had everything we needed, a very well-placed house in a very nice neighborhood, ultra clean with all you need and even more! Thank you again Annie!

The house is really very charming with a small garden and a beautiful terrace that we have enjoyed greatly. The bedroom and office/bedroom are spacious but in the half basement, which is quite common in Montreal but may surprise French people who are used to it. 

It's a co-living situation with several local roommates,  friendly for exchanges but this does require some discretion.
The neighborhood is very nice near Jarry Park... ideal for enjoying life in Montreal.
Dominic was friendly and helpful! We were not in the unit much as we were out all day.

Thank you so much Geneva for letting us stay in your lovely home. The location is very close to all of the fun activities Montreal has to offer. The detail, and care you put into your home was outstanding. Our group would like to thank you for your hospitality! Definitely would come back.

Don't be discouraged by the outside of the building. Geneva has a charming apartment with nice furniture pieces. She was out of town when we arrived but answered questions quickly. In fact, when we were there she had been away for a while and had had some Airbnb guests staying, so the apartment wasn't as clean as you might want. We liked the neighborhood and the great cafes nearby. The Korean restaurant was nice.
Geneva was a gracious host. She was very accommodating with our check-in time. The apartment was exactly as pictured and very clean. The location was wonderful and had a great neighborhood vibe.
Great comfortable apartment. Very close to stores, bars, and transportation.
We were very happy with our stay at Geneva's apartment! It was in the perfect location (close to Drawn & Quarterly and many other wonderful spots) and it was very comfortable.
Geneva was very welcoming. The apartment is surrounded by many delicious cafes and restaurants in the area. I will definitely return to this place if I ever visit Montreal again. =)
Geneva was nice. The apartment matched the description. The neighborhood is fantastic. No complaints!
The reservation was cancelled 4 days before arrival. This is an automated message.

We loved Geneva's place, it was perfect for our small family. She was helpful via text for finding parking and quick to respond to questions. Great neighborhood too!

Thank you, Geneva!
We had a nice time at Geneva's apartment. The apartment was basically as described, and we enjoyed time in the apartment's two outdoor spaces. Overall, it was a great base for exploring Montreal.

Had a really great time staying at Geneva's in the Mile End. The apartment was very cute and cozy, and Geneva was very communicative throughout the entire process. Overall, it was a great Airbnb experience for my first time using the platform!
Geneva's apartment was great for our Osheaga adventure! We thoroughly enjoyed the two porches and the neighborhood was very fun to explore.

Geneva's apartment is super well located, huge and generally overflowing with good vibes - from the aesthetically pleasing kitchen with creeper vines around the walls, to the living room-dining room with a huge table to spread out on and soft couch, the whole place was generally excellent. 

It's also in a great, convenient spot in the Mile End, well served by public transport.
Geneva was unable to accommodate us, but we found a pleasant apartment in a good location for all our outings.

Geneva’s place was definitely our favorite Airbnb in Montreal. It's in an older building and has a nice quaint, classic feel to it: natural light, wood floors, some neat plants in the kitchen, and a perfect layout. There's a small back porch with a fantastic view of the alley behind the house, which was covered in plants, vines, and people enjoying the air on their decks. The Mile End area was such a lively, picturesque place.

Geneva was friendly, helpful, and spoke fluent English (and Spanish!). We enjoyed our stay!
The host cancelled this reservation 126 days before arrival. This is an automated message.
Excellent experience at the Montreal center! Nice roommates and a very cool apartment!

The perfect place in the perfect location of downtown Montreal. The online pictures match the spacious loft apartment, and my room was ready with fresh sheets and bath towels. The host left post-it notes with tips throughout the apartment - including an empty shelf in the refrigerator and kitchen cabinet for me to leave things. There is no better location for jazz fest, and we walked everywhere from this very central location.
A great place to stay, with a fantastic location and very welcoming and friendly hosts. Highly recommended.

A great place full of unique furniture and art. I found it to be a productive writing space and ended up getting a lot of work done in the communal areas while I was there. Everyone living there was respectful of my space and delightful to talk to on occasion. My room was super quiet, practically soundproof, which is nice. The neighborhood is close to several train and bus lines that connect to other parts of the city, right in the heart of downtown, which was very convenient for me.

My stay at Pauline's and Thomas's place was very pleasant. Their spacious and sun-filled loft is full of character and charm. I was allowed to fully use their kitchen, washer & dryer and got a fan in my room which was pleasant after a warm day. Pauline and Thomas are nice people that are easy to get along with and are very warm. 

Conveniently located close to old town and the Palais de Congres, one can also easily go grocery shopping and quickly reach Ste-Catherine and the Arts district around UQAM.

I'll be happy to stay at their place again.

I stayed about two weeks in this awesome loft and I can totally recommend it! Thomas, Pauline & Ben were very nice and helpful and the loft looks even better than in the photos! Not to forget Couscous, probably the cutest cat I ever met. Thank you!

Pauline and Thomas were very friendly, gracious, and hospitable hosts during my stay, and it was a pleasure getting to know them and their fellow roommate Benoit. It's important to note that Pauline was very accommodating to my arrival schedule and had a high degree of organization, which I appreciated greatly, given the much different experience I had earlier with a neighboring hotel. The loft was much larger than I expected and situated perfectly within reach of Montreal's major points of interest. Cous Cous was probably the most chill and relaxed cat I've ever seen. I'd most certainly recommend the experience to anyone, including my own return visit to Montreal.

I stayed at this place for 3 weeks. Pauline and Thomas (and also roommate Ben) were very friendly and hospitable. They have a unique and gorgeous loft, which they have furnished and decorated in their own artistic styles. The place has a huge living area and a kitchen - and the bedroom was quite cozy as well. The location of the place is very convenient with metro and grocery shops close by. Cous Cous and Sid are probably the most relaxed and friendly cats I have ever seen, who I guess have learned a thing or two about hospitality from their owners :-) Overall I had a wonderful time in this charming loft and I would definitely stay here again.

I had a fantastic week. I didn't even realize how much time passed. The roommates are super awesome. Special mention for the PS4 party on the projector and for the two cats: Mr. Paul and Couscous (aka master of the cosmos).

I spent a weekend here. The loft is great. It has so much space in the living room, and the private room is nice and tidy. The roommates were friendly; they are bilingual, which is sweet for an English speaker in Montreal. Great weekend for me.
Very large room in a huge loft. Two steps from the Congress Palace and the Desjardins complex!

It's a really great place with very creative furniture setup and uniqueness. Pauline responds quickly when I have questions, and her roommates are very friendly and helpful. The place is located downtown, close to everything. I like everything there.
Very good

Pauline's place is one of the most special Airbnbs I've ever stayed at. The flat is mega cool and has all the amenities you need, and it's very central and convenient if you are arriving by bus from the airport. Check-in couldn't be easier. I would definitely stay there again.
Super loft with vintage decor!!! :)

Couldn't have chosen a better place to stay in Montreal. Pauline was so kind and considerate. The space was so clean, homey and cozy. The suite had tons of natural light. Couscous was the sweetest cat we've ever met. Pauline has a very impressive plant collection. The location was perfect for all the sights we wanted to see. There were restaurants, galleries, bixi stations and the metro nearby. We would definitely recommend staying here on your trip to Montreal. Thanks Pauline!

Pauline's place is perfect for staying one or two people, the bed and the room are cozy and comfortable. The rest of the apartment, which is shared, is beautiful and clean. The location cannot be better. Everything was as expected and Pauline is such a great host; I had to make a last-minute change and we agreed immediately, she was comprehensive and nice. So I recommend this place.

My stay at Pauline’s was fantastic. From the incredibly clean environment, the wonderful location, the great people, to Couscous, the friendly and cuddly cat :) 

If I need a place to stay in Montreal again, I wouldn’t hesitate to stay at Pauline’s again. I absolutely recommend it to anyone looking for a room in Montreal.
Pauline's place was spacious and artistic, Couscous was the most loving cat, she had a fun stay over in Montreal!
Pauline is very attentive and everything was in order. The apartment is truly charming and well-located.

Marie's 2-bedroom apartment in the Plateau was perfect for our stay. Great location, both to the Metro and to Mont-Royal, with everything you needed within walking distance. Although Marie and I missed the chance to meet face-to-face due to our schedules, we worked around it and made arrangements for keys, etc. She left us a great "cheat sheet" for the apartment and what to do in the neighborhood that was very helpful, as well as an amazing spread of continental goodies (croissants, fruit, coffee, and the like). It was very much a hotel-like stay with all the comforts of home. Marie stayed in touch via text/email throughout our visit to ensure everything was in order. Overall, a very pleasant experience! Thank you, Marie!

Marie was very friendly, informative, and thoughtful (she even kindly left us croissants, juice, and coffee for our first breakfast). The apartment was very clean and comfortable, with everything we needed, and it's situated in a really interesting area of Montreal. The whole stay was top-notch and we recommend Marie and her apartment as an excellent Airbnb option in Montreal. Thank you, Marie.

The apartment is immense and very clean.

The host provided us with all the necessary details to have a fabulous trip.

Communication with her was very efficient and comprehensive.

The location of the apartment is extraordinary.

A great spot to stay in a fun and vibrant neighborhood! It was really snowy when we were there so we parked our car (found street parking easily) and did all of our exploring on foot. 

The apartment is very cozy and comfortable. Marie was a gracious host who responded quickly to inquiries and made sure that we had everything we needed.

The best thing about this apartment? The espresso machine. We're going to have to buy one of our own now.
Great apartment with excellent location in the Plateau of Montreal. Marie was very kind to leave us many instructions for a pleasant stay!
Wonderful host, always helpful and easy to reach. The location is perfect and the place was exactly as the pictures show, spacious and very clean. Just perfect for our family of four.

Great apartment near everything! Marie was very communicative and left the apartment spotless upon our arrival. Two closed bedrooms make it an ideal place to stay for coworkers or friends. It's near a ton of shops, restaurants, and bars on Mt Royal and St Laurent. Really enjoyed the stay and hope it's available for rent the next time I'm in MTL. Thanks Marie!
Our family of four stayed with Marie for the second time and it was once again a wonderful time. The apartment and the location are great. Marie is a very caring host, and we can truly recommend it.

Marie's apartment is very nice and comfortable. We feel right at home there quickly. 
It's ideally located on the plateau.
I regret not having met Marie, who was so kind in our email exchanges.

Wonderful 6-night stay in Marie's cozy Mont Royal neighborhood apartment during our epic Women's World Cup trip to Canada.  Marie is very responsive and helpful; although we did not meet her, she was very personable via email and text.  The apartment is IDEAL for an active couple or family.  The walkup apartment is close to Parc Mont Royal for a hike or challenging run, and within a short walk of 3 Bixi bike stations (the best way to see Montreal is by bike; we took the Bixi everywhere, day and night, to Biosphere, Jazz Festival, Stadium de Montreal for World Cup).  Also close to the metro and bus to Airport.  Marie was very attentive in leaving information on the Montreal Jazz Festival.  We enjoyed the festival thoroughly, and were able to get tickets to see John Mayall, a lifelong dream for myself and my spouse.  The apartment was exactly as pictured, kitchen well-equipped (I cooked for us one night) and walkable to very hip area of bars, cafes, and restaurants.  The Netflix worked great to stream (Canada has a lot more content available than the USA), and Marie's internet was fast.  Our second trip to Montreal, and quite enjoyed staying there. It was a very good value as well. Thanks Marie, you are a wonderful hostess!

Karen & Bill (55-somethings) and Carrie & Amy (our young adult daughters).

Marie was a very welcoming host. She kept in touch to see that all was okay, and did her best to make our two-week stay enjoyable. Her apartment is ideally located, close to supermarkets, pharmacies, cafes, bars, restaurants, and yet it is very quiet. The living areas are spacious and comfortable. It is a 10-minute walk to Mont Royal metro station.

Marie was very quick to respond to any questions, and went above and beyond in making our stay comfortable. My wife and I visited Montreal with our 18-month-old daughter, and the apartment was clean, comfortable, and quiet. The location was very convenient with easy walking to several parks, grocery stores, and the Metro. Marie provided us with a map of nearby parks and plug covers for all the outlets. The AC was necessary during a heat wave, but was able to keep the whole place comfortable. I would highly recommend this apartment and would look to book again for a return trip.

Staying at Simon and Erika's apartment for a week was our best Airbnb experience yet! Their home is a beautiful gem. Gorgeous, clean, comfortable, inviting, interesting, accommodating—staying here was everything one could ask for in a vacation space. They left us informative instructions, great recommendations to the neighborhood, and were easy to contact during our stay. Rosemont is a great little neighborhood; it had an excellent bakery and every basic amenity nearby. Despite being further East, it's only a quick bus ride away from two different metro lines. Would love to stay here again!
Very nice, big, comfortable and stylish flat. Simon was very nice and gave us plenty of information. We highly recommend it.

A big thank you to Anouchka!

Very kind and very thoughtful, Anouchka sent us an email before we left to make sure we knew how to get to her apartment. She even offered to wait at the metro station for us to pick her up. She gave us the keys in person and showed us around her apartment. She even planned to leave us everything we needed for breakfast the next morning, which is appreciated when you arrive in the evening. The next day, she sent us a text message to see how our first night went and asked if we needed anything to perfect our stay. The accommodation is very warm, exactly as it appears in the photos, clean and very welcoming. We feel very good there! We won't hesitate to ask Anouchka to let us stay again during our next visit to Montreal! The neighborhood is very pleasant and the proximity of the metro is very convenient. Thank you again, Anouchka, and see you soon!

Anouchka's wonderful apartment is really a home away from home. Bright, colorful, full of natural sunlight and fully equipped with everything you need to make your stay in Montreal incredibly enjoyable. Her place is located within walking distance of great places to eat and visit, including the Jean-Talon Market (a must-see for anyone visiting the city). Anouchka was very responsive and accommodated my late arrival without any issues - I'd highly recommend her place for anyone visiting Montreal!

We had a lovely time staying at Anouchka's place! The apartment was clean and tidy, and it looked exactly as it is portrayed in the pictures. Anouchka was very welcoming and knowledgeable about her neighborhood. She was very flexible with check-in and check-out times to accommodate us. We would definitely stay at Anouchka's place again!

Very warm welcome from Anouschka, a quiet, cozy apartment well decorated; comfortable bed; apartment located near everything and in a great location. 

For those who love places with joyful and gentle energy!

Our stay was absolutely perfect. Anouchka is a very welcoming and cheerful host, which made us feel right at home immediately. We rented the apartment for one week, I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a warm, welcoming place full of energy. 
The apartment is close to interesting places and we felt like we were at home there. I will definitely go back there with great pleasure!

I always feel cozy and comfortable at the Airbnbs I stay in, but there was something about Anouchka's that really made me feel like I was at home, like no other time has. My boyfriend and I took the train up from NYC, and I was planning on updating Anouchka on our arrival time using the wifi on the train-- since we got transferred to a bus in Albany, I had no way of contacting her once we crossed the Canadian border. I was so worried, since the unexpected change caused us to arrive later than expected-- but Anouchka was completely prepared to handle every situation and left the keys for us in a convenient place even though we weren't able to meet her as planned. Nothing beat waking up in that beautiful, warm, comfortable haven each morning and seeing the snowfall outside. Thank you, Anouchka, for giving us the perfect home during our short but memorable stay in Montreal!

Anouchka met us at the apartment as planned. She is a very gracious host and made us feel welcome. All of our questions about the neighborhood were answered in a notebook complete with maps. The apartment was clean and well-equipped. 

We would certainly stay here again. Thank you, Anouchka.

Great neighborhood, lovely home, very welcoming. Anouchka was very gracious and friendly. 

Would love to stay here again on my next visit.
The reservation was cancelled 9 days before arrival. This is an automated message.
Anouchka was very nice and gave us a list of things to do in the neighborhood. We had some confusion checking in, but otherwise no problems at all! Great host and a cozy stay very close to the metro.
We loved staying in Anouchka's charming apartment and she made sure everything went smoothly for us. Highly recommended!

We had an excellent time in Montreal! Anouchka's house is very pretty, quiet and relaxing in a neighborhood that is both central but not too crowded. Anouchka is very responsive and available. Thank you to her.

My husband and I really enjoyed our stay. The bed was good with nice linens. The apartment was decorated in nice colors - bright and cheerful! The kitchen was equipped and the bathroom had good water pressure. The book left in the apartment described a bunch of places to check out - came in handy as we visited a local bakery and coffee shop (really nice). The neighborhood is classic Montreal. Tree-lined streets with three-story walk-ups. Very close to Jarry metro and Jarry Park. There are lots of local shops nearby, including grocery stores and pharmacies. We had no trouble finding street parking. I always travel with a sleep mask and it came in handy as the apartment is nice and bright, and the curtains in the bedroom let light come in. If you're there in the summer months and have the windows open, there's a bit of street noise, not too much but a little. This wouldn't apply in the cooler months when the windows are closed. Overall, I recommend this apartment - it's very clean and quaint, and the neighborhood is classic Montreal and close to the metro with easy street parking nearby!

Our arrival was well prepared by Anouchka, thank you to her! She has been very available, responsive, and friendly. She also prepared a folder with practical information for our stay. 

The apartment is well located, a metro station within walking distance, then easy access to the city center. 

In the end, good value for money!

Anouchka's apartment is an oasis! It is absolutely warm and cozy, and also very peaceful and relaxing. We weren't sure where to look for places to stay in Montreal. In fact, we only picked Anouchka's apartment because of the great pictures and glowing reviews -- we had no idea where it was in relation to attractions/restaurants/etc. I'm glad we chose this place to stay!

Anouchka left a great traveler's guide complete with suggestions of where to go in her neighborhood. The neighborhood is not in Old Montreal -- you need to take the metro which is located right down the street. I found the location to be perfect. Good restaurants and cafes; tree-lined streets and cool looking apartments; a great bar with local craft beer; etc. There is also a great balcony off the kitchen where you can enjoy breakfast or a book or a drink. The neighborhood was quiet when we were there, and even with a party going on downstairs, I couldn't hear them at all when I went to bed. 

Anouchka's apartment is incredibly clean. The decor is bright and cheery (I loved all the plants!). The bedroom is huge. The bathroom is huge. The sitting room is cozy with a nice, big couch. The kitchen is full-sized. It felt like home!  The pictures here on Airbnb are a great representation of this apartment.

Thank you for opening up your home to us! We truly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this flat to anyone!
The apartment was clean and smelled good. A briefcase awaited us on the kitchen table, where we found all the necessary information about the accommodation and the neighborhood.
The apartment was clean and very well-located. Communication with Anouchka was perfect, it was simple and quick. In short, we really enjoyed our stay! I recommend it

Anouchka's apartment was just great, exactly what we wanted in Montreal. Cozy, funky, and with everything we needed. The neighborhood is good, residential with enough bars and restaurants around to make it worth exploring, and with easy access to the metro to get to the center.

The listing was described exactly how it looks—very colorful and welcoming. The location was a 5-minute walk from The Metro, which was very convenient. A great coffee shop was a 5-minute walk away as well; it's called Cafe Larue & Fil. Anouchka was super flexible, friendly, and easy to get in touch with. We enjoyed our stay very much!

Anouchka's Traveler's Guide was just perfect and it helped me discover the best addresses in Montreal! The neighborhood is just sublime, and the apartment matched all the photos and descriptions perfectly.

The apartment matched the ad description. It was clean, comfortable, bright, colorful, and seemed to convey a sense of the host (whom we did not meet this trip, but spoke with on the phone). The arrival arrangements were as promised, even though we arrived later than anticipated. Having a washer and dryer in the apartment was great. The weather was hot and humid, but there was a rotating fan in the apartment that helped a great deal in that regard. We felt comfortable while there and were able to enjoy coffee on the terrace in the mornings (at least when it wasn't raining).

The neighborhood matched other reviewers' descriptions—quiet, residential, diverse. A short walk to Jarry Street presented a variety of dining, coffee, and drink options. There were several Vietnamese restaurants, Greek, Italian, and a couple of bars. We returned again and again to EtOH, which was on Jarry and St-Denis, as they had twenty craft beers on tap and good pub food. Java Mythe, marked in Anouchka's Traveller's Guide, which she placed in the apartment, had excellent coffee. A bit of a walk first thing in the morning, but worth it. A walk to Parc Jarry turned up a free concert on Friday evening; and over on Villeray we were able to get our poutine fix at Frites Alors. The subway, also on Jarry, was a short walk, and between that, our feet, and the 193 and 30 buses, we were able to go anywhere we wanted without having to touch the car for five days. Downtown, the Old City, the Plateau and Parc Mont-Royal, the waterfront and Atwater Market—for the most part, were within half an hour without needing a car. We would not hesitate to return to Anouchka's apartment.
Anouchka was very helpful. The apartment was small but cozy. It is well-situated, close to the Metro.
Warm and relaxing apartment in a great location. Anouchka is always available to help us during our stay. I highly recommend this place.

Anouchka's apartment was wonderful. Bright, exceptionally clean, and everything the pictures portrayed it to be. We were able to relax, and she was always prompt with responding anytime we needed something. We would recommend this place to anyone.

Anouchka offers a very friendly and thoughtful experience for travelers. She maintained contact with us before we arrived, made sure we were clear about how to enter the apartment, and left many interesting maps and brochures about the area. She also created a neighborhood map that pointed out various locations for meals and shopping. The apartment is very clean, and super energetic and colorful. The kitchen is well stocked with necessary items and allows for comfortable meals and socializing. The rest of the apartment offers comfort amidst a creative décor. There are many lighting options, which is nice when you just want to hang out or relax. The little porch provided a great place to find fresh air while sipping on drinks or reading a book. The surrounding area, while further away from the hub of Le Plateau or Downtown Montreal, provides quick access to the Jean Talon market --- an amazing must-see place --- and the #30 bus which can transport one to more bustling areas rather quickly. For the past decade or so, we have tended to stay in the Le Plateau region, and were a little worried about being so far out. But in the end, this was an amazing choice because we explored the Villeray/St Michel area, as well as Mile End, places we had ignored in previous visits to Montreal. As a result of the switch, we found great bagel and gift shops in Mile End, and appreciated a week-long supply of fresh berries and veggies from the Jean Talon market. When we wanted to go out for dinner or to a museum, we found the bus (with a stop just on the corner) to be incredibly convenient, and the metro a short and interesting walk away. We did not get a chance to explore the restaurants in the immediate area, although there are many. For us, being able to spread out, to relax, and to savor foods prepared at home was a real treat, which was made even more incredible by Anouchka’s decorating talent. We hope to return next year for a longer stay, and will definitely first look to see if this apartment is available. I am now a huge fan of Airbnb and Anouchka’s hospitality!

Great stay! Comfortable apartment with character and not too far from the sights. Anouchka left a book full of neighborhood tips and useful information. We didn't have the pleasure of meeting her, but she made it easy to get the keys and was very flexible on the departure time. We felt really at home during our stay!

We really liked how bright and colorful the apartment was! The welcome information and maps really helped us make the most of the neighborhood. Free street parking was also a nice perk! Overall, it was a fantastic first Airbnb experience! We would definitely recommend this apartment.

I had an amazing time in Montreal anchored by Anouchka's beautiful apartment. I found her apartment spacious, colorful, and inspiring with two balconies and it was situated close to Jarry station, which was one stop away from beautiful Jean Talon & Little Italy. Getting downtown and to Old Montreal was also a short ride away. Anouchka was a wonderful host; when I arrived she had a booklet with suggestions about the neighborhood, apartment rules, and even maps and tour guide pamphlets about the city. I could've asked for a better experience.
Anouchka's apartment was exactly what we were looking for on our first trip to Montreal. It was a nice size in a quiet neighborhood away from all the tourists. I highly recommend it.

Anouchka's apartment was absolutely fantastic. The neighborhood is beautiful and welcoming, and Anouchka's "travel guide" is incredibly helpful; it has complete instructions on everything in the apartment (including how to fix the Wifi if it broke!), and the local recommendations are useful and fantastic (especially Java Mythe and El Rey Del Taco).

Overall, I could not imagine a better place to stay in Montreal.
Pleasant apartment, bright and airy, where you feel good. As described.

My fiancé and I had a wonderful stay at this beautiful apartment in Montreal. It was near transportation, clean, and comfortable. Our host's information binder of maps and suggestions was perfect! We followed many ideas from the binder and were pleasantly surprised by the Java Myth Cafe, Tapeo, and Le Coin G. Thanks to Anoushka's recommendations, our experience in Montreal was exactly what we wanted: a short visit to a wonderful city without being in the touristy area. We would absolutely stay here again. Thank you for opening your home to us!
Anouchka has a lovely spacious and colorful apartment that is very clean and comfortable! She was enjoyable to meet and made me feel welcome from the start!
Very nice apartment, very well located, close to the metro, quiet neighborhood! A very good address. We felt like home.  Shame that our stay organization didn't allow us to meet you.
Anouchka was warm, friendly, and welcoming. The space was very clean and tidy.
We had a wonderful time! The apartment was clean, welcoming, and easy to find. We would definitely recommend it!

The apartment was amazing. My boyfriend and I were really impressed with how unique and colorful the apartment was. We felt extremely welcomed and the host provided us with a traveler's guide, along with brochures for events and places to visit while in Montreal. The apartment was conveniently located around a convenience store and supermarket. The neighborhood was lovely and very peaceful. Definitely at the top of our list and hope to visit again soon!
The host cancelled this reservation 33 days before arrival. This is an automated message.
Everything was great: cleanliness, quiet with easy access. THANK YOU!!!!

It was a pleasure staying at Anouchka's apartment! It was just as described and pictured, very conveniently located near the metro station, and affordable. We didn't get to meet Anouchka in person but she was very responsive and attentive to our needs/questions, such as confirming we had parked in the right place (and on that note, it was very easy to find free street parking!). Definitely recommend!
Colorful room and the host is well-communicated.

This was as described and was a great experience. We are frequent visitors to Montreal and were there for a wedding in Laval so needed something on the north side of the island. This was a new neighborhood for us and it was lovely, all we needed at hand, easy street parking and just minutes from the autoroute for our exit. Highly recommend this great apartment, you would be a fool to stay in a hotel!

Anouchka is very concerned with the smooth running of her guests' stay (she has written a very useful "travel guide") and very responsive to their requests.

The apartment is pleasant, bright, functional. 

In short, a pleasant stay. 

I highly recommend Anouchka's apartment.

Thank you, Anouchka, for letting me re-enter your beautiful apartment! 

The apartment was very clean, warm and welcoming. We really feel at home here! It is close to the metro and in a very pleasant neighborhood.

I hope I can come back to your place during my next trip to Montreal. Thank you again!!
Grace and Irwin were fantastic hosts! The apartment was in a super convenient location with lots of shops and restaurants nearby, yet it was quiet at night.
Very nice host, excellent place! I regard it as a home-like experience. Perfect location in downtown with a metro station nearby. I will definitely return next time I go to Montreal.

The apartment is just as it appears in the photos. My room was the smaller one, and had a twin bed. The mattress was hard, but quite comfortable, I slept very well. The rooms works for a small person, but could not accommodate two people. Everything was clean and in good shape, almost like a hotel room. The kitchen has a fridge, so you can leave your food there. It is not a room in someone's apartment, it is a room in a rental flat - something to consider. You have a lot of privacy, but don't get to interact with the hosts much. Grace and Irwin are kind and helpful, provided with everything I needed, and waited for me to arrive although it was quite late. They were quick to respond when I was there and whenever I needed anything. I used the washer and dryer - all worked perfectly.


The neighborhood is great! The metro is across the street, there is a convenience store in front of the apartment, a supermarket 5 minutes away, plenty of restaurants less than 5 minutes away. Very safe. The arts museum is less than 10 minute walk away. You can walk to a lot of places or take the metro when you are tired. Great location, very convenient.

I rented this apartment for one of my IT consultants for about three weeks with the intention of him returning a month later for another two to three-month stay and he absolutely loved the place so much that I had to rebook the same place before he even checked out to make sure he would get back the same place. He refused to stay anywhere else. Not only were the accommodations satisfactory, but Grace, the host, is a doll! She makes sure you're comfortable, warm and the apartment is always clean! Honestly, I can't think of one thing that my consultant complained about; he loved everything, he gave his stay a 10/10.

Thank you

Grace and Irwin were terrific hosts. I shared a room in an apartment, but the other tenant was quiet and worked long hours, so it worked out. The apartment was newly renovated, clean and tastefully decorated. Grace and Irwin were easy to contact, and their son helped me carry my luggage up the stairs and helped me get settled. All in all, a good downtown condo close to everything you need.
I really enjoyed staying at Grace and Irwin's place. They were wonderful hosts and made me feel at home. The area was quite lively and it was fun being in a very central location with lots to do!

The apartment was exactly as described, the location was great, and check-in was very easy. The hosts responded to requests very quickly and answered all questions promptly. A great stay; I would definitely stay here again.
Irwin and Grace were kind and helpful. The room was perfect. The location is great (everything is within walking distance of the apartment). A great choice for a trip to Montreal.

Irwin and Grace were very accommodating and helpful. The apartment was in excellent condition with a private bedroom and bathroom, much like a hotel. I felt as though I was staying in a four-star hotel in downtown Montreal without the expenses! The shared kitchen was beautiful, clean, and well-stocked, and a perfect place to prepare breakfast in the morning.

Perfect location to explore Montreal from, and exactly as described on the website.

Everything was brand new.

I will definitely check if this room is available again when I need to return to Montreal.

I really enjoyed staying with Grace and Irwin - they are very friendly and were very helpful throughout my trip. The condo is very nice - newly decorated, neat and has a great location for exploring Montreal. I'd definitely like to come back!

I briefly met Grace and Irwin. Clifton, their son, was kind enough to take my luggage to the 3rd floor where my room was. The kitchen area was nice and clean. My room was small and neat and clean. It was big enough for my short two-day stay. The 3rd floor had two separate bedrooms that allowed us to share the kitchen area. The neighborhood was a great location with restaurants, coffee shops, the arts, and the Jazz Festival. It was a great and safe location. I booked on short notice so it worked out great. Thanks, Grace & Irwin!
Melanie Guy

I had the opportunity to stay at Grace and Irwin's condo; this was my first time using Airbnb services and I was very pleased. Grace is a wonderful lady, and I spent a few minutes with her drinking tea. I wasn't feeling well with a bad cold, and she made sure I had some of her special delicious jasmine tea. Their son is a wonderful young man who also invited me for a cup of tea while Grace and Irwin were out. The place was impeccably clean and comfortable, close to the nicest areas of Montreal on Maisonneuve Road and St. Catherine Road just behind the condo, with many many restaurants nearby. Easy access to the metro and walking distance to downtown Montreal. The place is full of life surrounded by young kids from Concordia University, McGill University, and Montreal. Overall, a wonderful experience.

I arrived a little later than I thought, which was good because the room wasn't quite ready. However, the room was just as described. It was nice, small, and the en-suite bathroom was good enough for one person's stay. Comfortable! And cool after a day's excursion. Grace was very kind and her son was super helpful - taking all my questions patiently! The area was great with public transport and restaurants. Very nice place and very nice people!

Simple, pretty, almost wordless. It's really pretty. 

The only thing I could say about the room was that the amenities were a little off.  Why not toothpaste instead of mouthwash? There's a whole set of things in the bathroom but no shower gel?  It's a bit inconvenient location-wise, especially for tourists (because there are many good restaurants in the north).

I only saw the room briefly, but they lent me an umbrella when it started raining. The person was very kind and friendly. 

By the way, there were two rooms available, and the one I stayed in had a slight difference from the pictures, but it wasn't a big deal.  There is a small space for toiletries.
Grace and Irwin were very gracious guests. The room was neat, clean, and ready for my arrival. I would definitely go back! The location was also unbeatable
Very nice and clean place, and Grace and their son are so kind; they helped me handle all the issues.

I really enjoy my stay at Grace & Irwin's place. Although I never had a chance to meet them, their son Clayton explained and took care of everything for me during my stay. The place looked new, the room was clean, bathroom towels, shampoo/shower gel/toothpaste provided. The location is very convenient to subway, bus or walk to the main streets. 

Overall I enjoyed my stay. Thank you.

Grace and Irwin's condo unit was exactly as described. The pictures shown were accurate and like what other guests had pointed out, the unit was conveniently located. Shopping, sightseeing, eating, and drinking were all within walking distance. If you want to venture further, have no fear access to public transit is literally diagonally across the street. 

Do note though, there are three flights of stairs and no elevator. Luckily, their son and an older gentleman gladly helped me with my suitcase.

Comfortable room. You have total privacy and you can use everything in the kitchen. Grace & Irwin are kind and polite. The apartment is located next to the metro station and in the center of an Anglophone neighborhood. For me, it was perfect all summer.

Grace and Irwin's apartment is right next to the Guy metro station - super convenient for getting around. The apt is as described, and very clean and tidy. Grace was very kind and helpful in answering all my questions. Great place for a single person short stay!
Pleasant experience. The apartment was clean as promised. Excellent location. I recommend it!

Grace was so welcoming, as was her son who did an excellent job of helping me get oriented. The apartment is located half a block from Concordia University and the Guy-Concordia metro station. The neighborhood is lively and felt quite safe, with many restaurants, cafes, and a market nearby. The apartment is well-maintained and very clean, and I slept well in the comfortable bed. I was really glad that my room had a desk and privacy shades that also let in natural light. There's a nicely updated kitchen & dining table in the common area, which was great for saving money on breakfast. I truly felt at home during my week-long visit, and having a convenient place to stay made this a more productive trip for me. Thank you so much!
Grace and her family do a nice job. The rooms are newly renovated and everything is very clean. We plan to stay with them again.
Great place.
A wonderful experience in Montreal, the host did a good job at everything! If I come back in the future, I will choose this house again!
My stay here exceeded all expectations; everything is absolutely perfect, literally. Grace and her family are so friendly and lovely; you will never regret staying.

Thanks a lot!!!... I'm grateful for your kindness... Was a great experience with you!!!.

See you soon!!!
Lorena
Really good place, great location, very comfortable.
Great location, easy access to the subway and restaurants

Perfect place to enjoy Montreal! Very convenient to access public transportation and there are many stores and restaurants nearby.  On top of that, it's very clean and comfortable. 

Grace & Irwin are so nice.

Grace & Irwin were the most hospitable hosts I've had in all my Airbnb travels (and I've had quite a few hospitable hosts already!!). The Airbnb unit itself is meticulously cleaned and the location cannot be beat. I would recommend this place to anyone!!! As a bonus, they own the tea shop below the Airbnb, and it's a great place to get a refreshing drink or a delectable meal. (I recommend the General Tao's poutine!!!)

Great location within walking distance of central sights and very close to the metro station.  The room is good-sized, and there's access to kitchen facilities if needed. Air conditioning is a major plus for summer visits. The hosts were very helpful with recommendations for my stay.

Grace & Irwin were amazing hosts! I had to change my check-in time quite a bit on short notice, but they were very easy to communicate with and arranged a new check-in time without any problems =) 

The room is super clean, quiet, the air conditioning is very convenient and the bathroom has everything that is needed (water pressure really is quite low, as mentioned by the hosts). 

The location was excellent, I was actually able to walk everywhere, including nice restaurants, old town, Mount Royal, bus terminal etc.. I was really surprised that such a quiet room in such a nice house could be so close to all major attractions! Would definitely stay here again and can recommend it to anyone who is traveling alone and needs a safe, nice and accommodating place to stay!

Irwin and Grace were very friendly and helpful hosts. The room was comfortable, and the location is close to several restaurants and less than one kilometer from a large shopping mall. I was very satisfied and would recommend it.

Grace and her family are wonderful hosts. Although I arrived quite late, Grace was waiting for me. The condo is very comfortable and clean with easy access to the subway. I enjoyed my stay here and I highly recommend choosing Grace & Irwin!
This room is exactly as described: super clean, very new, and at an affordable price. The location was also excellent. If I am ever back in Montreal, I will know where to stay!

This is a very good place to stay. The location is terrific—the neighborhood is interesting and the apartment is just a block from the metro. The apartment is very clean and quiet, and Grace and Irwin were friendly and helpful. The bedroom is small, but it has a nice closet and a desk and chair—it was everything I needed for my stay. The kitchen was great for doing some simple cooking. I would want to stay there again if I had the opportunity to come back to Montreal.

Great room in a great location. Close to everything downtown. Perfect for tourists.

The room is convenient and clean.

Definitely recommend Grace and Irwin's place!
Grace & Irwin and their son are very friendly and welcoming, I really enjoyed living with them!

Grace and Irwin's flat was a really good choice. The place looks decent enough from the outside, even better inside. They did mention that the water pressure isn't the best, but it still worked fine - not really a big issue for me. It's really good value for money given its location. Walking distance to lots of shops, restaurants, pubs, etc... Unfortunately I didn't get to meet Grace and Irwin but their son was very helpful, even gave a quick history of Montreal and the different tourist spots. I would stay here again definitely. 5 stars

This place is very convenient to stay as it is located downtown. There are many restaurants nearby, especially Asian food. Guy-Concordia Station is right around the corner. The room is clean and has all the amenities you need. The host is the most welcoming Airbnb host I have ever had. Highly recommended.
Adequate space, clean and great location! Friendly and available hosts.

I think the room is perfectly fine for a short stay (from 1 to 5 days) given its hospitality and location. However, I would not recommend it for a long stay (at least 5 days) because no one will take care of cleaning the room (and the private bathroom).
Great location. Close to the metro station. Very clean. Good communication.

I stayed here for a week and overall had a good stay. I didn't get to talk to Irwin in person (only through messages) but I talked to Grace and their son quite a few times and both of them were so welcoming, friendly, and helpful.

The location is incredible. The apartment is located near the Concordia University Metro station, as well as a bus stop that will get you to a lot of places. The city in general is very walkable and the location really takes advantage of that - there are quite a few restaurants/cafes/grocery stores within a 15 minute walking distance, and the main downtown shopping area is close too. Vieux Montréal is just a short metro ride away.

The apartment itself is very clean and while the kitchen/dining area is small, it's well laid out and fully equipped. While I didn't use it during my stay, there is an in-unit washer/dryer. The room is a nice size, and I liked that there was a private bathroom attached. The bed was pretty hard, which didn't really bother me but is something to keep in mind. Sheets, a towel, a pillow, some hangers in the closet, toilet paper and body wash were all provided. The air con was awesome too, especially since it gets quite hot/humid in the summer.

My biggest negative staying here was the water pressure. They warned me beforehand that the building was old and therefore the water pressure could be low from time to time, but to just wait a few minutes and try again. Typically this wouldn't bother me at all, but there were two days where I couldn't take a shower because there wasn't water, even after waiting 30 or more minutes. When there was water, there was a light stream - sufficient enough to wash hands, but not much else. I hate leaving negative feedback, and maybe I just came on a bad week, but it was something that bothered me enough where I feel it's important to let other guests know. I truly hope they're able to fix the water pressure problem somehow, because apart from that everything was perfect.

Clean and tidy living environment with convenient access to supermarkets and restaurants. The only downside is that the water pressure in the shower isn't very strong, but it doesn't affect daily life.

Grace and Irwin's place was absolutely perfect—right in the heart of the city, with the metro, restaurants, and grocery stores just a stone's throw away. The apartment itself was spotlessly clean, recently refurbished, and very comfortable. Grace was helpful, friendly, and kind in her communication. Would highly recommend and would love to return on my next visit.

A perfect experience at Grace & Irwin’s place! A very cozy bedroom of enough space for two or even three adults with a spacious and very clean private bathroom inside. Everything in the room is in good condition. The WIFI connection is fast and stable. Some previous reviews mentioned that there could be some water pressure issues, but it did not bother me at all during my stay since I found I was able to take a bath every day. The shared living room has an open kitchen with a wide variety of cookers. I was told I could cook there and use anything available. Grace hosted me during my stay and she is very friendly, accommodating, and responsive. She answered my questions quickly and made check-in and check-out very smooth. The place looks very safe, with electronic code locks for each private room and two other doors to be locked from the outside of the building.  The location is also perfect! It's in downtown Montreal and very near a number of famous and top-rated restaurants. It’s within a one or two minute walk from a metro station so traffic is quite convenient as well. In short, this is a perfect place with a perfect host! I would choose this place again if I come back to Montreal next time. 
 
In summary, whether it's the hardware facilities, cleanliness, safety, location, or convenience of transportation, everything is perfect. The landlord is also very nice and responsible, and I will definitely stay here again if possible in the future.
The place is located steps away from Guy Concordia metro, which is great for getting around the city.
very nice place to stay

I chose Grace and Irwin's place in Montreal because I really liked the apartment they showed and described on the Airbnb website, as well as how close it was to the metro station and many places in downtown Montreal. However, even though being close to this service and the location I just described, I had a lot of trouble with other issues during my stay.

My main problems were the water pressure in the apartment was not good since the first week I arrived to the apartment, and this problem was never given a solution to during my whole stay there. There were several times when I got really late to several appointments at my job, had to cancel plans or reschedule my whole day because the water pressure would be so low that I couldn't take a shower without the water stopping every 2 minutes, and sometimes even for 30 minutes, making it impossible for me to take a whole shower in a short amount of time. Several times I had to write the owners to ask for a solution, since this kept being a bother to me and I only kept being told to be patient and try to understand the situation. During my stay in Montreal, this problem only kept getting worse, both in quantity (every time the amount of water coming out of the shower, bathroom and kitchen sink would be even less) and frequency (it kept happening more and more frequently, first every week, then every 3 days until it was every day) and what got me really disappointed is that I never felt this situation was handled correctly by the owners. It wasn't until my last week in the apartment that the water situation got so bad that it ran out completely and my roommate and I were left with NO water for two and a half days, that one of the owners went by and saw the problem herself. I didn't like that still, there was no solution to the problem. During these days, I had to buy several bottles and gallons of water and even subscribe to a gym in order for me to take showers and be able to use a bathroom. It was a problem that really changed the whole perception I had of the apartment as well as the owners' abilities to solve conflicts raised during the stay of a visitor. As I mentioned in one point to the owners, this kind of trouble was never described like this neither in person nor on the Airbnb website, and I think it should be mentioned before someone decides to stay in a new place.

Also, I have to mention that I did not feel comfortable being in the apartment several times because the owners of the building or part of their family would enter into the apartment and use the utensils there (e.g.: the kitchen, washer, dryer, etc.) while the guest were there. This made me feel as if I had no privacy and I was not paying for a place to be my home for those weeks, but instead felt as if it was not my apartment and I couldn't feel comfortable there.

Besides this, the apartment is really well located in Downtown Montreal and the location of the metro (1 minute walk) is a real plus for this building.

Everything was great!! All that was shown and told was accurate, and while staying in the apartment everything was even better!! I am very happy to have stayed in Le Solano and Simplissimmo team was a 10!

I had a great time at Daniel's place. Excellent location, almost in front of the subway and with tons of cafes, bars, and restaurants. The room is exactly as described and, like others have noted in reviews, the sheets and blankets are of very high quality. 

Daniel is a welcoming host and gave me excellent suggestions about what to do.

I would definitely stay there again and recommend Daniel's place for anyone.

"If I may say so, I felt very comfortable at Daniel's place. The apartment is well-kept, decorated with taste, spacious and ideally located!  

I am rather reserved in nature, but Daniel has been very kind and helpful. He is the type of person who adapts to their guests, he is open to discussion and he doesn't hesitate to take his time to give advice. 

If I return, it will be at his place that I will go and I recommend him."

This place was a rare gem and I was lucky enough to stay here for a whole week.

Daniel is truly friendly and honest, and an absolutely natural host. It was obvious he has a genuine interest in people which made him effortlessly accommodating and easy to talk to. The cats were no different, clearly they have learned a lot from him. 

The apartment was beautiful, an incredible space filled with unique décor, furniture, and art, much of which was custom made by Daniel himself. The private room no doubt matched the rest of the place, comfortable, clean, and stylish. 

The location could not be better, with transit in all directions just steps outside (including the Metro) and right in the middle of a lively and creative neighborhood.

I had a great time here and would highly recommend this place.
Daniel was an amazing host and my 4-day stay was absolutely amazing! The room was great and super clean, and he opened up his kitchen and laundry room for my use as well. Definitely recommend!

Daniel was a fantastic host who made me feel very welcome in his home. He graciously accepted my booking on short notice after another Airbnb booking fell through. I ended up feeling lucky as it is hard to imagine finding a better host.

Daniel's apartment was a lovely place to stay. The location was excellent - right in the heart of the Plateau and well connected to downtown via public transport. Nearby shops made it easy to self-cater, but there were also plenty of cafes and restaurants if you preferred not to cook. The Mile End is within walking distance, and Patisserie Au Kouign Amann (which makes the best croissants in town) is only a minute away.

Daniel has several rooms available. This one is smaller, but has a desk, something that was particularly useful for me as I was traveling primarily for work.

Daniel's apartment is absolutely beautiful and charming. It's also in the perfect location for experiencing the best of Montreal. The bedroom itself is quiet, charming, and peaceful - your own little oasis. The bed is also very comfortable, and the room is very dark at night, with no noise from the street -- so it's great for catching up on sleep.

Daniel is a lovely person and it was a joy to meet him and chat over coffee in the mornings. He goes out of his way to make you feel welcome and at home in his apartment, and has even stocked the bedroom with guidebooks to help you plan your trip. 

This was the absolute PERFECT place to stay for a beautiful, peaceful, fun and relaxing week in Montreal. I'm already dreaming about my return :)
Daniel was an excellent host. He was always available and very welcoming. His stay at his place was very pleasant! And his apartment is truly warm and inviting.

Daniel was the most delightful host. Friendly, welcoming, and a perfect balance of giving one personal space while also being there to have a nice chat. He is an excellent conversationalist, and it was really nice just to be able to chat casually with him (in French, and of course, he speaks English as well). The apartment and bedroom were spotless and just so cozy during a very cold week. I absolutely loved that my comfy room had its own adjustable thermostat. Daniel's cats are sweet and calm, and quite adorable when they peek their noses outside in the cold snow. You could literally crawl to the metro station from Daniel's place; it is phenomenally located. There's also the bus that goes to the top of the mountain that stops just in front of his place. 

Furthermore, you will sleep like an angel as Daniel's place is incredibly quiet (being two flights of stairs above the street and set back a bit as well). The kitchen was fully equipped with plenty of space for one's own food in the cupboards and fridge. 

It was one of the most relaxing weeks I've spent in a long time. 

Merci Daniel! :)

Everything was perfect.

Daniel Provençal is a very warm person
I was very well received and immediately felt at ease
The room corresponds exactly to the presentation on the website
The neighborhood is very well-placed for exploring Montreal

Daniel is a very warm and welcoming host; I really appreciated that he took the time to make coffee and sit down with me to talk about Montreal and his travels more generally.  It made me feel a lot more comfortable about staying in his impeccably maintained apartment.  It is a very clean place with two amiable cats, and is peaceful and quiet.  There were two other guests staying there at the same time as me but I didn't even see them, nor hear them!

The area feels very safe and it is extremely close to the Metro station, which is especially useful if you are visiting in freezing midwinter.  I did walk quite a lot even though it was so cold, and I can imagine that in the summer this would be a great base for exploring the city on foot too.  The apartment itself is very warm and snug and there is temperature control in the bedroom so you won't ever be cold indoors.
The place is awesome. It's clean, welcoming, and just two steps from the metro. Go for it without hesitation.

I went back to Daniel without hesitation for a second. I knew he was a friendly host and that the place would be clean and welcoming. 
And I wasn't wrong.

The experience was wonderful. Daniel is an excellent host and he keeps his home pristine. His cats are friendly and not intrusive, and the space itself has a great vibe and energy. It was a pleasurable stay while I was in the city. :)

Daniel was a wonderful host! His apartment is gorgeous, and I'm incredibly envious.  I only wish I had more time to stay there.

A++++ Would highly recommend!

This was my second stay at Daniel's apartment. Once again I had a great time. Daniel was a very welcoming host and his apartment is perfectly located for exploring all that the Plateau has to offer. His hard work on the balcony has also paid off this spring - it is a lovely spot to sit and enjoy the sunset.
Excellent location and accommodation would definitely make me return.

Super stay at Daniel's, I booked last minute and I haven't regretted my choice! Everything is as described in the listing; the apartment is well located and we are very comfortable there. Great experience.

Excellent reception from Daniel: I greatly appreciated his advice and our little chats...

Comfortable room in a nice apartment, very well located, two steps from the metro and in a dynamic neighborhood.

For my first Airbnb experience, I am delighted and would be happy to return for another stay in Montreal!

Daniel was truly an excellent, kind, and attentive host with a beautifully decorated apartment situated only steps from the subway in one of the best, liveliest neighborhoods in Montreal. I definitely enjoyed my stay there and interacting with him, and would not hesitate staying again on my next trip to Montreal.
Very gracious host. Fantastic cook as well

My stay with Daniel was wonderful. The location is perfect, the place is clean and beautiful. I have stayed with Daniel twice now and both times I felt like I was staying at a friend's house.

If you are looking for a place to stay, look no more. Daniel's place makes you feel at home away from home. My best reviews for the place and for Daniel.

Daniel was a very accommodating and gracious host! The location of his place is right by the Mont-Royal Metro, which is essential for those of us who want to explore Montreal on foot. Additionally, Mont-Royal Ave is a great street, filled with shops, bars, and cafes. The room was warm, comfortable, and perfectly sized for a single traveler. I'll definitely seek out this place the next time I stay in Montreal!

Great location, great host! Daniel was quick to communicate days before I arrived to make sure he was physically present for my arrival, which he was. During my stay, he was also very attentive to any needs I might have, by telling me the key attractions and restaurants in Montreal. His place was clean and neat.  I'll definitely stay here again on my next visit to Montreal!

I felt very lucky to start my first Airbnb experience at Daniel's. The location is superb, with the metro just steps away across the street. Daniel is my first impression of Montreal; he is always there to help and provide advice on good restaurants, easy ways to travel around, etc. I felt very welcomed home. The place is cozy, clean, clear, and quiet! I will hopefully return in June (for summer) and October (for autumn) next year. Daniel's is my first choice; hopefully, I will have the luck to book a room there then (he is so popular).

This was my second time staying at Daniel's place in Montreal. It was absolutely delightful. The room is cozy, warm and quiet, with a comfy bed and desk for convenient working with laptop (and great wifi, too!). But even more than that, Daniel is the best of hosts, always ready to chat or share a coffee over conversations. Furthermore, he even prepared a New Year's Eve dinner, as well as French Toast for New Year's Day brunch. One feels totally at home and at ease chez Daniel. I cannot recommend it more!
Daniel is absolutely amazing. He is a really welcoming host. His place is super artistic and clean. I would recommend his place to anyone who is considering it.

Daniel was an excellent host! He was welcoming, informative, and extremely nice. The apartment is in the best location, just a 3-minute walk from the metro station in a really cool neighborhood with lots of cafes and restaurants. The room was clean, quiet, had a comfortable bed, and there was enough space for luggage and your belongings; there's even a closet and a desk. I loved the place and the cats, and I will definitely Airbnb with Daniel again if I ever return to Montreal and the place is free!

Daniel was very kind, accommodating, and knowledgeable about Montreal. His home was spotless, and located in a great neighborhood near many restaurants and just across the street from the Metro station - very convenient! Daniel had great recommendations for places to grab a bite to eat in the neighborhood and also helpful suggestions about visiting Montreal in general. He kindly made coffee each morning, and offered an extra blanket because the temperatures were so low outside. I look forward to visiting Montreal in the summer and will definitely stay with Daniel again!

This is my second time! 
Same as the first time, I enjoyed staying at Daniel; he made me feel at home. 

He welcomed me with homemade cake (delicious). 

I enjoyed my stay.

Thank you for everything

I really enjoy staying at Daniel's place. He was very easy to reach before my arrival and answered all of my questions. He was very welcoming and friendly during my short stay in Montreal. The place is very neat and looks exactly as listed: very artistic! I love it! The area is safe and perfectly located; it's just a few steps away from the subway and has tons of nice cafes, restaurants, bookstores, etc. If I go to Montreal again, I would definitely like to stay at his place again. Thanks Daniel for being so kind!
Location is great. It's close to the Mont-Royal subway station and is about a 20-minute walk to downtown. The place is great, clean, and truly beautiful. Daniel is a great host. Thanks!

I absolutely loved my stay at Daniel's - so much so that I am coming back again for the end of my trip. It was so comfortable and the room at the back was so quiet. Slept very well. 

Daniel himself is so fabulous, kind, and helpful. He had all sorts of great suggestions and the morning coffee and chats were lovely. See you soon!

Daniel was a wonderful host. The place was beautiful and the bed was very comfortable for sleeping. It was also conveniently located within walking distance of shops, restaurants, cafes, parks, etc. So lovely!
Daniel is a fantastic host. This is my third stay with him, and I could use more reasons to visit Montreal so I can come back again! The location is great, and the apartment is lovely.

Daniel is a very considerate and helpful host. I really enjoyed my stay in his beautiful apartment. The entire place has a calming and cheerful atmosphere. 

Daniel is very thoughtful and interesting to talk to. There are two very adorable cats and my single room is very comfortable and quiet. I strongly recommend this listing.

Best wishes, Daniel. Thank you!
Daniel was very welcoming. The place was exactly as described. The bed was very comfortable, and the place was charming. Highly recommended.

Daniel was very friendly and gave me tons of information about the city. There were two other guys in the other two bedrooms and they were awesome people too. The apartment was absolutely true to the photos shown and most importantly, it was very clean. There is a bar just three stores down the same block, and my room faces the back alley, so it might be a bit noisy over the weekend though. 

The apartment is very conveniently located (close to the metro, and two stops from the central metro station). I was attending a conference at UQAM and Concordia, so that was perfect.

I want to thank Daniel for making me feel really welcome, especially since this is my first time using Airbnb. I definitely hope to visit the city again.

I had a wonderful stay in Montreal at Daniel's place! He is an outstanding host and works very hard to make sure his guests enjoy their stay. He is very knowledgeable about the city and has great ideas for places to go and things to do. He has many guidebooks and maps he will go through with you, he gave me some great information on Parc Mont Royal as well as some neighborhood walks. Plus, he makes great coffee and is an excellent chef! 

The apartment is very cozy and well-equipped. This bedroom is perfect for solo travelers or students, and is an outstanding value. Be aware that it is not large - however it is very comfortable, there is a closet for clothes, and a desk to read or work. With the desk and wifi I was able to get some work done to meet a deadline while I was gone. 

The neighborhood and location are both great. There are shops, restaurants, and a good market all close by. The metro is very close, and Saint-Laurent street and Mont Royal Park are all just a walk away. I stayed in June for the F1 Grand Prix, and the Plateau neighborhood was a nice change from the normal race crowd and activities. I felt that there were few to no tourists around, so I felt like I was living like a local, which I enjoyed. 

Comfortable and fun apartment, wonderful host, and a great location. I hope to stay here again!

Hello Gabrielle,

I just spent 10 days at Daniel's place in his very nice apartment in the Mount Royal neighborhood. The apartment is right next to the metro, and it takes about 20 minutes to walk to the city center by going down St Denis street.  For me, I loved all the nearby bookstores. I found six within a 15-minute radius around the apartment. It was my first Airbnb experience and I am delighted. Daniel welcomed me very warmly and made me feel at ease. He showed me the neighborhood, gave me his Montrealer experience. He is available, proactive and discreet at the same time. I occupied the room at the end of the apartment and had everything I needed with plenty of decorative details that make you feel like home. A Japanese person was occupying another room, and it went very well, especially thanks to Daniel's ability to reconcile everyone's expectations. I encourage you to take advantage of this great opportunity. Thank you Daniel

Daniel very warmly welcomed me in his lovely apartment located in a vibrant neighborhood, just two steps from the metro station. 
I highly recommend this place!

You have good knowledge of the city. He suggested things to do based on my stay duration. He and his family all live nearby. He is very friendly. The apartment is very clean and well decorated. It's very close to Mont-Royal metro station with restaurants, shops, and pubs around. There are cafes open 24 hours. If you have a bike, please bring it as this is a biking city. Thanks for having me at your place, Daniel.

Daniel's place was as it looks in the pictures -- a nice, clean, grown-up apartment with charm and impeccable style. And he actually lives there too. :)

Great location near the metro, great neighborhood to walk around. I hope to stay here again next time I'm in town!
My accommodation is perfect for discovering the Plateau neighborhood. Daniel will give you good advice on experiencing Montreal life.

Spacious flat in fantastic part of Montreal. The room was located towards the back, which was quiet and had a nice desk ideal if you wanted to do work. Daniel is an easygoing guy and was very knowledgeable about the city. Would definitely recommend this space for business or solo travelers. Cheers!

Daniel has an absolutely delightful place. I cannot recommend it more highly. Wonderful location, yet also very quiet. Daniel himself is a great conversationalist and is always ready to offer you ideas of things to do. This is the place you must stay in if you want a great Montreal experience!
