Wonderful location, excellent room stocked with essentials and more

Well-equipped housing, everything matched the photos and descriptions of the listing...

 Lively neighborhood and very well located...
The apartment looks exactly as pictured and is perfect for a short-term stay in the Plateau. It's very clean and stocked with almost everything.

Great spot, close to Parc Mont Royal and lots of great small shops and places to eat; an easy walk to the subway. The apartment is clean and has everything you need. The pull-out sofa is not very comfortable, so I wouldn't recommend this apartment for four adults. It was fine for a family with young kids - i.e., us. It would be great for a couple. Overall we really enjoyed our stay, and even though there was a mix-up with bedding, they were responsive and did their best to sort it out quickly.

A perfectly adequate place to stay in every possible way. The apartment is quite spartan and needs repairs, but it's comparable to Plateau apartments overall. I was very satisfied with the value for money.

Overall, we had a good stay. The location is great and the neighborhood is charming.  The apartment gets a lot of sun however, which woke us up too early. I've suggested that better blinds be put up.  But the other aspects of the apartment were good. Quiet, clean and pleasant.

Booked this place at the last minute and almost everything was great. As mentioned before, something should be done about the blinds. Otherwise, the place was super clean. We had everything we needed in the kitchen and the bathroom. Very easy to communicate with them and very responsive. It was especially hot days when we stayed in Montreal and the A/C being a bit noisy, we asked if they could provide us with a fan and they actually brought two on the same day. That was very much appreciated! I would definitely stay in other flats managed by Sonder.

The place was bright, beautiful, and clean and included everything as advertised. The only problem was that there was no power in the entire unit except for the kitchen, so we didn't have air conditioning for the first night. After contacting them and waiting half a day for a reply, we were finally able to get power back by switching the breaker back on. Other than that, it was a perfect place to stay for a few days.

Joanna was amazing, she responded immediately and the apartment we stayed at was beautiful. The apartment is located in a very nice area and we really appreciated the guidebook Joanna left for us as well! Joanna was great and we would definitely book a place through her again in a heartbeat!

Frederique is by far the nicest, most decent, and hospitable person I've dealt with since I can remember. There are no surprises when you rent from these awesome people; you get what you were promised, if not more. The flat was super clean, with a comfortable bed and top-notch washing machine, dryer, and kitchen equipment. The area is friendly and quiet with nice neighbors. 

Frederique responded to my questions instantly, and cooperated regarding any special requests I had. 

Those people care about Montreal and their guests passionately, so you will also get a guest book with all the information you need about the area you're staying in as well as the best things to do in Montreal. 

Dealing with people of this standard and kindness is heartwarming. I'm glad you guys exist.

My stay with Robert at the apartment hosted by Joanna and Frederique was simply amazing. It had all the amenities we needed to make our trip even more enjoyable. We utilized the kitchen often to cook our meals and enjoyed them on the balcony along with the nice weather and serenity of the neighborhood. The wifi was a little slow during the first few days but manageable. Frederique was a wonderful host and consistently checked up with us, responding very quickly to any questions or concerns. There is a very useful packet that came with the place, which provided information on the apartment and many recommendations for anything you could possibly think of—food, shopping, entertainment, etc. The metro was very close to the apartment and the location allowed us to travel very easily to the downtown area of Montreal. Overall, the experience was very satisfying and I certainly recommend anyone traveling to Montreal to stay at this spot! Thanks again, Frederique!

Hello,

The apartment we rented on Rue de Verdun is faithful to the photos posted on Airbnb. It's nice and well-equipped in terms of appliances and other amenities. It's not too far from the main road. 

We have a reservation about the quality of the mattress which is too hard and the noise level coming from the (website hidden by Airbnb) room located facing the street, as we can hear all the traffic noises clearly.  It's a shame but considering the apartment's configuration, it can only be placed facing the street. If the bedroom had been able to be placed on the interior side, it would have been great. 

Perhaps some soundproofing could be improved, but apparently this is a reservation I make for most apartments in Montreal, except for modern ones.

Otherwise, I recommend it apart from these reservations.

Charming apartment, ideally located near a metro station, easy parking. 

We unfortunately did not meet Joanna but we had excellent written communication and availability, all the practical information about the neighborhood and tips for exploring the city were available upon our arrival.

The apartment was very clean upon arrival and the way it does in pictures. The hosts were very helpful and I called them several times to ask questions about a few things, and they were nice and very kind. The guest book provided is very handy and I used it during our stay.

The washer/dryer are super. 
The kitchen is very clean and well-equipped. 
The bathroom is very decent. 
The bed size is okay; personally, I would prefer a bigger bed.
The TV, internet, and AC are all excellent additions. 
The only issue I had was the stairs to the building, and then up to the apartment. I have a knee injury, so you can imagine.

Overall, this place is worth it and it's close to literally everything. You just have to walk a maximum of 10 minutes to be near anything from metro stations...restaurants...markets...pharmacies...grocery stores...etc...
I highly recommend this apartment if you want to have a good time in Montreal!

I had three amazing weeks at Jad's. It was an absolutely pleasant experience. His place is super clean, organized and comfortable with all the comfort you can imagine. 

Great location, close to the metro and train station. 

He's a generous host with a friendly attitude, always ready to help.

Highly recommended! Would love to go back to visit.

The experience in Jad's apartment was absolutely extraordinary. Very luxurious and complete, located in the city center near everything, I highly recommend it for those who love urban living in a hotel-style apartment.

True to description - perfect "hotel-like" experience. Spent a weekend at Jad's with my girlfriend in what essentially is a hotel room suite. The room was well equipped with everything we needed and most importantly it was very clean. We also made use of the heated pool which was great. 

Location wise, it's perfect. Connected to the Metro and underground walking path. Also, it's easy enough to walk to the Old Port and some of the other points of interest in the city center.

Jad was honestly the BEST host you can ever imagine, he was there at the door with a croissant (like actually!). I couldn't have found a better host, suite, or location. The building was 5 minutes from the bus station and within 10 minutes of walking distance from everything! The room is exactly as in the description with some extra fun things Jad has put in the room (we got a lava lamp and a foot massage, haha). It was my first time using Airbnb and honestly, Jad and this location have set the standard. It was perfect.

My boyfriend and I had a great time at Jad's place. The building has all the amenities you could ask for and is within walking distance to everything. Jad was quick to respond to any questions we had and went out of his way to provide us with some of his favorite snacks. Would definitely stay at his place again in the future.

Jad was an awesome host. He met up with me even though my train arrived late and it was really easy to get in touch with him! He had all the necessities at his place in case you forgot something.  

The location is fantastic (right beside the train station). The view is great. 

This experience exceeded my expectations. I would definitely recommend him for anyone staying in Montreal.
Jad was a wonderful host and his apartment is fantastic! We loved the foot massager, haha. Jad gave us a nice tour when we checked in and was very helpful throughout.

Jad's place was amazing! Great view, and so close to everything. We had a blast!
Jad met up with us to give us a quick tour of all that his space has to offer... Which is a lot! He was very helpful and answered all our questions. Would definitely recommend his place. Thanks again, Jad!!! We'll be back! :)

Jad is a fantastic host! He was very welcoming, showed us around the building and gave us a brief tour of Montreal. I don't live far from Montreal so I was already familiar with the streets. The apartment was SO clean and it had everything we needed. The view was amazing too, the windows faced Downtown Montreal and was even better when lit up at night. HIGHLY recommend this place to anyone! Although, it is a shared kitchen as it's a residence but that didn't bother me at all. Oh, and, the king-sized bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on. All in all, I would recommend Jad's place to anyone!
Jad is very organized and a great hotel, we enjoyed the gym, pool, and even laundry! The bed is very comfortable. The location is excellent for visiting Montreal.
Translation: I really enjoyed my very clean stay with a beautiful view. This is a very safe place that I highly recommend to you. Thank you

Jad went above and beyond to make my experience exceptional.

The location of the unit is perfect for walking and exploring Old Montreal.

Jad is first-class!

The place was great and the description was very accurate. It was right in the middle of downtown, near trains and shopping areas. And Jad did a great job on checking in with me to see if everything was okay. Thanks Jad!

Jad's room was really lovely and exactly as pictured. It is centrally located. I could walk to the University and the old city, shopping, and great restaurants. The building has excellent services - gym, pool, library/business center, and the staff are very friendly. We enjoyed our stay very much.

Great location
Great apartment 
Clean & tidy
Great view

I really loved my first Airbnb experience and I really liked Jab's accommodation, which deserves a 4-star hotel! It was well-furnished, functional, and thoughtfully designed. The basic products were complete and close to the city center and all the conveniences of the city.  Definitely worth rebooking without hesitation.

Everything went smoothly. Great location, just a few minutes' walk from downtown and Old Montreal. What a great weekend! Jad was very communicative and always responded promptly. Will definitely stay again.
Excellent stay! Spacious and bright room. Everything is at your disposal in the establishment and the service is top-notch! Thank you, Jad!

Our stay at the Luxurious Hôtel Experience was truly delightful. This hotel offers very beautiful amenities that allow you to make your stay even more enjoyable from the moment you arrive. Jad's room is exceptionally comfortable with a breathtaking view of Montreal... Thank you, Jad, for this pleasant stay.
The host cancelled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated message.

Unfortunately, we didn't get to meet the host personally but everything went extremely well. We received two room cards and one laundry card, and have access to all the facilities including the communal kitchen. The room was fantastic and high-class, and the host was very considerate -- we have everything in the room that we can possibly think of! Great location and neighborhood, close to McGill University and shopping centers. The only con is residents need to beware of potential drunk students in the building and keep your door closed at all times. Overall wonderful experience. Thank you so much Jad!
Well-furnished, comfortable, located in the city center or near Old Montreal, ideal location.
The host cancelled this reservation 8 days before arrival. This is an automated message.
The host cancelled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated message.

We couldn't be more grateful to Geneviève and Yanick. The apartment was more beautiful than the pictures led on and these hosts were even more kind and easy to work with than we could have hoped for. Total sweethearts... thanks again for everything!

We had an amazing stay at this home! It is so much bigger and lovelier than the pictures even convey. The neighborhood is fantastic too.  It's a bit north of the trendy neighborhoods of Mile End and Plateau, but we were so happy we ended up staying here.  It has tree-lined streets with a wonderful village feel.  It also seems to be a destination restaurant neighborhood and we ate really well. I highly recommend both Jean Talon market and the Indonesian tapas bar.  The home itself is airy and spacious with a wonderful back deck. It's particularly good for families.  Coming back after a day out biking and exploring felt like coming home - only much nicer.  Genevieve and Yanick were out of town when we were there but communication was quick and easy and their neighbor Dan was enormously helpful in letting us in and providing advice.  Would definitely stay again if possible.

We spent a wonderful week in Geneviève & Yanick's charming home with its lovely back garden terrace. The apartment is very large and well organized for family life (we were two parents with three teens), and possessed all necessary amenities for visitors. The beds are comfortable, the two bathrooms are recently renovated, the kitchen is great to cook in, everything was clean and organized for our arrival, no problems with the wifi or tv.  And the cat is friendly. Our questions were quickly answered. 

The neighborhood is fantastic, very family-oriented, close to two metro lines, several bus lines, a fantastic bakery, Jean-Talon market, great restaurants, Dumoulin bike shop, Bixi bikes...you can walk everywhere you need to go!

We highly recommend this home for families traveling.

Genevieve and Yanick's place was in a very good location! The house is located in a very nice neighborhood. It is also very pleasant to live in. Everything was ready for us to have a great weekend! I highly recommend it!
We had a great stay at Genevieve and Yanick's home. The community was beautiful and the home was more than we expected!

I immediately felt at home! Félix is a wonderful host! I felt like a friend visiting. The room was beautiful, clean and comfortable and I slept very well. The adorable cats, and the decor really magnificent! The neighborhood is among the most beautiful in Montreal... I found everything I was looking for, and that on foot! I really enjoyed my experience and I would definitely stay in this room anytime!

Very pleasant stay, the room made available to me was entirely in accordance with its description: comfortable, well-furnished and functional. The apartment itself is also very nice and well located at the gates of Little Italy. Finally, a special mention for the particularly friendly, dynamic and involved hosts who helped me discover a delicious Vietnamese restaurant!

Felix has a lovely place minutes walk from Jean Talon market and great restaurants, cafes, and shops.

The room itself was clean and cozy, and though we didn't see too much of Felix and her boyfriend, they were very friendly and made us feel very welcome and comfortable.
This is a cozy and warm place to stay with the most welcoming people you'll meet. It made my stay in Montreal an amazing experience.

We greatly appreciated Félix and his companion's warm and funny side. Upon returning home, we found ourselves in an atypical and colorful universe: the decor is original and vintage. It's a real cabinet of curiosities! You will certainly be welcomed by Choucroute and Moussaka who are the stars of the house ;-)

My stay with Felix was a disappointment. I booked with her because she and her boyfriend appeared to be friendly and provide a comfortable living space, but my experience was the opposite. Felix's communication skills as a host were not where I believe they should be. I didn't receive any messages until I contacted her, wasn't informed that she would be away from the apartment until a few hours before my arrival, and received poor instructions regarding the location of the spare key (which led to a drawn-out process entering the apartment upon arrival). When I later asked for her recommendations on places to visit in the city, she made no attempt to offer suggestions, instead directing me to look at a guidebook. 

The apartment lacked comfort and cleanliness. The room itself was fine, but the mattress was very hard. The room is adjacent to the kitchen where most of the social activity happens. Additionally, the walls are thin, which meant that I could clearly hear the neighbor's crying infant baby at various points during my stay. The kitchen sink was stacked high with dirty dishes for most of my stay and clothes were placed on the bathroom floor for extended periods of time. The hosts smoke cigarettes and the smell (which I am sensitive to) entered into the kitchen and my bedroom. 

Overall, I felt unwelcome in Felix and her boyfriend's home. I booked on short notice, but if my stay was too much of a burden, I would have preferred that she not accept my request as there were several other great options in the area. 

On the positive side, the apartment has interesting vintage decor throughout and is well situated in the city. The cats are really sweet.

I had an unforgettable stay at Felix's place! Felix and his partner are exceptional people who were able to listen to my requests. Communication was truly excellent, right from the reservation ;) They gave me the best tips for enjoying the neighborhood and the city. 

On the room side, if you're looking for something quiet with original decor, you can't do better. It's a real curiosity cabinet, the apartment is full of vintage objects!

It's worth noting that the apartment is just a few minutes from the metro and all the buses you might need. The neighborhood is teeming with restaurants and bars, and there's a real neighborhood vibe! 

The cleanliness, hospitality, warm and original feel of the room... For me it's a 100%, I highly recommend to everyone Felix and his little haven of peace; )

Our stay with Felix and Yvan was once again a wonderful experience! We knew that returning would not disappoint us. Felix is still such good advice. 

Beaubien remains the neighborhood we prefer! It's truly close to everything. In short, a good base in Montreal!

Our stay with Félix was fabulous. She was easy to communicate with, check-in was a breeze, we were greeted by an open door and extremely welcoming flat! Her and her boyfriend were as nice as can be and I would absolutely stay here again! I can't recommend them enough!

I had an excellent stay at Felix's lovely apartment! Felix and her boyfriend Yvan were extremely kind and welcoming hosts. Felix was quick to respond to my last-minute request and made my arrival very easy.  

The room was very comfortable, and I felt right at home. Felix's apartment is filled with plants and cool vintage knick-knacks. The location is perfect - a charming block in Little Italy near many great bars, cafes, parks, restaurants, and easy walking distance to Mile End and Jean Talon Market. I enjoyed spending hours strolling around the neighborhood during my visit, and found it easy to get downtown and to other parts of Montreal via the nearby metro. It was great to come home after a long day of exploring the city to a glass of wine with Felix and Yvan on their balcony. I had the best time staying here in Montreal!
Lovely home and hosts. Quintessential Montreal artist home, welcoming with very comfortable bed and excellent location. Our first choice in the city.

Felix and Ivan are lovely hosts who were very friendly and helpful. Their place is spacious and clean and artsy. You get the privacy you want if you want it, but two lovely friends are always available to give you suggestions about where to visit and things to do. Location is in Little Italy, a really nice area with lots of cute restaurants and bars nearby. I really enjoyed staying there and would definitely recommend it to others!

The hosts made my guest and I feel very much at home. Both Felix and Ivan were helpful in making recommendations and urged us to contact them with any problems or concerns. Their artfully decorated space added a comforting aspect to our stay. The location is conveniently located minutes away from a metro station, which made it easy for us to travel. Best of all were the cats, Choupette and Moussaka :)

Everything about the trip was perfect! Felix and Ivan were very helpful and answered all of the questions I asked. Even if you don't know anything about the city, the hosts will guide you in the right direction. Their place has a warm and artistic feel to it which is very inviting. The location is fantastic as it is in a "quiet" part of town, but still has many restaurants and bars nearby. Even if you don't know anything about the city, the hosts will guide you in the right direction. Felix and Ivan made my first Airbnb experience fantastic and I am sure others will also be impressed.

Felix and Ivan were amazing hosts, very helpful and friendly, and not only did they make me feel completely at home, the room was light, comfortable, and very clean. Their two cats were very lovable and friendly. The bed was incredibly comfortable, especially the super soft sheets! 

They had an amazing coffee machine, and everything in the apartment was perfectly clean.

They are located in a vibrant and young residential area with a good variety of restaurants and stores. 

I had a great time staying here and getting to know Felix and Ivan (to the extent that I have stayed twice!), and would strongly recommend their apartment as the one you should stay in in Montreal!

A+++ Felix & Yvan are amazing! Their place is beautiful, clean and full of character. The house is in a lovely neighborhood, cafes and restaurants are an easy walk, as is Mount Royal. I would highly recommend staying here!
This place is great and the location is perfect. Very close to the metro, local merchants, and Jean Talon Market. The hosts are very kind. I strongly recommend this place.

Very friendly welcome by Felix and Yvan, we enjoyed our room and also being able to take advantage of all the amenities of the apartment. Very good starting point in a typical Montreal neighborhood. Recommended.
Magnificent apartment where it's good to live and where you feel like home thanks to Felix and Yvan who are two adorable hosts.
Such a charming place, it had a very relaxed, chill vibe. Felix was an excellent host, and even though the location changed, it was still in a great spot. I would definitely recommend it!

I had a fantastic stay. Felix and her partner were wonderfully welcoming hosts. The room was spacious and the desk was a nice bonus since I was coming into town for work. The apartment is only a few minutes away from the nearest Metro stop, making it really easy to get around. There were also tons of cool restaurants, cafes, and grocery stores in the area.

On couldn't have dreamed of better days than the last few with Felix and Ivan. Warmth, friendship, simplicity and intensity of exchanges, what superlative could we find? And for those lucky enough like us, you'll get the chance to sleep with Maria Carey. In short, at Félix & Ivan, a must-visit in Montreal's good vibes!

I am very happy with my stay at Félix and Ivan's place. Their accommodation is very well-located, the welcome is very warm and their insightful advice helped me find solutions to all my questions :)

The listing is totally in line with the accommodation, the room and bed are very comfortable and the accommodation is a short walk from the metro.

I hope I have the opportunity to cross paths with you on another trip. 

If you want to experience a beautiful Montreal experience, book it without hesitation!

Great location on a quiet street in a nice neighborhood. Two blocks from the subway and buses. Necessary amenities are nearby. Felix & Ivan were very hospitable and accommodating. Speaking of accommodating, they speak English - this is Montreal where many people do not speak English. (Perhaps I should learn a little French!)

Really awesome stay! Located in a lovely quiet neighborhood with access to the metro and small restaurants. One of the cats is especially friendly and loves attention :) Sweet hosts too! Would highly recommend!

A magnificent interior, full of charm and good cheer, located 5 minutes from the metro and situated in a peaceful and vibrant Montreal neighborhood.  Hosts who are always attentive and smiling, putting you at ease and justifying the experience themselves. Not to mention two adorable cats. Top. See you soon!

I recommend Felix and his spouse's accommodation. They welcomed my father who was visiting me in Montreal, and he really enjoyed his stay with them. The metro is a few minutes walk away and the apartment is located in a very nice neighborhood. Best of luck!

Translation:  "Wonderful stay at Félix's place, the room is perfect and very cute, great neighborhood, easy to access and just two steps away from some good restaurants and bars! Very warm welcome, and they were always available if I had any questions. Overall, it was a really nice experience, thank you again for a wonderful weekend!"
Super stay! Nothing to complain about. Perfect apartment and hosts! No headaches at all, really great!

Thank you, Félix and Ivan, for your hospitality, availability, and generosity, among other things. The stylish apartment is very well located, the bedroom is the most comfortable, and the terrace/garden is adorned with beautiful plants and other aromatic herbs. I had a wonderful stay. Thank you

Felix and Ivan's super welcoming home along with their two cats :) very well located. The room is excellent. Very available, I was able to share a pleasant evening with them. I am delighted with my stay, I recommend it.
Great location near two subway stations. Very unique building character and fit-out. The cats are very friendly.

Very welcoming people. They helped us with directions and finding restaurants nearby, and didn't mind when we came and went. The sheets were clean and there was soap and towels readily available for us. I am grateful I chose to stay at their place of residence.
Very nice apartment in a great location and especially the hosts are adorable and super cool to chat with, highly recommended!

Genevieve's apartment is very pleasant, well-located, equipped, and peaceful. We were unable to meet Genevieve, but her friend Leonardo, very friendly, was able to meet our expectations and ensure that our stay went as smoothly as possible.

Excellent experience with no complaints. Genevieve is a lovely host - she was constantly in contact with helpful information and checking in to ensure no issues. Logistics were easy, and Genevieve herself was very helpful and friendly (plus fluent bilingual). The apartment is very conveniently located, an easy walk to the metro as well as lots of great spots in Mile End. It was very clean, and an excellent value.

Hello

The accommodation corresponds well to the description on the website. Very clean, cozy ambiance and quiet. Close to major arteries, near metro stations and green spaces. Ideal for enjoying the big city! I highly recommend it to everyone! 

Geneviève is very welcoming and discreet.

Fantastic spot in a great neighborhood. Clean, comfortable, and Genevieve created a welcoming experience. Walkable, bike rentals nearby, and the metro is also close by. Chez Claudette! Super charming!

The apartment is indeed charming, very well located and well equipped. All of us had a great time spending time in the house in the different nooks and admiring the decor and walking around the neighborhood. Our dog loved the Laurier park and we enjoyed that we could walk to most places in the city or hop on the nearby metro when we got tired. It was a pleasure meeting Marius and visiting your bar too!

Great communication from Mina ahead of our arrival, making sure we had everything we needed. Everything was all set for us when we arrived. The apartment is very warm and welcoming; nicely laid out and has a very homey feeling. Bedrooms and living room are very comfortable and the kitchen is well equipped.

The neighborhood is quiet and friendly. There's no real noise at night (we slept with the windows open). Great cafes, restaurants, parks, and groceries within a 5-minute walk. The subway is an easy 10-15 minute walk with easy access to downtown.

Overall, this is a great apartment in a great location, and the hosts are very welcoming. Highly recommended!
We have really enjoyed staying in this apartment, which is clean and very functional.  A great location on the plateau. We would definitely consider this apartment for our next visit to Montreal.

Mina maintained excellent communication before, during, and after our trip. Check-in was easy and the apartment is very nicely decorated with everything you would need during your stay. Beautiful and quiet neighborhood with a Starbucks and supermarket on the corner which was very useful. Plus a bunch of great bistros, breakfast nooks, and restaurants steps away. You can't beat it. I highly recommend this flat to anyone visiting Montreal. Thanks for hosting us. We hope to return soon from NYC.

Excellent stay in Montreal at Mina's apartment, very functional and beautiful, as described. We were able to make machines, which was very helpful. We did not meet Mina as she was on vacation, but everything was prepared. The Plateau neighborhood is great. Recommend it.

Renting this apartment was great - Mina was quick to respond, communication was smooth and the apartment is in a wonderful location with great amenities, a fantastic neighborhood atmosphere and close to a subway station. The apartment has everything you could need - a well-stocked and appointed kitchen, Wi-Fi and air conditioning in a Montreal heatwave!

What a beautiful apartment in such a lovely neighborhood! We really felt like we were at home! Mina was so attentive, even though far from Quebec, and very accommodating to our last-minute changes. Thank you so much to her! We hope to come back very soon!

Though the host was not present when we arrived, she ensured all the details were taken care of to make us feel very welcome. The neighborhood was pleasant and close to all necessities. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend Mina's home to others.

Mina's apartment was a perfect place to stay! Very spacious and even though there were 6 of us, we didn't feel crowded at any time. There was even room to put an extra air bed in the living room. Grocery and SAQ are right around the corner, as well as some of the best ice cream in Montreal! (Bo-Bec). It was nice to relax in Laurier Park after having brunch at nearby Le Toasteur Laurier. Don't forget to walk over to St Denis or St Laurent or down to Mont Royal to check out the shops and restaurants!

As for the apartment itself, it was very clean, the beds were comfy, there were plenty of linens, the shower was amazing, the kitchen was GORGEOUS, and it was handy having the toilet in a separate room from the shower. Both the living room and main bedroom have ample air conditioning - it was quite warm in other parts, but that is expected in a heatwave, I suppose.  Although we did not get to meet Mina, she was available over text and answered the few questions we had, as well as offered her son's contact info (although everything was so organized and straight forward that we didn't need any help!) One thing of note is that the steps are very steep getting in and out of the apartment - possibly not suitable for older people.

I hope to stay here again when I return to Montreal next year. It was nice getting to know a different part of the plateau. Thanks Mina for everything!

We never met our host but communication was excellent and we were very pleased with the accommodation. The location was awesome, great neighborhood and if visiting in summer there is an outdoor pool nearby that's great to hang out with friends and family! 

The apartment is super spacious in a typical Montreal style home with ample facilities to cook, relax and freshen up. 

That's so much for a great stay!!

Mina's apartment was wonderful. It was very clean and the posted pictures are accurate. Communication with Mina before, during and after our stay was great. The location of the apartment was perfect, it was close to transit to get to major attractions, but it was very awesome to stay in a less touristy area to be submerged in the local culture. The neighborhood is wonderful with plenty of restaurants and shops within walking distance. We did not rent a car while we were there and had no issues getting around. I highly recommend this apartment for your stay in Montreal.

I stayed with Maureen for a month in June/July 2010. She made sure I had directions to get in, took me to the grocery store to make sure I knew where it was, and was generally a friendly, happy host. One thing not mentioned in the listing is that this is a triplex - Maureen lives on the first floor, I stayed in one of the four bedrooms on the third floor, and she was remodeling the second floor to create four more bedrooms. Guests have great privacy if they want it.

I need to mention that there were ants in the kitchen - Maureen knows and is working to eradicate them, but anyone who's really bothered by bugs might be put off.

I had a great time here. The place was just as described, the neighborhood was calm and safe, and Montreal was lovely. Thanks for having me.

I stayed with Maureen for a week at the end of July 2011 and couldn't have had a more pleasant time. Maureen was a gracious host who went above and beyond to ensure that I had a wonderful stay. Thanks for all you did to welcome me to the beautiful city of Montreal! :)

If you are looking for a serene and peaceful place devoid of city noise and commotion, then Maureen Place is the best place. If you want to do research and avoid prying eyes, then Maureen Place is the best choice. It's not like a conventional hotel where you can be disturbed by the housekeeper; you have everything to yourself. I would always choose Maureen Place whenever I come to Montreal.
Excellent. Highly recommend it.

I stayed at Maureen's for one week. The area is really quiet compared to the center of town. Nice place to have a rest after a long day of walking. Maureen was really nice to me, she even drove me to the supermarket as I arrived late and had nothing to eat. I recommend this place and this host.

It was an excellent place to stay, very clean, quiet, comfortable, and spacious. It is very near the subway and just one hour walking downtown. 

Maureen is a very nice hostess, she is always available if you need something. I really recommend this place. I spent 25 nights there and I didn't have any problems.

I had a great stay at Charming Mtl Homestay Accommodation. Maureen was very welcoming, friendly, and helpful.  A quiet, calm, and relaxed atmosphere and an interesting neighborhood, with Rue Sherbrooke nearby.
I really dislike reviews, and hate being badgered to write one. My stay was fine and had no problems, got what I paid for and moved on.

Maureen was a very friendly host who met me upon arrival. The room itself, bathroom, and common area (there were four bedrooms in total) were all very clean and quite pleasant, if somewhat plain. The kitchen (which I did not need to use) could have used a bit of cleaning. 

The neighborhood is nice; very quiet and close to buses, the metro, and great strips of activity on Sherbrooke (a 5-minute walk) and Monkland (a 15-minute walk). Available street parking is a nice bonus for those who drive.

If you're looking for a clean, quiet, and simple place to sleep that's relatively close to downtown, this is a good spot. Perhaps not for those who prefer a more chic B&B environment.

Our stay was fine. Guests should know that it's very basic: bring your own soap, paper towels, and extra toilet paper. If you plan to use the kitchen, bring a sharp knife, a fresh sponge, and some pots with handles.

Maureen was a very kind host. On the first day of my arrival, she even took me grocery shopping and showed me where I could do my shopping. The place is nice overall, and the bed is big. 

The shared kitchen is large, however, counter space is limited. The knife is a bit dull as well, but overall it was fine; there are pots, pans, plates, utensils, and even wine glasses at your disposal.

Maureen is a wonderful host! I stayed in her apartment for 2 months and had a great time! 
The apartment truly exceeded my expectations: spacious room, fully equipped kitchen and bathroom in a quiet, safe and very centrally located area in Montreal. 
Maureen was always friendly and kind and I enjoyed our occasional little chats on her doorway. 
She was always reachable and whenever there was a problem, she immediately took care of it.

Definitely my best Airbnb experience so far! I can only recommend staying with Maureen!
Staying at Maureen's was wonderful.

This is an entirely separate three-bedroom penthouse. We had four guys stay here for a long weekend and were very comfortable. The back balcony is great for hanging out, and it's very quiet at night for sleeping.

Thanks for a very comfortable stay. Parking was very easy & everything was what we expected. I liked how all windows slightly opened gave such a nice, cool & fresh air thru the entire home day & night. 

We would love to stay at your place again next time we visit Montreal.
Translation:  "It's a nice place and we are very well received. I am satisfied with my week. Thank you, Maureen."

Fantastic hospitality!
I felt at home as soon as I was welcomed by Maureen.
Very close to public transportation, making it very easy to see the city.
Maureen was very helpful in introducing me to Montreal.
Communication with Maureen was excellent.
We had a pleasant stay in the apartment. Everything was perfect, thank you to Ichraf for his hospitality and availability!

She was very accommodating, meeting us late at night. We were late, and there were no problems whatsoever. The place was very clean and nicely decorated. The washer and dryer were convenient, along with the great balcony and location.

Ichraf was very friendly and welcoming. The apartment is exactly as shown in the pictures. It was comfortable and we really loved the balcony and BBQ. Our only concern was that the parking was on the street. We really appreciated the small things Ichraf thought of like milk and cereal, coffee, spices, etc.

Ichraf is a wonderful host. The apartment was clean and had all the amenities you could need. It's a perfect sample of Montreal living in a great part of town with easy access to food and transit.
Couldn't recommend it more. Great value. Great place.

Ichraf's apartment is very comfortable and well-maintained. It has two good-sized bedrooms in addition to a long common space, so it was a good choice for our family with two young children. She was able to accommodate our late arrival, and even came to check everything was OK once she heard that I'd arrived. She was very friendly, and (unlike some other Montreal hosts) responded quickly to messages. We had a very good experience. One thing to note -- parking is street parking rather than located on the property.

Great welcome by Ichraf who greeted us on our more than late arrival. The location although not central is about 10 yards from a Bixi (Montreal bicycle rental) station. We bicycled back from downtown Montreal to the apartment and felt very safe. Overall, a great experience.
We were very well received! She was available throughout our stay to answer our questions. This was a beautiful start to our family's trip to America.

One of my first times using Airbnb and I was very happy with the stay. The apartment was just as described and my friends and I loved it!! Ichraf greeted us on arrival and left the place stocked with everything we needed. I highly recommend it! :)
Ichraf was very welcoming. She left us some juice and fruit in the fridge. The place was very clean and the location was very easy to get to. It was a quiet neighborhood.

I rented this apartment for friends who were coming from overseas. They were warmly welcomed by Ichraf, a very pleasant and helpful woman. Her apartment is very clean, organized, and well-equipped. She responded very quickly to my emails and was available to answer questions from her guests. Ichraf put milk, butter, orange juice, jam, and bread in her fridge for the guests. I found this very kind of her. I have no hesitation in recommending Ichraf's apartment.

I rented this big apartment for some friends who came from overseas. They had a smooth arrival and everything was well prepared by Icharf, a sweet host. Her apartment is very clean, organized, and very well equipped. Ichraf responded quickly to my emails and she provided my guests with milk, bread, juice, and jam when they arrived, which is very nice of a host.  I definitely recommend Ichraf's apartment.
The host cancelled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated message.

We stayed here for 3 nights and had great fun. The apartment was very clean and located in a safe neighborhood. Ichraf responded to questions very quickly and shared good information about local area attractions. We will definitely consider staying here again for our next trip.
The host cancelled this reservation 143 days before arrival. This is an automated message.
Place is just nice and clean. Great communication. Will stay again if needed.
Lchraf's place was perfect for us and exactly as described! Great central location. Very clean. Nice porch. Fast internet. Overall, a great stay. Hope to come back again!
Very good reception. Easy access and beautiful apartment not far from the Jean Talon metro.
It was a nice place to stay. I would recommend it!

The location is excellent, being close to the market (Jean Talo and Little Italy)! While it's a bit of a distance from the city center, it was definitely a good option if you enjoy the neighborhood and offers an experience worth having! :)
Great

Great location. My friends and I stayed here for the weekend. Great location. Nearby food spots. Parking wasn't hard to find. We did find a broken light fixture in the kitchen that had come off its hinges. Nothing major. The balcony was great for cooling down. The listing was as described. I would recommend it. Great house, great location. Ichraf was a little behind on responding to messages, but we figured everything out.
Translation:  Nice, clean, and cozy

I stayed here with my husband and his mom for 5 days, and we felt very comfortable from the moment of arrival. The place is just as advertised, nothing fancy but very clean, well-equipped, and cozy. Ichraf is a friendly and helpful hostess, living right next door. Location is good, with only 10-15 minute walks to the metro, stadium, and Jean-Talon market. Not much choice for restaurants in the immediate vicinity, but that was not an issue for us. Would definitely stay here again! Perfect for either families or friends.
Lovely home, photos were accurate, check-in and check-out was easy and convenient for us.

Very clean and well kept. Great location with easy access to many places. Would not recommend staying during the summer months as it was very uncomfortable, especially in the bedrooms, at night without air circulation. Would definitely stay again - just during a cooler time of year.
Despite minor issues, we had a good overall stay. The location is great and the host is responsive.
Great location in a fun neighborhood.
Ichraf has been smiling the whole time! I had rented for a family and they were thrilled. The apartment is close to a main subway station as well as Jean-Talon market, an absolute must-see!

The place was perfect for a group and located in a cool area with lots of unique places nearby. Ichraf was very responsive and easy to coordinate with. We loved our stay and would certainly recommend this place to other travelers.

Well-located, clean and well-equipped accommodation, ideal for a stay in [website hidden by Airbnb]. It's also worth highlighting the warm welcome and availability of Ichraf! I highly recommend this accommodation with pleasure!!
Nice place! Lovely back patio.
Beautiful little place! Clean, nice neighborhood, and lots of options within walking distance. Our favorite moment was relaxing on the back porch, drinking beer and playing board games.

This apartment was perfect for us. Everything was as you see in the photos. The rooms were large and clean and well-furnished. Our host, François, who lives downstairs, was very friendly and helpful. He assisted with several small things throughout our stay. In Montreal, the location is superb: close to the metro, close to Atwater Market, and near excellent cheese shops, bakeries, and grocery stores on Wellington Street. Also, the neighborhood is very quiet at night.  In short, it couldn't be better.

We spent 10 very pleasant days in this clean and very welcoming apartment. The apartment is equipped with everything you need, nothing is missing. The neighborhood is very quiet and very green. The metro is right next door and you can find all the necessary shops on Wellington Street just two steps from the apartment. The host is very friendly and nice. A very good experience, we highly recommend it.
Enchanté of our stay at François who is a very friendly person. Apartment and neighborhood very pleasant, we were "like home".

Francois's apartment is a perfect place to stay for a bit. I stayed for a month, and loved my time there. The apartment itself is very clean, and has a lot of character. 

I also really liked the location. It's a quick walk to get back into Montreal across the Lachine Canal, or an even quicker 10-minute subway ride to get downtown. 

And don't overlook the Verdun neighborhood. There are lots of great restaurants, shops, and parks. I really loved the area. 

Overall, I highly recommend it.

François is a kind host
Very available and cheerful
You feel like you are at home in his apartment
The apartment is extremely clean with all the amenities. Close to the city center, 8 minutes walk from the metro station. 
See you soon

François is very welcoming and warm. He has always been available to us throughout our stay. The accommodation is very well located, functional, quiet, close to all amenities. We spent over 4 months in it and it was a pleasure throughout. There's nothing to complain about, I would definitely go back there with great pleasure. :)
Pleasant, functional and very clean accommodation, 10 minutes from the metro station - host very friendly and excellent welcome.

Pleasant apartment, well-designed and fully equipped for a prolonged stay. We spent 5 weeks there with 5 people. It is located in a quiet neighborhood close to public transportation.

François, our host, was always available to us. Nothing to complain about, excellent welcome.

We spent a month with 2 friends in the apartment. The space is more than enough and can easily accommodate more than 3 people. Perfect for being quiet after a day in the city center. Close to the LaSalle metro, it's an 8-minute walk. Located about 20 minutes from the city, it's top! A Metro supermarket is within walking distance. The photos don't do justice to reality; we loved the apartment. Clean, functional and in a quiet neighborhood. We would have extended our stay if possible. Thank you for the welcome François and looking forward to seeing you again. 
Laura
The host cancelled this reservation 82 days before arrival. This is an automated message.

François has been a welcoming host to my various messages, his responses were prompt and accurate. 
The accommodation is very pleasant, furnished tastefully, it offers all the necessary comfort. It is located in a quiet neighborhood, the nearest metro station is less than 10 minutes walk away, shops are within 5 minutes.
If we return to Montreal, we will not hesitate to contact François again.
François is very pleasant and very available. Our stay was very enjoyable, the space is quiet and relaxing, close to everything. I highly recommend it!

We spent 3 weeks in family in this apartment. Everything was absolutely perfect, the apartment was extremely clean, decorated with taste and very functional. Moreover, the location is very quiet, but at a short distance from all amenities. François is an absolutely charming and caring host who is concerned about the comfort of his tenants. If we return to Montreal, we will definitely go back to him without hesitation! Thank you, François!
When you stay at François' place, you are never disappointed. He is a truly pleasant and helpful person and the accommodation is perfect.
It was just perfect!! Thanks Francois!!!

Super stay at François' place, he is a great host who is very accommodating and listens to his tenants. The apartment is spacious and very pleasant throughout, everything was perfect from start to finish.

We stayed with François all of October. We loved our stay in this large, typical Montreal apartment. The first impression upon arrival is that the apartment is very clean. There's a lot of space and beautiful decoration in each room. A quiet apartment in a really pleasant neighborhood. All services within walking distance, pharmacy, shops, SAQ, grocery store, Viandal butcher shop, two bars and several good restaurants. We recommend Street Monkeys, an Asian restaurant with a trendy atmosphere, Chez Boss and fils, as well as Piquillo. We also took a nice long walk along the river, which is right nearby. 
François is really friendly. He lives downstairs but that's absolutely no problem at all. We would love to go back there, it's definite! We recommend him.
Superb apartment, very pleasant to live in and François is adorable. I recommend it 100%.
Great service from the team. Fully equipped apartment. Thank you for 6 great weeks in Dorval.

Excellent location and surprisingly quiet inside! Clean and comfortable loft. Great location!!!

Yanick was always quick to respond and answer any of my questions. Thank you and see you soon, I hope!

Yanick was an excellent host, very accommodating to our schedule, which we truly appreciated. His loft was fantastic. The location couldn't be better in the heart of Old Montreal. It was very comfortable and clean, making it a great choice for anyone visiting Montreal and wanting to enjoy the beautiful charm of Old Montreal!

My friend and I stayed at Yanick's place for four nights. Yanick was very quick to respond to our questions, and very helpful overall. He showed us where to find good parking, and checked in on us to make sure things were okay during the trip. The place was even bigger than it looked in the pictures, and just the perfect size for our needs. It was clean when we got there, and the bed had fresh sheets and there were towels for us to use. One thing we wished for was sheets for the futon, since we were not sharing the bed. There was also no space for us to unpack, because the bureau drawers were full. Other than those two things, the place was great and not stuffy at all, though it was on the fourth floor. It's also in a great location, very conveniently located near lots of good restaurants, the waterfront, and the bike path along the river. We would definitely recommend this to anyone, it is WELL worth the price!

When I first saw the location and price, I thought this sounded too good to be true. But it IS true! The location is right in the middle of everything picturesque - cobblestone streets right when you step out, Old Port and Old Montreal your neighborhood, around the corner from City Hall and numerous restaurants with scenic patios. You can cross the street to Bonsecours Market, or walk 5 minutes to Notre Dame Bonsecours Chapel and about 10 to Notre Dame Basilica. If you want more than what's immediately walkable, Champs de Mars station is very close. If you drove like we did, there is paid street parking around you for short-term stays, and many lots to choose from for overnight stays. We personally liked the indoor garage on Gosford and Champs de Mars streets.

As for the loft itself, it has beautiful views of Old Port and Old Montreal, as well as a comfortable mattress and futon. It is well kept, and Yanick will provide you with wifi, a refrigerator full of cold water bottles, along with towels and linens. The pictures are exactly how the loft looks. He will also respond to any messages within a couple of days prior to your arrival, and within an hour or so during your stay. Logistics very easy for check-in and check-out.

This location may be the best in Montreal. The place is nice and cozy. Only one problem with the sound, there was always a small noise of the air conditioner but if you are not stay at home a lot, it should not be a problem. I will come back if I have a chance

Yanick was waiting for me when I arrived, the apartment is in accordance with the description, located on the Vieux Port, tourist street of Montreal. 

It's perfectly situated to go running, there are plenty of restaurants around if you don't want to cook, it's usually the studio occupied by Yanick, perfectly organized for this occasion. Perfect for a couple or a single person looking for a central location.

Bright and spacious loft for two, well-arranged. We spent four beautiful days in Montreal thanks to this wonderful pied à terre. 

Yannick, unavailable, had organized our arrival and kept us updated on the progress of our stay. 

One small problem: the noise from the air conditioning. Fortunately, the temperature dropped nicely at night and we could turn it off.
Yanick was a fantastic host. He was very communicative and helpful. The apartment was clean and had everything you could want to enjoy some time in the heart of Montreal's historic Old Port.

We arrived in Montreal a bit late and were fortunate to have international cellphone coverage to message Yanick about our late arrival. He was patient enough to wait for us in the apartment as we navigated around the Old Port to find parking. He spent 15 minutes explaining the accommodations before leaving us with the keys.

The closest overnight parking (1.5 blocks away) is at the Hotel de Ville (Montreal City Hall) and costs $18.75 CAD per 24-hour period. This is a good deal in terms of proximity. The apartment is within walking distance to great restaurants, the waterfront, the Clock Tower beach (our favorite spot to hang out), and public transportation.

The apartment has excellent air conditioning and met our needs. The bed was comfortable, Wi-Fi was excellent, the bathroom was clean, and the air conditioning was wonderful during the warm summer days. It's a great location and we would stay here again.

It was a wonderful experience in Montreal. The location is right at the heart of the old port. Everything is within walking distance, the kitchen is highly functional, there's a comfortable bed, washer/dryer and mostly I like the showers - they relieved all fatigue after a long day of walking. I highly recommend this place!!!!! 

Why wait? This place will make your visit to Montreal even better!

Yanick's place was the **perfect** home base for a weekend escape to Montreal. I stayed for two nights with a friend. The location can't be beat for tourists -- it's literally around the corner from Place Jacques-Cartier and a few blocks from the Metro. As a host, Yanick is a real pro. He was responsive, flexible with check-in/checkout time, and left a fully stocked bathroom. The loft is beautiful, clean, and modern. Full of light. A+, would book again. Thanks Yanick!

I had a great experience in Montreal. 

Yanick was very friendly and had a beautiful apartment. I texted him with any questions I had and he responded right away. The apartment is located in Old Port and on St Paul Street where the apartment is full of life - restaurants and bars galore.

Yanick's loft is just as described in the listing--right in the middle of Old Port section of Old Montreal, just steps from the Bonsecours Market and many pleasant restaurants and shops and convenient to the Metro. It's a bustling area, very pedestrian friendly--but quiet enough late at night to sleep with open windows. The place is small but not at all cramped. He has a lovely, up-to-date kitchen with a fabulous Nespresso maker, and he left the refrigerator stocked with water, juice and milk. Yanick is quite personable and welcoming. I arrived earlier than expected and he was most gracious about the mixup. He was also available by text when I needed to ask  where he stored a couple of household items.

Yanick's place was perfect for our quick getaway! Right in the heart of Old Montreal, we were a few steps away from numerous bars, restaurants, shops and the water. Everything we wanted to do and see was within walking distance. Leading up to our arrival, Yanick was extremely helpful – he always got back to me the day I emailed him. He provided us with great information regarding parking and places to eat! We will definitely use Yanick again if we return to Montreal!

Yanick was an excellent host. Communication was excellent. 

Having lived in Montreal, I have to say the location is excellent. 

One thing we noticed on our first night there was that the bed sheets were not freshly laundered. The problem was solved by replacing them with fresh sheets. Perhaps it was an oversight. 

The bed sinks in the middle, but that's us being picky. 

$18.50 per day parking needs to be taken into consideration; luckily the parking facility was nearby. 

Internet went down on our second day, though not likely Yanick's fault. 

Good place to stay.

It was in a prime location, conveniently located near many amenities. The place matched the description perfectly. Yanick was very responsive. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for accommodation in Old Montreal.

Staying at this loft was a true travel highlight. The location is exceptional. The loft is gorgeous. And, Yanick is a wonderful host. Attentive and ready to reply whenever needed, he really makes the place incredibly easy.

We had a great time in Montreal and Yanick was an amazing host. His loft is in the heart of Old Montreal and just a short walk to the subway. There are lots of great restaurants, shopping, and art galleries nearby. The space is clean and comfortable. My daughter especially enjoyed the view from the dormers.

Yannick was very friendly, accommodating, and excellent at communication. He met us at the location and pointed out everything we needed to know. There was an issue with the wifi, and he quickly resolved it with the provider. The loft is in a great location and was perfect for our vacation. We had everything we needed.

Location, Location, Location!! If you're looking to stay in Old Montreal for that European feel, then this is the perfect spot for you. His place is a stones throw away from Place Jacques Cartier. Yanick is a gracious host who made sure that you have everything you need, and if you need anything else, he's a phone call away. Thanks for making our stay pleasant.

I had a great time staying here. The location was perfect and the loft itself was very nice. Everything was clean and it had all the amenities you'd need. Yanick was a great host and very easy to communicate with!

Yanick was such a wonderful host! He greeted us when we arrived, gave us some important tips (parking, etc.).  He was so nice to deal with! As for the location, it's pure perfection! Close to everything and right in the heart of Old Montreal! The place was extremely clean and very cozy! We really felt at home! I definitely recommend this place!

What a great find! Yanick's place is in a super convenient location in Old Montreal where you can walk to nearby shops, restaurants, etc. Yanick is a fabulous host! He was very responsive, answered all of our questions, and let us drop off our bags early before check-in. The place is really clean and tidy and Yanick even stocked the fridge with some snacks and water bottles for us. Would definitely recommend!

Yanick's place is fantastic. It's next door to my favorite restaurant in Old Port, Jardin Nelson, and steps away from all the fun Old Montreal has to offer!

The apartment was beautiful, spacious, and clean. There were nice hospitality touches such as lavender shampoo and conditioner, and no shortage of towels and washcloths. The bed was comfortable, and the Wifi was fast. The place had great temperature controls, Yanick had the AC on before we arrived so it was comfortable right away. We didn't use the kitchen because we were only there one night, but the set up was beautiful as well as functional and would have been perfect for dining in if we needed to. 

About the host: Yanick saved my trip - all our other accommodations and plans had fallen through - Yanick's message to me that he would be able to meet us early to drop off our bags was a beam of sun in a very gloomy situation! He was friendly and so welcoming when we arrived, he let us leave our things while he finished turning the place over after his previous guests left - and he also let us leave our things when we checked out so we didn't have to carry them around the city all day before departing for good. 

We didn't have any problems but he was quick to reach via text for questions that came up. A perfect host! I only hope his place is available next time we come back!

Yanick was very accommodating in welcoming me to his place. 
The loft was perfect for my stay at the Old Port. 
It was literally steps away from restaurants, shops and attractions that Old Montreal has to offer.
I will definitely stay here again on my next visit.

Yanick's place is amazing for anyone wanting to explore Montreal, especially the old part. It's close to so many amazing restaurants and the atmosphere in the area is great! There are so many old buildings with so much character, and it's only a 5-ish minute walk from the Metro. The loft itself is very cozy, comfortable, and clean with nice views of the historical buildings nearby. Yanick was very kind and helpful, spending a lot of time giving us directions, making recommendations, and making sure we had everything we needed. I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone looking to stay in Montreal!
Lovely and very clean apartment in the best part of the city. Great communication with Yanick. Highly recommend!

I had a very good experience staying in Yanick's place. It's located on one of the most attractive old streets where you can visit one of the small restaurants or just take a walk. What was important for me was that Old Port is nearby and also a pickup point for excursions to Quebec is a 2-minute walk away. At night, it's not noisy at all; there's no music from the street. The Wi-Fi worked without problems. I recommend this apartment for anyone looking for a convenient location to explore old Montreal.

My boyfriend and I came to Montreal to celebrate his birthday. I am so glad I chose to stay at Yanick's apartment! It was cozy, super clean and in a perfect location! He was very responsive and gave great suggestions on new restaurants to try! Next time we venture to Montreal....Yanick's place it is!!! :-)
Our stay was terrific! The place was exceptionally clean and very cozy, it made us feel right at home. Yanick was very kind and responsive to our needs. I would certainly stay here again.

Yanick was great, gave me a tour of the place, and answered my tourist questions. The loft was amazing, clean, organized, quiet, and the windows looked out to iconic Old Montreal. It was close to the metro and bus routes, so getting anywhere in Montreal was easy. You couldn't have a better location!
Yanick is a wonderful host. He gave us a rundown of the neighborhood and was flexible with our schedule. I would definitely stay here again (what a great location!).
Excellent location for New Year's Eve, enjoyed staying in the heart of Old Montreal

Yanick's place was fantastic! It is in the perfect location in old town Montreal with easy access to the entire area - restaurants, shops, historical locations, nightlife - you name it! The home itself is nice and cozy, just as it looks in the photos. It was perfect for the two of us, really nice touches throughout the apartment. Yanick was a very gracious and flexible host. He was also very responsive, we arrived very late at night and had no problem getting in whatsoever. Yanick was helpful in recommending restaurants and things to do. He was right, winter ice skating on the river was a great experience!

Yanick's apartment is in a fantastic location. There's an elevator so you don't have to climb stairs (which is key for late-night adventures in Montreal). The street the building is on is lined with fantastic restaurants, cobblestone and about 100 meters from the river. Amazing. Clean. Cozy and stocked with all the amenities.
Great place and friendly hosts! Very highly recommended. Comfortable and perfect location.

Loved this location and apartment. Exactly as pictured, no problems, and very accommodating host. Nice too! I found the bed to be super comfy and the home very clean. Would stay again if looking in Old Montreal.

Yannick is a very good host. Pleasant, cheerful and available he welcomed me directly to the apartment to explain the operation of 2/3 things and hand over the keys. The apartment is very nice, clean, consistent with the photos and located right in old Montreal at 100m from the river. Note that the apartment is close to the metro which makes it easy to get around everywhere.

In summary a very good stay with Yannick that I highly recommend!
Friendly and hospitable hosts. Very comfortable apartment with everything you need (even more like coffee, breakfast, very good wifi). Highly recommend!
It was a great neighborhood and easy to find! Thanks, Yanick

Yanick's place was great! The loft is nice and cozy, just as it looks in the photos. It is in the perfect location in old town Montreal with easy access to the entire area - restaurants, shops, historical locations, nightlife - you name it! It was perfect for the two of us, really nice touches throughout the apartment. Yanick was great, very responsive and helpful.

Yanick was very welcoming, friendly, and helpful. Checking in and out of his wonderful loft was easy, and the location is perfect. I would highly recommend staying there and I look forward to another visit.

Yanick was great, there to meet us when we arrived. He gave us the quick tour of the flat, which was wonderful. We knew the city fairly well so didn't really need recommendations, but he was more than willing to give them. The neighborhood is fantastic, we look forward to returning, and hope the place is available when we do!!

Yanick was a wonderful host. I arrived to Montreal much earlier than anticipated, and he made sure I had a place to drop off my bags and explore the city while the loft was being prepared, which was ready for me ahead of schedule. 

He also ensured coffee and more than basic staples were available when I arrived. The apartment was clean, spacious, and comfortable. Ideal for meeting up with friends and going out in Montreal, while taking some time between events to separate from the group and finish some work. 

I will reach out again on my next trip to Montreal and rebook if the unit is available.

Yanick has been an excellent host! His cozy apartment is in the heart of Montreal's old port, a lively neighborhood with tons of great places to eat and drink, just a few minutes walk from the city center and some of the coolest neighborhoods. Yanick himself is a lovely guy and made me feel welcome from the very first minute. The place was fully equipped - with a fantastic coffee machine - and very quiet, allowing for long hours of sleep :)

Yanick was an amazing host, extremely responsive and accommodating. Within minutes of texting, Yanick responded in a helpful way, and he went out of his way to make sure my stay was comfortable. One day I asked about water, and that night he brought a pack of water. The apartment was beautiful (both inside and location wise), clean, and comfortable. It was right in the middle of the life of Vieux Port, yet quiet: I will really miss that. It was perfect for getting focused work done (WiFi was on point too) so I could enjoy my trip afterwards and ideal for winding down after a day of exploring. For anyone that stays here, I highly recommend exploring the neighboring art galleries: my mind was blown by some of the art there. I would stay here again, and I can't wait to plan my next trip.
The location was great and had everything we needed!

Yanick was very accommodating and generous. We felt right at home. Old Montreal was gorgeous, and Yanick's place was right in the middle of it all - exactly as described! Just a 12-minute walk to the convention center too. It was very charming - quiet but still central. If you left the window open, you could hear the street musicians playing in the evenings. It was a beautiful, bright, and clean space. I felt very calm and relaxed staying there - with nothing to worry about because Yanick had thought of everything! I rested very well and looked forward to coming back to the flat every day. A must-stay place when I return to Montreal someday!

My wife and I had a great time staying at Yanick's place while in Montreal. It is an ideal location, as it is within walking distance of many fantastic things in Montreal. The place was very clean and had everything we needed for our stay.

It's a great location. The street was being torn up, so it wasn't what it normally would be, I'm sure. He was there to meet us, and the place is really well provisioned - water in the fridge, plenty of extra towels - really nice.

This is a beautiful place located in a desirable area of town. It's conveniently close to many popular attractions, including the waterfront, Bixi bikes, and public transportation. Yanick is excellent at communicating. I highly recommend staying here!

Yanick met us to get the keys and showed us all around the apartment. He made sure we knew where everything we might need was. The listing was amazing and exactly what we were looking for. Yanick checked in on us several times throughout our stay to see if there was anything we needed. Overall, it was a really great experience.

Yanicks loft was perfect for our trip to the Montreal Canadian Grand Prix! Located right in old Montreal with easy access to the Metro, Bixi Bikes and a closed parking lot.

Yanick was a great host offering all the usual amenities plus more! We will definitely stay with Yanick again next time we visit Montreal!

Thanks Yanick!

Yanick has been an excellent host from the moment I messaged him to make a reservation. His response time for any of our requests was very quick. We let him know we were traveling from the NYC area, so we would be arriving late, and he was very flexible with us on that. In fact, when we hit traffic and got lost and arrived an hour after our expected time, he accommodated us. Upon arrival, the loft was in perfect condition. He took time to show us where everything was, how things worked, and walked me back to my car to show me where the garage was to park. The loft is such a gem of a find! The location is perfect for first-time Montreal visitors because it's in the heart of Old Port. The streets surrounding are bustling with lively restaurants, shops, and history. Anything we wanted to do was within walking distance, so we didn't have to move our car much. The views from the loft were gorgeous, overlooking the port and attractions in town. We definitely will be making a trip back to Montreal soon, and we would love to stay at Yanick's loft again!

Yanick was very accommodating, the flat was well-appointed and well-located, and it had a robust AC system which was very welcome during my stay. I also appreciated being just steps away from so many restaurants, the Vieux Port, and shops.
We had a great getaway at Yanick's place in Old Montreal. His loft is clean, neat, and comfortable. And you can't beat the location!

The location of this unit cannot be beat; it is only about a 100-meter walk to the water! Although not large, for the two of us, this place was ideal, especially with the open windows which allow you to hear the birds and music from the street below. Yanick was a pleasure to work with!
Excellent housing, excellent reception, excellent neighborhood. Thank you, Yanick!

This loft is very conveniently located in the Old Port area. It is close to dining, shopping, and all the attractions in Old Montreal. The Metro (subway) is just a few blocks away. We found this space to be comfortable, quiet, and equipped as described by Yannick, our host. We would definitely consider staying here again.
Fantastic location, so close to Old Montreal. Very comfortable condo. Great restaurant downstairs.

We had an amazing time in Montreal! Yanek and his family were lovely hosts. Their place is ideally situated right in the heart of Old Montreal. No need for a car since we were able to walk most places and catch the metro very easily just a few blocks away. The place is exactly as it looks. Everything you need is provided, including some delicious cappuccino. You will definitely be back again on our next trip to Montreal.

Very nice apartment, amazing location, safe & easy. Great host and the best location we could have chosen. Restaurants surround the apartment on both sides and shops surround the restaurants. Old Montreal is amazing.
Yannick was very polite, welcoming, and cleaned the house really well.

Yanick was very welcoming and helpful! We enjoyed our stay here very much. The extremely convenient location made it perfect for a weekend getaway to explore Old Montreal. It was a lovely experience! Thank you, Yanick!
Perfect location, clean and comfortable. The location and espresso machine justify the price!

For our first time in Montreal, the apartment was in the best possible location. Old Montreal is beautiful, and the apartment was gorgeous. Yanick was extremely accommodating, especially since we arrived later than expected. The Nespresso machine was a great feature as well. Parking was kind of a pain, but that's to be expected in a city. Would definitely stay here again!

Yanick's place is lovely: airy and cozy at the same time, with all the amenities. There *is* music playing for most of the day out in the square below, but that was the only drawback. Otherwise, the location was excellent: in the center of the old town and close to a subway station, not to mention close to the Promenade du Vieux-Port and the jogging trail along the canal. Yanick was there to greet me at the apartment even though my train was late, he humored my bad French, and he was polite even when we had a scheduling mix up last night. Highly recommended.

My week at the cozy loft was great! Check-in was a breeze; I texted Yanick with my arrival time and he was waiting for me at the loft when I arrived. He also stocked the kitchen with coffee, tea, cereal, and fruit for breakfast, which was a pleasant surprise! The location in Old Montreal is perfect, there are a ton of restaurants and shops within walking distance. I definitely recommend staying here.

Great location. The unit is small as noted but has everything you need. We loved the beautiful, exposed, old beams and all the windows overlooking a quaint courtyard with live music. 

Yannic is very responsive and accommodating, checking in with us to see if everything was going well and if we needed anything.  Loved this weekend getaway and will be back.
Great location. Yanick was very accommodating. Book this Airbnb!

My sister and I stayed at Yanick's place for 5 days. It was perfect! Great location and ambiance, right in the heart of old Montreal and near the old port. The street in front of the apartment is under construction, but we did not have any issues with noise. Yanick was a great host, he accommodated our very late arrival and was very responsive to any questions that we had. He also made some extra gestures, ensuring the kitchen was stocked with breakfast essentials, coffee, tea etc upon our arrival. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a place with great character in an ideal location.
The host cancelled this reservation 16 days before arrival. This is an automated message.

Responsive and hospitable host, clean loft with everything you need, plenty of fruit and cereal choices for breakfast, great location, nice view, lovely neighborhood full of restaurants and shops. I would recommend Yanick's place to others.

A truly memorable experience, from Yanick greeting us upon arrival to its convenient location and amenities within the unit (really comfortable bedding/sheets)...this apartment is everything you need and more. 
It is perfectly situated in Old Montréal. It was very convenient for my husband and I to get around and explore for a few days. 
Most of all, Yanick was super helpful and very gracious with setting us up with some breakfast starters (milk, cheese, egg, bread...WOW!) Very yummy coffee provided too which made our mornings much easier :) 
If you're looking for an excellent host with an excellent place, look no further...you've already discovered it. 
Mahalo nui loa to Yanick!!! :)
Yannick was very welcoming and easy to communicate with. The location was fantastic, right in the heart of Old Montreal. Charming, clean, and well-equipped suite. Great place to stay.

Yanick was incredibly accommodating and responsive. He answered all of our questions quickly, and he made himself available to address our concerns.  He is the perfect host.

His place is in a great location and it's only a short walk away from a bunch of bars, restaurants, and stores. My two brothers and I spent the weekend there and it was amazing. I will definitely book this place (if it's available) the next time I am heading to Montreal.

This place is incredible! It is simple but tasteful, the bed was very comfortable, and the location could not have been better (on the fourth floor of a building that opens directly onto the cobblestone streets of the historic district centered around Rue St. Paul.) We had a glorious breakfast every morning with the eggs and orange juice provided by Yanick, and made delicious lattes with the cappuccino machine available. The place is between one quarter and one half mile to Champ-de-Mars metro station and right across the street from the magnificent City Hall building. As long as you don't need tons of space, you will not regret booking this spot!
