Yanick's place in Vieux Montreal was wonderful. It was a tiny, charming space right on the main street in the tourist district. I loved the wood beams and the decor and the location couldn't have been better. It was great to be in a building with an elevator, since the place was on the fourth floor. Parking was pretty close by. I love Montreal and really enjoyed staying at Yanick's place. I would definitely recommend it to anyone else looking to visit Montreal.
Awesome location and awesome loft! The host was very accommodating and friendly. Would love to stay here again!

Our stay at Yanick's place was short and sweet. Yanick was very accommodating to our late arrival as well as our late departure. The place was cute and homely, in a perfect location right in the heart of Old Montreal. Would definitely like to stay here again, but for a longer visit next time! Thanks Yanick!

Yanick's apartment was perfect and in the perfect location. Yanick is very responsive to any questions and met us at the apartment to explain everything. He provided everything for breakfast in case you needed it (cereal, milk, bread, eggs) and also has a Nespresso machine for you to use if you want to make yourself something. There's pretty much everything within 5 minutes of Yanick's place and even better you can open the windows to hear live music. Would definitely recommend staying here.

Yanick's apartment was cozy, clean, and in a wonderful location. The bed was very comfortable, and we had everything we needed. In fact, even more because there was coffee, bread, cereal, eggs, milk, and other staples that we were free to consume which we thought was a lovely bonus. Yanick was very friendly and promptly replied when contacted. He was waiting for us when we arrived. Everything was perfect, and we would definitely stay here again. Thank you so much, Yanick! We loved your place!

Yanick made me feel welcome right away. He came with groceries and water and showed me how to work the espresso machine as well as the TV. The place is beautiful and really could not be in a more perfect location in Old Montreal! The views are beautiful and despite the busy square nearby and the construction out front, the loft was extremely quiet and cozy. Yanick made it feel like a home away from home and I would definitely come stay here again or recommend it to anyone visiting Montreal!

Yanick was fantastic and his place was too. I was in town for business and needed a place to stay. Yanick was easy to communicate with and his place exceeded my expectations: excellent location, cleanliness, organization, and a comfortable bed.

I can't speak highly enough about my experience staying at Yanick's place. He and I coordinated via text prior to my arrival about when to meet after departing my train. Yanick gave me a tour of the place, including how to use the TV, set up WiFi, how to use the Nespresso Machine, where the laundry was, etc., and he even had offerings of groceries for breakfast. I used the kitchen to cook several meals—a kitchen that is fully equipped with pots, pans, spices, utensils, etc.—and found myself right at home. The loft itself is absolutely stunning, and in an ideal location. It was quiet, comfortable, and a perfect size for my 4 days there. Every evening, I enjoyed live music in the central plaza, seen from the windows. I absolutely will be staying here again in the future. I can't thank you enough, Yanick, for the hospitality. Your place is a gem.

Amazing spot, really close to everything. Yanick's place is really awesome, cozy, clean and beautiful! 

We wouldn't doubt going back!

We even had groceries and other goodies

Summary: Quite frankly, I prefer to stay here than in a hotel. Great location, very clean apartment, helpful and friendly host.

Location: Located right in Old Montreal where the major tourist spots are. About 5 to 10-minute walk from closest metro and bus stations.

Apartment: The apartment itself was in a very clean and tidy condition. Almost everything from towels, to kitchenware and utensils, to free laundry... had all been meticulously prepared for you.  The only minus was that the A/C was not functioning properly during my stay, so it felt slightly hot during the day, but still tolerable since Montreal was getting cold at night during my stay anyway.

Host: Mr. Yanick was very friendly and very quick in replying when I needed help with directions in Montreal. Great host overall!

Upon my arrival, Yannick was waiting to explain the details and amenities of the loft. He was very courteous and the accommodation exceeded my expectations. It was very beautiful, very clean, and had many amenities and equipment, even coffee and breakfast were included, which was very appreciated. Given the rainy weather, the Wi-Fi cable was convenient. The bed was very comfortable. The location of the accommodation is ideal and on a street in Old Montreal that is close to everything. I have no negative comments.

This was my first time visiting beautiful city Montreal.

And which made my little trip more perfect was this place where I stayed.

First, the best thing about the place is its location. You can't find anywhere better than here. It's just across the old port and just a few steps from Place Jacques Cartier. I enjoyed walking nearby every day. 

And Bixi is just across the street if you are a fan of biking.

Second, the best thing about the house itself was that it was very clean, with a cute kitchen that had everything you needed. Although I don't cook much, you will definitely find it comfortable to use. Nice and clean bed and bathrooms, etc. 

Third, the host was very attentive. He explained about the place and greeted me when I arrived. You can see how attentive he is when you stay there; he prepared little things in the house for you.

It was a great experience for me, and I am very glad that I made the decision to stay here for 10 days.

Yanick was an excellent host. His loft is beautiful, cozy, neat, clean, and the location is amazing. He made everything extremely easy, and he provided us with everything we could have possibly needed during our stay. 

I highly recommend staying here!

Yanick was an excellent host. He answered questions right away as they arose during our stay, and checked in to make sure everything was okay. The apartment was quiet, serene, and a nice temperature, which I was concerned might be an issue visiting in mid-November— instead it felt great. It's a cozy and straightforward studio but has all the amenities you would need. The kitchen was nicely stocked, and the water pressure in the shower of the clean bathroom was fantastic. The location was ideal, close to the port and steps away from tons of good food. I would definitely consider coming back.

Yanick's communication was excellent, we were booked almost immediately and he was great at setting up our check-in. The apartment is all yours. It's a perfect studio setup for a couple, with a full kitchen stocked with most things you could want and a fridge full of water, milk, eggs, cheese, etc. Thanks Yanick! The bed is super comfortable, the Wifi is good, and the bathroom is super clean. The location is GREAT! Right across from the Bonsecours Market and right on Rue St. Paul; it's hard to find a better spot if you're looking to explore Old Montreal's shops, restaurants, and nightlife. Close to Place d'Armes and Champ-de-Mars subway stops if you want to check out other areas of the city as well. Can't wait to come back. :)
The best location in the city. Very clean.

My wife and I enjoyed a wonderful stay at Yanick's loft. We were met by Patrick who was a terrific and responsive host. He helped us carry our bags into the loft, provided local activity information and gave us a tour of the loft's amenities. Yanick's place is centrally located and surrounded by the most wonderful restaurants; you will not have to search for a great meal. Shopping, dining, museums, cathedrals and galleries are mere steps away on Rue St. Paul. You will be in the center of everything.

This was a lovely apartment in a great location. Parking was tough, but luckily there was a metro station and bus stop close by. Yanick was a great host - he was very communicative and had good suggestions for things to do in the area. I'd definitely recommend the apartment!
Lovely studio space with everything you need for a comfortable stay.
The place is in an absolutely wonderful location, and is very nice and exactly as advertised. Yanick is a great host, and the apartment is great. Would definitely return!

Yanick's loft in Old Montreal was unbelievable! Yanick made sure I was all set up at check-in and was great at helping me figure out where to go. The location was dreamy, a two-minute walk to everything Old Montreal has to offer. Listen to the bells of Notre Dame de Basilica from the loft and explore the cobblestone streets for exquisite restaurants and bars. Thank you again to Yanick for everything!
We had a great time - it was the perfect location in Old Montreal, and the apartment was so comfortable & clean. I would definitely recommend this!

This is the place to stay in Montreal.

Yanick was a great host making us feel very welcome and giving us lots of good information about exploring Montreal.

The apartment is warm and cozy with lots of character. Location is fantastic in Old Montreal with lots of things to do and see within walking distance.

I could recommend this place more highly.

From James & Anita (Australia)
Could not recommend enough. The place is immaculate. The location is excellent.

As I only spent a total of 7 hours at Yanick's place (arrived late and had to leave early for a breakfast meeting), I didn't get to thoroughly soak in the ambience of his loft suite in Vieux Montreal. The bed was comfy and the place was clean with all the amenities one would need - I especially loved the high quality towels. His place would be ideal for someone wanting to authentically experience living in Vieux Montreal. I was very impressed with Yanick's prompt level of response and how he went out of his way to make sure I got in when my train arrived late.

Yanick's place is beautiful, exactly as pictured and very clean. It was so much fun to stay directly in Old Port! I definitely recommend using the parking garage he suggests in his description - it makes this super easy. Hope to stay here again!

Clean, quiet, extremely convenient if you want to see all the tourist highlights in Montreal within walking distance! Close to the metro if you want to go further. Great host! Very comfortable with everything you need! Wish we had time to stay longer!

This small apartment offers everything a traveler needs. It's clean and tidy, located in the heart of Old Montreal. Yanick is a very pleasant person. I would highly recommend anyone traveling here to stay at his place!

This was my first stay in Montreal and it couldn't have gone better! Yanick was very flexible when I had check-in issues and was a wonderful host. The location of the apartment was perfectly situated in an old neighborhood. I will definitely be coming back again.
You can see the old city hall from the bed and the large windows let in a lot of light, what a great place

Yanick is a perfect host: pleasant, attentive, always concerned with the well-being of his travelers. 
The accommodation is clean, pleasant, functional, very well located in the heart of Old Montreal. A place and an host to recommend! 
It's sure that when we return to Montreal, it will be at Yanick's!
Thank you again for everything, Yanick!
Cool place.. I'll be back
Great location in Old Montreal. Yannick is a very nice host, and the place is very clean. It's a perfect, affordable jumping-off point for enjoying the city.
Great location and very clean. Everything you need. 10/10 would book again
Excellent and well-priced apartment in one of Montreal's most tourist-friendly neighborhoods. Yannick was an excellent host.
Super location and awesome host.
Second time

Yanick's place is PERFECT. It was right in the center of Old Montreal so everything was within walking distance. The apartment is cozy but had everything you'd ever need and more! Nice and clean, well-appointed, and Yanick is a great host. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and made exploring Old Montreal a blast. The only downside is the lack of parking in the (Website hidden by Airbnb) biggie though coz there was pay parking just a block away from the apartment. We ended up paying $40 for 2 full days, not bad at all I think. All in all I highly recommend Yanick's place, it was just perfect!!!

I have nothing bad to say about the place or Yanick. The place is so absolutely adorable and very clean. 
The bed was like a wonderful cloud that hugged you. 
I would definitely go back, it's in a great location. 
The only issue I had was finding parking, had to walk a bit to a parking garage but otherwise no complaints

My 19-year-old son and I took a road trip to Montreal and wanted to experience Old Montreal in all its quaintness. This was the perfect place for us to stay! Yanick was a wonderful host, and he was great with communication too, which was helpful since we are from the States and had never visited French Canada before. We would have loved to stay longer!

This place will be at the top of my list for future business trips to Montreal. It's perfectly located in Old Montreal. Yannick is an excellent host and goes above and beyond with the little things that make a big difference. Huge thumbs up on this Airbnb!
Fantastic location! So much charm in the old town and so close to the water (only one block away). Easy to walk to many bars, restaurants, and the riverwalk! Great stay. Thank you!
Yanick, as always (this is my second visit to the place), has been a fantastic host! I owe him a nice bottle of wine for this! Best regards! Highly recommended spot!
Yannick's place was great! I highly recommend it.

Couldn't ask for a better location for our stay in right in the middle of Old Port! Yanick was a great host and his apt offered every amenity you could want; Netflix, Nespresso machine, breakfast, soft towels, umbrellas for use- just to name a few. Highly recommend!

Yanick's place exceeded our expectations!! Although the dwelling is located on one of the main streets in old Montreal, it is very quaint and quiet and very picturesque. The house is wonderful and the bed is very comfortable. Yanick's hospitality was warm and welcoming and he even left us things for breakfast and coffee pods for his coffee machine. I would recommend his house to anyone! Another added bonus is the Netflix, in case it is raining. 5 star accommodation!!!
Great stay - very clean, quiet and comfortable, with all amenities. Highly recommended. Located in the heart of Old Montreal, yet a secluded spot off the street - almost forgets where you are!
Amazing! In the heart of the old port - perfectly awesome for tourists! Clean! Clean! Clean! And an awesome, attentive host! Would not hesitate to stay again!
Best location in Old Montreal. Clean and well-kept. Couldn't ask for more.
From the kindness of our host to the perfect central location, this space was absolutely perfect for us. I highly recommend Yanick's space, and I highly recommend Montreal to everyone.

The apartment and location were wonderful! Yanick's hospitality was exceptional. He left water and breakfast items for us. The apartment was very clean. He answered all our questions quickly. I highly recommend this apartment.

It was my first time renting with Airbnb and my first time in Montreal as well.  I have to say that Yanick's place was 10 times better than what I expected. The location is within walking distance of some of the best tourist spots, even if I had only spent a day there I would have left home happy. The loft is cozy and all the amenities that Yanick provides make you feel at home. He provides breakfast from fresh eggs, coffee, a variety of cereals, fruit, and the list goes on and on. For me it was so easy to be able to wake up and have those items available to start the day as it is something that I am use to having available in my home. His home is exceptionally clean which makes you feel as if you are staying at a high-end hotel chain. His recommendations on where to visit Montreal turned into my official tour guide. One of the reasons I wanted to visit Montreal was because I had heard such great things regarding the city and people. We are happy that our stay at Yanick's was proof that the city and the people are absolutely MARVELOUS!!!
This apartment was perfect for our four-night stay. We were in the heart of Old Montreal, easily able to walk or take the subway or bus anywhere, and had access to everything Montreal has to offer.

Yanick's place was amazing. Right in the center of Old Montreal with quick access to everything you would want or need. It was also incredibly clean and had great amenities that I don't often see in Airbnbs, such as the Nespresso machine, breakfast foods, and bottled water. Unfortunately, I only stayed one night. I will definitely be back for many more.

This place is in the most perfect location. You can get up and be right there in all the main beauty of Old Port. The place is small but cute. It's exactly what you need while traveling. I fell in love with this and asked to book more nights. So make sure to book in advance and stay here as long as possible because it books up quickly. Perfect location with wonderful useful items inside (e.g., umbrellas, hair dryer, towels, espresso machine, breakfast items...).

Ideal location to visit the old port and surrounding area.
Our host waited for us for 2 hours, be careful of traffic jams.
We appreciated having food in the fridge available.
And we really enjoyed the organic products for the shower and bath.

We had a very good stay. Appreciated the milk, cereals, and fruit for breakfast. The location is perfect and I appreciated the cleanliness of the unit. Yannick was also very patient with us due to the fact that the suggested parking was not high enough for our truck. It took us a while to find suitable parking and Yannick stayed until we returned. I highly recommend this unit in the heart of Old Montreal.
An awesome suite in a fantastic location in Old Montreal. Would definitely stay here again!
Very accurate description. Yanick is helpful and available to answer questions. Overall, a great stay.
This little loft is comfortable, has plenty of atmosphere, and is located in Vieux Port near restaurants and shops. There is a full kitchen and a nice bathroom.
Literally right in the heart of the Old Montreal, a great location! Very nice and clean place with all the essentials you'll need for your stay in Montreal.

Absolutely loved our stay at Yanick's loft. The location was ideal - close to parking and right in Old Montreal and very close to the port. Yanick provides amazing amenities - we especially appreciated the lavender toiletries and the breakfast/snack supplies. The Nescaffe machine was an added bonus, too. I highly recommend this apt to anyone visiting Old Montreal.
Fantastic location in the heart of St Paul Street. Would love to rent here again when we return to Montreal.
Great experience!! Great location! Description accurate!!!

You could not ask for a better location. Not only that, but the place was nice and loaded with amenities that you would actually use (espresso machine, kitchen, Netflix, etc). It will make your trip a lot more convenient.
The best possible location! So cozy! Wonderful host!
It was a super place to stay for our family of four. Plenty of food and drinks for the kids. Great location.

Yanick was very welcoming and communicative. His place was perfect for spending a couple of nights in Old Port, we liked his building and the exposed old wooden beams in his apartment. We would stay here again.
Fabulous little place right in the middle of Old Montreal. Loved the fact that they had all sorts of breakfast items and coffee for us!
Location was amazing. The loft was comfortable, had everything we needed and perfect for our visit.

Yanick's house was perfectly located to explore old Montreal with easy access to the metro, bike rentals, etc. The house was more than we expected with a very comfortable bed and a very clean, organized house. The little things he left for us were very welcome to start the day.

Thank you for being such a great host.
Great location, easily accessible, comfortable, and clean.

Yanick was the perfect host and his property is unbeatable in terms of location, cleanliness, and amenities. You will find yourself right in the heart of the best of historic Old Montreal. We will definitely be back.

Very nice welcome from Yanick. Lovely apartment in the heart of old Montreal. It was nice having milk and breakfast food available. The area felt very safe. Near lots of restaurants. Yanick was very helpful with our request for a later checkout due to flight time. A great host!

Thank you, Yanick, for the amazing hospitality! We had a great time with our friends, there were three of us. The breakfast options were excellent, and surprisingly diverse according to everyone: bread, pancakes, yogurt, waffles, and even some fruit. The Nespresso coffee machine provided a boost to the morning. The bed was very comfortable, it fit two people comfortably for sleeping. A futon/sofa served as a third sleeping spot. We loved the amenities of the apartment. Communication with Yanick was easy and quick. The location was central but quiet. Thank you! We had a wonderful weekend in Montreal!
Perfect location and space for a nice weekend in Montreal
Great place to stay - spacious and well-equipped plus very convenient to the Old Town and the Metro. Wonderful view too!

Yannick is easy to access.

A nice and clean apartment, very well located. I would go back there if needed. 

Thank you

Great place in an excellent location with all amenities available in a studio-sized apartment. Yanick was a great host who went above and beyond, providing a well-stocked kitchen. I would definitely stay again

We had a truly wonderful stay at Yannick's place! I would highly recommend it, and Yannick was an excellent host and very helpful. The apartment was exactly as advertised, very clean and comfortable, and had extra amenities like coffee and food for breakfast, which was really convenient.  The location is also perfect and in the heart of Vieux Montreal, within walking distance to shops, restaurants, monuments, galleries, etc.

Location: A+
Comfort: A+
Host: A+
We thoroughly enjoyed our two-day stay at the loft, it felt much like being in Europe. We would love to return and will miss the Nespresso machine!
We loved this apartment. It was perfectly situated, full of charm and had a really comfortable bed. We really appreciated the little extras like coffee and breakfast food.
Yanick's apartment was perfect and exactly as described. Its location is unbeatable, and I really enjoyed my stay!

Perfect. My stay was just a bit better than expected - I say that because you can read MANY positive reviews about Yanick's place on this page. The 'bit better' part was experiencing Yanick's generosity in sharing information, food (fridge stocked "this is all for you") and heart. His kindness set me up for success in all my interactions with the Montrealers. Stay here if you can.

5-star location in the heart of Old Montreal. Short walk to the metro station. There's more than enough to see and eat in Old Port that you could essentially spend an entire weekend walking the cobblestone streets. 

Yannick's loft is well kept and the amenities are thoughtful and convenient, such as the espresso machine and breakfast. 

Highly recommend.

Yanick is a special host in the Airbnb community. I have stayed at many places on Airbnb over the past 5 years. This has to be the best valued Airbnb I've ever been in. Yanick provides all the urban amenities needed, and special touches throughout the studio. One of the best features of this studio in fall is the live music outside the window in the public square. When I was in the studio, I left the windows open (in autumn) and listened to the street performances nearby. The studio was warm, homemade, comfortable, cozy, and fully stocked. I can't wait to return to Montreal and stay at his house again
Perfect in every way... I highly recommend it without any hesitation... I loved my stay at Yanick's

Clean and comfortable loft; conveniently located in Old Montreal within walking distance of the Palais des Congrès, Chinatown, and the Old Port; well-stocked kitchen (bread, milk, juice, jams, eggs, etc.) and all amenities you would expect in a lodging.
Location, location, location. Located in the heart of the Old Port, within walking distance to shops, restaurants, events, and a metro station. Perfect for those who love to walk.
This location is absolutely stunning and the suite is lovely, too. Perfect for my stay on all fronts. Yanick was helpful and kind and responsive. I hope to be back!

Yanick is a very likable host! The place is a lovely home suitable for both single travelers and groups. The location was spectacular, and it was very quiet at night inside the unit. This is the perfect spot to stay in if you're experiencing Montréal for the first time!
Historic and charming! One can almost feel the ghost of Charles Dickens (a one-time visitor) wandering the halls of this former hotel in the heart of Old Montreal!

Lovely, cozy and quiet loft in old Montreal - it was just as described. There were beautiful views and a homey atmosphere. Yanick is a superb host. He was quick and spot on with answers to all my questions and has an extremely welcoming manner. He waited there to greet me despite a fairly late arrival and as other guests have mentioned went the extra mile supplying fruit, milk and breakfast food for the stay. Loved the loft!

Yanick was a very nice man. He met with us when we arrived and provided more than we needed. There was food in the apartment which saved us some money, and everything worked well. One thing to note is the fact that there are no nearby places to buy beer at a wholesale value, meaning there are only bars and restaurants around the apartment. We had to walk over fifteen minutes away to find a place that sold beer (it was in Little China). Other than that, the stay was pretty much perfect, although like Yanick said, the apartment was a little small for four people. Although we managed just fine.
The apartment is very well located, especially when working in the city center. It's located in a historic place of great importance for the Patriots. Thank you!

Yanicks place was very clean and in a perfect location for a nice weekend getaway in the old port of Montreal. He graciously left us food for breakfast and greeted us when we entered. We had everything we needed and more! Would definitely recommend this apartment to family and friends or anyone looking for a great place in a great location!
Great place amazing location!! Espresso and fruits a lovely extra - highly recommended

Yanick was an amazing host during my time in Montreal. He was great with communication and made sure I was satisfied throughout my stay. There were also several thoughtful touches, such as a fully stocked kitchen. 

The place itself is in an ideal location for touring Montreal. It's a beautiful loft in a historic building. You know you're staying in a great place when you see other tourists stop to take pictures from the outside :)

Overall, a wonderful stay and I hope to be back!

I would rate it an 11 out of 5. Yanick met me at his home and walked me through the operations. He left breakfast items, fresh fruit, OJ, coffee, tea, in addition to the usual bedding and such. The location is outstanding! It's the most convenient and charming district; great restaurants, shopping, two museums, plus a spa are within walking distance. The Metro is an easy walk. This is a modern unit with beams from the 17th century. The original structure is otherwise hidden, but Charles Dickens stayed at the same address. Next time I visit Montreal, I hope this unit is available.

This is a great loft in a great location! Yanick makes sure breakfast and coffee are available. It was very warm in such cold weather. There were no issues and Yanick checked in on us throughout our stay, which was nice.

This is a small, very clean and well-located studio located in the heart of Montreal's historic district. The owner is very responsive to messages, friendly, and punctual.

We would have liked to know that this was actually a studio because one bedroom is specified in the listing. However, as it is actually a studio, the bed is in the living room. 

Therefore, we hear the noise of the refrigerator at night intermittently.
The bed located in a corner is not easily accessible for the second person. 
If you are renting in January, it's best to check the dates of the "Igloofest" electronic music festival which takes place on Thursday, Friday and Saturday two weeks in January because we hear some sounds from the stage.

My experience here was wonderful and I highly recommend it to anyone staying in Montreal.  I'd never stayed in this area and wanted to try it out.  Yanick's place was perfectly located just a couple blocks from the Metro.  Also, you could walk out the front door and be directly in the middle of the cobblestones of Old Town.  He was very good about making sure everything was perfect and was kind enough to text me during my stay to make sure I had everything I needed.  When I arrived, there was fruit and breakfast options available, along with simple things like a couple bottles of water and an amazing coffee maker.  He just got all the details right.  Definitely stay here if you can!

We stayed in this lovely loft for one night on our honeymoon and are so glad we did! Everything about this place is fantastic: it's comfortable and clean; it's a quiet unit right in an unbeatable and lively location; Yanick's hospitality and communication is great; five stars all over!
Very cute spot in the heart of the old port. Yannick the host was very helpful. Loved it!

Yanick's place was completely awesome! The space was beautiful, in a great location and had everything you could need for your stay in Montreal. Yanick was easy to communicate with and the check-in process was very simple. It was nice to explore all day and then come back to lay on the couch and watch Netflix on the TV ;)

If we ever travel back to Montreal again, we will definitely be looking to see if this place is available first thing. It was a great stay and the Old Port district is so charming. We walked to the Bell Center for a hockey game from here with no problems, enjoying the downtown sector as well.  It was an altogether pleasant part of our honeymoon.

There is a reason why Yanick and his BNB have a 5-star rating! He is a very gracious host, communicative and very accommodating. The loft is clean, cozy, and in a great location.  
I will be returning upon my next visit to Old Montreal!
Perfect location. Minutes from the subway, restaurants, and shops. Cozy and comfortable space. I would definitely stay there again.

Yanick was a wonderful host! His place is adorable and the location is perfect. It's an easy walk all throughout Old Port, with great access to bars, restaurants, coffee shops, and historical landmarks. The apartment has every amenity you would need and Yanick's communication prior to check-in was superb. Looking forward to booking this place again for future visits :)
I highly recommend Yanick's place. He is very nice and his place is located in one of the best locations in Montreal.

Yanick was a fantastic host, very quick to respond and accommodating, and his place was great. I had been a bit concerned from the photos that it might be chilly being an older place that looked a bit like a converted attic, but when I arrived it was nicely warm and I didn't have to make any temperature adjustments. The place is very private and secure, with the extra benefit of a keyed common entry and keyed private entry. I had expected something like a single room in a hostel-like setting, but it's actually more like a hotel including an elevator. All the photos are accurate and the location is great - easily walkable distances to explore the city. This was my best Airbnb experience yet and I would definitely stay again.
This is the place to be. Loved every minute of the trip. The location is in an exciting part of Montreal as well.
This place is just pretty cool. It's right in the old part of Montreal. We really enjoyed our time here.

This is an exquisite location! It was perfect for walking distance to several wonderful sightseeing destinations. It was really nice to have breakfast items and water left for me. I was very happy with my stay.

My friend and I had such a lovely stay at Yanick's studio apartment in Montreal. It was clean, comfortable, and he generously provided an array of breakfast foods and cooking staples (oil, vinegar) and amenities to actually cook dinner too (which we did). The neighborhood felt extremely safe. Thank you so much for hosting us, Yanick.

Excellent location, 5 minutes from the metro and in the Old Town. Excellent value for money. Friendly welcome, the fridge was stocked with breakfast items! Many thoughtful touches from Yannick, a very clean and comfortable apartment. I recommend it! Ideal for one or two people.

First off, Yanick's description of the location is spot-on! His loft is located right on St. Paul Street in the heart of the old town. If you want the European experience without going overseas, then this is the spot.  Yanick's loft is wonderful. It's comfortable and well appointed with anything you may need if you forget to pack something :-) As a host he was kind enough to wait for us when we were arriving late (which we very much appreciated) and he gave us some good tips on the surrounding area. Finally, you cannot beat the value. What Yanick offers is unbelievable at the price - you cannot go wrong here.
Nice place near everything!
Yanick was a wonderful host, and his home was so beautiful and in the perfect location. We loved everything about it and it really made our trip special!

Cozy studio apartment with all the amenities needed to comfortably spend a day indoors or return to rest after a busy day of exploring. The neighborhood is quiet and very peaceful at night. We enjoyed being removed from the liveliness of downtown at the end of a busy day. We didn't spend a great deal of time in Old Montreal as we found it expensive and preferred to explore the more culturally diverse areas of Montreal. It was easy to walk to most of the areas that we had more interest in exploring. Overall, Yanick's home was cozy with lots of extras (Nespresso, fruits, milk, eggs, cereal, etc). It was very clean and Yanick was responsive and punctual. We weren't left waiting for him to arrive and greet us after our long drive, which we appreciated.

The apartment is great, perfect location, 5 minutes walking to the metro, 10 minutes to Notre-Dame, and 2 minutes from the Ferris wheel. Despite being a very touristy area, it's very quiet at night, perfect for relaxing! The apartment had cereals, coffee, juice, and yogurt! It's worth every penny!

Lovely apartment, walking distance from all the tourist attractions but also very quiet and fully equipped, if you ever want to escape the crowd and spend an evening at home. The perfect place to explore old Montreal! Also, Yanick is a great host: he's always available and flexible about my check-in and check-out time.

Yanick's place is a cozy studio apartment near everything in Old Montreal. You can't beat this location. Open the door, and you're in front of Marche Bonsecours. It's perfect for two people. Everything you need to cook a meal is in the kitchen and the bathroom has everything you forgot to bring. Yanick was there to greet us when we arrived to show us around and explain the Nespresso machine to us (which we needed). The water bottles and coffee he provided came in handy! We would definitely stay here again.

The stay was perfect, Yanick is a very nice person, the flat is prepared perfectly! 

Thank you!
Great location - Host was easy to communicate with. Handsome decor. Just loved it

This was our first Airbnb experience and I’m glad it went smoothly. Our host, Yanick is very nice. 
The place is very clean. Plenty of hot water and excellent water pressure. The location is perfect, everything is close by, you are right on Old Montreal East.

We are so thankful for the breakfast items provided as we could not find a restaurant nearby that served breakfast (we only checked the street of St. Paul), so we went back to our room and made egg sandwiches, yum!

We will definitely be back and would definitely recommend this place! ❤️

This place is amazing. We can't fault it! A beautiful apartment right in the middle of the old part of town - so accessible. Teena brought us everything we needed for breakfast and made us very welcome when we arrived. Oh, and the shower was probably the best one I've ever had (website hidden by Airbnb) powerful! There's a lot of thought that's been put into this listing and it really all adds up to make a perfect stay!

Surrounded by history and culture, Yanick's place is in a perfect location in Old Montreal. There are countless restaurants, bars, galleries and churches nearby (within five minutes or less), and Ste-Catherine is only a 15-minute walk away. Yanick was kind enough to stay up and let us in well after his regular check-in time—great host.

This is a very cute little apartment in the heart of all the action of Old Montreal. The location literally could not have been better as it is at the back of the building (so it is quiet), but only steps from great restaurants, shopping, and entertainment. Yanick is a great host. He not only provides sightseeing tips, but umbrellas, bottled water, high-end coffee, and breakfast items. We truly enjoyed our stay and will be back.
Excellent location. Walkable to everything. Very clean apartment. Nice extras in the fridge for breakfast.

Beautiful space and AMAZING location! Yanick is such a thoughtful host. He was there to explain everything when I checked in and was very understanding when my flights to Montreal were delayed three times and I checked in very late. The place is very clean and tidy, and the bed and pillows are very comfortable. I would love to stay there again when I'm in Montreal. Beautiful eats around the apartment and it's very close to all the tourist destinations in the city. Loved my stay!

Our stay at Yanick's was wonderful! It was such an amazing location to explore Montreal from - so close to the metro and within walking distance of many great galleries, museums, parks, restaurants and, of course, the Old Port! We would definitely love to stay here again! Thanks so much for the great stay!
This is the best Airbnb we've ever stayed at. Yanick is an amazing host who went above and beyond in every way. I can't recommend this place highly enough!
Great location in the heart of Old Port. Super close to public transportation, restaurants, and bars. The space is nice and bright, and Yannick thoughtfully provided supplies for our stay.

Excellent compromise. 
Functional apartment ideally located to discover Montreal to the fullest.
Fantastic studio in the heart of the old city. Yanick was kind and met us to show us the place and give us the keys. Thank you, Yanick!

The location of Yanick's sweet little loft was incredibly convenient for exploring. We didn't take our car out of the garage once we arrived, walking to great sights to see, places to shop, and of course, great food. A very comfortable bed after a day full of activity was a huge plus. If we get a chance to visit Montreal again in the near future, I'd certainly hope The Loft would be available.
Incredible location! Perfect. Yanick made the entry easy and we had no problems. Highly recommend!
Amazing place in the heart of old downtown! Yanick is quick to respond and his apartment has everything you need!
This location is as good as it gets for visiting the Old City of Montreal. In addition, the apartment was generously stocked with breakfast food.

Nice and clean loft in a perfect location. It's right on Saint Paul Street. Comfortable bed. Has all the necessary amenities. Thoughtful host, Yanick met us at check-in and shared some local tips. I would definitely recommend it.
The perfect place for a Montreal getaway!

If you have never been to old historic Montréal, this is the place in the heart of it.
The metro is within walking distance, clean, and will take you SAFELY to Park Mont Royal, large, green, and safe (bus 11) or the botanical gardens. Walk downtown, eat in Chinatown, shop on rue St. Catherine. Airport taxis take you to the front door, literally, for $30 USD.
Yannick had lots of breakfast supplies, including a great Nespresso machine.
Yanick's place is in an amazing location in the heart of Old Montreal. The place was very cute and the check-in process was very easy! I would stay there again!

I stayed with my wife for 5 nights in September 2018. The apartment is on the 4th floor (with elevator) in excellent condition. The location is perfect, right in the heart of Montreal's Old Port area, within walking distance to many restaurants, bars, and shops. We always had bottles of water, Nespresso coffee, cereal, juice, yogurt, fruit... the host was very attentive and concerned with details. I would stay there again on my next trip.
We enjoyed our stay very much. The thoughtful amenities and breakfast options were appreciated. We liked the wooden floors.

Yanick's place was exactly as described. Fantastic location in Old Montreal with a ton of restaurants and bars conveniently close by. Check-in was easy and Yanick provided everything that was needed, including breakfast foods and drinks in the refrigerator. He also responded very quickly to questions that I had during my stay. The place was clean and cozy. I highly recommend his place if you travel alone or with 1 to 2 others.
Convenient location and very clean!

This is a fabulous little apartment in a dream location. Right in the heart of Old Montreal, you're surrounded by places to explore, restaurants to dine at, and walks along the waterfront. The kitchen was such a treat, so well stocked - I saved money and time by eating at home occasionally. And the style, with those beams!, was excellent. Couldn't have been happier.
Great location if you want to be in the heart of Old Montreal. I would definitely stay there again.
Great location, clean and charming unit with a nice view of the street life. Enjoyed my stay. Easy check-in process.

We loved Yanick's place! A great location to get anywhere with really affordable parking nearby. Right in the heart of everything, but incredibly quiet at night. We can't recommend it enough as a perfect spot to land in Montreal!

This loft is in a great location. We stayed two nights and enjoyed the space and Netflix in the evening after spending all day walking and eating our way through Montreal's charming neighborhoods. 

The directions to the loft were excellent and Yanick was waiting for us to check in when we arrived early.
Check out was straightforward too.

Would recommend this for a romantic getaway.
Amazing location and a great host. Clean, very comfortable bed, with breakfast food in the fridge. Thank you Yanick for your great hospitality.
Perfect location!

A fantastic location and a great little base for your holiday! Yanick is a great host and is easy to communicate with. And as a bonus, he thoughtfully provides provisions for breakfast which makes your stay so much easier! The location of the apartment is amazing and transport was really easy with the nearby Metro station. I would definitely stay here again.

Best Airbnb I have stayed in! Can't beat the location if you want to see Vielle Ville. On the oldest street in the city. Everything was superb in the space—all I needed plus quality soaps/options/bath products/tea/Nespresso machine, soft sheets, eggs, cheese, cereal, more than I’ve seen in a typical Airbnb. Well-designed space, comfortable, amazing views from the window.  I just might go back!
Had a great stay! Beautiful location and charming space.
Great place & location for anyone wanting to explore old Montreal. Will definitely spread the word.
Great place, great location, great host
Yanick's place was a nice location downtown. The apartment wasn't ready until several hours past check-in. Yanick was friendly and helpful. The place was cozy.
Perfect cozy space in Old Montreal! Yanick is a great host and the apartment is clean, spacious, and very cute! Couldn't have imagined a better place for my stay in Montreal!

Yanick's apartment was wonderful. It is a great, cozy place for two people and in a good location. Everything was very walkable and Yanick offered suggestions for food and activities. The apartment was clean and stocked with breakfast amenities.
Perfect everything! If I go back to Montreal, I will still stay here. Five-star recommendation!

Yanick's place is perfect for solo travelers as well as couples, with a cozy feel to it. The location is perfect, check-in and check-out were a breeze, and communication was excellent. The place itself is very well equipped with everything you need for a comfortable stay. All in all, this was one of the best Airbnbs I stayed at, and I would love to come back and stay here on my next visit to Montreal.

I was very busy at a conference during my week-long stay, so I hope to stay there again sometime. The location was amazing, the place was perfect for my needs, very reasonably priced, and having a bit of starting food in the fridge was extremely useful especially when just arriving. Really great!!!
Great host, great location, great apartment!

Yanick's place was absolutely wonderful. As soon as you walk in, you're in a much larger loft than the pictures can show. There were nice breakfast amenities during the stay, as well as the place being very clean. Lastly, the location is mere steps from just about everything in Vieux Montréal, and even then, public transportation and the more hip downtown are within a 10-20 minute walk.
Fantastic location in the heart of Old Montreal near an abundance of restaurants, bars, and other shops. The complimentary coffee and breakfast were appreciated. Highly recommend!
He was very helpful with local restaurants and parking. There was a lot of stuff in the kitchen for breakfast, which was amazing.
Nice place in Old Montreal. Thanks Yannick
Won't be disappointed with the location or studio
great place
Fantastic space, fantastic location.
Nice, clean space. Enjoyed the clear instructions and parking tips. Definitely would recommend again.

Our first night we walked to the port to ice skate, then to a great little brasserie for dinner and music. It was so nice to have both at our fingertips. The location was out of the way for the heavy tourism which made for nice and quiet nights. 

The mattress is firm, so please take that into account if it matters to you. 

Thanks for a nice clean apartment during our stay in Montreal!
Great stay - thank you Yanick!

Yanick's place was so good and it is within walking distance of many tourist attractions and even a metro station. He is also very accommodating, helping me check in even outside the designated check-in times.

Very nice and clean apartment. The apartment is very well located and Zaki welcomed us very warmly and gave us tips for visiting Montreal. 

It was a great stay! I highly recommend this apartment!
Zaki is a very nice host, available and welcoming. The flat has a perfect location to enjoy this beautiful city. Recommend!

Super apartment, extremely quiet and a joy for my parents who loved their stay. 
Perfect resemblance to the photos. 
Located two steps from the metro and Mont Royal Avenue, perfect for all shopping! 
Very clean. Highly recommend!

My host, Zaki, was welcoming and responsive.  I had a very late arrival (close to midnight) and he was there to greet me and show me to the place. The place was just as it was described and was away from street noise and quiet which was great when I needed to sleep. The place is situated in a great spot with easy access to the metro and Bixi bike rental, which I used. Cafes and places to eat are a block away. Overall it was a great experience, with a great host, in a great place!

Lovely apartment, sparkling clean, well equipped and with a super comfy bed! Well located on a pretty street very close to the Metro, it doesn't overlook the street so very quiet (not that it's a noisy street!) Great to have a laundry room right next to the flat - $1 each for wash and dry. Fast wifi. We loved it there. Highly recommended!

Very well-located apartment on the plateau, and incredibly quiet. Parking is very easy to find nearby. Excellent communication with the owner. Ideal for a couple's weekend getaway, but the space is limited; I would hesitate to stay there longer unless alone. I recommend it if you plan to enjoy the neighborhood.
Very nice neighborhood close to all amenities.

The host arranged for his brother to be waiting for us at the door with the keys. It was very convenient. The neighborhood is central to the plateau in Montreal, and yet it was quite quiet...just as advertised.

Very accommodating! We arrived late and Zaki was very nice and patient. The apartment was true to the photos and in a great location! The host was very helpful. We stayed one night, there was free parking out front. It worked out great!

Really great location!
Close to the metro and Bixi bike is on the corner of the street!
Mont Royal was a really nice neighborhood and with being polite to everyone about not speaking French, the hospitality industry was happy to speak English with a polite attitude.
Zaki was able to meet us before our stay and let us know any small details about the place, a clean and tidy apartment perfect for two for a week getaway!
Would come back to stay here in a heartbeat! :)
Translation: It was easy and awesome!

Zaki very kindly met up with us to deliver the keys and gave us a few tips on where to go to enjoy the neighborhood. We loved the street and the neighborhood where Zaki's place was! The apartment was comfortable and had basic amenities such as towels and wifi. Highly recommended place for a weekend getaway to true Montreal!

The place was everything we needed. It's a nice quiet neighborhood with street parking. Zaki helped us understand the parking signs. The kitchen was equipped with what we needed to enjoy our market goodies. The porch pictured faces the back yard, which allowed us to sleep with the doors open and screen closed. I suggest bringing dvds or a tablet for movies because there is no cable. There are many bars and restaurants you can easily walk to. Great stay!

Zaki has been phenomenal. 
The apartment was clean, central as advertised.
Highly recommended.
Zaki is flexible with our check-in and check-out times, easy to communicate with. The house is clean and tidy, and it has everything you need. Great host.

Zaki was an excellent and wonderful host! The apartment had everything you could need for a stay in the best neighborhood of Montreal. It was clean, organized, and fully equipped with all the essentials. A short walk to shops, bars, and restaurants. I would definitely stay again!
Zaki was a great host. The studio was clean and in a convenient location. I would definitely recommend it.

Zaki's place was great! Very clean, comfortable and quiet, and exactly what we needed. Zaki was very easy to deal with and always quick to respond to any questions we had. He was very accommodating with check-in/check-out times and the neighborhood is amazing! So close to the metro and lots of great coffee shops, bars and restaurants right around the corner. Would stay here again for sure! Highly recommend!

I loved the location, near subway and restaurants and bars. The stairs to the door were very steep and not suitable for elders or drunks. The unit was not bright or cheery. The TV should have cable TV or at least HD cables for your computer. Also toilet paper would be a bonus!

Zakis apartment was clean and functional, although a bit sparsely decorated. It was a great place for us to crash during a weekend in Montreal, as we could walk to all the best bars, restaurants, and boutiques in and around Le Plateau and Mile End within 35 minutes. In fact, we hardly left the area except for a shorter visit to the old city. The check-in process could have been smoother as we had not received adequate information on which floor or apartment was assigned to us, however, Zaki was quick to reply when we texted for more info and was very flexible regarding our stay.

Very friendly place to stay, true to the description. Zaki was particularly accommodating and very nice. 

The only small downside is the bedding which didn't seem to have been changed despite fees being charged for that. 

Access is via a colossal staircase, so bring an extra strong friend if you have any suitcases to carry up.

The apartment is very well located in the Plateau neighborhood. The metro is right outside and the neighborhood is full of restaurants and bars. 

Access to the apartment is simple. Everything you need is present, everything was clean and comfortable.

We didn't get a chance to meet Zaki but he remained available and responsive to our messages. 

I highly recommend it!

The apartment is exactly as seen in the pictures. The location of the place is superb, a 5-minute walk from Mont Royal station and in the midst of a great cafe/restaurant scene. There are multiple gems on the side streets of Mont Royal Rue too! Overall, we had a great time in Montreal and this place was exactly as we expected!

For future guests:

It's a no-frills, basic place with most amenities. The cable TV does not work and there were no toiletries - so bring your own shampoo and soap! Per previous reviews, the steps leading up to the apartment are extremely steep, so it is difficult if you have a large suitcase.

Very close to the metro. There are some excellent local diners in the area. Zaki was very easy to reach. We had some internet problems when we first arrived due to a snowstorm, but he fixed them as soon as he could. The TV didn't turn on, but we didn't really need it. Overall, great stay.

When we arrived at Zaki's place the temperature was about -10 degrees Fahrenheit. The apartment heated up quickly and was very cozy. It is clean, simple, and well-equipped. Some amenities we appreciated were two bedside lamps, hooks in the bathroom, and an extra comforter for the bed. The apartment is in an excellent location--near Avenue Mont Royal, Rue Rachel, and Rue du Duluth. There are so many appealing restaurants nearby. It is also very close to the beautiful Parc La Fontaine. We had planned to be out and about far more than we were, but due to the frigid temperatures, we were inside quite a bit and it was so comfortable and pleasant. We hope to be back!

This is a great location in Montreal. Close to great restaurants and not far from downtown. Zaki was great and made it very easy to check in and out. The apartment was very clean and much more cost than a hotel. Couple things to note, parking is a problem as street parking is for permit holders so you risk getting a ticket. Also the tv didn't work for us. It turned on but we couldn't switch the media source to use the DVD player. Wasn't a big deal as we were only there for the night but something to note for longer stays. All around a great place to stay. Thank you Zaki!!

The neighborhood is amazing. We walked everywhere - lots of cafes, shops, etc. The street is also nice and very typical of Le Plateau. It's a stretch to call the apartment "Grand Luxe" as it's very basic and functional. It would have been helpful to have better instructions for the lockbox as we had lots of difficulty getting into the apartment. The TV didn't work for us and there were no instructions for the WiFi, but it was clean and quiet.

Zaki's studio apartment was clean and cozy when we arrived. It's small but has everything you need. It's in a multi-unit building, but it was very quiet. And the location is terrific!—very close to the Mont-Royal metro station and St-Denis street so you have quick access to the whole city.  And there are plenty of great places to eat right in the neighborhood as well. 

Parking is on the street which can be a challenge, as per usual for Montreal. Just read the signs closely and be prepared to park a couple of blocks away. 

Zaki was very gracious to me about my stilted French and we managed to communicate well, so don't worry if you're not a French speaker. My husband and I highly recommend booking with Zaki. Merci mille fois, Zaki!
The apartment was ideal for a weekend in Montreal. It is well-equipped and clean, though not "luxurious" as described. The neighborhood is charming and vibrant, but the apartment is peaceful.
Zaki was an amazing host! Incredibly responsive and very helpful. The apartment was perfect, clean, and in the best location in Montreal! Highly recommend!

The studio was as described. A perfect place for exploring Montreal and feeling relaxed and comfortable after a long day touring. We found the studio to be in a very quiet area. The neighborhood was pleasant and refreshing. Zaki had left great instructions on making arrangements for the keys. No problems at all and no surprises. Everything required was available in the studio.
Great, comfortable little spot. Excellent location. Clean. Zaki was easy to contact via messaging. Would definitely stay again in a heartbeat.

Pleasant studio, quiet and well-located on the plateau between Mont-Royal metro station and "La Banquise," a must-visit for poutine lovers.  Please note that access to the interior courtyard is not permitted. Zaki is easily reachable and always has a solution. However, there was a slight inconvenience: the minimum amount needed to make coffee or tea upon arrival was not guaranteed. We had to resort to the convenience store, which was the only downside to our short stay at Zaki's place.  Zaki's apartment is highly recommended.

We didn't see or meet Zaki which was fine as we were busy. The place was pretty clean although the corners had dust and the cracks of the chairs had crumbs. One block form the Metro station with bixi bikes even closer. Galley kitchen with pots, pans, glasses, cutlery etc but no supplies (salt, pepper, sugar, oil etc.) Good for reheating leftovers or pre made meals. It was quiet as it's in the back of the building although there is only one window, the sliding door in the bedroom, and when the heat exchanger for the building is running it is fairly loud as it's directly below the door. When we were there the screen door was unusable, just leaning against the side of the building and the garbage can was full, stinky and 3 feet from the sliding bedroom door. Fortunately it wasn't really hot while we were there so we only had to close the door once because of the stink. I noticed a bike rack in the backyard, good spot if you brought your own bikes although at $100/night you're probably going to spend another $5/day for a bixi pass if you want to bike.

Great location, clean and great price.  Really tough to beat. I didn't get a chance to meet Zaki, but he was responsive and a great host. 

Highly recommended if you're traveling solo or as a couple.

Very good stay in Montreal and Zaki's apartment was a lot for many people. Faithful to the description, it is clean and has everything necessary for the first day. In a quiet and silent building. The only noise of the morning is the song of birds from the back courtyard. Quite pleasant. Zaki was very clear about key handover and very responsive when I had questions. I will return to Montreal, I will stay at Zaki's again.

The room was clean and in a nice area, but don't be deceived by the street view; it's very small and quite hot, only a fan which barely helped and a TV with no service, just a DVD player and no selection. I guess you get what you pay for. Also, there are very steep stairs to access. Good value for young people with little luggage.

Earlier this month, we stayed in the studio apartment in the Plateau neighborhood of Montreal (hosted by Zaki). We loved the charm of the building and neighborhood (and the cleanliness of the apt).  The studio apt. was the right size for two of us who were more interested in exploring Montreal than staying around in an apt. The apt. is a short walk to the Metro station (at Mont Royal) and a short walk from MANY dining and entertainment options. Zaki even recommended a couple of places for dinner (we chose the "best poutine in Montreal" spot). We knew that the apt. didn't have air conditioning (as stated) but we were disappointed that the only screened opening in this interior apt. was broken. If you are thinking of visiting in the heat of summer, this is less than ideal. The other issue that people traveling by car have to be aware of is the lack of parking in this entire area. There is free parking in limited spots but it is only for certain times of day, so we either had to hang around the neighborhood jumping from spot to spot or risk getting a ticket (they don't tow)...we got ticketed (but were lucky because we only received one ticket in a two-day period). But, even though there were some issues to deal with, we loved the feeling of being a part of this active Montreal neighborhood. P.S. The eclairs at the bakery in Sherbrooke were the best!!

Comfortable and clean place to stay. Many amazing places to eat within a 5-minute walk from the location. The main "downtown" area of Montreal was about a 40-minute walk away.

Parking: there is a spot for about 4 cars right in front of the building where you can park most days and overnight (minus the few hours on the day listed on the street parking sign). 

The host was wonderful with responses. The only thing missing was that we ran out of toilet paper during our 2-night stay because there weren't any extra in the apartment. The host apologized that he hadn't gotten a chance to restock before our arrival.
Very well located housing in a very lively neighborhood, close to the metro and shops, while still being pleasant to live in. The landlord was very accommodating with the hours, thank you!

Zaki's house is located in a prime spot, very close to the metro station and local shops and restaurants. However, it is quite small and some amenities were missing. Zaki was very responsive and tried his best to address some of the issues.
Great stay. Close to everything. Location perfect.

The apartment was absolutely perfect for a weekend in the city. Everything was clean, and the check-in process was quite smooth. The location couldn't have been better. There are tons of cafes, bars, and restaurants within walking distance - we hardly had to use public transportation at all! (Although the metro is conveniently nearby the apartment as well.)

10/10, would recommend. Thanks, Zaki!

"Metro Mont Royal - Super neighborhood near the metro. Zaki has left the keys available. Magnificent building, very pleasant apartment with a private balcony and washer and dryer accessible. Excellent value for money."
Simple and efficient quick organization. The apartment is very quiet and well-located.
Great place with an even better location. Walking distance to all of the main streets. Tons of shops and restaurants nearby. Would definitely stay again.

The location of this space is AMAZING...the space is perfect, it has everything you need...but it was a bit pricey and some things need to be taken care of in terms of cleanliness...I've informed Zaki...I'm certain he will work on it. 

Also, Zaki was very accommodating and responsive.
Good communication, good location, authentic photos, nothing to say!

The apartment is exactly as described. It is very, very well located in a neighborhood we have greatly enjoyed.

We stayed there for 6 nights during Christmas and were charmed by it. If we were to return to Montreal in winter, we would definitely rebook it, and this makes us want to go back in the summer.
Thank you, this was an excellent experience!
The host cancelled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated message.
Ideal location for staying in Montreal. Clean apartment, well-located, quiet. Highly recommended!
Incredible apartment. We couldn't have found a more perfect place to stay in Montreal. We were close to great restaurants, the neighborhood was great, and the apartment was very clean!
Well-located apartment with a great value for money.

This apartment is amazing for up to 2 people for an indefinite amount of time. The location is amazing, 1 block in any direction to food and sights. The bed is comfortable, with plenty of space in the bedroom. Full bathroom and kitchen, with a breakfast table that was more than you need for a trip where the main purpose is to binge eat! Quiet apartment, never heard or saw any neighbors, and the street is mostly families so no problems with rowdy folks. Multiple "out-of-town" parking spaces located right in front, just read the signs on the street! Easy check-in/check-out/Great communication! We would/are absolutely going to stay here again!

Zaki was wonderful to stay with. We never actually met, but he helped out on very short notice when our other Airbnb messed us around... His communication was great and everything about the place was as advertised. Easy and convenient for us and we were able to secure a parking spot right in front of the apartment
Pleasant, quiet and central location.

Ideal apartment for discovering Montreal. The metro is just 2 steps away. The neighborhood is arguably the most pleasant in the city. Nothing to complain about. Zaki is very nice and accommodating. Highly recommended

The location was great! The apartment was clean for the most part, with the exception of a dirty towel hanging on the back of the bathroom door, no toilet paper upon arrival, and I also found some of other guests' hair on the bed linen (definitely not mine). The apartment has the basic amenities EXCEPT the wifi did not work at all. I reached out to Zaki and he said he was out of town and that he would call me the next day but I never received a phone call or any form of follow-up.

Quiet studio in a good location.
No Wi-Fi or TV. No comfort items upon arrival (drinks, toilet paper, coffee, milk).
The owner was not present for 3 days. Communication was only by SMS.

Zaki's apartment was just as described: clean, comfortable, and perfectly situated. It is just around the corner from a big park and a five-minute walk from the metro as well as the best areas in the city for shopping, eating, and going out. The kitchen had all the cooking utensils we needed to cook but wasn't stocked; if you plan on cooking, bring your salt and pepper, etc. There was an issue with the wifi before we arrived, but Zaki communicated with us and had the issue fixed shortly after we arrived.

Zaki's place is quite nice. It is in a fantastic location! Very close to the Metro, restaurants, bars and shops but on a quiet street. Best of both worlds. Zaki was quite helpful with a couple problems that arose like letting me keep my bags there a few hours past check out.
This is a great studio. Everything you need for a comfortable retreat. It was surprisingly quiet given its central location. Just tucked away above a courtyard. I would definitely stay again.

Quiet housing close to all amenities, shops, restaurants and public transport...

Ideal for 1 or 2 people without any physical problems due to the slope of the exterior staircase.

The kitchen and bathroom are blind rooms.
We stayed in unit 3, and while it wasn't the worst place to stay, it wasn't great either. It's not a home. It looked like a full-time rental with essential needs met, but was not very clean.

Excellent location on the Mount Royal plateau. Quiet apartment with good bedding. Pleasant bathroom.

It is a shame that the apartment is dark. The fan is insufficient during hot days... Air conditioning would be welcome.

Comfortable and practical studio (laundry facilities in the building, very well-equipped kitchen and bathroom), very well located, close to the metro, shops, restaurants and a free swimming pool on Marie-Anne Street. The owner is very available. The neighborhood is very pleasant, perfect for strolling and admiring the houses and gardens and meeting Montrealers, always ready to chat with French speakers! Excellent conditions for accommodation for an excellent stay!

Zaki's place was centrally located in a great neighborhood, and it was quiet at night. I appreciated having a fan in the apartment, as it could get stuffy in the evenings. We had a wonderful stay in Montreal!

Great location, but there were a couple of issues which could easily be corrected by the host for future guests. 

The main problem was that the unit had no air conditioning and it was summertime hot, so we couldn't cool down the place - the net effect was two sleepless nights. I called the host and he texted me that there is no AC and will just have to sleep with the sliding doors open at night to the outside - there are no windows in the unit. There's a fan that we kept on, but it just blows hot air around. I tried a bucket of ice in front of the fan, but couldn't cool down the place.

The other issue is that, given a $40 cleaning fee, while the place looks clean, when I turned on the shower, the water backed up because of hair and gunk in the drain. Some towels didn't smell clean and the bedspread/sheets had some stains. Not a big deal, but when charging a $40 fee, it's not acceptable. 

Overall, we were mainly disappointed because it shouldn't cost the host much to have a small AC unit that can be turned on for hot days and nights, which would have made all the difference.

We unfortunately found ourselves in a situation where our Airbnb was completely uninhabitable, but our host was not willing to provide a refund. On the evening of our arrival, we soon discovered that the bathtub faucets were in such disrepair that the water could not be turned off after use. As the tub filled up quickly with water from the broken faucet and a bad drain, we had to use kitchen pots to bail water out of the tub for 40 minutes until the host arrived. Although Zaki was immediately reachable by phone, we were unable to communicate our issue due to the language barrier. After hanging up to write to Zaki on the Airbnb app, he said he would come to the apartment in 20 minutes. He did arrive after 40 minutes.

He arrived and managed to turn the faucet off by jamming and twisting the shower head toggle and tap at the same time. Clearly, he knew the faucets were broken before but did not bother to fix it. Further, it seemed that he had broken the faucet even more in the process of turning the water off. So at this point, the hot water knob no longer worked and water could only come out of the bottom spout, and not the shower head. Then, Zaki tried to tell us that this was due to "city work" when clearly, anyone could look at the shower and tell that it was in bad shape to begin with. He then suggested we could shower by using the KITCHEN POTS to catch water and pour over ourselves. We told him that we were leaving and he agreed to refund us the rest of the trip (2 nights). Later, when Zaki had left, he messaged to tell us that he would only refund us $200 even though we paid $108 per night plus $100 in service fees and cleaning fees.  We ended up wasting the entirety of our first day and a half in Montreal dealing with the bathtub situation and filing a complaint with Airbnb customer service. Luckily, they were extremely helpful and got us the full refund. 

Another thing to note is that the apartment was not clean. There is a strong odor that is noticeable as soon as you walk in. The coffee maker used by the previous guest and was left dirty.

Zaki's place was great - quiet, clean, just as advertised. Loved the neighborhood too.

Zaki was very attentive and quick to respond as well.
It was a perfect location and a comfortable bed. I walked virtually everywhere I wanted to go (grocery stores, restaurants, bars, etc).

Just for the neighborhood, it is a great place to stay. It is perfectly located on the Plateau Mont-Royal, near so many restaurants and hot spots, near the subway or within walking distance of downtown. The home itself is a bit small, but very clean and quiet. We had a few problems with the shower (hot water not closing), but we were warned by Zaki about it (even if a bit late: two hours before arrival). Except for these few details, we had a great weekend in Montreal!
My stay was great! Zaki always got back to me when I tried contacting him. Would definitely stay again!

Zaki's studio is really very well located on the Plateau, close to the Mont Royal metro and many restaurants. 
The studio is good for sleeping (during the day it is very dimly lit). 
During our stay (3 nights), garbage cans were left abandoned in front of the house, which was quite messy compared to the rest of the street. 
We didn't see Zaki but he was available via messages and explained check-in/check-out very well. 
It's not a "grand luxury" studio, but rather good for a few nights.
Amazing location! Zaki responded to messages very quickly and solved our problem very soon.

My accommodation is really well located, a 5-10 minute walk from the metro station. It's a bit shady, but very quiet, I didn't hear a single noise in 3 nights.

Zaki is really available at any time, which is very appreciated!
Perfect location! Literally walking distance from the metro, must-try restaurants and shops.
Super apartment for a short stay in Montreal!
Nice place to stay in Montreal! Quiet and close to nice places in the "Plateau". Highly recommended to everyone!
Quiet apartment in a pleasant neighborhood.
Perfect stay in a perfect studio, just right for a couple or a solo traveler visiting Montreal for a few days!

This apartment is located in a nice spot between two main areas. Zaki communicated well with us and had excellent food recommendations! However, the place was not as clean as we would have liked with leftover food in the cupboard and microwave, and an unclean bedspread. Other than that, we enjoyed everything available in the kitchen and the easy location.
Zaki was a wonderful host. He went above and beyond to ensure his guests were happy. The apartment was fantastic, and we had a lovely time in Montreal. I would highly recommend the place.
Well-located and quiet location. Very helpful host who responds quickly. The kitchen is manageable for basic cooking if needed.
Loved our stay at your place, luxurious apartment and great location and great communication. Thank you Zaki.
Ideally located studio - air conditioning would be a plus in hot weather

I was in Montreal in November 2018! Zaki, the owner, was very welcoming and helpful! He came to meet me, told me everything, was attentive and responsive! The apartment is in a very convenient location; everything you need is available; beautiful apartments and the owner! I recommend
Very beautiful apartment! Spacious, bright, extremely well located in Montreal. We also received excellent welcome!

The place was huge! You got a whole flat all to yourself, with warm lighting, everything was clean and spacious, and a cute cat to be your roommate. Aside from minor hiccups like the cat throwing up everywhere, it was perfect.

Lovely space - bright, clean, spacious with lots of interesting and beautiful plants.  A great area that is very accessible by public transit and has good local hangouts. Great value for the money. Yaan was a very good communicator and made check-in and check-out easy for us.

We had a lovely stay at Yann’s place. The apartment is very large and bright with lots of house plants. Gizmo the cat is very friendly and a nice addition to the apartment. Yann was very helpful and explained everything thoroughly. Very comfortable bed and ample amenities. Short walk to the metro station, Mile End and Little Italy. Would stay again!
Great place
Very clean and comfortable place. Great location.
Simple and complete apartment, Yann is a very friendly person and his cat is adorable! The place is quiet and close to the metro, perfect for visiting Montreal. I recommend

A beautiful apartment in a lively neighborhood. The host Yann was incredibly welcoming and helpful. The rooms were spacious, clean, and comfortable. Highly recommend and will definitely return in the future. P.S. Gismo the cat is the best housemate ever!
Great location, good value and very comfortable place to stay in Montreal. Host was also very easy to communicate with. Would not hesitate to go back.
Nice and cozy place, great host and good location.
Staying at Yann's place was like being in a cozy cottage in the countryside. It was spacious, quiet, and charming with a very welcoming and friendly host!
Yann's place was well-stocked and easy to find. We used the back entrance for parking, which was convenient, and he communicated well from start to finish. Recommended!
Yang's place is awesome. It's very clean and the location is great. He's the best host I've ever had. Also, the cat Gizmo is so cute!
Good
Vero was out of town when I arrived, so I didn't get a chance to meet her in person. I got the keys from the neighbor. The place was decent and clean. Amazing location close to everything.

My girlfriend and I stayed at Véro's for a couple of nights. Everything was as we expected. Although she was out of town, her boyfriend was there to receive us and show us around. He was very kind and available via phone for the duration of our stay. The apartment is cute and clean with character. The neighborhood is interesting and has plenty of cafes, restaurants, bars, shops. It feels completely safe. Close to the center and subway stations, making it very convenient. Completely recommended. 

Thank you Véro for letting us stay in your lovely place!
Vero was a really great host! She prepared everything and the room was very clean! Her neighbor was also a kind person. 😊 I will definitely stay here again when I return to Montreal!

Vero welcomed us into her cozy and comfortable home with open arms, and we gladly fell into this place of warmth and well-being. Her workshop-style home is colorful and full of board games and books which kept us busy through the cold bleak storms of winter. She gave us great recommendations for local attractions (Drawn and Quarterly For the Win)  and Depaneur Cafe.

Overall, it was a lovely stay. Vero is awesome, very helpful, and very attentive to the needs of her guests. 5 stars

We loved staying at Vero's place! Vero was super communicative with us. We didn't get to meet her because of holiday travels but her friend met us at her place and gave us a ton of recommendations for where to go and showed us how to use the keys. The area was really nice and close to all the fun neighborhoods. We had a short stay but we were able to walk to all the different neighborhoods suggested to us (even in the snow!) and check out a lot of independent book stores and really great coffee places. The apartment is exactly as pictured and a very nice place to stay for the weekend. We hope to come back and possibly stay at Vero's workshop in the Village again!
