If the futon was a more comfortable pull-out couch and there were curtains over the windows, this would be a great Airbnb. It suited me fine for 2 nights but I was happy to return to a real bed!

This location is absolutely wonderful! It is next to a number of boutique shops and the food around there is great. Getting around town is very easy because the location is a 3 minute walk from the metro. Anastasia's place is extraordinarily clean and the studio is decorated very well. Super great value!

Anastasia's place is very nice and centrally located. However, a couple of details could be improved: we found the bed to be a little too small for two, and not extremely comfortable. Also, the heating made a noise that was distracting, especially at night when trying to sleep. Perhaps adding some blinds to make it darker for sleeping would also be helpful? Other than that, great place!
This is a very cool space in a nice area that's fun to walk around in and close enough to other interesting parts of Montreal.
Great place to stay in the Plateau-Mont-Royal! Very clean and stylish!
The location is perfect. Close to tons of nice restaurants and public transportation. It's easy to get around everywhere. And the space is quite unique. I really love the plants
Beautiful place and Anastasia really took great care of me.
Excellent responsiveness and availability from Anastasia. Everything was perfect.
Great location and clean, stylish space.

Great communication, beautiful, inspiring space with everything you need in downtown Montreal. Close to restaurants and public transportation. Cannot wait to stay again soon and visit Au Pied du Cochon. (If you haven't been there...go there!)

I had a wonderful stay at Anastasia's stylish little place (Website hidden by Airbnb) has endearing personal touches and happy plants! The location is amazing...right near great restaurants and shopping...

Anastasia was always easy to reach, generous and helpful. A true treasure for the price.
Perfect location, cozy artistic spot. Very clean, can't wait to stay here again!

William was very available, even though he couldn't be present on the day we arrived, he left us everything we needed. The apartment is very functional and very nice. It is very well located, a few minutes from the metro and shops. Ideal for a stay in Montreal! Thank you for everything, William!

William was an excellent host throughout the entire experience. He greeted us upon arrival and was easy to contact during our stay. He provided us with some information on public transportation, a list of his favorite spots, and even some great music! The apartment is simple, neat, and clean with plenty of amenities. It's located in a quintessential Montreal neighborhood with manageable parking around the corner. Be sure not to park right in front (Hutchinson), as it's resident-only and we got a parking ticket within 20 minutes because it's permit-parking only. Around the corner, there is pay-by-space parking and some other free spots. We used Uber and our car to get around, but the metro is close and seems very manageable. William is a great resource for anything you may need to know about the area.
The host cancelled this reservation 3 days before arrival. This is an automated message.
The host cancelled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated message.

The apartment was very well equipped with everything you need, and I could contact William for any problems.

Very happy to have been there

For short or long stays, I highly recommend this apartment. You feel as though you live like the locals, and it has everything you would need. The bed is comfortable and there's plenty of space for lounging.

It's a short walk to the metro, and easy to car share to. Good option.

We had a great experience at William's place. His apartment is steps from a centrally located subway stop (and grocery store - bonus!), yet very quiet and safe. I am a light sleeper and was surprised at how quiet it was (Email hidden by Airbnb) communication was great from the moment I tried to book. There was a glitch on Airbnb's side and William worked with them to correct the problem within a few hours.  I never had to wait long for a response to any of my questions.  I even had a few over the holidays while he was traveling, and he replied quickly! If you're looking for a well-located, tidy, cozy apartment with a comfy bed, stocked kitchen and plenty of room for two, this is your place. I plan to visit Montreal again soon (I hope!) and I would not seek a different spot to stay unless I had to!
Very clean and quiet place near downtown area. Fantastic for 1-2 people exploring Montreal!
William is a wonderful host and his home was perfect for our stay. I would highly recommend staying here!

Excellent location, next to Notre Dame and the old Montreal. In front of the Palais de Congress. For cold days there is quick access to the RESO that takes you to the Desjardins Center where there's a market. We were as a couple with a baby. The apartment was super equipped. We only missed a sofa for the end of the day.

A simple way to get the keys at the welcome desk near the apartment. Alejandro was quick to respond if we had questions. Parking was possible on-site for a reasonable price. The apartment was really clean and bright and had everything from pots to cutting boards... The location is perfect for visiting Old Montreal.

Unfortunately, the bed was a bit hard and shaky; if someone turned around, you could hear the fridge and air conditioning during nighttime. 

Despite these two things, we really enjoyed our stay in Montreal.
Loved the place and its location. Very close to everything.

This place made our stay in Montreal beyond perfect. What a perfect location and such a great experience. 
Highly recommend!

Great apartment/suite in a perfect location on the edge of Old Montreal, within walking distance to both downtown, Notre Dame, and all other sights in Old Montreal. There was a Metro stop literally 2-3 minutes away, which was convenient for getting nearly anywhere else in the city. 

The apartment itself was clean, spacious, and comfortable. It looked and felt like a hotel suite (was even in the Embassy Suites building, I believe). 18th floor with a nice view of Mont Royal (could see the cross out of our window). Gym on site and onsite underground parking available (though at an additional charge of $30/day). Laundry in the apartment was an added benefit. 

Alejandro was responsive leading up to the trip and very friendly. It was a bit harder to reach him during our stay, but he works with a company (Corporate Stays) that was reachable during their business hours, and Corporate Stays was able to assist with any of our questions/concerns.

Though the apartment is a bit pricey, I thought the location was excellent and the space was comfortable. Thanks Alejandro and Corporate Stays!

Stayed there for a month, perfect location in Old Montreal, close to everything you need, especially the metro station. The place had an hotel feel to it and the view was great (I was on the 20th floor). I had some issues with the WiFi but they gave me a number to call for customer service and the issue was quickly fixed.

Managed by a corporate rental company. Key pickup is at another location 7 minutes walk away. They require photo ID for keys. The building is primarily short-term rentals. A 2-minute walk to Notre Dame and the Metro. Great location. The unit was clean. The front door was off its hinges, making it difficult to open and close. Kitchen cabinet hinges were also broken. The bathtub turns into a swimming pool after 2 minutes. No microwave. Wifi did not work. The layout is like a 600 sq ft condo. Great space. Clean appliances, good cable package. King-sized bed. Lots of pillows, very quiet at night. Location, location, location! I would go back and hope the bathtub was unclogged. :)

Richard lives next door... It's very convenient for us to be welcomed in this quiet place, we truly feel like we are in the countryside right in the heart of Montreal... 

It is recommended...

Excellent experience. The apartment was very clean and even better than the photos. Just two blocks off of Saint Catherine in a perfect location. Richard was a great host, very quick to reply to all of my questions and inquiries. Will definitely re-book. Thanks again.

Richard is an extraordinary host, without a doubt our best Airbnb experience. We only have one regret, not having been able to enjoy it longer in his beautiful location and incomparable hospitality. His house is located on a charming little street, spacious for a couple and beautifully decorated. We highly recommend it!
A memorable night in this little piece of paradise amidst the city. We almost forgot about it!

I was really happy with the rental. The apartment was clean and modern, and looked just like the photos. The kitchen is fantastic, and there's also a BBQ outside. This would be a great rental for a couple who enjoy grabbing food from local markets and preparing meals. The apartment is located on a one-way laneway with little to no traffic. The apartment is a 3-5 minute walk away from the gay village. There's an amazing brunch place called Le Passe Compose just steps away from the apartment that I highly recommend guests check out.

Richard greeted us warmly, offering a few cold drinks from the fridge! The pictures accurately depicted the house's current interior and exterior - beautiful! Unfortunately, the cleanliness of the house was not as good as I had anticipated, considering the cleaning fees paid.  I had to wash the inside of the refrigerator, kitchen counters, and bathroom, and the upstairs floors. The main floor was also dirty, but we kept our shoes on during our stay. We were disappointed there was no air conditioning and only two windows had screens to let in cool air at night. The patio doors did not have screen doors either. We recommend installing a ceiling fan above the bed; however, there were two small fans that came with the unit which we used. The neighborhood itself was sketchy - we witnessed homeless people changing clothes and a drug user shooting up in the parkette across from the house. Despite the negatives, the house is completely modern and beautiful inside - you would never know it was originally built in the 1800s! Richard used wood from the old house for the new renovations that add wonderful charm to the updated kitchen and living room. The kitchen was a dream to cook and eat in and had everything we needed (except a microwave, but not crucial). The bathroom was huge and we especially loved the large luxurious spa shower. The area was surprisingly very quiet so we had no trouble sleeping. Perhaps the characters in the park were outliers. You would be hard-pressed to find such a spacious, modern, and beautiful home with a covered deck and lovely backyard in the middle of the city.

Our host was fantastic! Richard was readily available and very communicative. The location was excellent and spacious. The reclaimed barn wood accents were beautiful. Overall, it was a wonderful place.

Overall, it was a fantastic experience and a wonderful place to stay while visiting Montreal. Our hosts were both friendly and eager to answer any questions we had, and the apartment is gorgeous. It's completely redone and 100% matches the pictures online. We also loved the location of the apartment, just two blocks from a metro stop on a peaceful and quiet side street right next to a small city park. Overall, we loved our stay and would absolutely rebook for our next visit to Montreal.

We had such a wonderful experience from start to finish. Richard and his family are lovely hosts who genuinely made us feel welcomed. You cannot beat the location. There are 2 metro stations within 5 minutes walking distance. Located in the village, there is a thriving nightlife and restaurant scene 2 blocks away. The home itself is clean, modern, yet cozy all at the same time. We loved the backyard area and the small park just steps from the front door. It's so nice to have outdoor space on vacation! I would, without hesitation, recommend this place. This was our first Airbnb experience, and it exceeded our expectations. Richard is so kind and accommodating and the condo itself was the perfect spot. I'm so glad we did this and we would stay here again in a second.

Richard was fantastic! We arrived a little early but he was able to take our bags and recommend a little coffee shop for us to go to while he just finished up cleaning inside! The house is really beautiful, has had a lot of work put into it and it shows! Communication was easy and I would definitely recommend staying here!

Richard was an excellent host. The apartment is immaculate, modern and very well equipped. The location is perfect, on a street that is extremely quiet despite being close to the city center. We highly recommend Richard's apartment and we will definitely return there.

We booked at the last minute and Richard was very accommodating and responsive to our needs. Richard's place is within walking distance of many restaurants, bars, coffee shops, etc... We truly enjoyed our stay and would gladly recommend it for visitors to the area.

This was the best experience for me. Not only is the place beautiful, comfortable, and in a great location, but also Richard, the host, was super attentive and communicative before and during my stay. 

I arrived during a heatwave in Montreal and the place had no AC upon my arrival, but within an hour Richard went and got an AC unit! Incredible. Highly recommended; you won't find a better place.

The house is superb, the little garden a corner of paradise!
The bed is very comfortable, we had a very good night.
Richard was very welcoming, we had two beers waiting for us in the fridge: super attention!
Small downside: the neighborhood. We stayed only one night and maybe it was exceptional but the street wasn't very quiet.
Recommended!

Richard was very welcoming and responded quickly to any communication I had. The house was comfortable, clean, and cozy. The location was very convenient; the house is one block from the closest metro station (Beaudry) which is one station from a main transit hub (Berri-UQAM). This allows for easy access to many parts of the city. Also, within two blocks, there is a grocery store that has a mixture of fresh food/produce and was more than enough to keep us well stocked during our stay. Definitely would come back during future visits to Montreal.

Richard's apartment is a fantastic place to stay when visiting Montreal, we had so much fun! The location is perfect, very close to the Metro, as well as many shops, restaurants and bars. It is set back from the main street so the avenue is quiet. We were able to find free street parking nearby, and then we walked everywhere. 

The apartment was very clean and comfortable. Richard provided everything we could need, the washer & dryer were a nice bonus. It is also nice to have a private backyard for relaxing, especially in the beautiful summer weather. 

Richard was quick to communicate and very flexible. Our arrival time was pushed back and he made it easy to contact him and check into the apartment. 

If you are looking for accommodations in Le Village, Richard's apartment is a great choice!
Richard was a gracious host. He has a beautiful place on a beautiful street. A great quiet backyard. Will definitely stay here again when visiting!

Wow! Awesome apartment! It's very well located and very clean. Richard is very welcoming and available. There were two cold beers in the fridge upon our arrival, a very nice gesture. 

Thanks
Lovely place that was very well equipped with amenities and in an ideal location. Highly recommend!

The house was absolutely wonderful. Very cute, it had everything I needed, designed very nicely, and most importantly it was extremely clean from top to bottom. Richard was very helpful before my arrival and during my stay by providing suggestions and he's quick to respond via email. The street is very cute and quiet.  I would definitely stay here again.

Richard is a wonderful host! He took the time to explain the features of the house and recommended good places to eat, visit, and see. The house is just perfect! I felt like home! So comfy, perfectly clean, the backyard is so nice and I fell in love with that cute little street. Everything is within walking distance: convenient store, grocery, drugstore, subway, restaurants, etc.  I recommend this house to everyone and I will come back again!

Richard is a very available and welcoming host. Everything is done to make you feel welcome, a beer awaits you upon arrival. He has not hesitated to give us advice on visiting and discovering Montreal.

The accommodation is very well located in Montreal, for a first visit to the city it's a good starting point. 
The accommodation corresponds exactly to the photos, functional and well equipped. 
It offers a good value for money considering the apartment's amenities. 

I recommend this accommodation to people who, like me, do not know Montreal and want to discover this city.

I can highly recommend this stay. Everything about the house is exceptional. Brand new kitchen, bathroom, living space, beautiful backyard.  Plus, it's located on one of the nicest streets in the heart of a metropolitan city like Montreal. We actually cancelled other plans we had and spent the night here so we could enjoy the space. Marie greeted us warmly, like family, and helped us learn the ins and outs of the house. Can't wait to return again.

We had a wonderful time at Richard's house! He is a great host and was very responsive throughout the process. His wife was there to welcome us and show us the house and the neighborhood for the best place to park. 

The location is great, there are stores nearby but it's set off the main street and very quiet, we especially enjoyed the backyard with the covered deck. The house was very clean and modern, exactly like the photos, the bathroom was very roomy with a luxurious spa shower. Richard and his wife were very welcoming and attentive and made us feel at home, I would definitely stay there again and highly recommend!
For a second time it was PERFECT!  I will come back soon and I highly recommend this wonderful place!
Adorable hosts! Very lively neighborhood. Perfect apartment, very well equipped, quiet in a small street. Everything is nearby. Metro at 5 minutes!
Translation: **perfect**

If you are looking for a very comfortable, quiet and well-located place to stay near the center of Montreal for two people, then this is the one you need. In addition, a very friendly host will welcome you.

We loved this home in Montreal. Spacious, clean, airy, and beautiful. We want to live there!! The detail of Richard's renovation is just amazing. He was there to make sure our arrival was smooth; and we had no problems. 

The address adds to the apartment's charm. We were able to walk everywhere! And close by we discovered all that we needed for our stay.

Thank you, Richard, we'll be back! 

Mark & Todd
The house was fantastic, well-situated, modern and very cozy with all the amenities away from home. Richard and his partner were great hosts; I can't wait to come back next time.
Richard and Melanie were very friendly and welcoming. The apartment was perfect for my stay.

This apartment is impeccable and decorated with care and attention. The location is charming in an unusual street and allows for very quick access to the city center as well.

As Richard had indicated, at the end of the evening, upon reintegrating the apartment, I was able to easily find a parking spot in the surrounding streets.

A longer stay would have allowed me to fully enjoy the amenities and attractions of this apartment. When I return to Montreal, I will search for Richard's apartment whose value for money is excellent. Note that Richard's Superhost status played a role in my decision to choose his apartment. 


Jean-Marc
Gentleness and benevolence in a nice place well equipped.
Richard has made some great renovations to the unit. It's the best Airbnb I've stayed at.

We had a wonderful stay! The apartment is awesome, and the host was very attentive! A real sense of hospitality at the top level! Thank you again to Richard and his wife for letting us have such a great vacation.

A truly amazing place to stay when visiting Montreal! The location is perfect and has everything you need nearby. Richard was a fantastic host, and was always ready to answer any questions you might have, as well as offer his own opinions :) I will definitely be back.
Richard truly deserved his superhost status; he's a gentleman and an all-around fantastic host, just like the house itself. It's spectacular! See you soon, Richard

It's a wonderful place with lots of floor space and large windows from floor to ceiling. Richard is fantastic and incredibly courteous, he recommended places we chose and showed us the place upon our arrival. 

We would love to visit again if the place is available.
Superb accommodation, warm welcome, remarkable tranquility, everything was perfect. Available for rent again!

This was my first Airbnb and Richard and his family set the bar pretty high. We were their first guests for the holidays... he and his family set up a Christmas tree and made gingerbread cookies for us! He also gave us the backstory on his Airbnb which I won't spoil. The place is great. Super clean, quiet, great shower and all top-of-the-line appliances. It's also near a lot of nice shops and eateries. I would recommend this place to anyone looking to get away for a weekend, explore Montreal or even a longer stay. If/when I visit Montreal again I'd pick this place for sure.

A great place to stay right in the heart of the Village ~ just steps away from the Metra station, restaurants and shops. Richard was wonderful ~ he was there to greet us upon arrival and showed us around the house. He was very responsive to all our questions before we arrived as well as gave us some great recommendations as to what to see & do in Montreal. His house was beautiful, clean and even decorated with a Christmas tree for the holidays! We would definitely stay here again the next time our travels bring us back to Montreal.
Richard's place was fantastic. Exactly as expected. Gorgeous and spacious. Heated floors were a particularly nice touch. Stay here!

Very good stay at Richard's! We appreciated the hospitality and kindness of our hosts! The house is magnificent and matches the photos! Very well located, close to a metro station and in the city center, we would have liked to stay longer :)

Thank you again to Richard and his wife for this pleasant stay! We recommend 100% !

Great place! Richard's place was very spacious and modern. Richard's wife greeted us upon our arrival and went above and beyond helping us with suggestions of things to do/places to eat. The neighborhood is very quiet and we easily walked everywhere we needed to go. The shower is amazing, and I loved the heated flooring throughout the house. I recommend this place to all!

The apartment was perfect. It was close to everything, and we literally Uber everywhere. Richard was so good at getting back to us and made us feel very at home.

The decor is amazing and it's a very cozy place. 

For downtime when we got back to the apartment, we streamed a lot of music and played board games because there was no TV or radio. 

It's definitely a perfect getaway, and we will be back for spring hopefully!

Richard's place is fantastic! I can't recommend this unique home enough. My boyfriend and I stayed here during a trip to Montreal and our only wish was that we had more time to spend. The location is fantastic (in the heart of the city), the home is beautiful, and you can really tell Richard cares about the little details, even the sheets in the bed were super soft and comfy. Above all, Richard gave us suggestions and even told us about the fantastic story of the historic home that he's remodeled into a truly gorgeous place. This has been one of our best, if not the best, Airbnb experiences we've had.

Don't miss Richard's house!
A haven of peace in the heart of Montréal's village neighborhood.
The house has just been renovated with style; 
Moreover, Richard and his wife have a real sense of hospitality.
I highly recommend this accommodation.
Jean-Luc
Richard and his wife are very welcoming and pleasant, their accommodation is superb and ideally located in Montreal!

This place is great. So nicely renovated and there are a lot of little things that add to the experience. Richard lives right next door so check-in was super quick and simple. Heated floors throughout, amazing shower, board games, and the bed!!! - oh, the bed. Probably 4 of the best sleeps I've had, ever. Very quiet, friendly neighborhood. Highly recommend. Thank you!
Very pleasant and clean place. We will definitely book again in the future!
Richard is a very friendly and welcoming host. The house we rented from him is a real haven of tranquility in the heart of Montreal. We loved it.

Richard was at the house doing some maintenance work when I arrived and was very friendly. The photos accurately represent the house. The kitchen is nice and spacious, though it could use a few more cooking utensils.

The location is nice and located on a very private side street/alleyway with one of the city's many tiny public parks across the street (think a few trees and a couple of benches). There will be virtually zero traffic outside your door. There are (French) guide books in the house that can point you in the right direction, if you're looking for something to do.

I stayed at Richard's place in February, and the heated concrete on the first floor was great. I would love to come back in the spring or summer and enjoy the quiet backyard, which would be perfect for a romantic picnic.

Overall, a great stay and I'd definitely recommend it.

We spent two nights in Richard's apartment. We had a wonderful stay. The space was exactly as described on the webpage. The apartment is spacious, with every detail to make your stay incredible. Richard and his wife were gracious and welcoming.  We would recommend their place to anyone visiting Montreal.

Richard was a warm and gracious host who met me at check-in to walk through his home and let me know he lives just next door. The pictures are accurate and the place is very clean and stylish with great working wifi. The two-level single family home is on a pretty, very quiet, smaller street, just off great longer avenues (St. Catherine and Maisonueve) with bars, restaurants, shops, and gyms within walking distance. I highly recommend this listing. Thanks Richard!
Nice place
Richard was a kind and welcoming host. The apartment is located in the heart of a very trendy neighborhood, and it provides easy access to everything Montreal has to offer.

Richard is very welcoming and available if needed.

The apartment is very nice, well decorated, quiet and very well located. A very relaxing weekend. It only lacked the sun to enjoy the terrace. Recommended.
Richard was a wonderful host and the location was perfect! We loved the spacious interior and having our own private backyard.

This is a great home. Centrally located and walkable for most things. Very close to public transport and Bixi stations as well. We ate at a great sushi restaurant, Uchi, 7 minutes away by foot. Also, had brunch at Passé Compose just down the street, and highly recommend it - just get there with plenty of time, the line was out the door!
The bed is very comfortable, and there's great water pressure in the shower. There's lots of space to store clothes if you're staying for a longer period.
We had a very pleasant stay and would choose to stay here again.
We spent 15 magnificent days. Richard and his wife were helpful and gave us good culinary advice. The house is great in a great neighborhood. Little note for our American cousins, you are awesome.

We stayed in Montreal for the Grand Prix. Richard's place is well located near the Beaudry station (like only 2 blocks). From there we connected to Old Montreal and attractions. We did not have time to enjoy the place's deck and BBQ :) .  Richard was very attentive to the check-in and check-out and made it easier for us. Thanks!

Richard and his wife are wonderful hosts. The house was centrally located in a great area of town. You literally have access to everything. Check-in and check-out were effortless. The house is amazing. Richard did an excellent job on the renovations. We would definitely stay again.

We had a great time staying at Richard's place and in Montreal in general. The place was quiet and comfortable, and we really enjoyed the back patio area. The only drawback was that the AC unit wasn't able to keep the room upstairs cool.
Great location. The place has everything you need for a nice stay. Quiet and clean
Richard's place was highly valued.  Really nice house in a great location. Highly recommend

We had an excellent stay at Richard's, who is an extremely friendly and easy to reach host! The house is very pleasant and in an extremely convenient location! Everything is within walking distance, and the nearest metro station is a 2-minute walk away. We will definitely return with pleasure! Thank you, Richard, and we'll see you soon. Kristel & Virginie

This place has an amazing location and yard! It is located on the cutest street in Montreal, right out of Paris. Parking wasn't too hard to find nearby even with many local roads closed when we were there. The backyard is definitely the highlight of this place! The whole apartment looks just like the pictures. 

The kitchen could use a few more items; if you plan on cooking you might want to bring a few of your own things including a knife (the one that was there wasn't great). If you come in the summer, and have room, bringing a fan wouldn't hurt. There is AC but just in the upstairs bedroom.

Richard (the host) is a really cool guy, hopefully you get a chance to chat with him when you stay. We had an awesome time and would definitely stay here again.

Richards' Airbnb is located in a central spot. It was a 5-10 minute walk to transit, food, nightlife, etc. It offered plenty of space and had everything we needed - there was an iron, lots of closet space, hair dryer, washer/dryer onsite, AC, etc. There was also plenty of free street parking available. His location is on a small side street so you'll need to park a short distance away. Richard was responsive and check-in was a breeze!
We had a pleasant stay. The apartment was clean and the little garden ideal for enjoying the nice weather.

I can't say enough about Richard's place - although the pictures are accurate, I was surprised to find the space more lovely, more spacious and more comfortable than expected. The location is fabulous and the street that the house is on makes you feel like you're a world away from big city life. I would recommend Richard's place to anyone looking for a quiet and upscale retreat - yet still close to the village, the metro and everything else the city of Montreal has to offer. I hope to be back again soon!
This is the best deal in town. Perfect central location in a charming, quiet street. Richard's place is tastefully designed and super cozy. It gets better each year!
Super apartment, designed and well-equipped located within a 5 minute walk of the metro station.
Great hidden charming spot right in the heart of everything we were looking for in Montreal.
The house is as pictured, therefore very beautiful. It is in a very good location and well-served. We loved our stay but would have liked to meet the host! Next time :)

Richard's place is such a gem that I'm reluctant to share. It's exactly the kind of place I'd like to come home to every day. It's perfectly minimalist, with everything you need. It made me consider moving to Montreal.

The backyard is a real treat after a long day traipsing around the city (or a long drive from NYC) and there's a small park across from the front door. Ample, but competitive, parking on the streets. The shower has three heads and a detachable head. Don't say I didn't warn you.

The bed was so comfortable that we overslept and were late getting back to New York. My only regret was not bringing my laundry. I had a lot of fun playing with the kitchen lights, too.
Superb accommodation! Very well located, close to the metro and quiet!!!
This place was great!
Very well-located apartment. Beautiful decor, very clean, pleasant garden and terrace... Nothing more to say, it was perfect!

We really enjoyed our communication, check-in/out were all swift and friendly. The space is well decorated and maintained on a quiet street in the Village. Easy walking distance to loads of restaurants, nightlife, and metro. 

Definitely a great space with a great host! Highly recommended!

It's very quiet and peaceful. It takes about 20-30 minutes to walk to downtown. We walked around the neighborhood while we were there, exploring it. The city hall is close by, as well as VIA Rail, and Notre Dame Cathedral is also nearby. And the house was so clean that I was surprised and felt comfortable. I stayed for just five days, but it was really great! (Mom loved it^^)

We loved Richard's place and found it much better than expected. The pictures do not do it justice. 
Parking was relatively easy on R. Panet, and we always found by Parc Raymond Blain. The location to the Gay Village is perfect being close enough to the bars and restaurants. The property is on a quiet street with no regular vehicular traffic.
We couldn't enjoy the backyard, but believe it would have been wonderful during the summer. The kitchen is stocked with essential sundries. 
We both left Montreal being in love with the city, and would definitely consider staying at Richard's place again.

Richard's little house is wonderful! It is stylishly decorated and has all the comforts and amenities of home. The location is close to everything. Communications and check-in were prompt and easy. We would be thrilled to stay at Richard's place again and highly recommend it to any future guests.

The place is as seen in the pictures, even better! It's a quiet neighborhood close to everything. It's far from the hustle and bustle of St Catherine but close enough that you can be in the lively neighborhood in under 5 minutes. The space is spacious, welcoming, and just lovely. If you're not a city person, don't try to brave a car rental unless absolutely necessary. Parking was tough to find at night. Besides this, it was the perfect getaway and the best place to stay!

Richard's place is awesome. Very short walk to all the restaurants, bars, and shops on St Catherine but located down a quaint quiet street. The apartment itself is modern and comfortable. The terrace and balcony were great! Check-in/check-out was a breeze and Richard was very responsive.

Absolutely loved staying at Richard's place!! The location is perfect for exploring the village and easy access to the metro! But it is also conveniently quiet away from the busy street so you can get a nice rest! The space is beautiful and comfortable with everything you will need! Beautiful kitchen, super private backyard, spacious bathroom, comfy bed and cute balcony off the bedroom! The place was super clean and had everything I needed for an amazing stay! Excellent value!!

Richard's house was so cute and cozy! It had plenty of space for two people and all the amenities necessary. It was also decorated so cutely. It was easy to get to and close to train/bus stations, making it very easy to travel to/from. I would definitely stay here again when I am in Montreal!

This was perfect for us. Great, quiet location for a young couple. It was -8 degrees outside but nice and warm inside. We used the kitchen one night and they had everything we needed. The owners were very responsive. Would stay again.

Super accommodation. There were no surprises; the place was true to the pictures. It was spacious, functional and clean. The only possible improvement would be adding a table. However, since we mainly ate at restaurants, it wasn't a problem for us.

The stay was great. It was a great location and Richard was very responsive. The property had some rough edges and needed minor cosmetic fixes, but it was easy to overlook as the property was stylish overall. The washer/dryer were convenient. We didn't grill because we didn't have time and it was too dirty to use. If we come back to Montreal, which is likely, we will stay here again!
Great location. The apartment is on a charming block. Richard was a great communicator (quick and helpful). I highly recommend the place.
Excellent private room, very clean, modern. Owner Richard was very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Would definitely do this again!
Great!

Richard's place was extremely clean, had a great backyard space, and was located in the perfect area. The kitchen was also stocked full of everything one needs so I did not feel the need to eat out for every meal. Highly recommended and would definitely stay here again!
Richard's place was very trendy and comfortable, located in an excellent neighborhood nestled on a quiet side street.

This comfortable, clean apartment is on a quiet one-way street with lots of character. It's a peaceful little neighborhood but at the same time only a short walk to Saint Catherine Street, about a block away. 

The queen bed was comfortable with cozy bedding and plenty of pillows. The place can accommodate a family, but everyone has to sleep in the loft together. The loft itself is spacious, with a bathroom, an outdoor deck, and air conditioning. The first floor has an open living room and large kitchen with a porch and small yard surrounded by a tall privacy fence. So although the apartment is not huge, it has many spaces within its boundaries. Very comfortable. 

Richard himself was always quick to respond to our every need. He reached out to us through Airbnb while we were on our way there to ensure a smooth self-check-in and answered promptly each time we had a question. Also, I inadvertently left behind some valuables and he agreed to send them to me promptly through the mail. 

I highly recommend this place.

Excellent location just blocks from all the action in the Gay Village, and short walks to other major points of interest. It's in a quiet alley tucked away across from a small park and boasts a lovely green yard and balcony to enjoy the sunshine and watch the birds and trees mingle. 

The house itself was lovely. The bottom floor has a generous kitchen with all the essentials and the living room is cozy and charming with lots of Montreal-specific literature to browse through. 

Upstairs, the bed is comfortable, the bathroom is clean and stylish, and as an added bonus you have a solid washer and dryer that came in (Email hidden by Airbnb). Communication between Richard and I was very smooth and clear. I will definitely stay here again!

We enjoyed our stay in this apartment because the rooms are large and it is located on a very quiet street. The garden is also a strong point. From there, we were able to make our visits by foot or public transportation. Thank you.

Richard's place is perfect! Richard is such a considerate host that the place has everything you ever need. The place is even more spacious and beautiful than the pictures show. Also, the backyard is so lovely! 

We had a wonderful time during our stay and would definitely recommend it to everyone who wants to have a good time in Montreal!

Stylish and comfortable space (the bed gave me a glorious night's sleep) that was exactly as shown in the listing. Richard was quick to respond to any questions I had and was very friendly to speak with. This is a perfect spot for people looking to stay in the middle of the fun, while also wanting a quiet retreat to relax. I would definitely book again!
Great location and stylish setting. Outdoor space is wonderful!
Best location in town, an apartment with everything and makes you feel special in a really simple and stylish way. Thank you so much.
Very good

A great place to explore Montreal. We were biking through the city and it's conveniently located for easy access to bike paths. It was great to be on a quiet side street, yet so close to everything downtown.

We loved our stay in Montreal and Richard's house was perfect in terms of location, design and comfort. Richard was very friendly and helpful and the house had everything we needed. I was attending a conference at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth hotel during my stay and really enjoyed the half hour walk through the city each day. We'd definitely stay here again - thanks!
Richard's place is awesome - so clean and stylish, and very close to the Montreal village. I really enjoyed my stay in this little oasis!
Three spacious, quiet and beautifully decorated homes
The place was amazing! Easy check-in and check-out. Really close to the metro. Would definitely come back again!!!

This is a rare find and an absolutely amazing place to stay in Montreal. This house was so stunning and stylish; it made my Montreal trip just that much better. I would definitely come back. Thanks, Richard!
This was one of the best Airbnb places I've ever stayed at.  Especially, I loved the kitchen so much and everything else was neat and nice. Thank you for offering this beautiful house, Richard!

Spacious, comfortable home located near Gay Village with easy access to local transit, BIXI bike share, and plenty of safe street parking.  Large, modern kitchen and private outdoor spaces add to the charm.

Such a great place! Richard was always very quick to respond and answer any questions. The place itself was awesome - super spacious, GREAT kitchen and backyard, awesome shower too. Location was centrally located and close to public transport, Bixi bikes and markets to pick up food and drinks. Overall awesome place to stay and experience in an amazing city.
Richard's accommodation was perfect for accommodating my visitors. The tranquility of the street and the proximity to downtown were particularly appreciated.

This place is located in a trendy area with lots of good restaurants to try out. It's also perfectly situated for those who enjoy walking a bit to all the tourist attractions, but for those who don't, there are metro stations very close by as well. Richard's place has plenty of space so that if you're traveling with children it is also ideal with the two twin beds available. It is nicely decorated and well kept. I would definitely recommend it to others.
A wonderful stay in a comfortable apartment close to Rue Sainte Catherine! Thank you, Richard, for your responsiveness. We recommend his accommodation!

Richard's place is in a fantastic location, on a quiet side street adjacent to the Village and Old Montreal neighborhoods. A short walk to cafes, unique restaurants and nightlife made this the perfect spot for a weekend adventure. Private outdoor space would be fantastic if we were staying longer and wanted to grill for dinner - next time! :)

Nice place with a private backyard, grill and balcony in the middle of the city. Ideal for a couple, solo or with 1-2 small children. Great washer and drier. Parking on the street may be hard to find, but with some patience we always managed to find a spot less than 2 blocks away - be sure to learn about Montreal's parking signs as they can be quite confusing. Would surely come back!
Richard's place is amazing. It has such a cool layout in a great location. It feels like home away from home, highly recommended.

Fantastic private space two blocks from St Catherine's. On a quiet street, the location is perfect if you plan to spend time in the Village. Half a block away from a fantastic brunch spot (Passe Compose - go early or prepare to wait!). The home is very comfortable with a private yard and deck, a large kitchen, and a comfortable couch. Bathroom floors are heated and the shower is big. Bedroom linens and pillows should probably be replaced, along with the towels, but overall very accommodating. Communication and check-in with the host was very quick and easy. The home is on two levels (the kitchen and dining room are on the first floor, the bedroom and bathroom are on the second).
Richard's place is excellent, and he couldn't ask for a better location.
This was a great place to stay. The place was advertised well and communication with the guest was excellent.

The host made me feel very welcome, and the apartment was very nice. The neighborhood was also very nice and was located exactly where I needed to be within the city; I was there visiting a friend who lived nearby.
Sarah was very nice and accommodating. She was available right away to answer any questions or concerns.

Isabela's apartment is great! We stayed there with more than 5 friends and we had a nice time in Montreal. It is well-located just a few minutes from the subway station. She was so kind and helpful with check-in and check-out hours. Definitely, I recommend her apartment. Thank you, Isabela!

Isabela was amazing! I didn't get to meet her but she made sure I had everything I needed, also made sure the apartment was warm and cozy! I would definitely recommend everyone to stay here, it is close to many places and she has some wicked cool CDs and board games!
Excellent experience! Isabela was very kind and accommodating. Communication was very easy. No problems were encountered.
Expensive and very well-located housing.
Wonderful stay! The location is perfect for a short weekend in Montreal! Excellent value for money! Isabela was very attentive and there were no communication problems!
The host cancelled this reservation 23 days before arrival. This is an automated message.
Great experience. Everything went well. All the essentials were provided. Guillaume was also very cool.

We had a fantastic week in Valérie and Jean's apartment. We immediately felt like we were at home in this super cozy, perfectly clean apartment with everything we need and more for both short and long stays. We will definitely go back without hesitation for even just a minute. The Hochelaga neighborhood is really nice and lively and perfect for exploring the city. Finally, Valérie and Jean are very warm and truly care that our stay is perfect.

My daughter and I had an excellent 3-night stay at Valerie’s apartment! It was exactly what we were looking for as we had tickets to an event at the arena within Olympic Park and wanted accommodation within walking distance. One of the reasons we enjoy using Airbnb is to get to know local neighborhoods of big cities, such as Montreal's Maisonneuve. The apartment actually exceeded our expectations - it is as pictured and described; very well stocked with what we needed for a comfortable stay; we parked our car right in front and either walked or used public transport to get wherever we needed to go (Olympic Park – Biodome and Planetarium a short walk – and we took the Metro into the Montreal Old Town); appreciated the maps, tourist info and book with Valerie's personal recommendations of nearby restaurants, services, etc. including the nearby Maisonneuve Market. After our busy days, it was great to come “home” to our classic “Montreal walk-up” apartment! Merci Jean and Valerie!

This was my first Airbnb experience and what an amazing one it was! Valerie and Jean were fantastic hosts. The apartment itself was cozy, comfortable, very clean, and had everything we needed. A cute balcony which made me feel so relaxed and like I was away somewhere tropical. The apartment's location is also great. Great restaurants nearby, convenience stores, a market, the metro, and other cool places to check out in Montreal like Parc Île Jean Drapeau were a 15-minute drive. Would give this 5 out of 5 rating and highly recommend it to others!

My girlfriend and I enjoyed our stay with Valerie and Jean. They were very accommodating to our early arrival time. The place was clean and comfortable to come back to after spending the days exploring the city. Montreal was great to visit. Also, one day we were able to rent a car and drive up to Quebec City. It was a couple hours drive, but it was well worth it. We also enjoyed checking out the nearby planetarium, botanical gardens, market, and Hoche Cafe.
We had a nice visit - the apartment was very comfortable and relaxing, the setup was perfect for our three-day visit, and the nearby playground was an added bonus for our daughter!

Valerie's apartment was wonderful. It was very clean and there were clear directions about the internet, etc. She also included information about the neighborhood. I only stayed there briefly and didn't get a chance to meet her, but she was very flexible and able to accommodate my arrival and departure times.

We had a wonderful stay in Valérie and Jean's apartment. The apartment is very well located (right next to the Biodôme and the metro), quiet and clean. It was perfect for our end-of-stay in Quebec. Valérie is easily contactable and was able to answer all of our questions. We recommend this apartment without any hesitation! Thank you again, Valérie and Jean.

I booked for my parents. 
They were first-time Airbnb users. 
They both agreed, "We will do it again". 
Thanks for the great experience.

Wonderful stay in a very comfortable apartment, clean and functional. Our hosts were attentive to all of our needs. The quiet neighborhood and proximity to everything make this the perfect combination. Hochelaga-Maisonneuve has become a trendy arrondissement with many hidden gems of restaurants, bars, and shops. A great experience!

We were sensitive to the welcome booklet and its recommendations, as well as the business cards with good addresses to discover in the neighborhood. The street is pleasant, tree-lined and close to a commercial artery. The description and photos matched perfectly with the reality of the places. We will be happy to return to Valérie and Jean for another stay in Montreal.

First Airbnb experience for my parents who came from France and they loved the hospitality of Valérie and her husband, very warm and discreet hosts. The apartment was clean and fully equipped (washing machine, dryer etc.), very well located with shops and transport nearby. Very quiet street, highly recommended!

It was such a pleasure to stay with Jean and Valérie! The apartment is filled with just about everything you need, and is easily located right near the metro, making getting around so easy. My mother and I stayed here on a bit of a last minute notice and Jean and Valérie were very accommodating and attentive...highly recommend and would stay again!

Jean and Valerie were excellent hosts! The apartment was wonderful and had everything you might need, including a washer and dryer. They even included a book full of restaurant suggestions. They were very thoughtful hosts. It felt like a home away from home!

A return visit to Valerie and Jean's – that should say it all! 

We were once again very pleased with the hospitality and the apartment itself – clean, comfortable, quiet and well-equipped with many thoughtful touches provided for guests. Within walking distance of Olympic Park attractions and the Maisonneuve Marché and neighbourhood. Convenient to drive to Montreal attractions or use public transit. Highly recommend!

Both Naveen and I were very impressed with the apartment. Everything was neat and clean. The kitchen is well equipped. The pictures are very accurate. We would have enjoyed staying longer.  The location is perfect. It is very close to the Botanical Garden (easy walking distance). The Metro is located at the Garden as well, so getting downtown was very easy. We parked our car and used public transportation the whole weekend. Ontario Street is a great place to check out (again, easy walking distance). Valerie was wonderful. We really appreciate all the extra touches she adds (books to read, maps of the city, guest book with details about nearby stores/restaurants).
Very pleasant, comfortable and relaxing accommodation. We were looking for a little piece of peace for a few days and it was an ideal place!

We were greeted and made to feel welcome as soon as we arrived. We were given a tour of the apartment so that we felt comfortable and knew where to find everything.  Also, there were notes with useful information as well. The apartment had everything we could possibly need and we felt right at home.

My wife and I had a wonderful experience at this apartment. It was close to the subway and offered a variety of restaurants and shops. Jean and Valerie were excellent hosts who made us feel welcome and we had no problems checking in and out.

My sister and I had a wonderful stay on Rue Sicard. Jean and Valerie were tremendously accommodating and very kind. The space was clean and the essentials were perfectly supplied. I thought the location was great as well and easy to get to and from other parts of Montreal.

I have stayed in several Airbnb apartments and this one was definitely a favorite! The apartment is so cute and inviting and very clean. It's obvious that Jean and Valerie care and want you to have a pleasant experience. The market just a couple of blocks away is amazing. We really enjoyed buying some things for dinner and eating outside on the balcony. The subway is a short walk away, which makes traveling into the city very easy.  The neighborhood itself is quiet and friendly, and it's perfect if you are traveling by car since you can park right outside.

Pleasant studio, clean, very well equipped and quiet. 
Close to the Olympic Park, a few minutes from the metro for getting into downtown Montreal
Welcomed by the friendly owner
We felt like "at home" Thank you

My husband and I had a perfect weekend here for our second wedding anniversary. This apartment was quiet, clean, and romantic. Valerie and Jean are very kind hosts, and even better, they gave us more time to leave the apartment because of our later train departure. I love Montreal, I know I'll be back, and next time, for longer! Thank you all, Jean and Valérie, for a real Montreal experience.

A beautiful place to stay, just outside of old Montreal. The subway was a 5-10 minute walk away and easy to find. It was another 5-10 minute ride into town, but it was great to get off at different stations and have a look around. Car parking was easy and we felt comfortable leaving the car out front.  The unit itself was clean and comfortable; the bed was so cozy. The only minor criticism, there was no aircon, but there are multiple fans which helps cool the unit down. Overall a great place to stay and I would recommend the unit to anyone wanting to visit Montreal. Thanks Valérie for being a great host.

Three good experiences. The apartment is all cute and very pleasant. Our hosts were also charming. Everything was operational, well organized. Too bad the holidays are already over. Christelle & Arthur

Such a charming and delightful place! Very comfortable stay here. It's a little bit out of the city, but very easy to get downtown via the metro. The guidebook was a lovely touch and very helpful. I would gladly stay again!
Jean was there to welcome us and Valerie introduced herself later. Directions were very clear.

Valerie's accommodation is perfect for discovering Montreal: very comfortable, well equipped, it exactly matches the listing. The neighborhood is quiet, there's plenty of space to park the car and the metro station is right nearby for exploring the city. Valerie and her husband are friendly and will advise you effectively. I highly recommend Valerie and her apartment and I hope to have the opportunity to return there. Thank you again for everything and maybe we'll see each other soon.
RAS

Great place to stay, we loved having a little space of our own to enjoy after wandering beautiful Montreal! Easy to get around with public transportation and really well-kept apartment. Thanks for a lovely spot!
Valerie was very nice and had a beautiful apartment. The bed was extremely comfortable, and our hosts provided lots of information about local sights and places to eat. Five-star hosts for sure
I had a great stay at Valérie and Jean's apartment. It was a perfect getaway - private, quiet, clean, and beautiful space. I'd definitely stay here in the future!

My husband and I had a perfect stay in Valérie's apartment. The location is very convenient for getting to downtown, and also features local amenities and charming restaurants. The apartment itself is wonderfully spacious yet cozy and comfortable. We would love to stay again and definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Montreal!
The apartment is well-located, near Olympic Park and a metro station, very clean and well-equipped. It corresponds to the description and I recommend it.
Very welcoming and quiet accommodation.

We spent a really nice week in Valerie's lovely apartment. Everything we needed to make our stay pleasant was provided, and Valerie even suggested things to do/see in the city. Checking in/out was very uncomplicated. 

Thank you! Merci beaucoup!

My wife and I stayed for a week at Jean and Valérie's apartment. It was basic, but comfortable, homely and well equipped.

There's plenty of public transport close by so it's easy to get around the city.

If you're looking for a great value apartment as a base for exploring Montreal, this is an excellent choice!
The host cancelled this reservation 22 days before arrival. This is an automated message.
Quiet neighborhood. The apartment is very well designed. It has everything you need. The welcome is warm. Highly recommended.

I cannot recommend Valerie and Jean strongly enough; they were the perfect hosts. When my friend and I had travel issues/delays, Valerie was always very quick to reply to my updated messages regarding our changing schedule.  The apartment is perfect: very clean, cozy, with a small private balcony, a comfy bed... really an ideal base from which to explore Montreal. Although it's north of the city center, there are lots of things to do/explore within walking distance of the apartment including the old Olympic Park and Botanical Gardens, plus, the Metro is about a 10-minute walk so it's very easy to get anywhere else in the city. This is an ideal, quiet retreat from the hustle and bustle of downtown that still allows visitors to take advantage of all Montreal has to offer.

Valerie and Jean are absolutely charming hosts, generous and very accommodating. They gave us excellent advice for organizing our stay in Quebec.  Furthermore, the accommodation is impeccable, clean, functional and above all, very well located. Perfect for visiting the city of Montreal and its surroundings while remaining in a calm and peaceful place. Thank you again!

Valerie and Jean are wonderful hosts, and it was a real pleasure to meet them. Moreover, their accommodation is perfect, entirely in line with the listing, very well-equipped and within walking distance of the Olympic Park. The balcony is an added bonus. We highly recommend them!

We had a wonderful time at Valerie's place! The apartment is very comfortable, clean, and in a great location. We could walk to tons of restaurants and the metro was close by so we could be in the center of the city very quickly. Jean and Valerie were so nice and made a point to say hello and offer us tips and recommendations for the area. We tried out their recommended breakfast spot and it was great. We'd definitely recommend this place for your trip to Montreal.
Fantastic host, very friendly and prompt to reply to messages. Lovely apartment with everything you need and more. Perfect location for our trip as we were at the Olympic Park most days. Thank you.

Very nice apartment a few subway stops from the city center, with nearby shops and parking available, a beautiful botanical garden nearby as well as the Biodome. We were very well received by our hosts.

Valérie's place was absolutely wonderful for my wife and I's weekend getaway to Montreal. My only regret was spending so much time in the city and not in her apartment! The apartment was just as described, wonderfully clean, spacious, and very comfortable. Plenty of power outlets to charge my many camera batteries as well. While we didn't use it, I loved that the kitchen was well supplied with all the pots and pans you might need to cook yourself a nice dinner to eat on their lovely back porch. It's located within walking distance of many outstanding restaurants, Olympic Park, and the Metro for easy access to downtown Montreal. Easy parking on the street right outside as well! I'm already looking at my calendar to figure out when we can come back!
Valérie's place is great! The apartment is cozy and well-appointed. It is also super clean and in a great location. I would stay here again.

Valerie's place was fantastic, we felt like home throughout our stay. Valerie welcomed us when we checked in and was available throughout. The place had everything we needed and more, we will definitely be back again.

This is the second time I have stayed at Valerie's place and I recommend this accommodation. It is well-located, near a metro station, Maisonneuve market, and Olympic pool. The welcome is warm, the apartment is clean, and the kitchen is well equipped.

Past good times spent in Hochelaga with Jean and Valérie. The neighborhood is not (yet) too touristy and authentic. Ontario and St Catherine streets have charm with their diverse shops; the bakery, butcher shop, and beer store, various bars/cafes, and the beautiful covered market of Maisonneuve. We had a wonderful weekend where snow fell in big flakes, making the street with all these stairs and trees, magnificent. 
Valérie and Jean have a welcoming spirit that is pleasant to experience with this type of rental, and we say, gladly, as we leave, that we will be happy to come back and see them again!!
We were very well received. A nice market is located not far from the accommodation, as well as a good restaurant recommended by our hosts.

Parfait, the accommodation is cozy, we feel like home, the place is quiet, a bit outside, but well-served by bus at 150 meters and/or metro at 10 minutes. Valérie and Jean are very friendly, we recommend them. Yves and Fabienne
Clean, calm and well-situated apartment. Great hosts and great value.
Amazing place and great communication with the host!
Superb stay in Montreal at your apartment! The accommodation is perfectly clean and well-equipped, we feel right at home. Thank you for the hospitality :)
Very cute apartment, super close to the Viau metro and the Maisonneuve market. The hosts are very friendly and responsive. Everything is perfect, nothing to complain about!

I highly recommend this apartment without hesitation. It is very well located (metro, shops, restaurants) in a pleasant neighborhood. The apartment is very well equipped and very clean. The owners have been very responsive and the communication has been very good and efficient.

The apartment is very clean and exactly as it appears in the photos. It is very well organized with a small instruction manual and recommendations for restaurants and shops in the neighborhood. Don't hesitate to rent this apartment, it is truly great.

Valérie's apartment is beautiful, cozy, and quiet. It's located in a very nice part of Montreal, close to Marche Maisonneuve and many restaurants, the metro is about a 7-minute walk away. The kitchen is very well equipped and there is a washer and dryer. Thank you, Valérie and Jean for being perfect hosts!
Excellent location. Host Karim was very kind. There is nothing to complain about and someone who enjoys the city of Montreal, this place would be highly recommended... very cozy.

The apartment is very well located in the city center, close to Peel metro station. Karim was very welcoming and flexible about arrival and departure times.  

The apartment is spacious, beautifully decorated, clean and therefore very pleasant. The bedroom has a very large bed, we were able to easily sleep four in the apartment (with the sofa). A beautiful view of the city! Very secure building with concierge at the entrance. 

Perfect for spending a short or long time in Montreal.

Very accommodating and helpful host! Karim was very quick to answer any questions. The apartment was very clean, had quiet neighbors, and had the best location in downtown Montreal. The apartment was equipped with all necessary everyday use items. For sure will stay again here, when I come back to visit Montreal!
It was a great apartment with plenty of space and comfort; a prime location for us, close to the conference center and dining options.

I stayed at Karim's place for one night with a work colleague. It's in a great location, with an easy walk to shops, restaurants and bars. Although there is only one bedroom, the sofa is HUGE and as wide as a single bed anyway. 

The apartment was spotless and Karim was extremely friendly and accommodating. He helped us out with several recommendations in the local area and replied to messages almost instantly. 

If I come back to visit Montreal again, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

This apartment is exactly as pictured and described. Do you want a large, modern, well-equipped apartment in a great location? This is a prime choice. We were able to walk to some of Montreal's best restaurants, bars, and shopping. The excellent Metro and bus system is very accessible. Karim is a charming and welcoming host. He responded promptly each time we contacted him. Also, he offered to act as a concierge if needed during our trip. The building is safe and secure, and the quiet neighbors will allow for a relaxing sleep in a large and comfortable bed. It was obvious the apartment had just been cleaned, and the linens were freshly washed. The Wi-Fi was fast and dependable, and there was Netflix and Apple TV. The city views from the apartment are great, and the rooftop terrace is even better. 

We highly recommend this listing if a visit to Montreal is planned.

Karim was an excellent host who made us feel right at home, not only at his apartment but also in Montreal. The apartment is great and exactly as it appears online; an excellent location, a clean apartment, and a welcoming host. Thanks again for a wonderful stay!
The host cancelled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated message.
Beautiful apartment and Ka is a super knowledgeable and accommodating host.

Great location, accurate pictures, safe building!! My friends and I were extremely comfortable in this beautiful apartment. It has an amazing balcony (with a table, two chairs, and some small outdoor lights) that provides a great view of quaint architecture below and lovely trees. Ka was extremely helpful and flexible with our check-in and check-out which I greatly appreciated since I was coming from the United States and was caught in border traffic. The building is extremely safe. Only thing to keep in mind is that currently your car must be 6'3 or shorter to fit in the garage. We found parking on the street since it was the weekend and had no issue.
Good central apartment
Excellent location - close to Crescent Street and Mount Royal; best for couples

Everything about this apartment worked well for us. The host was friendly and helpful, going out of his way to drop off a second key and let us store our luggage on our last day. The location was perfect for my conference a couple of blocks away. We loved the balcony and the TV setup. The bed was very firm – best if you like that in a bed. The only downside – a previous guest had left something in the fridge that had gone bad and left a pretty unpleasant odor – was easy to deal with.

We were extremely happy with this booking, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this apartment. The host, Karim, is a delightful young man who is hospitable, respectful and very capable—thus, a great host.

We stayed here with two elderly people, and their comfort was of utmost importance to us. We therefore had a lot of questions prior to booking the apartment and before our arrival. Karim was prompt in his replies and diligent in his answers. Everything went smoothly and according to plan. 

The apartment was clean and in tip-top shape when we checked in. One thing we loved was the bathroom, which was very spacious—offering not only a bathtub, but also a shower. The kitchen was clean and aptly equipped, which was nice. Nice big couches as well! Being a high-rise building, the view was also great. This is a relatively small apartment, however it does not feel like it at all. The people who work at this apartment building—those at the reception etc.—are also very helpful and able persons. They assisted us whenever we needed help, which would have probably happened even if Karim did not also talk to them on our behalf upon our arrival. 

However, the biggest asset of this property is probably its location. It is situated in the heart of downtown Montreal. If your desire is to do all the touristy things Montreal has to offer especially in the summer, this apartment is ideally situated. For instance, the Canada Day Parade took place only a street away (5 mins walk) the day after we arrived (July 1). A couple of days later, a cycling race happened right in front of the building, which was a lot of fun to watch. Quartier des spectacles, where the Jazz Festival was happening, is only a couple of metro stops away. The Old Port/Old Town is about a 10 min taxi/car ride.

This location should also prove ideal for families from outside Montreal who wish to visit the numerous universities in Montreal. Both Concordia* and McGill are at a walking distance, and UQAM is again only several metro/bus stops away. This may also apply to scholars. (*Not Loyola Campus, but the downtown campus)

In all, we were extremely happy with our stay. Great host, great apartment, great location, and a most wonderful city. 

Alp

Amazing place, great host! I highly recommend it to anyone wanting to be close to everything. It's clean, safe, and has everything you need. A great place for families. Kim is very friendly and easy to work with.

Best Airbnb experience in Montreal. This apartment has everything you need. Amazing view of the city. Close to the supermarket, bars, restaurants, malls, and metro station. Kams is also available at all times. Perfect place to stay.

Our suite exceeded our expectations. It was very modern and clean, with all the amenities we needed. Excellent location in downtown Montreal with a great view of the city. The host was excellent, and it offered great value for the price.
Great location and apartment!

I don't do negative reviews, but this is not a video, pic, or opinion. This was technically a transaction between two parties (three?). I will stick to the facts and you can draw your own conclusions.

I booked my first trip using Airbnb on October 15th (credit card record). Since it was my first time, I emailed with some questions but didn't hear back. I wasn't alarmed since it seemed to be a hosting business posting through this website.

On November 18th, three days before my trip, I emailed a second time. The host never replied. On Tuesday, November 20th at noon, my spouse was able to talk on the phone (we weren't sure about bringing linens, parking, and/or how we would get the key). Everything looked fine; he will be waiting for us, be sure to text 30 minutes before arriving.

Since we were planning on leaving at 5 am, I went to bed early. At 11:33 pm, I got a text message that didn't make sense... checked my email and there was a message about a heating issue and that "...I unfortunately won't be able to get the heating system back in operation before your arrival. Please accept my apologies." I wasn't sure how to proceed; would I get the apartment later in the afternoon? What did it mean? I went back to bed thinking I needed to get up earlier; I would check my email later and hoping for good news.

At 1:13 am, I got a second text saying my reservation had been canceled. Now I was suddenly awake. In a couple of hours, I needed to wake up my family for a seven-hour drive to a metropolitan city where we didn't have a place to sleep?!

By now, I have three emails from Airbnb in my inbox... at 1:13 am with the cancellation; 1:28 am with a ticket number; and 1:37 am with a manager following up.

One of the emails has a button to get a refund or a button to rebook.

I booked a hotel using a well-known travel website, once I got my confirmation, I requested a refund (which now shows on my credit card from November 22nd).

So, as far as my experience was, I won't be using or recommending Airbnb. Maybe it was an isolated case, maybe the heating was really broken; I don't want to hurt anyone's business, but something didn't add up. As a consumer, I felt completely vulnerable. 

By the way: I don't know how much information Airbnb shared with the hosts, but to be able to book you need to upload your driver's license and/or passport, a recent picture, and I might be forgetting something... I spent hours preparing this trip that almost didn't happen, but maybe because I knew the destination pretty well, I was able to fix it quickly.

What I'm not so sure of fixing quickly is removing my personal data from Airbnb.

After a problem with the apartment I had rented, we were given another apartment slightly smaller but more luxurious. Modern amenities, very clean, well-located with a garage; excellent for a stay in Montreal.

I did not meet Kams, it was his friend Rubens who welcomed us. Check-in imposed at 6:30 PM which I managed to negotiate to 5:45 PM. It's a bit late especially since check-out is at 12:00 PM. He didn't seem to know much about our arrival. Communication with Kams via email was slow at first but very responsive later on, to clarify certain points regarding the apartment change.

Excellent apartment, well located, good value for money. Highly recommended without hesitation.

Karim was an amazing host. He answered a last-minute request, picked us up, and even ordered an Uber for us to transport our tons of luggage. The unit wasn't exactly the one in the photos, but it had the same amenities in the same building and was probably even better. I highly recommend anything he has to offer, and we'll certainly be back.
The location and property are superb.  Great view from the living room and bedroom.  Quite a large apartment. Clean.

Really beautiful apartment. Great location, close to the city center and metro. Comfy beds, air conditioning, pool and gym, and even underground parking (essential if you have a car as parking is a nightmare in downtown Montreal). Great host - apartment spotless. You really can't do better than this apartment for a short break in Montreal.
Great. Everything you need.
Very clean, great location and parking was also free as advertised. Check-in and communication were a bit confusing and stressful.

We were traveling as a family of three and had booked this large apartment with a jacuzzi to enjoy the end of our Canadian trip.

It all started with a scavenger hunt to find the host's collaborator in a neighborhood where parking was impossible within a stone's throw, requiring about 10 phone calls.

At that point, he claimed there was an electrical problem in the apartment and redirected us to another apartment and a street parking spot with a payment card for purchasing tickets.

In the end, this apartment only had a double bed and no jacuzzi.

He offered us a inflatable mattress: unique for a luxurious apartment!

We naturally refused and he promised us a refund.

We had to find an emergency solution to find accommodation at 7pm because he hadn't taken the trouble to inform us of the unavailability before check-in.

After three days, still no refund.

I had to contact AirBnb to cancel the reservation and initiate the refund.

In short, a host who doesn't communicate, doesn't manage much.
Not serious, absolutely avoid!
The host cancelled this reservation 7 days before arrival. This is an automated message.

Although this host helped Airbnb and I out of a difficult situation by being available last minute, this unit was not what was pictured or described at all. It felt like we got a bait and switch unit. And, because apparently AirBnB's are not allowed in the building, we were escorted to the back door/parking garage by hosts and asked to keep a low profile. The unit looked like it had no longer been cared for.  Old furniture, a broken mirror in the bedroom, all the pictures were crooked. It looked like a college student lived there. It was not at all what was advertised or pictured. It was terribly disappointing.

The host canceled our stay the morning of our flight arrival in Montreal!!! We booked 2 months in advance the same apartment with the same host we did 8 months ago. We received the usual Airbnb message of our incoming trip 7 days prior to our stay. I sent a message to the host two days before as I did not receive any information on where and how to meet and get the key. I resent a message 18 hours before and just before taking our flight to Montreal. No answer!

We landed in Montreal and I received from Airbnb an email, a SMS and a phone message saying that the host canceled our stay. We had to find a hotel and of course at peak tourist season and higher prices. This is not an individual who rents his apartment but some kind of company. Very unprofessional and untrustworthy.
Karim was an overall good host, but I was disappointed that he did not respond to messages within the Airbnb interface. The place was great: pool + hot tub, location, cleanliness, all great!
The space was very nice and in a great location, but I had some issues with communication. I was only contactable via WiFi, and the WiFi connection stopped working for three days.

To simplify things: what you see is what you get. :) Though we had to switch apartments briefly due to water damage, it met our expectations exactly. Karim's apartments seem to all be of the same modern style. Nice lounge area, two TVs, a modern bathroom, a comfortable bed, and a well-equipped kitchen. Above all, there's free parking in the garage and an outdoor heated pool. A really amazing extra was the free coffee service in the lobby from Monday to Friday that we enjoyed very much.

Our apartment was - as promised - right in the heart of Downtown and also just a few steps away from "Crescent Street" with all its bars, pubs, and restaurants.
Before our visit I was a little concerned if the central location might cause too much noise but in the end we heard nothing. No noise from the streets or any neighbors. 

The only small thing missing was a hair dryer (or maybe we just didn't find it...?) However, due to the hot summer temperatures, it wasn't really an issue for us and I'm sure Karim will handle this. ;) He has a backup for nearly everything and if something isn't working or missing, just let him know.

We would definitely stay in the apartment again!
Good for visiting Montreal in two days.
The apartment was great and the building was also very nice. Midway through my stay the internet was upgraded to 1 Gbps, which was super nice to have, though it was already plenty fast.

Very comfortable accommodations and the location was wonderful! If you want to visit Montreal and Old Montreal, this is the place to stay. The Museum of Fine Arts is a block away, the Metro is close by and the variety of restaurants is amazing!
